It's almost overwhelming when coupled with Prado on same day but they are very closely located so it made sense to do both while in area.

quote: Minor Works of Major Artists; Major Works of Minor Artists
reviewnospace: I really enjoyed this museum. It felt very accessible and I loved the variety of art. I'm from New England, so I was thrilled to see American art from Massachusetts and the Hudson River group.
titleopinion: Minor Works of Major Artists; Major Works of Minor Artists. I really enjoyed this museum. It felt very accessible and I loved the variety of art. I'm from New England, so I was thrilled to see American art from Massachusetts and the Hudson River group.

quote: Go - especially if you like impressionism
reviewnospace: Go - get your Museo del Arte card and go. The Thyssen clearly added immesurably to the rather at time staid standards at the Prado
titleopinion: Go - especially if you like impressionism. Go - get your Museo del Arte card and go. The Thyssen clearly added immesurably to the rather at time staid standards at the Prado

reviewnospace: One of the impressive collections I have seen spread through a larger scope of art history. Not just the classics but reaching to modern art as well
titleopinion: Loved it. One of the impressive collections I have seen spread through a larger scope of art history. Not just the classics but reaching to modern art as well

quote: The most enjoyable of the three big Madrid art galleries
reviewnospace: We found this the most enjoyable of the three big art galleries, because of the huge variety of works by famous artists covering all major periods and styles of art history. Aside from the large collection of medieval religious art on the top floor, a high level of interest was maintained throughout, and it would have been a struggle to think of a famous artist that was not represented with at least one work (OK I have thought of one now - Turner!). My personal favourite was Dali's "Dream Caused by the Flight of a Bee around a Pomegranate, a Second before Waking Up", but it had a bit of everything from a Holbein portrait of Henry VIII through to the obligatory Rothko. The temporary exhibition of Caravaggio works gave some interesting insights, was well staged and just about the right size.
titleopinion: The most enjoyable of the three big Madrid art galleries. We found this the most enjoyable of the three big art galleries, because of the huge variety of works by famous artists covering all major periods and styles of art history. Aside from the large collection of medieval religious art on the top floor, a high level of interest was maintained throughout, and it would have been a struggle to think of a famous artist that was not represented with at least one work (OK I have thought of one now - Turner!). My personal favourite was Dali's  Dream Caused by the Flight of a Bee around a Pomegranate, a Second before Waking Up , but it had a bit of everything from a Holbein portrait of Henry VIII through to the obligatory Rothko. The temporary exhibition of Caravaggio works gave some interesting insights, was well staged and just about the right size.

quote: A fantastic flight through the middle Age to today's paintings and arts
reviewnospace:
Private museum close to Museo del Prado.
Despite its smaller dimensions compared with del Prado, its collection is breathtaking.
All the paintings displayed are masterpieces.
Italian Renaissance as well as Impressionism are very well represented.
titleopinion: A fantastic flight through the middle Age to today's paintings and arts. Private museum close to Museo del Prado. Despite its smaller dimensions compared with del Prado, its collection is breathtaking. All the paintings displayed are masterpieces. Italian Renaissance as well as Impressionism are very well represented.

reviewnospace: Underrated and relatively unknown, an interesting collection illustrating the development of a variety of styles.
titleopinion: Mr. Underrated and relatively unknown, an interesting collection illustrating the development of a variety of styles.

quote: Excellent collection of art from 13th century to modern
reviewnospace: The Thyssen is a few minutes walk from the Prado and in my view is equally a "must see" in Madrid. While the Prado is somewhat overwhelming in the sheer scale and depth of its collection, the Thyssen presents an fascinating collection of art in a smaller, more digestible format and with far smaller crowds. It also includes more contemporary art with excellent collections from the 19th and 20th centuries.
titleopinion: Excellent collection of art from 13th century to modern. The Thyssen is a few minutes walk from the Prado and in my view is equally a  must see  in Madrid. While the Prado is somewhat overwhelming in the sheer scale and depth of its collection, the Thyssen presents an fascinating collection of art in a smaller, more digestible format and with far smaller crowds. It also includes more contemporary art with excellent collections from the 19th and 20th centuries.

reviewnospace: Nice small museum if compared to prado but it is a must do for all the art lovers when visiting madrid because it has a nice collection for picasso, van gogh and others
titleopinion: Amazing. Nice small museum if compared to prado but it is a must do for all the art lovers when visiting madrid because it has a nice collection for picasso, van gogh and others

reviewnospace: Coming here was the hi-light of our trip to Madrid. What a collection, from Picasso to Caravaggio its all here!
titleopinion: The Caravaggio exhibition was superb!. Coming here was the hi-light of our trip to Madrid. What a collection, from Picasso to Caravaggio its all here!

reviewnospace: Here you can't find the long queue so easy access..you must start from the 2.floor and you can find Rubens,Caravaggio,Rembrandt..in the level 1 you will find Monet and Renoir..unfortunately both famous picture was out when we visited..level 0 you can see Dali,Kandinsky and 2 Hungarians as well
titleopinion: Lot of beautiful paintings. Here you can't find the long queue so easy access..you must start from the 2.floor and you can find Rubens,Caravaggio,Rembrandt..in the level 1 you will find Monet and Renoir..unfortunately both famous picture was out when we visited..level 0 you can see Dali,Kandinsky and 2 Hungarians as well

reviewnospace: We went directly from the Prado (which was overwhelming) to the Thyssen, and it was a breath of fresh air! No lines to get tickets, few crowds inside. They required backpacks to be checked. They had a huge range of art, including several impressionist masterpieces. Takes an hour or two to see everything even with taking your time. Well worth the time.
titleopinion: Beautifully done small museum.. We went directly from the Prado (which was overwhelming) to the Thyssen, and it was a breath of fresh air! No lines to get tickets, few crowds inside. They required backpacks to be checked. They had a huge range of art, including several impressionist masterpieces. Takes an hour or two to see everything even with taking your time. Well worth the time.

quote: One of the great art collections in the world
reviewnospace: Amazing collection, starting with Ghirlandaio and ending with Picasso, Munch and moderns. The displays are superb, with plenty of space and restful rooms. More seats would be nice.
titleopinion: One of the great art collections in the world. Amazing collection, starting with Ghirlandaio and ending with Picasso, Munch and moderns. The displays are superb, with plenty of space and restful rooms. More seats would be nice.

reviewnospace: Great museum without any queues and when we went there was a special exhibition by Caravaggio and Caillebotte. We didn't have loads of time so we focused on the more famous art work and it was more than enough to give us happy half day out.
titleopinion: Great lesser known museum. Great museum without any queues and when we went there was a special exhibition by Caravaggio and Caillebotte. We didn't have loads of time so we focused on the more famous art work and it was more than enough to give us happy half day out.

reviewnospace: Free entry on Mondays 12 noon to 4pm. Smaller crowds and a more relaxed museum visit than The Prado. A more international art collection
titleopinion: Better than The Prado. Free entry on Mondays 12 noon to 4pm. Smaller crowds and a more relaxed museum visit than The Prado. A more international art collection

reviewnospace:
We saw the Caravaggio collection which was fantastic, however to do that and go through the main collection which is quite large unto itself, you may want to go a second time. We managed it but were quite tired after seeing both collections.

They were both worth seeing and we do recommend a visit. The audio tour is worth the extra money.
titleopinion: It's a large Museum. We saw the Caravaggio collection which was fantastic, however to do that and go through the main collection which is quite large unto itself, you may want to go a second time. We managed it but were quite tired after seeing both collections.  They were both worth seeing and we do recommend a visit. The audio tour is worth the extra money.

reviewnospace:
Three delightful floors - 15th century on the top - modern / abstract on the ground. Great collection and not crowded. We arrived at 10.30am and we were able to view in comfort.
The Caravagio exhibition was on which we visited - rather more crowded but timed tickets were required to manage visitors.
Semi basement cafe was fine for a coffee break but do visit the raised & covered outdoor restaurant- we had lunch - simple but very civilised.
titleopinion: Superb. Three delightful floors - 15th century on the top - modern / abstract on the ground. Great collection and not crowded. We arrived at 10.30am and we were able to view in comfort. The Caravagio exhibition was on which we visited - rather more crowded but timed tickets were required to manage visitors. Semi basement cafe was fine for a coffee break but do visit the raised & covered outdoor restaurant- we had lunch - simple but very civilised.

reviewnospace: We went to the Thyssen Museum and saw two exhibitions, one about Caravaggio and another about Caillebotte. Both were very good. This is the first exhibtion that we have seen of Caillebotte, a French impressionist painter. We enjoyed his paintings of flowers.
titleopinion: Good Exhibitions. We went to the Thyssen Museum and saw two exhibitions, one about Caravaggio and another about Caillebotte. Both were very good. This is the first exhibtion that we have seen of Caillebotte, a French impressionist painter. We enjoyed his paintings of flowers.

reviewnospace: The museum has a wonderful collection, but I was most surprised by its extensive collection of American Art. Among the best I've seen outside the United States.
titleopinion: Amazing American Art collection!. The museum has a wonderful collection, but I was most surprised by its extensive collection of American Art. Among the best I've seen outside the United States.

reviewnospace:
What a fabulous collection this museum houses! Spanning centuries there's sure to be something for every taste and it's a good way of re-viewing works from periods and artists one may not visit if not displayed the way they are here.

I'm no major art buff but I do love galleries, I like what I like... and my taste expanded here.

Manageable in a couple of hours, give or take a bit... but people spend very variable amounts of time looking at pictures (allegedly averaging 9 seconds?!)
titleopinion: An amazing collection. What a fabulous collection this museum houses! Spanning centuries there's sure to be something for every taste and it's a good way of re-viewing works from periods and artists one may not visit if not displayed the way they are here.  I'm no major art buff but I do love galleries, I like what I like... and my taste expanded here.  Manageable in a couple of hours, give or take a bit... but people spend very variable amounts of time looking at pictures (allegedly averaging 9 seconds?!)

quote: An excellent museum covering various epochs.
reviewnospace:
The museum is well planned and beautifully displayed in order to view and appreciate each work at ease. We were fortunate to view the Caravaggio exhibition as well. In addition, the Caillebote exhibition was a treat with exceptional art.
An easy to navigate museum with ample space between the paintings to not feel cramped and uncomfortable.
titleopinion: An excellent museum covering various epochs.. The museum is well planned and beautifully displayed in order to view and appreciate each work at ease. We were fortunate to view the Caravaggio exhibition as well. In addition, the Caillebote exhibition was a treat with exceptional art. An easy to navigate museum with ample space between the paintings to not feel cramped and uncomfortable.

reviewnospace: No down sides here. Amazing collection, well laid out and spacious. Noi queues. We loved the terrace cafe.
titleopinion: World class art and venue.. No down sides here. Amazing collection, well laid out and spacious. Noi queues. We loved the terrace cafe.

reviewnospace: After visiting the small and perfectly formed Sorolla Museum in the morning, we decided on the T-B Museum for the afternoon. We felt a bit disappointed. Absolutely no interpretation, a lot of paintings on loan, and as others have said a lot of good paintings but not many truly great ones. But no queue for tickets!
titleopinion: Good but not great. After visiting the small and perfectly formed Sorolla Museum in the morning, we decided on the T-B Museum for the afternoon. We felt a bit disappointed. Absolutely no interpretation, a lot of paintings on loan, and as others have said a lot of good paintings but not many truly great ones. But no queue for tickets!

reviewnospace: Wonderful and unique collection. I particularly enjoyed the Ghirlandaio portrait of Giovanna. The Rafael portrait of a young man is stunning. The Martin Head - Hummingbird with Orchid is not to be missed, Great exhibit.
titleopinion: Outstanding Museum. Wonderful and unique collection. I particularly enjoyed the Ghirlandaio portrait of Giovanna. The Rafael portrait of a young man is stunning. The Martin Head - Hummingbird with Orchid is not to be missed, Great exhibit.

reviewnospace: Baron Thyssen and his wife accumulated some extraordinary works of art and they are cleverly curated here. We stumbled on a Caravaggio exhibition that was a revelation, juxtaposed with other canvases of the same era and subject matter. But apart from that there are paintings from all periods from the thirteenth century to the present. I partularly liked the Kirchners, Hoppers, van Goghs and other 'modern' artists.
titleopinion: Incredible collection of art. Baron Thyssen and his wife accumulated some extraordinary works of art and they are cleverly curated here. We stumbled on a Caravaggio exhibition that was a revelation, juxtaposed with other canvases of the same era and subject matter. But apart from that there are paintings from all periods from the thirteenth century to the present. I partularly liked the Kirchners, Hoppers, van Goghs and other 'modern' artists.

quote: Great space and over 65 is FREE!
reviewnospace: Even if we had not gotten in for free, it would have still been great. Admission, free or paid includes the permanent and special exhibits. We went on a weekday about wpm and had no wait.
titleopinion: Great space and over 65 is FREE!. Even if we had not gotten in for free, it would have still been great. Admission, free or paid includes the permanent and special exhibits. We went on a weekday about wpm and had no wait.

reviewnospace: Allow at least two hours here... loads to see well laid out apart from the confusing entrance ticket area. Busy but waiting time for tickets is short. Well worth visiting
titleopinion: Extensive collections. Allow at least two hours here... loads to see well laid out apart from the confusing entrance ticket area. Busy but waiting time for tickets is short. Well worth visiting

reviewnospace: A world class collection from 12th century to the 1960's. Expect to spend 3 hours to see it all and then you need to walk fast - buy a one year pass to see all three museums and go back more than once - amazing collection!
titleopinion: Not to be missed . A world class collection from 12th century to the 1960's. Expect to spend 3 hours to see it all and then you need to walk fast - buy a one year pass to see all three museums and go back more than once - amazing collection!

reviewnospace:
Here the collection has a bigger variety than Prado .
You can find Picasso , Monnet , VanGogh and different styles and Eras .
titleopinion: Best museum in Madrid. Here the collection has a bigger variety than Prado .  You can find Picasso , Monnet , VanGogh and different styles and Eras .

reviewnospace: An extensive collection. Must see for those who appreciate art and architecture. One of Madrid's main attractions.
titleopinion: A main attraction. An extensive collection. Must see for those who appreciate art and architecture. One of Madrid's main attractions.

reviewnospace: Speaking (factually, unsnobbishly) as serious art lovers who've traveled far & wide to see great art, we kept putting off this museum in our past trips to Madrid for lack of time. Well, we finally made it there, and spent 2.5 hours without seeing everything. (Granted, we look carefully and take our time.) Conclusion: glad to have visited, but returning to finish the visit will definitely not be a priority when we're next in Madrid, as even its works by first-rate artists are by and large second-rate. Highlights are all late 19th- and early 20th-century: note rare, interesting works by Van Gogh, Degas, and German painters of the Blaue Reiter or Die Brücke.
titleopinion: Enormous collection, few MUST-sees.. Speaking (factually, unsnobbishly) as serious art lovers who've traveled far & wide to see great art, we kept putting off this museum in our past trips to Madrid for lack of time. Well, we finally made it there, and spent 2.5 hours without seeing everything. (Granted, we look carefully and take our time.) Conclusion: glad to have visited, but returning to finish the visit will definitely not be a priority when we're next in Madrid, as even its works by first-rate artists are by and large second-rate. Highlights are all late 19th- and early 20th-century: note rare, interesting works by Van Gogh, Degas, and German painters of the Blaue Reiter or Die Brücke.

reviewnospace: Went to see the Caravaggio exhibition and stayed on to see the permanent collection. An amazing collection of some of the world's finest artists. All well displayed in this purpose built gallery.
titleopinion: Amazing collection of art. Went to see the Caravaggio exhibition and stayed on to see the permanent collection. An amazing collection of some of the world's finest artists. All well displayed in this purpose built gallery.

reviewnospace: A good variety of paintings from different eras an amazing private collection. A good cafe for a break too!!
titleopinion: Culture. A good variety of paintings from different eras an amazing private collection. A good cafe for a break too!!

reviewnospace: I enjoyed the Thyssen very much, perhaps even slightly more than the Prado! Its a very manageable collection because although it covers a wide range (from the 1400s to about 1970) over three floors, there are only a few paintings by any one artist so your mind is constantly refreshed and there were many artists I had never heard of here so my horizons were broadened too, especially among the more modern stuff! We wandered around and saw everything although, admittedly, we spent more time looking at some things than others. Unlike the Prado, there were no queues at this one although I still bought my tickets in advance as I wanted to see the Caravaggio exhibition which was also excellent. Highly recommended - a remarkable collection to have once been owned by one family!
titleopinion: I loved it too!. I enjoyed the Thyssen very much, perhaps even slightly more than the Prado! Its a very manageable collection because although it covers a wide range (from the 1400s to about 1970) over three floors, there are only a few paintings by any one artist so your mind is constantly refreshed and there were many artists I had never heard of here so my horizons were broadened too, especially among the more modern stuff! We wandered around and saw everything although, admittedly, we spent more time looking at some things than others. Unlike the Prado, there were no queues at this one although I still bought my tickets in advance as I wanted to see the Caravaggio exhibition which was also excellent. Highly recommended - a remarkable collection to have once been owned by one family!

quote: Very interesting and versatile, I loved it
reviewnospace:
They have many different styles and everything is well organized.
It has a good atmosphere, nice staff, and you can quietly enjoy your visit there :)
titleopinion: Very interesting and versatile, I loved it. They have many different styles and everything is well organized. It has a good atmosphere, nice staff, and you can quietly enjoy your visit there :)

reviewnospace: Beautifully presented and full of fine paintings. Easy walking distance from Prado. Historic and contemporary wings both have numerous 'wow' paintings - contemporary collection strong in Eastern European and Russian works. Lovely bright cafe and terrace, friendly staff, attractive stylish shop. Must see for art lovers. Extremely well managed and welcoming.
titleopinion: Top quality picture gallery. Beautifully presented and full of fine paintings. Easy walking distance from Prado. Historic and contemporary wings both have numerous 'wow' paintings - contemporary collection strong in Eastern European and Russian works. Lovely bright cafe and terrace, friendly staff, attractive stylish shop. Must see for art lovers. Extremely well managed and welcoming.

quote: a private collection that beats Louvre when it comes to innovation
reviewnospace: Who ever heard of Caillebotte? Millionaire impressionist Monet friend art lover, painter and plants and gardens scientist WOW, the Thyssen-Bornemisza brings you surprises like this
titleopinion: a private collection that beats Louvre when it comes to innovation. Who ever heard of Caillebotte? Millionaire impressionist Monet friend art lover, painter and plants and gardens scientist WOW, the Thyssen-Bornemisza brings you surprises like this

quote: Viaje a través de la historia de EU
reviewnospace:
Mon FREE.
Following a stroll through the Botanical Gardens, take the opportunity to visit the Thyssen Museum with its complete journey through the history of European art (12th to 20th centuries).
titleopinion: Viaje a través de la historia de EU. Mon FREE. Following a stroll through the Botanical Gardens, take the opportunity to visit the Thyssen Museum with its complete journey through the history of European art (12th to 20th centuries).

quote: Opportunity to see some masters amidst mediocrity
reviewnospace: Wall-to-wall art of every description to cater for all tastes, but it's the masters you really want to hunt down to make this trip really worthwhile. Whilst the whole collection is a feast for the eye, it's really the interspersed masterpieces that make this visit memorable. Go on a Monday from midday when the main exhibition is free to view, thanks to Visa (I think), or was it MasterCard?
titleopinion: Opportunity to see some masters amidst mediocrity. Wall-to-wall art of every description to cater for all tastes, but it's the masters you really want to hunt down to make this trip really worthwhile. Whilst the whole collection is a feast for the eye, it's really the interspersed masterpieces that make this visit memorable. Go on a Monday from midday when the main exhibition is free to view, thanks to Visa (I think), or was it MasterCard?

reviewnospace: Of the three Art museums - Thyssen-Bornemisza was my personal favourite! Although smaller than Prado - it has a collection of far greater European variety and even allows you to take photographs!
titleopinion: Variety at its best!. Of the three Art museums - Thyssen-Bornemisza was my personal favourite! Although smaller than Prado - it has a collection of far greater European variety and even allows you to take photographs!

quote: Art History explained by an amazing art collection
reviewnospace: The, possibly unique, contribution this gallery makes to the world body of art museums is that it is laid out chronologically and therefore provides a complete history of pictorial art from the middle ages to modern times with the aid of a large selection of art masterpieces throughout the ages collected by the Baron. An interesting recent addition to the gallery is the exquisite collection of the Lady Baroness, also arranged chronologically and perhaps in a minor key. Thoroughly recommended. A good companion piece to Gombrich's astounding book, "The History of Art" .
titleopinion: Art History explained by an amazing art collection. The, possibly unique, contribution this gallery makes to the world body of art museums is that it is laid out chronologically and therefore provides a complete history of pictorial art from the middle ages to modern times with the aid of a large selection of art masterpieces throughout the ages collected by the Baron. An interesting recent addition to the gallery is the exquisite collection of the Lady Baroness, also arranged chronologically and perhaps in a minor key. Thoroughly recommended. A good companion piece to Gombrich's astounding book,  The History of Art  .

quote: Underrated but great for an afternoon visit!
reviewnospace: Everyone talks about the reina Sofia and the prado but this museum is actually very interesting in its own right. Especially right now with the Caravaggio special exhibit. Don't skimp on the audio guide - definitely helps you contextualize and understand the art on a deeper level!
titleopinion: Underrated but great for an afternoon visit!. Everyone talks about the reina Sofia and the prado but this museum is actually very interesting in its own right. Especially right now with the Caravaggio special exhibit. Don't skimp on the audio guide - definitely helps you contextualize and understand the art on a deeper level!

quote: Audio guide is excellent, use it!
reviewnospace: This is a great museum. For art history novices like me, the audio guide puts the genres into contest and explains what defines them. It is well organized -- better than the Prado. We went for free on Monday afternoon and three hours passed quickly and still not enough to enjoy the wonderful exhibits. Do it!
titleopinion: Audio guide is excellent, use it!. This is a great museum. For art history novices like me, the audio guide puts the genres into contest and explains what defines them. It is well organized -- better than the Prado. We went for free on Monday afternoon and three hours passed quickly and still not enough to enjoy the wonderful exhibits. Do it!

reviewnospace: While on the Hop On - Hop Off bus to see the sights and sounds of Madrid, the Prado National Museum was my first choice to get a feel of European Art. But the long queue just to get in the museum was not welcoming, given that I was a travelling with my octogenarian mother, and we had just come from a gruelling 24 hour trip. What a blessing that the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum was part of the red line. With good reviews written, I opted to go down and have my introduction to European art. And, I was not disappointed. Large enough to house beautiful paintings from the classics to modern art, it was the perfect museum for a first time art enthusiast. We spent an easy, yet leisurely 3 hours at the museum, appreciating the seats made available at the center of each room, to rest weary feet. Indeed, the best museum for an introduction to art.
titleopinion: The best introduction to Art.. While on the Hop On - Hop Off bus to see the sights and sounds of Madrid, the Prado National Museum was my first choice to get a feel of European Art. But the long queue just to get in the museum was not welcoming, given that I was a travelling with my octogenarian mother, and we had just come from a gruelling 24 hour trip. What a blessing that the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum was part of the red line. With good reviews written, I opted to go down and have my introduction to European art. And, I was not disappointed. Large enough to house beautiful paintings from the classics to modern art, it was the perfect museum for a first time art enthusiast. We spent an easy, yet leisurely 3 hours at the museum, appreciating the seats made available at the center of each room, to rest weary feet. Indeed, the best museum for an introduction to art.

reviewnospace: This is an amazing museum as most of the display is from the private collection of the Thyssen family. Sadly only a few of Picasso but a great early cubist painting. The Dutch portraits are terrific.
titleopinion: interesting collection. This is an amazing museum as most of the display is from the private collection of the Thyssen family. Sadly only a few of Picasso but a great early cubist painting. The Dutch portraits are terrific.

reviewnospace: The permanent collection her is varied and interesting - don't miss the modern art section on the ground floor - but the temporary exhibitions are my favourite. Small but well-curated they are always fascinating.

reviewnospace: A great art collection, beautifully displayed (lots of space between the pictures). Terrific air conditioning on a boiling hot day!

reviewnospace:
This is a museum or better to say a collection of the ranges middle age until today in other words everybody can find his favorites or simply love it all
Always a must while we are in Madrid

This guy is my type of hoarder! I'll take 10 of this, 30 of those and don't skimp on that Renoir!!

quote: Ace Cafe with art gallery attached!.....
reviewnospace: The Thyssen-Bornemisza is a lovely and compact museum that is a must-see on any trip to Madrid. It does not have the (very) long queues of the Prado, and has a similar, but collector's-eye choice of the very best art pieces from several periods, ranging from the medieval right through to the post -modern. (Tip: If you visit between 12 noon - 4.00pm, entry is free courtesy of MasterCard, otherwise it's €12). There is a very good and comprehensive museum shop, as well as the aforesaid ace café attached, where you can relax and enjoy some reasonably-priced food after your visit.
titleopinion: Ace Cafe with art gallery attached!...... The Thyssen-Bornemisza is a lovely and compact museum that is a must-see on any trip to Madrid. It does not have the (very) long queues of the Prado, and has a similar, but collector's-eye choice of the very best art pieces from several periods, ranging from the medieval right through to the post -modern. (Tip: If you visit between 12 noon - 4.00pm, entry is free courtesy of MasterCard, otherwise it's €12). There is a very good and comprehensive museum shop, as well as the aforesaid ace café attached, where you can relax and enjoy some reasonably-priced food after your visit.

reviewnospace: We really enjoyed our visit here viewing a diverse range of paintings. No queues unlike the Prado. Busy but no so that one couldn't stand back to view a painting which took our fancy and really had to be seen from a distance. Well worth a visit.
titleopinion: A wonderful collection of paintings.. We really enjoyed our visit here viewing a diverse range of paintings. No queues unlike the Prado. Busy but no so that one couldn't stand back to view a painting which took our fancy and really had to be seen from a distance. Well worth a visit.

reviewnospace: A truly beautiful jewel of a museum! Very close to The Prado, it is a must see in Madrid. Terrific temporary exhibitions complement the permanent collections. It also has a lovely cafe and a wonderful shop. Treat yourself to a few hours of beauty in this museum...you won't be sorry!
titleopinion: Lovely smaller museum! . A truly beautiful jewel of a museum! Very close to The Prado, it is a must see in Madrid. Terrific temporary exhibitions complement the permanent collections. It also has a lovely cafe and a wonderful shop. Treat yourself to a few hours of beauty in this museum...you won't be sorry!

reviewnospace: Beautiful art pieces at this museum. You can easily spend 4-6 hours looking at everything. Nice gifts at the gift shop - my girlfriend bought her mom a jigsaw puzzle which she loved!
titleopinion: Beautiful art at this museum. Beautiful art pieces at this museum. You can easily spend 4-6 hours looking at everything. Nice gifts at the gift shop - my girlfriend bought her mom a jigsaw puzzle which she loved!

reviewnospace:
I visited this museum on my second visit to Spain... how mistaken I was!
This place is to be visited ASAP.

Inside you will find nothing but pure gold.

Perfect place.
titleopinion: Gold to be admired. I visited this museum on my second visit to Spain... how mistaken I was! This place is to be visited ASAP.  Inside you will find nothing but pure gold.  Perfect place.

quote: Excellent Exhibit of world renowned paintings!
reviewnospace:
We had the privilege of viewing the the Thyssen-Bornemisza collection which is of a high world standard .

A busy day at the Museum but the wait was well worth it.

The traditional and permanent exhibit was a good start for us but we enjoyed the private collection of Carmen Thyssen-Bornemusza most, with some exceptional Renaissance paintings.

Certainly worth an extended visit as this is a very large private collection.
titleopinion: Excellent Exhibit of world renowned paintings!. We had the privilege of viewing the the Thyssen-Bornemisza collection which is of a high world standard .  A busy day at the Museum but the wait was well worth it.  The traditional and permanent exhibit was a good start for us but we enjoyed the private collection of Carmen Thyssen-Bornemusza most, with some exceptional Renaissance paintings.  Certainly worth an extended visit as this is a very large private collection.

quote: Tis is the best art gallery I've been to
reviewnospace: The selection of paintings here is amazing and when you pay the entry price this includes the temporary exhibitions as well not like some galleries. The Caravaggio and Gustave Caillebotte temporary exhibitions were really good and as the Caravaggio one was on a timed ticket it never got too busy at 12 euro this visit was good value. There are some times when a visit is free
titleopinion: Tis is the best art gallery I've been to. The selection of paintings here is amazing and when you pay the entry price this includes the temporary exhibitions as well not like some galleries. The Caravaggio and Gustave Caillebotte temporary exhibitions were really good and as the Caravaggio one was on a timed ticket it never got too busy at 12 euro this visit was good value. There are some times when a visit is free

reviewnospace: This museum was a joy, I have a feeling the Count and Countess must be very nice people. The private collection covers everything from medieval religious art, through the 15th - 19th centuries, to all the European names, Impressionists, and some half-decent modern stuff. The Count is dead, but the Countess still rules the Madrid art scene, and I think she buys the kind of things I would buy if I had her money. Her collection is displayed separately and is the gem of the museum.
titleopinion: A beautiful collection. This museum was a joy, I have a feeling the Count and Countess must be very nice people. The private collection covers everything from medieval religious art, through the 15th - 19th centuries, to all the European names, Impressionists, and some half-decent modern stuff. The Count is dead, but the Countess still rules the Madrid art scene, and I think she buys the kind of things I would buy if I had her money. Her collection is displayed separately and is the gem of the museum.

quote: Best part was the temporary Caravaggio exhibit
reviewnospace: A guidebook describes its collection as major works by minor artists and minor works by major artists. That said, the Caravaggio exhibit was wonderful!
titleopinion: Best part was the temporary Caravaggio exhibit. A guidebook describes its collection as major works by minor artists and minor works by major artists. That said, the Caravaggio exhibit was wonderful!

quote: Very large collection with a variety of artists' work
reviewnospace: The collection is very large. All my family were dead tired after visiting all the floors plus the excellent temporary Caravaggio collection but it was worth it. There were no queues. Students can enter at a reduced rate if they have an identification with their name and educational institution.
titleopinion: Very large collection with a variety of artists' work. The collection is very large. All my family were dead tired after visiting all the floors plus the excellent temporary Caravaggio collection but it was worth it. There were no queues. Students can enter at a reduced rate if they have an identification with their name and educational institution.

reviewnospace: This is the best Museum in Madrid period. Art is Excellent .Great exhibition, in my opinion better than Prado even Prado is more popular than Thyssen/Bornemisza.In addition Staff in this Museum is nice, friendly and very educated twice more than in Prado.Highly recommended.
titleopinion: The best Museum in Madrid. This is the best Museum in Madrid period. Art is Excellent .Great exhibition, in my opinion better than Prado even Prado is more popular than Thyssen/Bornemisza.In addition Staff in this Museum is nice, friendly and very educated twice more than in Prado.Highly recommended.

reviewnospace: I went with friends for the temporary Caravaggio exhibition (excellent by the way) but also spent a very rewarding few hours looking at the permanent collection. Everything from Monet to Manet, Picasso to Pisarro, Kandinsky to O'Keefe. And air-conditioned too (it was around 40°C)!
titleopinion: Superbly wide ranging collection. Recommended. I went with friends for the temporary Caravaggio exhibition (excellent by the way) but also spent a very rewarding few hours looking at the permanent collection. Everything from Monet to Manet, Picasso to Pisarro, Kandinsky to O'Keefe. And air-conditioned too (it was around 40°C)!

reviewnospace: A stunning gallery. The collections are wonderful. Any staff I spoke to were friendly and helpful. Give yourself at least a half a day to view the works.
titleopinion: Stunning. A stunning gallery. The collections are wonderful. Any staff I spoke to were friendly and helpful. Give yourself at least a half a day to view the works.

reviewnospace: I already had visit the permanent collection several times before, but I did it once more for my sister, after visiting the extremely interesting Caillebotte exhibition. Please check the temporary exhibitions
titleopinion: Don't miss it. I already had visit the permanent collection several times before, but I did it once more for my sister, after visiting the extremely interesting Caillebotte exhibition. Please check the temporary exhibitions

reviewnospace: Don't bother with the queues at the Prado (2 hours), this place has far better art and a heady mix. No queuing here, straight in and Carravagio to boot.
titleopinion: Brilliant. Don't bother with the queues at the Prado (2 hours), this place has far better art and a heady mix. No queuing here, straight in and Carravagio to boot.

quote: Large art museum in the centre of Madrid
reviewnospace:
We had hoped to visit the Prado but didn't book in advance and when we arrived the queue was a mile long. Consequently, we decided to try the Thyssen which is two minutes away. This was far less busy and we weren't charged for entry as there's free admission on Mondays from 12.00 until 18.00.

There's a huge selection of art from renaissance through to neo-classism, romanticism, modern and contemporary. There are works by artists such as Caravaggio, Cezanne, Van Gogh, Monet and Picasso. Works by Dali, Rothko and Jackson Pollock are also displayed, there's something for everyone here so I'd recommend a visit!
titleopinion: Large art museum in the centre of Madrid. We had hoped to visit the Prado but didn't book in advance and when we arrived the queue was a mile long. Consequently, we decided to try the Thyssen which is two minutes away. This was far less busy and we weren't charged for entry as there's free admission on Mondays from 12.00 until 18.00.  There's a huge selection of art from renaissance through to neo-classism, romanticism, modern and contemporary. There are works by artists such as Caravaggio, Cezanne, Van Gogh, Monet and Picasso. Works by Dali, Rothko and Jackson Pollock are also displayed, there's something for everyone here so I'd recommend a visit!

quote: Great way to spend a hot Monday afternoon
reviewnospace: Went at noon on a Monday when it is free for the four hours it is open. The queue moved quickly and there was much of interest and all well laid out. I used the audio guide you can rent, which definitely added to the experience - the info was concise. I also took a break and had lunch in the (posh) air-conditioned restaurant and had a tasty meal. This was a thoroughly enjoyable experience and better for me than the free visit to the Prado the day before, which was comparatively rushed and too busy.
titleopinion: Great way to spend a hot Monday afternoon. Went at noon on a Monday when it is free for the four hours it is open. The queue moved quickly and there was much of interest and all well laid out. I used the audio guide you can rent, which definitely added to the experience - the info was concise. I also took a break and had lunch in the (posh) air-conditioned restaurant and had a tasty meal. This was a thoroughly enjoyable experience and better for me than the free visit to the Prado the day before, which was comparatively rushed and too busy.

reviewnospace: Great museum with special exhibitions for Caravaggio and Caillebotte. I would have preferred to see more original Caravaggio paintings instead of small photographs when used as reference to other painters using the same theme.
titleopinion: Fantastic Exhibitions. Great museum with special exhibitions for Caravaggio and Caillebotte. I would have preferred to see more original Caravaggio paintings instead of small photographs when used as reference to other painters using the same theme.

reviewnospace:
One of the best art galleries I've visited. Well planned out, incredible works of top historic artist.
Highly recommend
titleopinion: Great art gallery . One of the best art galleries I've visited. Well planned out, incredible works of top historic artist.  Highly recommend

reviewnospace: We went this time to the Museum to visit the Carravagio's exhibition which was wonderful. You can appreciate the influence that Carravagio had on the artists of his time and in later centuries. Do not miss the exhibition and run before it shuts down. Yona S.
titleopinion: This is a great museum. We went this time to the Museum to visit the Carravagio's exhibition which was wonderful. You can appreciate the influence that Carravagio had on the artists of his time and in later centuries. Do not miss the exhibition and run before it shuts down. Yona S.

reviewnospace: Incredible eclectic collection from 14th to 20th century. Needs several hours to do it justice. Many works by famous artists.
titleopinion: Amazing. Incredible eclectic collection from 14th to 20th century. Needs several hours to do it justice. Many works by famous artists.

reviewnospace: For those who've been to the Prado and felt old master fatigue with angels and disciples, this is a good antidote. Three wonderful floors and the full price ticket will likely include entry to a temporary exhibition - there are two- Caravaggio and Caillebotte at the moment - which makes it even more incredibly good value. An excellent gift shop where one can print posters on-demand. Also a very nice restaurant is attached with nice selection of meals and snacks with great, friendly service.
titleopinion: Simply Superb . For those who've been to the Prado and felt old master fatigue with angels and disciples, this is a good antidote. Three wonderful floors and the full price ticket will likely include entry to a temporary exhibition - there are two- Caravaggio and Caillebotte at the moment - which makes it even more incredibly good value. An excellent gift shop where one can print posters on-demand. Also a very nice restaurant is attached with nice selection of meals and snacks with great, friendly service.

reviewnospace:
Highly recommend visiting this museum. It has a wide range of art from 1600's to 1900's. Many renowned artists are included as well as lesser known yet just as talented ones. The entry exhibit was a bit crowded but once you get up to the other floors, there are so many rooms that the crowd thins out and you can enjoy the art without bumping into people too much.

Give yourself at least two hours to cover the entire museum.

We ate lunch at the museum cafe on our way out. It was very crowded and the service was terrible. But if you are not in a hurry, the outdoor seating is nice.
titleopinion: Amazing collection . Highly recommend visiting this museum. It has a wide range of art from 1600's to 1900's. Many renowned artists are included as well as lesser known yet just as talented ones. The entry exhibit was a bit crowded but once you get up to the other floors, there are so many rooms that the crowd thins out and you can enjoy the art without bumping into people too much.   Give yourself at least two hours to cover the entire museum.   We ate lunch at the museum cafe on our way out. It was very crowded and the service was terrible. But if you are not in a hurry, the outdoor seating is nice.

quote: One of the greatest small art museums in the world
reviewnospace:
I took my family here to see my favourite little museum. The addition of Carmen's collection to the of her father extends and confuses things quite a bit but there is joyous discovery after discovery in this reasonably compact museum.

The whole setting is lovely and far more airy than the Frick its rival in my eyes for best small art museum in the world.
Two hours would allow a real appreciation of the collection two days would be needed to fully do it justice.
titleopinion: One of the greatest small art museums in the world. I took my family here to see my favourite little museum. The addition of Carmen's collection to the of her father extends and confuses things quite a bit but there is joyous discovery after discovery in this reasonably compact museum.   The whole setting is lovely and far more airy than the Frick its rival in my eyes for best small art museum in the world.  Two hours would allow a real appreciation of the collection two days would be needed to fully do it justice.

reviewnospace: As the Thyssen and the Prado are usually seen on the same trip (two highlights of Madrid several hundred meters apart), the Thyssen does it's best work with artists and artistic styles from the 19th and 20th centuries. From Impressionist to Modern and post-Modern artists, visitors will find something to appreciate.
titleopinion: Perfect complement to the Prado. As the Thyssen and the Prado are usually seen on the same trip (two highlights of Madrid several hundred meters apart), the Thyssen does it's best work with artists and artistic styles from the 19th and 20th centuries. From Impressionist to Modern and post-Modern artists, visitors will find something to appreciate.

quote: wide range of paintings till modern times
reviewnospace: Amazing collection of paintings, from Renaissance till XXth century. well furnished book shop and nice restaurant. temporary exhibition on Caravaggio with an extension at the Royal Palace.
titleopinion: wide range of paintings till modern times. Amazing collection of paintings, from Renaissance till XXth century. well furnished book shop and nice restaurant. temporary exhibition on Caravaggio with an extension at the Royal Palace.

reviewnospace: The beautifully presented 7 Centuries private collection of art treasures is beyond comprehension, mind blowingly over whelming. Not to be missed. Take note of time on ticket for access to any special exhibition(s) as they are rigidly enforced. Seniors discount available for 65+ with passport.
titleopinion: An absolute MUST visit.. The beautifully presented 7 Centuries private collection of art treasures is beyond comprehension, mind blowingly over whelming. Not to be missed. Take note of time on ticket for access to any special exhibition(s) as they are rigidly enforced. Seniors discount available for 65+ with passport.

reviewnospace: Very nice permanent collection: Degas, Corot, Signac, Kandinsky, Vlaminck, Cezanne, Manet, Sargent... And very interesting temporary exhibitions. The visit was an absolute pleasure.
titleopinion: Must to visit. Very nice permanent collection: Degas, Corot, Signac, Kandinsky, Vlaminck, Cezanne, Manet, Sargent... And very interesting temporary exhibitions. The visit was an absolute pleasure.

reviewnospace: Great Museum. I thought this was a really modern and nicely laid out museum. It takes a whole day to really get round and enjoy all it has to offer. The museum is very modern and has a very light airy feel. Admission is reasonable and there are lots of options if you want to visit it along with one or two of the other museums in Madrid.
titleopinion: Great Musuem. Great Museum. I thought this was a really modern and nicely laid out museum. It takes a whole day to really get round and enjoy all it has to offer. The museum is very modern and has a very light airy feel. Admission is reasonable and there are lots of options if you want to visit it along with one or two of the other museums in Madrid.

reviewnospace: Nice paintings and overall museum, but the staff could not organize the visitors. No information in English and highly confusing, you might need some knowlege ahead to enjoy it more if not speaking fluent Spanish.
titleopinion: Poor service. Nice paintings and overall museum, but the staff could not organize the visitors. No information in English and highly confusing, you might need some knowlege ahead to enjoy it more if not speaking fluent Spanish.

reviewnospace:
This time we just visited the temporary exhibition "Caravaggio and the painters from the north". (on until 18 Septmber 2016) Very interesting exhibition to see several of Caravaggio's work and his influence on other painters from Holland. If one criticism, maybe not quite enough Caravaggio's spread through the whole exhibition. We wanted to see more! Just one big painting the end. Several people went back through the exhibition to see the Caravaggio's at the beginning again!
This museum is fabulous and is a great space. We didn't see the permanent t exhibition on this occasion but from previous visits know it is well worth a visit. There is a great terrace cafe and a restaurant on the top level in the evenings during August.
Highly recommended.

reviewnospace: Love this place! the artwork is extensive and the staff are very friendly, they had a gorgeous Caravaggio and even their usual; artwork was really good!
titleopinion: Gorgeous Caravaggio exhibition. Love this place! the artwork is extensive and the staff are very friendly, they had a gorgeous Caravaggio and even their usual; artwork was really good!

reviewnospace: Wonderful museum but by far the best part was the special Caravaggio exhibit. If you're here while that's still going on I would not miss it
titleopinion: Caravaggio . Wonderful museum but by far the best part was the special Caravaggio exhibit. If you're here while that's still going on I would not miss it

reviewnospace: This museum is very close to the Prado and is easy to see in a few short hours. There are many masters here and it is not as crowded as the Prado so if the size of one scares you this would be a fabulous alternative.
titleopinion: Lovely museum. This museum is very close to the Prado and is easy to see in a few short hours. There are many masters here and it is not as crowded as the Prado so if the size of one scares you this would be a fabulous alternative.

quote: Exceptional - be sure to visit when in Madrid
reviewnospace:
Absolutely loved the collection here. The building was easy to navigate and the highlights readily found.
We visited after having been to Prado and Queen Sofia. The Prado is undoubtedly something special, albeit that the religious art is not to my touch. Sadly I was not blown away by the modern art at Queen Sofia, of which I felt there were few exceptional pieces.
Would definitely come back here as there is so much to see and enjoy.
Cafe is also worth a visit.
titleopinion: Exceptional - be sure to visit when in Madrid. Absolutely loved the collection here. The building was easy to navigate and the highlights readily found. Sadly I was not blown away by the modern art at Queen Sofia, of which I felt there were few exceptional pieces. Would definitely come back here as there is so much to see and enjoy. Cafe is also worth a visit.

reviewnospace: one of the best art collections i have ever seen - and the museum layout and content was in my opinion better than the Renee Sofia museum that houses the Guernica
titleopinion: fabulous collection. one of the best art collections i have ever seen - and the museum layout and content was in my opinion better than the Renee Sofia museum that houses the Guernica

quote: A Great Gallery, with a Wide Range
reviewnospace: We got the three gallery special, this being number one. Excluded access to the temporary exhibitions, but there was still plenty to see. Loosely chronological in presentation, a large collection of everything from early Christian art, through to a few Pop Art pieces, and all stops in between, including a big section on Impressionism, and lots of big names, and quite a few that I was not familiar with. Finished with a sandwich in the cafe. Very pleasant half day.
titleopinion: A Great Gallery, with a Wide Range. We got the three gallery special, this being number one. Excluded access to the temporary exhibitions, but there was still plenty to see. Loosely chronological in presentation, a large collection of everything from early Christian art, through to a few Pop Art pieces, and all stops in between, including a big section on Impressionism, and lots of big names, and quite a few that I was not familiar with. Finished with a sandwich in the cafe. Very pleasant half day.

reviewnospace: Good to know: the museum is open and the entrance is free on Monday from 12 till 16h. Very varied collection!
titleopinion: Wonderful collection. Good to know: the museum is open and the entrance is free on Monday from 12 till 16h. Very varied collection!

reviewnospace: We thoroughly enjoyed what turned out to be a journey through time depicting the changing face of art. From Canaletto to Freud and everything in between this collection has something for every taste. The museum is spacious and well lit and we were able to wander through at our own pace. A definite must if you have a couple of hours to spare.
titleopinion: An interesting journey. We thoroughly enjoyed what turned out to be a journey through time depicting the changing face of art. From Canaletto to Freud and everything in between this collection has something for every taste. The museum is spacious and well lit and we were able to wander through at our own pace. A definite must if you have a couple of hours to spare.

quote: The most interesting Museum in Madrid
reviewnospace: The most people will visit Prado as the first museum in Madrid. But I would recommend as a first museum to visit in the city the Thyssen-Bornemisza. One of the most complete collections of 19th and 20th century paintings
titleopinion: The most interesting Museum in Madrid. The most people will visit Prado as the first museum in Madrid. But I would recommend as a first museum to visit in the city the Thyssen-Bornemisza. One of the most complete collections of 19th and 20th century paintings

reviewnospace:
We love this museum. The size is good so that you are not overwhelmed. The layout is so easy to follow and you will not miss anything. Start the visit from the top floor and travel down, you will see art works from the medieval time to the 20th century. It is like you are traveling through the art history. We love this museum!

The museum store is also worth to check out. They have really cute stuff at reasonable price.
titleopinion: Wondering museum deserves your time. We love this museum. The size is good so that you are not overwhelmed. The layout is so easy to follow and you will not miss anything. Start the visit from the top floor and travel down, you will see art works from the medieval time to the 20th century. It is like you are traveling through the art history. We love this museum!   The museum store is also worth to check out. They have really cute stuff at reasonable price.

reviewnospace: Generally enjoyed this museum. Paintings are well displayed in a dedicated space, well lit and with plenty of space around them. As a private collection it is a bit limited by what was available to buy at the time. There are some real classic pieces like Holbein's Henry VIII and some nice Canalettos but the collection of impressionists is where the museum really shines. It wasn't crowded and took up a nice morning's viewing.
titleopinion: Some very interesting paintings. Generally enjoyed this museum. Paintings are well displayed in a dedicated space, well lit and with plenty of space around them. As a private collection it is a bit limited by what was available to buy at the time. There are some real classic pieces like Holbein's Henry VIII and some nice Canalettos but the collection of impressionists is where the museum really shines. It wasn't crowded and took up a nice morning's viewing.

reviewnospace: A Museum with a comprehensive collection of art of Baroque, Neoclassical to Contemporary painting. There are interesting temporary exhibitions
titleopinion: A beautiful collection. A Museum with a comprehensive collection of art of Baroque, Neoclassical to Contemporary painting. There are interesting temporary exhibitions

reviewnospace: We paid extra for the Caravaggio special exhibition which we thought was expensive for what it was. However, the rest of the gallery is a very pleasant airy, uncluttered and spacious building. It has a great collection of modern art from all of the well know artists. It is much smaller than the Reina Sofia but big enough to keep you engrossed for three hours or more.
titleopinion: Mainly very good. We paid extra for the Caravaggio special exhibition which we thought was expensive for what it was. However, the rest of the gallery is a very pleasant airy, uncluttered and spacious building. It has a great collection of modern art from all of the well know artists. It is much smaller than the Reina Sofia but big enough to keep you engrossed for three hours or more.

quote: One of the best collections in the world
reviewnospace: This is one of the best collection in the world. I love the fact that it is kind of intimate and it is not full of tourist wondering about of art. Usually people who go there are all well mannered and know what to expect. An the fact that is located in a palace it give you the experience to know how the Spanish nobility use to live.

I love the fact that it is kind of intimate and it is not full of tourist wondering about of art. Usually people who go there are all well mannered and know what to expect. An the fact that is located in a palace it give you the experience to know how the Spanish nobility use to live.

reviewnospace: What I loved about this museum was the size. My mom and I spent a few hours in the afternoon while it was cooking outside and it was such an enjoyable, comfortable afternoon. They featured exhibit was Caravaggio, nicely curated. Then we leisurely walked through much of the rest of the museum without feeling overwhelmed. I highly recommend this museum.
titleopinion: A very doable museum.. What I loved about this museum was the size. My mom and I spent a few hours in the afternoon while it was cooking outside and it was such an enjoyable, comfortable afternoon. They featured exhibit was Caravaggio, nicely curated. Then we leisurely walked through much of the rest of the museum without feeling overwhelmed. I highly recommend this museum.

reviewnospace:
I really enjoyed it here - a fantastic collection of 12th/13th century religious works coupled with fantastic works from Picasso, Dali, Holbein, Degas, Cezanne and Lichtenstein all in a light, airy building.

It's the smallest of the 3 main Madrid galleries (Reina Sofia & Prado being the others) but it is just as good - highly recommended!
titleopinion: Great builsing, great collection. I really enjoyed it here - a fantastic collection of 12th/13th century religious works coupled with fantastic works from Picasso, Dali, Holbein, Degas, Cezanne and Lichtenstein all in a light, airy building.  It's the smallest of the 3 main Madrid galleries (Reina Sofia & Prado being the others) but it is just as good - highly recommended!

reviewnospace: There is so much in this museum to see that it's hard to even begin. There are so many highlights, but what is wonderful is that there is so much space, so beautifully lit and laid out that you don't feel crowded. My main advice is to plan a day here, take your time, relax in the cafe to recharge your batteries, and carry on. The Caravaggio exhibit was outstanding.
titleopinion: Overwhelming!. There is so much in this museum to see that it's hard to even begin. There are so many highlights, but what is wonderful is that there is so much space, so beautifully lit and laid out that you don't feel crowded. My main advice is to plan a day here, take your time, relax in the cafe to recharge your batteries, and carry on. The Caravaggio exhibit was outstanding.

reviewnospace: A wonderful collection of paintings. Unfortunately, like in Prado's case, there are too many things to see for the tourist disposing of only few hours. A possible choice (not the best one) is to combine Thyyssen-Bornemisza Museum with Prado Museum (they are very close each other) in one day, looking only to the most important masterpieces, according to the leaflets you may find at both entrances.
titleopinion: Something to roemember!. A wonderful collection of paintings. Unfortunately, like in Prado's case, there are too many things to see for the tourist disposing of only few hours. A possible choice (not the best one) is to combine Thyyssen-Bornemisza Museum with Prado Museum (they are very close each other) in one day, looking only to the most important masterpieces, according to the leaflets you may find at both entrances.

quote: The best private collection in the world!
reviewnospace: Everytime I go, I discover new things. This time it was the Ribera's.....so influenced by Caravaggio.
titleopinion: The best private collection in the world!. Everytime I go, I discover new things. This time it was the Ribera's.....so influenced by Caravaggio.

reviewnospace: A very diverse range of artists and periods represented. A nice counterbalance to the Prado. Very quiet when we visited so didn't save any time by pre-booking tickets. Spent around two and a half hours walking around which didn't really do the museum justice. Lovely cafe with outdoor terrace however not quite as nice as the cafe at the Prado........but nice to have a break during the visit. Something for everyone and definitely worth visiting. Some lovely items in the shop drawing from the collection. Well worth booking a slot for the Caravaggio exhibition.
titleopinion: Varied Collection. A very diverse range of artists and periods represented. A nice counterbalance to the Prado. Very quiet when we visited so didn't save any time by pre-booking tickets. Spent around two and a half hours walking around which didn't really do the museum justice. Lovely cafe with outdoor terrace however not quite as nice as the cafe at the Prado........but nice to have a break during the visit. Something for everyone and definitely worth visiting. Some lovely items in the shop drawing from the collection. Well worth booking a slot for the Caravaggio exhibition.

reviewnospace: Some of the most famous and beautiful works of art ... even if you know little about art, as is my case, you'll be entranced by all these. Plan on spending at least half a day, it's worth it.
titleopinion: Beautiful. Some of the most famous and beautiful works of art ... even if you know little about art, as is my case, you'll be entranced by all these. Plan on spending at least half a day, it's worth it.

reviewnospace: Very impressive art collection, especially German expressionists, American 19th century art, Flemish paintings.

quote: Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum was very nice, well worth the visit!

titleopinion: Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum was very nice, well worth the visit!. Excellent and a must see while in Madrid. I recommend all the museums you can get to while in Spain!!

reviewnospace: Very nice museum, again too big so we didn't visit all the floors, but lot of nice hold paintings, love to go back.
titleopinion: Art!. Very nice museum, again too big so we didn't visit all the floors, but lot of nice hold paintings, love to go back.

reviewnospace:
We visited the hotel on a Monday, turns out its free to go on a Monday (I think because it opens at 12 and not 10). The painting collection there is amazing, it covers such a large time period and is set out according to time. Therefore any visitors should start on level 2 and work your way down. You'll get to see El Greco, Caravaggio, Rubens, Monet, Picasso, Dali, Miro, Freud etc etc. the list goes on !!
A visit here is a must if you are in Madrid.

You'll get to see El Greco, Caravaggio, Rubens, Monet, Picasso, Dali, Miro, Freud etc etc. the list goes on !! A visit here is a must if you are in Madrid.

reviewnospace: Close to the Prado Museum yet not so prominent in appearance, this museum is a hidden treasure. It offers a varied collection of old masters housed in a updated mansion. Everything is well organized and professional. During my visit they had a visiting exhibit of Northern European paintings. The permanent collection is also worthwhile seeing. A visit to this museum will enhance a visit to the other art museums in Madrid.

reviewnospace: This collection encompasses fills in the blanks from the Prado over the road - a vast array of incredible art. Canaletto, Van Gogh, Manet, Rubens, Holbein, Degas, Picasso, Dali, etc. There's something for every taste.

quote: A jewel of a museum to visit again and again
reviewnospace: If you like paintings, this museum is the place to go. It is like a big mansion that has paintings everywhere. You can take all the pictures you want (not in the special Exhibitions, but this does not matter) and conclude your visit with purchases from the Museum's Shop. I have visited the Museum many times and every time it is like my first. The setting is what makes the difference. You can approach the paintings and spend as much time you want on any of them. Absolutely wonderful and inspiring.

Great organisation and staff who spoke English.

reviewnospace:
This is an excellent museum and is the perfect compliment to the Prado Museum.

As a very keen admirer on Caravaggio’s art I was so glad to know that there was a temporary exhibition of Caravaggio’s works called ‘Caravaggio and the Painters of the North’. What a fantastic surprise! It was pretty busy and there was a long queue to enter the exhibition but it is worth it very much.

The Thyssen Collection itself is considered to be the greatest private collection after that of Queen Elizabeth II. Among the works are stunning paintings by Durer, Hopper, Titian, Toulouse-Lautrec, Hals, Van Dyck and many more. The place is pretty big so take as much as you can.

There is a combine ticket to visit Thyssen Collection and Caravaggio’s works on reasonable price.
titleopinion: Excellent exhibition of Caravaggio’s works!. This is an excellent museum and is the perfect compliment to the Prado Museum.   As a very keen admirer on Caravaggio’s art I was so glad to know that there was a temporary exhibition of Caravaggio’s works called ‘Caravaggio and the Painters of the North’. What a fantastic surprise! It was pretty busy and there was a long queue to enter the exhibition but it is worth it very much.   The Thyssen Collection itself is considered to be the greatest private collection after that of Queen Elizabeth II. Among the works are stunning paintings by Durer, Hopper, Titian, Toulouse-Lautrec, Hals, Van Dyck and many more. The place is pretty big so take as much as you can.   There is a combine ticket to visit Thyssen Collection and Caravaggio’s works on reasonable price.

From four Rodin sculptures in the "lobby", through old masters, impressionists and finally the mind blowing Salvator Dali... it is not a museum to miss and was our second choice after the Prado. We also enjoyed a drink on the beautiful terrace of the museum's restaurant. A nice touch: on Monday from 12 to 16 it is free, we didn't have to pay anything and amazingly it wasn't even crowded.

Its clean airconditioned and well laid out. Awesome senspirational museum.

All the masters are available to see including taking photography.  Its clean airconditioned and well laid out. Awesome senspirational museum.

reviewnospace:
I visited the Thyssen during the free period, after queuing for an hour and squeezed it in while my children went to the Bernabau. My limited 90 minutes allowed me to walk through the whole museum, focusing on my preferred sections and less time on the others (it was still quite quiet at this time).
The collection is generally modern (starts at Renaissance) and clearly and well displayed (it was hard to get lost unlike the Prado). You could also follow the art in terms of a timeline, which I prefer to do.
The museum itself is beautiful and lends itself to displaying the art so well.
Definitely recommend this museum - some (professional) reviewers say it is too eclectic a collection or not in the same league as the other museums, which is probably true. All i know is I preferred this as it was more manageable in my timeframe, easy to navigate, a wide range of art that would be accessible to most people.
I wish I had taken my children to this museum instead of the Prado as they would have enjoyed the Kandinskys, Mondrians, Lichtensteins and Pollocks as well as the light and airy feel of the museum.

reviewnospace: I live in Madrid and have visited this museum many times over the past ten years especially with visiting friends and family. It houses both a permanent collection and a regular turnaround of fantastic temporary exhibitions featuring certain artists or art periods. You can check the exhibitions on their website. I have never had to queue very long to get in and there is a nice gallery shop attached. The museum building is attractive and I like the fact that the museum is spacious but not as colossal as other museums like the Prado or Reina Sofia so its quite easy to navigate. Definitely worth a visit!

If you start at the top, and work down, you will start at the earliest paintings. This museum has only a few works by each artist, sor you don't get sick of an artist. Saw Rembrandt, dali, van gogh, Jackson pollock, picasso, among others.

reviewnospace:
We absolutely loved the Thyssen museum and would happily go again and again and again. Easy to get around; not overwhelming; great works of art; an app which helps you out with most of the pieces; and it's free on Monday afternoons WITHOUT being busy!

Kandinsky, Van Gogh, Monet, Cezanne, Picasso, Dali, Lichtenstein, Holbein, Lautrec, Degas, Canaletto, Feininger, Matisse, Estes....the list goes on. It feels like there is a work of art from almost every artist you can think of and it is all so accessible. You can stare at a Dali picture for hours if you want or follow a route pertaining to a particular theme...easily unlike at the Prado.

I was blown away by this museum and plan to return again and again.

If u like both old and modern arts u will like this museum.

reviewnospace: This museum has a wonderful collection and is curated well. It is definitely worth a visit. You will not be disappointed.
titleopinion: Nice Collection. This museum has a wonderful collection and is curated well. It is definitely worth a visit. You will not be disappointed.

reviewnospace:
On a recent visit to Madrid, I learned what an art mecca the city is. Our first (of three) art museum visits there was to the Thyssen-Bornemisza, which had started decades ago as a private collection. We weren't disappointed.
While the Thyssen may be overshadowed by the nearby Prado, it holds its own well. The Museum has a much broader range than the Prado (or the modern art Reina Sofia), with its four floors including 14th Century+ European, Baroque, Impressionist, and Expressionist offerings. Artists featured include Duccio, Rubens, Van Gogh, Degas, Cezanne, Gauguin, and Homer (among others).
The floors are well laid out and not overly crowded. Allow at least two hours to see the highlights, and longer if you want to really get in depth.
titleopinion: Art Treasures Worth Exploring. On a recent visit to Madrid, I learned what an art mecca the city is. Our first (of three) art museum visits there was to the Thyssen-Bornemisza, which had started decades ago as a private collection. We weren't disappointed. While the Thyssen may be overshadowed by the nearby Prado, it holds its own well. The Museum has a much broader range than the Prado (or the modern art Reina Sofia), with its four floors including 14th Century+ European, Baroque, Impressionist, and Expressionist offerings. Artists featured include Duccio, Rubens, Van Gogh, Degas, Cezanne, Gauguin, and Homer (among others). The floors are well laid out and not overly crowded. Allow at least two hours to see the highlights, and longer if you want to really get in depth.

reviewnospace:
I prefer this gallery to the Prado. The works are spectacular, but they are also very well organised so that you can walk through history. From old religious works through to pop art with much in between, this is a stunning museum.

Monday's are free, so you can visit then and save some money.
titleopinion: Fabulous. I prefer this gallery to the Prado. The works are spectacular, but they are also very well organised so that you can walk through history. From old religious works through to pop art with much in between, this is a stunning museum.   Monday's are free, so you can visit then and save some money.

quote: Lovely insight into the tastes of a couple of collectors
reviewnospace: This museum based on the private collections of a husband and wife offers a wide range of mostly painting styles, while also giving a glimpse of their personal tastes. It is a very manageable museum. Since you can purchase a ticket that lets you into the Prado as well, I'd recommend coming here first. There was no line-up. Also, the courtyard restaurant was a lovely place to hang-out and refresh, and has good food.

reviewnospace: Loved this gallery with enough really good paintings to satisfy the most jaded palate. There was a special exhibition of Madrid realism artists work that I loved when we visited. And the Kandinskis in the main gallery were fabulous.
titleopinion: Kandinsky!. Loved this gallery with enough really good paintings to satisfy the most jaded palate. There was a special exhibition of Madrid realism artists work that I loved when we visited. And the Kandinskis in the main gallery were fabulous.

reviewnospace: Easily completed in a morning or afternoon. Rent the audio guide, it is excellent. Don't miss the excellent adjacent restaurant - loved the tapas.
titleopinion: A great afternoon treat!. Easily completed in a morning or afternoon. Rent the audio guide, it is excellent. Don't miss the excellent adjacent restaurant - loved the tapas.

quote: One of the Most Amazing Collections in the World
reviewnospace:
Upon our visit to Madrid we were eager to visit all the fine museums that this beautiful city has to offer. Coming from New York City, we are regulars at all the world renowned fine art museums. The Thyssen museum was by far one of the best museum we have ever visited worldwide. It is like a smaller version of The Met. The collection is so diverse and presented in the most exquisite way. The salmon colored walls on one of the floors which displays the religious art makes the artworks come to life. There are many famous artists represented in the collection: Rembrandt, Monet, Close, Picasso, and many, many more.

This is a beautiful museum worth a visit while staying in Madrid. There is something for everyone to enjoy and for art lovers it is an incredible collection straight out of an art textbook representative of artists worldwide.
titleopinion: One of the Most Amazing Collections in the World. Upon our visit to Madrid we were eager to visit all the fine museums that this beautiful city has to offer. Coming from New York City, we are regulars at all the world renowned fine art museums. The Thyssen museum was by far one of the best museum we have ever visited worldwide. It is like a smaller version of The Met. The collection is so diverse and presented in the most exquisite way. The salmon colored walls on one of the floors which displays the religious art makes the artworks come to life. There are many famous artists represented in the collection: Rembrandt, Monet, Close, Picasso, and many, many more.   This is a beautiful museum worth a visit while staying in Madrid. There is something for everyone to enjoy and for art lovers it is an incredible collection straight out of an art textbook representative of artists worldwide.

quote: A museum sponsored by a former Spanish gold digger who had married the 30 years older Thyssen multi- billionair
reviewnospace:
There was a German 78 years old grandson of the legendary founder of the famous Thyssen steel imperium. His name was Heinrich Baron von Thyssen-Bornemisza.

A 25 years younger Spanish former beauty- queen of about 50 years old met this German multi-billionair. She was married with the US- American actor Lex Barker (famous for his role as the blond, tall and athletic 'Shatterhand' in the "Winnetou" western movies).

The money- greedy Spanish former beauty queen switched from her husband Lex Barker to the German multi billionair (old and a wreck, but extremely wealthy) Heinrich Baron von Thyssen- Bornemisza (Hungarian noble name).

After Baron Heinrich von Thyssen-Bornemisza's death this money greedy Spanish former beauty queen Tita von Thyssen (alias Carmen Cervera) inherited his multi- billion fortune and a lot of extremely expensive paintings (exhibited in this museum).

If you want to know more about this money- gredy gold-digger lady, search in the Internet for the Spanish lady "Tita Thyssen" alias "Carmen Cervera" and for the German multi- billionaire "Heinrich Baron von Thyssen-Bornemisza".

- Though this money- greedy gold diger lady, the museum itself is really worth a visit. You won't regret it!
