I love the Thyssen-Bornemisza, it is very airy and well lit with an amazing collection from very early to very modern art. Love the Chagall's and the Bonnard's but it does not matter what your taste in art is there will be something that appeals.

reviewnospace: Truly a remarkable collection spanning the history of art. Very pleasant to wander around with plenty of places to sit. Interesting audio guide. I saw the Caravaggio exhibition which was excellent and the Caillebotte one (lacking The Floor Scrapers) which was more ordinary
titleopinion: Outstanding collection. Truly a remarkable collection spanning the history of art. Very pleasant to wander around with plenty of places to sit. Interesting audio guide. I saw the Caravaggio exhibition which was excellent and the Caillebotte one (lacking The Floor Scrapers) which was more ordinary

reviewnospace: A vy nice buding with an incredible,eclectic, and varied art collection. Well worte visit and make if you are of a certain age or can show proof of being a student you will get a discount on the ticket to get in. The varied art work included somewell known painters including Monet, Manet, Picasso Dali,Hopper and Letrec. There were also a number of more modern painters includong Jason Pollack, and Wyeth,
titleopinion: Impressive collection of art.. A vy nice buding with an incredible,eclectic, and varied art collection. Well worte visit and make if you are of a certain age or can show proof of being a student you will get a discount on the ticket to get in. The varied art work included somewell known painters including Monet, Manet, Picasso Dali,Hopper and Letrec. There were also a number of more modern painters includong Jason Pollack, and Wyeth,

reviewnospace: Wonderful general collection. Post-impressionist works are particularly interesting. A wonderful complement to more "traditional" visit to Prado. Highly recommend. Watch out for special exhibits too. Last (and least), museum cafe is a good choice for light lunch.
titleopinion: Wonderful general collection, particularly post-impressionists.. Wonderful general collection. Post-impressionist works are particularly interesting. A wonderful complement to more  traditional  visit to Prado. Highly recommend. Watch out for special exhibits too. Last (and least), museum cafe is a good choice for light lunch.

quote: The art enthusiast could kill a day here
reviewnospace: I spent probably 5 hours in this museum. And I could have spent more had I not been in a hurry to get to the Royal Palace before closing. As someone who loves older art, I would start at the 3rd floor and work my way back down to the first. That's the most logical order in hindsight and that way, if the more modern art isn't your thing, you and blow through it at the end. Also there is a special exhibit there right now called Carvaggio. It's worth the extra money in my opinion. I spent an hour in that exhibition alone.
titleopinion: The art enthusiast could kill a day here. I spent probably 5 hours in this museum. And I could have spent more had I not been in a hurry to get to the Royal Palace before closing. As someone who loves older art, I would start at the 3rd floor and work my way back down to the first. That's the most logical order in hindsight and that way, if the more modern art isn't your thing, you and blow through it at the end. Also there is a special exhibit there right now called Carvaggio. It's worth the extra money in my opinion. I spent an hour in that exhibition alone.

reviewnospace: There are a lot of great art works here and some of THE greats. Picasso, Dali, Cezanne, Van Gogh and Monet are common place. Well set out and well lit with non flash photography allowed which is good. When there is this much art on show you can pick and choose what you want to concentrate on and a list of the main paintings are on the back of the guide.
titleopinion: Amazing art gallery. There are a lot of great art works here and some of THE greats. Picasso, Dali, Cezanne, Van Gogh and Monet are common place. Well set out and well lit with non flash photography allowed which is good. When there is this much art on show you can pick and choose what you want to concentrate on and a list of the main paintings are on the back of the guide.

reviewnospace: This is a great place to visit, the museum is well organised the art work is wonderful with a better variety than the Prado and it is easy to navigate. Toilets are clean and well signed. We had a pass for the three main museums and this was our favourite. The café down stairs was very busy so time your visit well.
titleopinion: Excellent museum. This is a great place to visit, the museum is well organised the art work is wonderful with a better variety than the Prado and it is easy to navigate. Toilets are clean and well signed. We had a pass for the three main museums and this was our favourite. The café down stairs was very busy so time your visit well.

quote: a real MUST when in Madrid !
reviewnospace: Spent 3 hours non stop with the collection and an hour more with the Caravaggio exhibit . Memorable ! and great gift shop .
titleopinion: a real MUST when in Madrid !. Spent 3 hours non stop with the collection and an hour more with the Caravaggio exhibit . Memorable ! and great gift shop .

reviewnospace: Although much smaller than Prado this is a must see. Not as busy but all the art was phenominal. Loved it and it was also so cool inside as it was sweltering outside. Many artists works to see.
titleopinion: A Favourite. Although much smaller than Prado this is a must see. Not as busy but all the art was phenominal. Loved it and it was also so cool inside as it was sweltering outside. Many artists works to see.

quote: Completely shocked in a great way
reviewnospace: Don't miss it Sometimes overwhelmed by its bigger sisters in Madrid however has a collection that is both old and new. Shows the eye of a truly savvy collector that put passion thought and love into their collection. There is something for everyone including perfect special exhibits. Currently Caravaggio. It is not only inviting but inspirational. A complete surprise
titleopinion: Completely shocked in a great way . Don't miss it Sometimes overwhelmed by its bigger sisters in Madrid however has a collection that is both old and new. Shows the eye of a truly savvy collector that put passion thought and love into their collection. There is something for everyone including perfect special exhibits. Currently Caravaggio. It is not only inviting but inspirational. A complete surprise

reviewnospace: Beside the Prado this is the museum to see in Madrid. And there is a lot to see and beautiful paintings. Also temporary exhibitions
titleopinion: Must see. Beside the Prado this is the museum to see in Madrid. And there is a lot to see and beautiful paintings. Also temporary exhibitions

reviewnospace: This is a lovely museum with a broad-spectrum of styles and periods of art. It was not overly crowded (especially considering I had visited on one of their free days). There was no line to enter; spent about 2 hours or so.
titleopinion: Don't miss this Gem!. This is a lovely museum with a broad-spectrum of styles and periods of art. It was not overly crowded (especially considering I had visited on one of their free days). There was no line to enter; spent about 2 hours or so.

quote: This was my favorite in Madrid
reviewnospace: This museum is substantially smaller than the Prado, but it has a varied collection of art which I really loved.
titleopinion: This was my favorite in Madrid. This museum is substantially smaller than the Prado, but it has a varied collection of art which I really loved.

reviewnospace: My friend and I went to Thyssen for a few hours. Honestly, we went two hours before the permanent exhibit closed and it wasn't enough time to see it all. We got the audio guide which was on one hand great, but on the other way too detailed for your average art appreciator (art enthusiasts would probably be in heaven with all the detail). We also went to the Carravaggio temporary exhibit which was small, but interesting. I would definitely recommend going, but wouldn't get the audioguide next time.
titleopinion: Beautiful Art, Many Famous Artists. My friend and I went to Thyssen for a few hours. Honestly, we went two hours before the permanent exhibit closed and it wasn't enough time to see it all. We got the audio guide which was on one hand great, but on the other way too detailed for your average art appreciator (art enthusiasts would probably be in heaven with all the detail). We also went to the Carravaggio temporary exhibit which was small, but interesting. I would definitely recommend going, but wouldn't get the audioguide next time.

reviewnospace: Everyone knows the Prado, but this is the other great art gallery in Madrid, and can be more enjoyable than its more famous neighbour.
titleopinion: Must see in Madrid. Everyone knows the Prado, but this is the other great art gallery in Madrid, and can be more enjoyable than its more famous neighbour.

quote: So great I visited it twice in a week
reviewnospace: During our visit a temporary exhibition dedicated to Caravaggio took place - that alone drove me twice to this great museum. Smaller than Prado, with great collection of flemish old school masters, italian and spanish mansters and painters form Kandinsky to Monet. I rank it higher and liked it more than the Prado Museum. Also, you do not get as exausted as the themes of the paintings in question are more diverse. Do not miss it.
titleopinion: So great I visited it twice in a week. During our visit a temporary exhibition dedicated to Caravaggio took place - that alone drove me twice to this great museum. Smaller than Prado, with great collection of flemish old school masters, italian and spanish mansters and painters form Kandinsky to Monet. I rank it higher and liked it more than the Prado Museum. Also, you do not get as exausted as the themes of the paintings in question are more diverse. Do not miss it.

reviewnospace: Although I was only in Madrid for a few days I made sure to see this museum. Although it is a matter of personal taste ,I enjoyed this museum much more than the Prado. There is so much to absorb & enjoy yet one does not feel rushed. If I have the good fortune to return to Madrid I will definately return to my new ,favorite museum !
titleopinion: So Interesting !. Although I was only in Madrid for a few days I made sure to see this museum. Although it is a matter of personal taste ,I enjoyed this museum much more than the Prado. There is so much to absorb & enjoy yet one does not feel rushed. If I have the good fortune to return to Madrid I will definately return to my new ,favorite museum !

reviewnospace: This museum allows one to see the growth of painting from the 12th century to now. It has the major painters lessor work and Minor painters master works. Your will easily spend the whole day here!
titleopinion: Great Museum. This museum allows one to see the growth of painting from the 12th century to now. It has the major painters lessor work and Minor painters master works. Your will easily spend the whole day here!

reviewnospace: We spent the better part of a day here and saw some lesser-known but very good works of art. Our lunch in the cafe was very good, too. I liked the fact that it wasn't as over-run as many art museums often are.
titleopinion: Lively and colorful!. We spent the better part of a day here and saw some lesser-known but very good works of art. Our lunch in the cafe was very good, too. I liked the fact that it wasn't as over-run as many art museums often are.

quote: The history of art in one place
reviewnospace: From religious art till modern times. You can clearly see how painting evolved through ages. Lots of top names. Definitely a must-see. Tickets €12
titleopinion: The history of art in one place. From religious art till modern times. You can clearly see how painting evolved through ages. Lots of top names. Definitely a must-see. Tickets €12

reviewnospace:
Here , in one of the 3 best museum/galleries in Madrid, you can see many examples of great art over the last 700 years. The collection is large, and you need plenty of time, to really appreciate the assembled work .The Dutch Golden age, Impressionist art, and 20th Century are impressive.It really is one of the best Private art collections, open to the Public anywhere.
There is the bonus of art by Caravaggio and his contemporaries, which lasts until September.
titleopinion: Wonderful art collection , and Caravaggios.. Here , in one of the 3 best museum/galleries in Madrid, you can see many examples of great art over the last 700 years. The collection is large, and you need plenty of time, to really appreciate the assembled work .The Dutch Golden age, Impressionist art, and 20th Century are impressive.It really is one of the best Private art collections, open to the Public anywhere. There is the bonus of art by Caravaggio and his contemporaries, which lasts until September.

quote: For modern art go to the 1st floor
reviewnospace: Great collection. It is recommended to use the audio-guide. The upper floor has more traditional Spanish items. If you want a good sample of 20th century painting, the first floor is full of it. Three hours is approximately needed to go through the main items.
titleopinion: For modern art go to the 1st floor. Great collection. It is recommended to use the audio-guide. The upper floor has more traditional Spanish items. If you want a good sample of 20th century painting, the first floor is full of it. Three hours is approximately needed to go through the main items.

reviewnospace: We bought the one ticket which gave us access to the 3 main museums which was a great way to skip some long lines at the Prado. We really enjoyed this museum as it wasn't too big but we were able to enjoy excellent works from some great artists.
titleopinion: Wonderful collection!. We bought the one ticket which gave us access to the 3 main museums which was a great way to skip some long lines at the Prado. We really enjoyed this museum as it wasn't too big but we were able to enjoy excellent works from some great artists.

reviewnospace: The museum is extremely well laid out and some excellent paintings on display, well worth the admission fee and I would definitely visit it again
titleopinion: Well presented top quality. The museum is extremely well laid out and some excellent paintings on display, well worth the admission fee and I would definitely visit it again

reviewnospace: One of the best museums we have visited. Well laid out, the painting descriptions are available in English. This museum has examples of every important artist in the world.
titleopinion: One of my favorite museums!. One of the best museums we have visited. Well laid out, the painting descriptions are available in English. This museum has examples of every important artist in the world.

reviewnospace: Thyssen has a good collection but it is always worth checking out what exhibition is in place and planning your visit accordingly. Definitely a good place to explore Madrid.
titleopinion: good collection. Thyssen has a good collection but it is always worth checking out what exhibition is in place and planning your visit accordingly. Definitely a good place to explore Madrid.

reviewnospace: One of my main reasons for going to Madrid. This was my favorite museum in the city. There are so many famous paintings here that I could have spent several days poring over the works. Hope to come back to see more. Modern paintings were truly enjoyable.
titleopinion: Not to be missed. One of my main reasons for going to Madrid. This was my favorite museum in the city. There are so many famous paintings here that I could have spent several days poring over the works. Hope to come back to see more. Modern paintings were truly enjoyable.

quote: Nice way to spend free time.
reviewnospace: After the Royal palace, it was a nice break to shop and then go to the Thyssen Bornemisza museum. I did not rent an audio tape and just walked through at my own pace. The Renaissance and more contemporary artists were a particular love. Many on the top floor were not terribly interesting to me. The ticket enabled me to enter the temporary exhibition. Well worth the price.
titleopinion: Nice way to spend free time.. After the Royal palace, it was a nice break to shop and then go to the Thyssen Bornemisza museum. I did not rent an audio tape and just walked through at my own pace. The Renaissance and more contemporary artists were a particular love. Many on the top floor were not terribly interesting to me. The ticket enabled me to enter the temporary exhibition. Well worth the price.

reviewnospace: If you are in the museum district of Madrid, make sure to visit this under-rated museum. Admission is more than reasonable (cheaper than Prado and the Sofia), and their collection is surprisingly stunning! Chronologically organized, you're taken through time to witness the evolution of art.
titleopinion: Absolutely Stunning. If you are in the museum district of Madrid, make sure to visit this under-rated museum. Admission is more than reasonable (cheaper than Prado and the Sofia), and their collection is surprisingly stunning! Chronologically organized, you're taken through time to witness the evolution of art.

reviewnospace:
Went in a free evening.
Was busy but still fantastic
Great artworks an extensive collection.
A must see in Madrid.
Love it.
titleopinion: Great art gallery . Went in a free evening.  Was busy but still fantastic  Great artworks an extensive collection.  A must see in Madrid.  Love it.

quote: Went for free- fantastic museum, must see
reviewnospace: First, a hint. Don't wait in line for the free attendance in the heat of the day. Wait 10 minutes after the free period starts and you will walk right in. I really don't know where to start. The museum is very well organized by the period of the art. The Thyssen collection has lot of American artists and great collection of abstractionists. We spent about 3 hours there. Like most museums, lighting is a problem to take non flash pictures. But, careful positioning can help. Around the corner is the Prado and a great fresh salad restaurant. That's for another review. Enjoy
titleopinion: Went for free- fantastic museum, must see. First, a hint. Don't wait in line for the free attendance in the heat of the day. Wait 10 minutes after the free period starts and you will walk right in. I really don't know where to start. The museum is very well organized by the period of the art. The Thyssen collection has lot of American artists and great collection of abstractionists. We spent about 3 hours there. Like most museums, lighting is a problem to take non flash pictures. But, careful positioning can help. Around the corner is the Prado and a great fresh salad restaurant. That's for another review. Enjoy

reviewnospace: Even though the Prado museum is the most famous this is my favourite museum in Madrid. If you love impressionists and modern art this is your place. Plenty of Dali paintings and some very important impressionist art work will be waiting for you. Very relaxing and nice building. Add it to you list of you are in Madrid!
titleopinion: My favourite . Even though the Prado museum is the most famous this is my favourite museum in Madrid. If you love impressionists and modern art this is your place. Plenty of Dali paintings and some very important impressionist art work will be waiting for you. Very relaxing and nice building. Add it to you list of you are in Madrid!

quote: Go now before it closes! Don't overthink - go !
reviewnospace: Before it is no longer available - and potentially moved to Andorra or somewhere else for a private collection - go see great classic pieces - this is one of the most recognized collections owned by 1 family! Also took a couple of hours to make it through this one - stop only at what calls your attention or you won't make it to the end. Make sure to get the audio piece- if you are smart - bring you earphones so you can plug into the audio piece.
titleopinion: Go now before it closes! Don't overthink - go !. Before it is no longer available - and potentially moved to Andorra or somewhere else for a private collection - go see great classic pieces - this is one of the most recognized collections owned by 1 family! Also took a couple of hours to make it through this one - stop only at what calls your attention or you won't make it to the end. Make sure to get the audio piece- if you are smart - bring you earphones so you can plug into the audio piece.

quote: Probably not the Prado - but definitely worth a vsit
reviewnospace: You could wander here for hours, There are some superb pieces, but also a lot of stuff that didn't suit my taste. But please go - it's should be a Madrid essential. Whilst probably not as good as the Prado for the heavy duty stuff there;'s plenty to see that you'll enjoy.
titleopinion: Probably not the Prado - but definitely worth a vsit. You could wander here for hours, There are some superb pieces, but also a lot of stuff that didn't suit my taste. But please go - it's should be a Madrid essential. Whilst probably not as good as the Prado for the heavy duty stuff there;'s plenty to see that you'll enjoy.

reviewnospace: We were so delighted with our lunch at the glass-walled cafeteria of the Thyssen museum. You walk down a ramp at one extreme of the building (I think we had to exit the building) and come upon this large, airy room with sunlight pouring in. We had sandwiches listed at $3.50 each so we expected miniscule portions. Oh no. Nice sized bocadillos (on what Americans would call French or Italian bread) were delicious, and came with chips as well. A bottle of water rounded out the meal and we paid about $5 each for a really nice lunch. I'm from Manhattan so the price and quality were quite unexpected, but even my Valencian friend was impressed. Sorry I didn't take a photo to go with this review, but honestly, it was a find.
titleopinion: Wow--what a nice surprise!. We were so delighted with our lunch at the glass-walled cafeteria of the Thyssen museum. You walk down a ramp at one extreme of the building (I think we had to exit the building) and come upon this large, airy room with sunlight pouring in. We had sandwiches listed at $3.50 each so we expected miniscule portions. Oh no. Nice sized bocadillos (on what Americans would call French or Italian bread) were delicious, and came with chips as well. A bottle of water rounded out the meal and we paid about $5 each for a really nice lunch. I'm from Manhattan so the price and quality were quite unexpected, but even my Valencian friend was impressed. Sorry I didn't take a photo to go with this review, but honestly, it was a find.

reviewnospace: Constant Companion and I always visit the Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza when in Madrid. Our most recent visit was to view the EXCELLENT Exhibit "Wyeth: Andrew and Jamie in the Studio" which was done in conjunction with Denver Art Museum. This was the first European retrospective of the Wyeth's and is now closed but a very good virtual tour is still available on the Thyssen website. Following our Wyeth tour we re-visited some of our favorite Fauvist and German Expressionist works which the Thyssen is famous for displaying! Note that there is a reduced Senior Rate for entrance and also free evenings. Check the website for specifics.
titleopinion: Always Visit the Thyssen!!!!. Constant Companion and I always visit the Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza when in Madrid. Our most recent visit was to view the EXCELLENT Exhibit  Wyeth: Andrew and Jamie in the Studio  which was done in conjunction with Denver Art Museum. This was the first European retrospective of the Wyeth's and is now closed but a very good virtual tour is still available on the Thyssen website. Following our Wyeth tour we re-visited some of our favorite Fauvist and German Expressionist works which the Thyssen is famous for displaying! Note that there is a reduced Senior Rate for entrance and also free evenings. Check the website for specifics.

reviewnospace: Don't do this museum the same day as the Prada. This museum has lots of 15, 16, 17 and 18 century art...way more than can be seen in a day.
titleopinion: Big. Don't do this museum the same day as the Prada. This museum has lots of 15, 16, 17 and 18 century art...way more than can be seen in a day.

quote: And then, across from the Prado...
reviewnospace:
There's the Thyssen! More great art, from a private collection, this time. Many different schools of art, arranged by country and period, as well as style. A huge impressionist collection, anchored by lesser works of Monet and Degas, but lots of great paintings by lesser known practitioners.

Also a wonderful collection of Dutch masters, and Italian school. I was able to see the Caravaggio exhibit, which had his work, as well as that of artists he influenced. Again, worth the time.
titleopinion: And then, across from the Prado.... There's the Thyssen! More great art, from a private collection, this time. Many different schools of art, arranged by country and period, as well as style. A huge impressionist collection, anchored by lesser works of Monet and Degas, but lots of great paintings by lesser known practitioners.   Also a wonderful collection of Dutch masters, and Italian school. I was able to see the Caravaggio exhibit, which had his work, as well as that of artists he influenced. Again, worth the time.

reviewnospace: Museum Thyssen has a vast collection of paintings from late Middle Ages up to the start of the 20th century. All paintings are well exposed in a beautiful building. A cool oasis in the middle of a hot Madrid summer.
titleopinion: vast collection. Museum Thyssen has a vast collection of paintings from late Middle Ages up to the start of the 20th century. All paintings are well exposed in a beautiful building. A cool oasis in the middle of a hot Madrid summer.

reviewnospace:
There is no separate tickets to temporary expositions :(
There are only 7 masterpieses of Caravaggio on temporary excibition "Caravaggio and the Painters of the North"
titleopinion: Great collection. There is no separate tickets to temporary expositions :( There are only 7 masterpieses of Caravaggio on temporary excibition  Caravaggio and the Painters of the North

reviewnospace: This private museum is set up in mostly a chronological order. It was nice to go through and see the progression of art and was very interesting for my daughter to get a feel for what inspired what.
titleopinion: Art through the ages. This private museum is set up in mostly a chronological order. It was nice to go through and see the progression of art and was very interesting for my daughter to get a feel for what inspired what.

quote: My new favorit - all time high
reviewnospace:
I choose this museum because I'm mostly intrested in impressionism and expressionism. From room 30 uppwards I could hardly believe my eyes. Maybe because they filled with tears. The most serene Munch painting as a contrast to what is best known av him, wonderfull pictures av both Kandinsky and Munther, members of Der blaue Reiter, the latter (Munther) underestimated in her days. And so on. I just marvelled.
The accessability for disabled people was good (we didn't use the toilettes, so we can't judge those.)
titleopinion: My new favorit - all time high. I choose this museum because I'm mostly intrested in impressionism and expressionism. From room 30 uppwards I could hardly believe my eyes. Maybe because they filled with tears. The most serene Munch painting as a contrast to what is best known av him, wonderfull pictures av both Kandinsky and Munther, members of Der blaue Reiter, the latter (Munther) underestimated in her days. And so on. I just marvelled. The accessability for disabled people was good (we didn't use the toilettes, so we can't judge those.)

reviewnospace:
Beautiful building !!!!!
Nice staff in ticketing place . Well displayed the arts . Exquisite arts of Caravaggio paintings .
titleopinion: Caravaggio . Beautiful building !!!!!  Nice staff in ticketing place . Well displayed the arts . Exquisite arts of Caravaggio paintings .

reviewnospace: Defiantly do on a Monday between 12pm - 4pm, it's free!!! Check website to confirm, not certain how long the offer is in effect.
titleopinion: Monday's are free. Defiantly do on a Monday between 12pm - 4pm, it's free!!! Check website to confirm, not certain how long the offer is in effect.

reviewnospace: The museum is very nice with wonderfull pieces of paintings from several old Masters. You can visit in half a day if you want. The cafe outside is nice to sit with reasonable priced drinks and sandwiches. You can exit the museum and continue later if you want. A place you must visit if you like ancient paintings.
titleopinion: Amazing museum. The museum is very nice with wonderfull pieces of paintings from several old Masters. You can visit in half a day if you want. The cafe outside is nice to sit with reasonable priced drinks and sandwiches. You can exit the museum and continue later if you want. A place you must visit if you like ancient paintings.

reviewnospace: Would recommend for any art lover as well as a must go for anyone visiting the city. Varied art so there is something for everyone. Pay a small fee to go in, gets a bit more expensive for specific exhibitions but the main exhibits are great.
titleopinion: Lovely museum, spacious and varied. Would recommend for any art lover as well as a must go for anyone visiting the city. Varied art so there is something for everyone. Pay a small fee to go in, gets a bit more expensive for specific exhibitions but the main exhibits are great.

reviewnospace: An excellent gallery, and collection of art work. the impressionist art work was well worth the entry fee. We went at the back of 4pm and were there for 3 hours. If you like art - include this in your itinary for a visit to Madrid. It beats the Prada hands down.
titleopinion: A Delightful Art Gallery. An excellent gallery, and collection of art work. the impressionist art work was well worth the entry fee. We went at the back of 4pm and were there for 3 hours. If you like art - include this in your itinary for a visit to Madrid. It beats the Prada hands down.

reviewnospace: I was only in Madrid for a few days and having already been to many larger museums, I felt some of the others were too big and not the best use of my time (for my interests) while in Madrid. I love impressionist art and found the Thyssen-Bornemisza museum to be the perfect size to explore, doesn't break the travel budget and was filled with lovely paintings including many impressionist pieces for those that love Monet, Renoir, Degas, etc.
titleopinion: Great, smaller size museum. I was only in Madrid for a few days and having already been to many larger museums, I felt some of the others were too big and not the best use of my time (for my interests) while in Madrid. I love impressionist art and found the Thyssen-Bornemisza museum to be the perfect size to explore, doesn't break the travel budget and was filled with lovely paintings including many impressionist pieces for those that love Monet, Renoir, Degas, etc.

reviewnospace: Beautiful art gallery which is very user friendly. On a hot June day it wasn't at all crowded. The art is very well spaced and the lay out and directions are clear. Contains predominantly modern art, in particular, the impressionists. Reduced entry for seniors on production of passport.
titleopinion: Superb collection.. Beautiful art gallery which is very user friendly. On a hot June day it wasn't at all crowded. The art is very well spaced and the lay out and directions are clear. Contains predominantly modern art, in particular, the impressionists. Reduced entry for seniors on production of passport.

reviewnospace: This is one of the best art galleries in Madrid. It is centrally situated and no queues! Spacious and cool with fabulous paintings to see. Cafe also was quick and food delicious.
titleopinion: Thyssen Bornemisza Museum. This is one of the best art galleries in Madrid. It is centrally situated and no queues! Spacious and cool with fabulous paintings to see. Cafe also was quick and food delicious.

reviewnospace: Picasso, Goya, Caravaggio ... and more! Amazing museum ... but even more amazing is that on Mondays it is free of charge all day!
titleopinion: A MUST DO. Picasso, Goya, Caravaggio ... and more! Amazing museum ... but even more amazing is that on Mondays it is free of charge all day!

quote: A highlight of a visit to Madrid
reviewnospace: Madrid is world renowned for its three Art Museos - Prado, Sofia and Thyssen. On a previous visit to Madrid we had visited two but this time it was Thyssen. You cannot take it all in, in an extended visit. Just take time to focus on the areas that attract and let it wash over you, whether you are an expert or someone open to experiences of the moment. Highly recommended - it is free entry Mondays from 12 noon to 4pm sponsored by Mastercard.
titleopinion: A highlight of a visit to Madrid. Madrid is world renowned for its three Art Museos - Prado, Sofia and Thyssen. On a previous visit to Madrid we had visited two but this time it was Thyssen. You cannot take it all in, in an extended visit. Just take time to focus on the areas that attract and let it wash over you, whether you are an expert or someone open to experiences of the moment. Highly recommended - it is free entry Mondays from 12 noon to 4pm sponsored by Mastercard.

reviewnospace: Very easy to visit with broad clear spaces and a great collection. From Middle Ages to Moderns. Right now a great Caravaggio exhibition. They are ver friendly but as usual the personal is weak in English.
titleopinion: My preferred museum in Madrid. Very easy to visit with broad clear spaces and a great collection. From Middle Ages to Moderns. Right now a great Caravaggio exhibition. They are ver friendly but as usual the personal is weak in English.

reviewnospace: Permanent collection is alot of great works but you need to plan out what you want to see as it can be overwhelming with 1600 works. Audio is a must. Definitely worth a visit and the cafe after is also excellent. Highly recommend while in Madrid.
titleopinion: Visiting collection was Caravaggio...excellent.. Permanent collection is alot of great works but you need to plan out what you want to see as it can be overwhelming with 1600 works. Audio is a must. Definitely worth a visit and the cafe after is also excellent. Highly recommend while in Madrid.

reviewnospace: I am not an art lover per se but from what my limited education was back in high school regarding art I did recognize many famous names. This place is wonderful. I could not believe the quality and quantity and range of art displayed here. I was most pleased that I had the opportunity to visit such an art museum.
titleopinion: Wow. I am not an art lover per se but from what my limited education was back in high school regarding art I did recognize many famous names. This place is wonderful. I could not believe the quality and quantity and range of art displayed here. I was most pleased that I had the opportunity to visit such an art museum.

reviewnospace: Please go to this museum.It has some of the most famous artists works. I enjoyed this museum more than the Prado. It has classics and contemporary artists. Andrew Wyeth exhibit is a temporary exhibit.
titleopinion: Absolutely fantastic. Please go to this museum.It has some of the most famous artists works. I enjoyed this museum more than the Prado. It has classics and contemporary artists. Andrew Wyeth exhibit is a temporary exhibit.

reviewnospace:
What a wonderful collection and beautifully curated. The paintings are grouped in salon by period, allowing you to cruise through periods that may not be your favorites and focus on the well-known paintings from that time. Then, you can easily enjoy the periods you like in more detail.

First time ever for me, I spent the entire day in a museum; from 11 am to closing at 7 pm. Which brings me to another good feature of the museum - its cafe/restaurant. What a pleasant place to take a break. I wasn't expecting anything special of the food front and was pleasantly surprised with the fresh fish dish with nettle sauce and decent wine. We returned to have dessert later.

Thank you to the couple that collected and sold or loaned the art-work and to the government that built and maintains the museum.
titleopinion: Favorite Museum in Madrid. What a wonderful collection and beautifully curated. The paintings are grouped in salon by period, allowing you to cruise through periods that may not be your favorites and focus on the well-known paintings from that time. Then, you can easily enjoy the periods you like in more detail.  First time ever for me, I spent the entire day in a museum; from 11 am to closing at 7 pm. Which brings me to another good feature of the museum - its cafe/restaurant. What a pleasant place to take a break. I wasn't expecting anything special of the food front and was pleasantly surprised with the fresh fish dish with nettle sauce and decent wine. We returned to have dessert later.  Thank you to the couple that collected and sold or loaned the art-work and to the government that built and maintains the museum.

reviewnospace: This is a gem of a museum with a tremendous collection of Renoirs. Monet's , Degas and all the master's. A must visit while in Madrid . The set up of the museum was much better than other museums we visited.
titleopinion: My favorite museum in Madrid . This is a gem of a museum with a tremendous collection of Renoirs. Monet's , Degas and all the master's. A must visit while in Madrid . The set up of the museum was much better than other museums we visited.

quote: A possibly overlooked gem in Madrid
reviewnospace: So we went to most of the major museums in Madrid--El Prado, Reina Sophia, etc, but our favorite was this small museum near the El Prado. They say they have minor works by major artists and major works by lesser known artists. The art was chosen by the Baron Thyssen, his wife, and his father before him. It was a wonderful experience and even lunch in the museum restaurant was great!
titleopinion: A possibly overlooked gem in Madrid. So we went to most of the major museums in Madrid--El Prado, Reina Sophia, etc, but our favorite was this small museum near the El Prado. They say they have minor works by major artists and major works by lesser known artists. The art was chosen by the Baron Thyssen, his wife, and his father before him. It was a wonderful experience and even lunch in the museum restaurant was great!

quote: Well-Designed Museum with a Wonderful Collection of Impressionist and Expressionist Art
reviewnospace: We had a wonderful guide who explained the history of the museum and the rationale for its layout. She stressed that the Prado had most of the classic works but that the Thyssen had the more contemporary paintings. I liked that the museum wasn't crowded and that it was very easy to explore the different galleries.
titleopinion: Well-Designed Museum with a Wonderful Collection of Impressionist and Expressionist Art. We had a wonderful guide who explained the history of the museum and the rationale for its layout. She stressed that the Prado had most of the classic works but that the Thyssen had the more contemporary paintings. I liked that the museum wasn't crowded and that it was very easy to explore the different galleries.

reviewnospace: This art museum is smaller than the Prado but still has the same quality and boasts many world famous painters and paintings. This focuses more on fresher and original and modern fine art and only has a sprinkle of religious art. And good abstract art hete as well. In my opinion this is the better art museum but if you can and have the time please do visit both main art museums. Located over the road from the Prado. This museum is not as popular as the Prado and doesnt have much queuing. Toilets and good shop. Banco de Espana metro station is best. Free with Madrid Card.
titleopinion: Excellent art museum . This art museum is smaller than the Prado but still has the same quality and boasts many world famous painters and paintings. This focuses more on fresher and original and modern fine art and only has a sprinkle of religious art. And good abstract art hete as well. In my opinion this is the better art museum but if you can and have the time please do visit both main art museums. Located over the road from the Prado. This museum is not as popular as the Prado and doesnt have much queuing. Toilets and good shop. Banco de Espana metro station is best. Free with Madrid Card.

quote: Great museum - but stiff competition from other museums in Madrid
reviewnospace: I visited this museum with my mother & grandmother primarily to see a temporary exhibit of Paul Gauguin. Great museum - but the Reina Sofia museum ranks as a top 5 museum in the world in my opinion. Unsure if you can get in free with a student ID - I believe I did pay to get in.
titleopinion: Great museum - but stiff competition from other museums in Madrid. I visited this museum with my mother & grandmother primarily to see a temporary exhibit of Paul Gauguin. Great museum - but the Reina Sofia museum ranks as a top 5 museum in the world in my opinion. Unsure if you can get in free with a student ID - I believe I did pay to get in.

reviewnospace: This is a first-rate museum. Personally, I'd return here before returning to the Prado. The exhibits are well curated, the art is well chosen and well displayed. What more can you ask for in an art museum?
titleopinion: Come For The Art. This is a first-rate museum. Personally, I'd return here before returning to the Prado. The exhibits are well curated, the art is well chosen and well displayed. What more can you ask for in an art museum?

quote: Visit to the Thyssen Art Gallery
reviewnospace:
The Thyssen is a private gallery. It had exquisite masters from every period. Selected works from many old masters, and a beautiful variety.
The exhibition was very well done in a progressive manner. The gallery was not huge, and easy to absorb in detail, with good descriptions.
titleopinion: Visit to the Thyssen Art Gallery. The Thyssen is a private gallery. It had exquisite masters from every period. Selected works from many old masters, and a beautiful variety.  The exhibition was very well done in a progressive manner. The gallery was not huge, and easy to absorb in detail, with good descriptions.

reviewnospace: Very rich in contemporary history and culture, I dont think anyone would be disappointed when visiting this place. but yet not the best museum in Madrid for sure
titleopinion: Amazing and huge musem. Very rich in contemporary history and culture, I dont think anyone would be disappointed when visiting this place. but yet not the best museum in Madrid for sure

quote: One of the most interesting museums in Madrid
reviewnospace: Incredible collection, it is really worth the visit. A wonderful trip that takes you through the history of art, from centuries ago to contemporary paintings of great value and beauty.
titleopinion: One of the most interesting museums in Madrid. Incredible collection, it is really worth the visit. A wonderful trip that takes you through the history of art, from centuries ago to contemporary paintings of great value and beauty.

reviewnospace: An amazing collection of art comprising roughly nine centuries of art. A must-see for art lovers, currently with a temporary exhibit on Caravaggio and painters he influenced.
titleopinion: Impressive collection of art. An amazing collection of art comprising roughly nine centuries of art. A must-see for art lovers, currently with a temporary exhibit on Caravaggio and painters he influenced.

quote: One of the best Art galleries I have ever been to!
reviewnospace: The collection here is outstanding. A broad range of artists from medieval to contemporary. Not just the best of each artists but unique and rare examples. A must see museum.
titleopinion: One of the best Art galleries I have ever been to!. The collection here is outstanding. A broad range of artists from medieval to contemporary. Not just the best of each artists but unique and rare examples. A must see museum.

quote: Very good museum. Plenty to see
reviewnospace: This museum is very good and with an interesting history behind its collectors. One of the largest private collections, there is plenty to see in multiple styles.
titleopinion: Very good museum. Plenty to see. This museum is very good and with an interesting history behind its collectors. One of the largest private collections, there is plenty to see in multiple styles.

reviewnospace: What a wonderful discovery. Lost ourselves in this extraordinary collection of beauty and discovered some new artists (to us!) Very calm.
titleopinion: Just wonderful.... What a wonderful discovery. Lost ourselves in this extraordinary collection of beauty and discovered some new artists (to us!) Very calm.

quote: Overview of the world of arts
reviewnospace:
The Thyssen Museum holds a brilliant collecion from art of more than tousand years.
My personal interest starts with the imressionists and I have to say, that basically of every famouse artist, the thyssen museum shows a master piece. This is true as well for many moden us artists.
An impressive museum with regularly changing special exhibitions.
You can even visit the collection free of charge on the mondays ftom 12-16
titleopinion: Overview of the world of arts. The Thyssen Museum holds a brilliant collecion from art of more than tousand years. My personal interest starts with the imressionists and I have to say, that basically of every famouse artist, the thyssen museum shows a master piece. This is true as well for many moden us artists. An impressive museum with regularly changing special exhibitions. You can even visit the collection free of charge on the mondays ftom 12-16

quote: Worthy visit and nice place for breakfast!
reviewnospace:
Another museum where you can find many other activities.
It is also a great place to have breakfast (starting at 10).
titleopinion: Worthy visit and nice place for breakfast!. Another museum where you can find many other activities. It is also a great place to have breakfast (starting at 10).

reviewnospace: The queues at the Prado were huge so we decided to come here instead and we're glad we'd done so. The museum was large enough to have a fabulous variety of work but small enough to be manageable. Some really wonderful pictures. No guides that we saw but audio machines. After we went to the cafe in the grounds and had a lovely lunch in very pleasant surroundings.
titleopinion: A beautiful and interesting museum. The queues at the Prado were huge so we decided to come here instead and we're glad we'd done so. The museum was large enough to have a fabulous variety of work but small enough to be manageable. Some really wonderful pictures. No guides that we saw but audio machines. After we went to the cafe in the grounds and had a lovely lunch in very pleasant surroundings.

reviewnospace: Great, as usual: the temporary exhibitions are well designed, but they are always very crowded. Visit them early in the morning.
titleopinion: Temporary exhibition. Great, as usual: the temporary exhibitions are well designed, but they are always very crowded. Visit them early in the morning.

reviewnospace: This smaller museum does not disappoint. Thoughtfully curated collections from western artists chooses only a few pieces from each artist, but they show surprising insight into the work beyond what you may have learned in art history class. Very friendly to the viewer and not as crowded or overwhelming as the neighboring major museum.
titleopinion: Superb gem of a collection. This smaller museum does not disappoint. Thoughtfully curated collections from western artists chooses only a few pieces from each artist, but they show surprising insight into the work beyond what you may have learned in art history class. Very friendly to the viewer and not as crowded or overwhelming as the neighboring major museum.

quote: Check out the exhibitions before you go
reviewnospace:
The private collection is incredible but so are the exhibitions. Try to look them up ahead of time and get the tickets in advanced. The last one I saw left me mesmerized, Munch. An artist I admire since very young and finally had the opportunity to see his work in person.
Easy to get there, is right in what Madrilians call "the artistic triangle", buses 27, 14, 34, among others. Use their webpage to get your tickets and enjoy the art.
titleopinion: Check out the exhibitions before you go. The private collection is incredible but so are the exhibitions. Try to look them up ahead of time and get the tickets in advanced. The last one I saw left me mesmerized, Munch. An artist I admire since very young and finally had the opportunity to see his work in person.  Easy to get there, is right in what Madrilians call  the artistic triangle , buses 27, 14, 34, among others. Use their webpage to get your tickets and enjoy the art.

reviewnospace: If you were filthy rich and wanted to build a collection of art from all times and places, this would probably be it / Si fueras asquerosamente rico y quisieras montar tu colección de arte de todo lugar y tiempo, este sería probablemente el resultado
titleopinion: A Collection / Una colección . If you were filthy rich and wanted to build a collection of art from all times and places, this would probably be it / Si fueras asquerosamente rico y quisieras montar tu colección de arte de todo lugar y tiempo, este sería probablemente el resultado

reviewnospace:
We downloaded the audioguide on an iPhone - cheaper and lets you share by splitting headphones!
Overall really enjoyed spending a morning in this museum. It is an extremely well laid-out, extensive collection (of European paintings, that is) and seems to be a more relaxed alternative to the ever-crowded Prado, as other reviewers have mentioned.
titleopinion: Very enjoyable visit. We downloaded the audioguide on an iPhone - cheaper and lets you share by splitting headphones! Overall really enjoyed spending a morning in this museum. It is an extremely well laid-out, extensive collection (of European paintings, that is) and seems to be a more relaxed alternative to the ever-crowded Prado, as other reviewers have mentioned.

reviewnospace: You start on the top floor with the Romanesque and work your way down to the Abstract on the ground floor. The visit is not at all overpowering and the special exhibition is always worthwhile.
titleopinion: Art from top to bottom.. You start on the top floor with the Romanesque and work your way down to the Abstract on the ground floor. The visit is not at all overpowering and the special exhibition is always worthwhile.

quote: A must-see! Best museum in Madrid!
reviewnospace:
Most people rank the Reina Sofia or Prado museums as the best, but for me the Thyssen-Bornemisza had a greater range and more spectacular artworks than both combined!

I have to admit I'm a huge surrealist fan, and seeing a few Dali's in one place may have tilted my bias, but there was also Magritte, Van Gogh, Degas, Monet, Manet, Cezanne, Rembrandt, Holbein, Lichtenstein and more!

All that in a much smaller space than the other museums so you can easily see all the artworks in one go without wearing yourself out.

Dali's "Dream caused by the flight of a bee around a pomegranate a second before awakening" was a total highlight for me.
titleopinion: A must-see! Best museum in Madrid!. Most people rank the Reina Sofia or Prado museums as the best, but for me the Thyssen-Bornemisza had a greater range and more spectacular artworks than both combined!  I have to admit I'm a huge surrealist fan, and seeing a few Dali's in one place may have tilted my bias, but there was also Magritte, Van Gogh, Degas, Monet, Manet, Cezanne, Rembrandt, Holbein, Lichtenstein and more!  All that in a much smaller space than the other museums so you can easily see all the artworks in one go without wearing yourself out.  Dali's  Dream caused by the flight of a bee around a pomegranate a second before awakening  was a total highlight for me.

reviewnospace: Before visiting this museum, I got diferent recomendations... Don't pay attention to the bad readings, it is really an amazing museum, many kind of different artist and a wide variety of styles. We enjoyed our time spend there!
titleopinion: Can't miss it!. Before visiting this museum, I got diferent recomendations... Don't pay attention to the bad readings, it is really an amazing museum, many kind of different artist and a wide variety of styles. We enjoyed our time spend there!

quote: Great hand held descriptions of paintings
reviewnospace: Very good Caravaggio temporary exhibition. Need to put a bench in every room for the handicapped and elderly to sit. Restaurant should have full menu available while open.
titleopinion: Great hand held descriptions of paintings. Very good Caravaggio temporary exhibition. Need to put a bench in every room for the handicapped and elderly to sit. Restaurant should have full menu available while open.

quote: Skip the Prado and come here
reviewnospace: This museum was much more enjoyable than the Prado. The modern and impressionist art was wonderful to see up close. It is on both my sons favorite part of Madrid.
titleopinion: Skip the Prado and come here. This museum was much more enjoyable than the Prado. The modern and impressionist art was wonderful to see up close. It is on both my sons favorite part of Madrid.

reviewnospace: If you can only manage one gallery out of Reina Sofia, Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza then this is the one. The collections range from pre-Renaissance through to post-modern.
titleopinion: Most comprehensive selection. If you can only manage one gallery out of Reina Sofia, Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza then this is the one. The collections range from pre-Renaissance through to post-modern.

quote: Van Gogh, Cézanne, Kandinsky, Dalí, Rembrandt
reviewnospace: Could you imagine owning these paintings! What an amazing afternoon I had on my own. As a design student from Costa Rica It was completely inspiring. To see these paintings up close is truely a dream come true! I loved the gift shop!! Great book collections and decor but a little pricey.
titleopinion: Van Gogh, Cézanne, Kandinsky, Dalí, Rembrandt. Could you imagine owning these paintings! What an amazing afternoon I had on my own. As a design student from Costa Rica It was completely inspiring. To see these paintings up close is truely a dream come true! I loved the gift shop!! Great book collections and decor but a little pricey.

quote: A wide range of art - excellent Wyeth temporary exhibition
reviewnospace: The current, temporary, exhibition of art by Andrew & Jamie Wyeth is excellent. The collection of art is extensive and covers several centuries.
titleopinion: A wide range of art - excellent Wyeth temporary exhibition. The current, temporary, exhibition of art by Andrew & Jamie Wyeth is excellent. The collection of art is extensive and covers several centuries.

reviewnospace: I've tried to get into the Prado Museum several times with no success - the lines are just too long. So walking back to my hotel - Westin Palace - I discovered the Thyssen right across the street. Thought I would pop in for 30min or so, stayed for three hours. Great range of art, excellent layout and flow of people - just the right amount of people. Staff is very friendly.
titleopinion: Pleasant Surprise. I've tried to get into the Prado Museum several times with no success - the lines are just too long. So walking back to my hotel - Westin Palace - I discovered the Thyssen right across the street. Thought I would pop in for 30min or so, stayed for three hours. Great range of art, excellent layout and flow of people - just the right amount of people. Staff is very friendly.

reviewnospace: Went in because there was no line (getting into Prado was impossible) and needed to escape the heat wave. Was blown away by the collection of impressionist art (the rest was ok too, but impressionists are all I really care about) Highly recommend
titleopinion: Impressionists!. Went in because there was no line (getting into Prado was impossible) and needed to escape the heat wave. Was blown away by the collection of impressionist art (the rest was ok too, but impressionists are all I really care about) Highly recommend

reviewnospace: Try visiting on Mondays 12-4pm when it's free in, nice selection of works which is handy when you're travelling with people who aren't massive art lovers so you can buzz about in an hour or two and not try their patience too much! The Degas ballerina verde is simply stunning
titleopinion: Free on Mondays. Try visiting on Mondays 12-4pm when it's free in, nice selection of works which is handy when you're travelling with people who aren't massive art lovers so you can buzz about in an hour or two and not try their patience too much! The Degas ballerina verde is simply stunning

quote: A stunning collection of contemporary and classic art
reviewnospace: The Thyssen-Bornemisza is one of my favorite art collections anywhere. That is is the private collection of one family is extraordinary and the range of art collected is stunning. From the Danish masters to the French impressionists and the Spanish greats, my personal favorites were among the contemporary collection that includes Pollack, Rothko, Kandinsky, Lichtenstein, Hopper, Wyeth and many more. The range is remarkable.
titleopinion: A stunning collection of contemporary and classic art. The Thyssen-Bornemisza is one of my favorite art collections anywhere. That is is the private collection of one family is extraordinary and the range of art collected is stunning. From the Danish masters to the French impressionists and the Spanish greats, my personal favorites were among the contemporary collection that includes Pollack, Rothko, Kandinsky, Lichtenstein, Hopper, Wyeth and many more. The range is remarkable.

reviewnospace: This museum is the best in Madrid for modern art and surpassed my expectations. Lots of impressionism and fauvism. Full day of interesting artwork
titleopinion: Rivals Pompidou . This museum is the best in Madrid for modern art and surpassed my expectations. Lots of impressionism and fauvism. Full day of interesting artwork

quote: Surprising collection of 20th Century European paintings
reviewnospace: This art museum was a real surprise and delight! I just loved the variety of Modern European painters, especially the German Expressionists and it was interesting to see so many lesser known early works by so many of the artists like Matisee, Delaunay and Kandinsky where you could see how their particular style developed. Well worth a visit - after the Prado.
titleopinion: Surprising collection of 20th Century European paintings. This art museum was a real surprise and delight! I just loved the variety of Modern European painters, especially the German Expressionists and it was interesting to see so many lesser known early works by so many of the artists like Matisee, Delaunay and Kandinsky where you could see how their particular style developed. Well worth a visit - after the Prado.

reviewnospace: Visited the special opening ceremony for the new Caravaggio and the Northern artists exhibit. It was somewhat crowded, but exhibit is very thoughtfully put together. Several beautiful pieces by Caravaggio and his disciples.
titleopinion: Caravaggio Exhibit. Visited the special opening ceremony for the new Caravaggio and the Northern artists exhibit. It was somewhat crowded, but exhibit is very thoughtfully put together. Several beautiful pieces by Caravaggio and his disciples.

reviewnospace: Better than the Prado this museum has everything. Louvre quality,without DaVinci . Don't leave this out. Has the best Picasso's, better than Picasso Museum in Barcelona. Has even modern art that is magnificent. This museum is something that you will enjoy long after your visit.
titleopinion: Top Museum -A must see . Better than the Prado this museum has everything. Louvre quality,without DaVinci . Don't leave this out. Has the best Picasso's, better than Picasso Museum in Barcelona. Has even modern art that is magnificent. This museum is something that you will enjoy long after your visit.

reviewnospace:
The most wonderful collection , private or public I've ever experienced . Beautifully laid out , and comfortably walkable .
The range of Art , so varied from the 1400's to Lichtenstein , teased at the start by some exquisite Rodin .
I got there an hour before opening time , first in had the luxury of space to view .
I saw some stunning & unfamiliar artists .
titleopinion: This Gallery is a must ! . The most wonderful collection , private or public I've ever experienced . Beautifully laid out , and comfortably walkable .  The range of Art , so varied from the 1400's to Lichtenstein , teased at the start by some exquisite Rodin .  I got there an hour before opening time , first in had the luxury of space to view .  I saw some stunning & unfamiliar artists .

reviewnospace: El Prado one day and Thyssen the next, it doesn't get any better. To see these actual famous paintings sent chills up my spine.
titleopinion: More artistic beauty.. El Prado one day and Thyssen the next, it doesn't get any better. To see these actual famous paintings sent chills up my spine.

quote: Great permanent collection and temporary exhibitions
reviewnospace: The temporary exhibitions are mostly great. Check for prior reservation if you are interested in particular exhibits.
titleopinion: Great permanent collection and temporary exhibitions. The temporary exhibitions are mostly great. Check for prior reservation if you are interested in particular exhibits.

reviewnospace: Very well organized. You have the chance to experience history of art in one and a half hour. The way the collection is presented helps anyone understand the evolution of arts, currents and even the way artists perceive light in different countries. Very easy to see especially for 1400-1700 where paintings are displayed per countries.
titleopinion: exquisite art collection. Very well organized. You have the chance to experience history of art in one and a half hour. The way the collection is presented helps anyone understand the evolution of arts, currents and even the way artists perceive light in different countries. Very easy to see especially for 1400-1700 where paintings are displayed per countries.

quote: One of the Best in the World!
reviewnospace: We were blown away by this incredible art collection. We saw works by almost all of our favorite artists, except Vermeer. It's a beautiful museum, easy to navigate, and each piece is well marked. My dream was to one day see the Prado, which we loved, but hubby and I can't stop raving about the Thyssen. Works are from different countries and different periods, spanning hundreds of years (late 13th century to the 1980s). If you loved the Frick n NYC, you will love this collection too. It's considered to be one of the world's greatest private art collections. Three floors, open Tues - Sunday 10-7 and Mon 12-4 when it's free. 12 euros regular price or 8 euros for seniors and students. Very near the Prado (walking distance). Lovely outdoor cafe near entrance. Photos ok, no flash. Wheelchair accessible and available for loan.
titleopinion: One of the Best in the World!. We were blown away by this incredible art collection. We saw works by almost all of our favorite artists, except Vermeer. It's a beautiful museum, easy to navigate, and each piece is well marked. My dream was to one day see the Prado, which we loved, but hubby and I can't stop raving about the Thyssen. Works are from different countries and different periods, spanning hundreds of years (late 13th century to the 1980s). If you loved the Frick n NYC, you will love this collection too. It's considered to be one of the world's greatest private art collections. Three floors, open Tues - Sunday 10-7 and Mon 12-4 when it's free. 12 euros regular price or 8 euros for seniors and students. Very near the Prado (walking distance). Lovely outdoor cafe near entrance. Photos ok, no flash. Wheelchair accessible and available for loan.

reviewnospace: We were overwhelmed with the private collection and could have spent hours in this amazing museum. We're disappointed however that the Caravaggio was unavailable due to the upcoming exhibit in five days. Wish we had booked our tour of Madrid one week later. This is a special museum that should not be missed.
titleopinion: Wow, what a collection!. We were overwhelmed with the private collection and could have spent hours in this amazing museum. We're disappointed however that the Caravaggio was unavailable due to the upcoming exhibit in five days. Wish we had booked our tour of Madrid one week later. This is a special museum that should not be missed.

quote: Best collection of art I have admired in Madrid
reviewnospace:
I visited this museum after the Reina Sofia and El Prado; for me, it was above both of them.
Better organized, nicer paintings... The permission to take photos wherever you feel you find an interesting spot...
All that and some. Go there and you'll see with your own eyes.
titleopinion: Best collection of art I have admired in Madrid. I visited this museum after the Reina Sofia and El Prado; for me, it was above both of them. Better organized, nicer paintings... The permission to take photos wherever you feel you find an interesting spot... All that and some. Go there and you'll see with your own eyes.

reviewnospace: Prado is great, but this museum is more my style. Enjoyed the Impressionists, Hopper Rothko, Kadinsky and others. A wonderful museum. If in Madrid and an art lover-don't miss it! Discounts for seniors. Alert-Picasso's Guernica is not at this museum. It is at Reina Sofia museum not far away.
titleopinion: Liked it Better than Prado!. Prado is great, but this museum is more my style. Enjoyed the Impressionists, Hopper Rothko, Kadinsky and others. A wonderful museum. If in Madrid and an art lover-don't miss it! Discounts for seniors. Alert-Picasso's Guernica is not at this museum. It is at Reina Sofia museum not far away.

quote: amazing collection of art from the 15th century up to contemporary pieces
reviewnospace: Amazing collection which takes you through the ages of art. I was there for free entry on Monday afternoon and will be back for more for sure. Unfortunately they allow people to take pictures so it is extremely annoying for everybody else who just wants to look at the artworks rather than take a meaningless photograph.
titleopinion: amazing collection of art from the 15th century up to contemporary pieces. Amazing collection which takes you through the ages of art. I was there for free entry on Monday afternoon and will be back for more for sure. Unfortunately they allow people to take pictures so it is extremely annoying for everybody else who just wants to look at the artworks rather than take a meaningless photograph.

reviewnospace:
OK, Spain can boast for it's artists like Picasso and Dali'.
This museum houses modern art so you have to like modern art.
The main attraction is the large famous paint by Pablo Picasso "Guernica".
titleopinion: Interesting. OK, Spain can boast for it's artists like Picasso and Dali'. This museum houses modern art so you have to like modern art. The main attraction is the large famous paint by Pablo Picasso  Guernica .

reviewnospace: Baron Thyssen had the eye. From 17th century masters to Impressionism to the moderns. The Rothko, Bacon, Freud, the Degas, Manet, please take your time. Lovely. Absolutely lovely.
titleopinion: Private collection in elegant architecture. Baron Thyssen had the eye. From 17th century masters to Impressionism to the moderns. The Rothko, Bacon, Freud, the Degas, Manet, please take your time. Lovely. Absolutely lovely.

quote: Wow; a history of art in three easy floors.
reviewnospace: This is a phenomenal collection, starting with early icons on the top floor, through every development (too many to mention) right up to Lichenstein. The most impressive private collection I have ever seen!
titleopinion: Wow; a history of art in three easy floors.. This is a phenomenal collection, starting with early icons on the top floor, through every development (too many to mention) right up to Lichenstein. The most impressive private collection I have ever seen!

quote: Balanced overview of occidental painting since medieval era, excellent display conditions and building
reviewnospace:
This is mostly a quite well organized museum with very good display rooms. It offers a very balanced panorama of occidental painting since the end of middle ages (13th century and up).

I would stress the section of modern art (since the end of the 19th century, going through the 20th century). Nice paintings from Picasso, Dali, Miró, Kandinsky, Cézanne, Chagall, Degas, Van Gogh, and other impressionist and cubist painters. There are also many 17th century, 18th century, renaissance and medieval paintings from important artists, including the German, Flemish, Italian and Spanish schools (El Greco, Rubens, Rembrandt, Canaletto, Caravaggio, Ticciano, etc...).

There is a noticeable split (in terms of exhibition rooms) between the paintings of the Barons Thyssen-Bornemiza collection which have been bought by the Spanish state and those which are still in the possession of the Baroness Carmen Thyssen-Bornemisza and which are at display in the museum.

Well, to summarize I have to say I am not an art freak but had a very nice visit to the museum; it was not crowded at a Sunday afternoon, has a very nice "cafetaria", beautiful paintings, good gift shop, and is very well located in front of the "Museo del Prado".

Compared with the Museo del Prado (I visited it the day before), which doesn't display modern art, this visit at the TBM was a more pleasant way of spending an afternoon (not accounting with the fantastic Hieronymus Bosch - El Bosco - exhibition now undergoing in the Prado).
titleopinion: Balanced overview of occidental painting since medieval era, excellent display conditions and building. This is mostly a quite well organized museum with very good display rooms. It offers a very balanced panorama of occidental painting since the end of middle ages (13th century and up).  I would stress the section of modern art (since the end of the 19th century, going through the 20th century). Nice paintings from Picasso, Dali, Miró, Kandinsky, Cézanne, Chagall, Degas, Van Gogh, and other impressionist and cubist painters. There are also many 17th century, 18th century, renaissance and medieval paintings from important artists, including the German, Flemish, Italian and Spanish schools (El Greco, Rubens, Rembrandt, Canaletto, Caravaggio, Ticciano, etc...).   There is a noticeable split (in terms of exhibition rooms) between the paintings of the Barons Thyssen-Bornemiza collection which have been bought by the Spanish state and those which are still in the possession of the Baroness Carmen Thyssen-Bornemisza and which are at display in the museum.  Well, to summarize I have to say I am not an art freak but had a very nice visit to the museum; it was not crowded at a Sunday afternoon, has a very nice  cafetaria , beautiful paintings, good gift shop, and is very well located in front of the  Museo del Prado .  Compared with the Museo del Prado (I visited it the day before), which doesn't display modern art, this visit at the TBM was a more pleasant way of spending an afternoon (not accounting with the fantastic Hieronymus Bosch - El Bosco - exhibition now undergoing in the Prado).

reviewnospace: This museum is nicely laid out and easily visited. Perhaps we just got lucky, but we found that we had most rooms to ourselves as we wandered through the exhibits.
titleopinion: Great art with fewer crowds.. This museum is nicely laid out and easily visited. Perhaps we just got lucky, but we found that we had most rooms to ourselves as we wandered through the exhibits.

reviewnospace: this one's the best, no doubt: easy, not too busy but an amazing collection till recent decades. Preferable to Prado
titleopinion: The best museum in Madrid. this one's the best, no doubt: easy, not too busy but an amazing collection till recent decades. Preferable to Prado

quote: Great art shame about the wall colour
reviewnospace: Enormous collection of art - really take your time over them, if you have it, as there are many fine paintings in here. I much preferred this to the Prado. Minor gripe: María del Carmen Rosario Soledad Cervera y Fernández de la Guerra, Dowager Baroness Thyssen-Bornemisza de Kászon was obviously a great art collector but she really should have let someone more experienced as an art curator choose the wall colour. The salmon pink doesn't seem right and gets rather bland/repetitive as it's in every single room.
titleopinion: Great art shame about the wall colour. Enormous collection of art - really take your time over them, if you have it, as there are many fine paintings in here. I much preferred this to the Prado. Minor gripe: María del Carmen Rosario Soledad Cervera y Fernández de la Guerra, Dowager Baroness Thyssen-Bornemisza de Kászon was obviously a great art collector but she really should have let someone more experienced as an art curator choose the wall colour. The salmon pink doesn't seem right and gets rather bland/repetitive as it's in every single room.

quote: Buy Art Pass and Visit More Than Once
reviewnospace:
The Thyssen-Bornemisza collection is a wonderland of rarely seen works. Guides direct you to the top floor to see the oldest works first, but if you are a fan of modern art, resist their advice and head to the left, directly into the stunning collection of 20th century modern art. Overall, the museum collection is breathtaking but the museum itself is poorly lit, sadly and many of the paintings are under glass and are difficult to see with the reflection of the pinkish lights.
Skip the ticket lines by getting an Art Pass to the three top museums.
titleopinion: Buy Art Pass and Visit More Than Once. The Thyssen-Bornemisza collection is a wonderland of rarely seen works. Guides direct you to the top floor to see the oldest works first, but if you are a fan of modern art, resist their advice and head to the left, directly into the stunning collection of 20th century modern art. Overall, the museum collection is breathtaking but the museum itself is poorly lit, sadly and many of the paintings are under glass and are difficult to see with the reflection of the pinkish lights. Skip the ticket lines by getting an Art Pass to the three top museums.

quote: My favourite museum in Madrid with lovely impressionist art. Another good free experience from Madrid
reviewnospace:
We went here on Monday, when it is free for all and found it a great experience. I would have liked to spend more time here and would love to go back here again.
I found the impressionist art particularly interesting as its my favourite style, but there is something for everyone with portraits, cubism and many more styles of art throughout the museum.
The shop is also good with a section where you can buy your favourite pictures in different sizes for a not too expensive price.
My favourite museum in Madrid and a must-do if you are in the city.

The shop is also good with a section where you can buy your favourite pictures in different sizes for a not too expensive price. My favourite museum in Madrid and a must-do if you are in the city.

reviewnospace: This museum is three minutes from the Prado and has a first-rate collection very nicely displayed. There is also a nice cafe and patio.

quote: Must see for those who enjoy fine art
reviewnospace: This museum is a wonder. You will struggle to find as good a collection as well displayed and, because it is less well-known, in a more peaceful setting. The museum is an education in Western art unto itself.
titleopinion: Must see for those who enjoy fine art. This museum is a wonder. You will struggle to find as good a collection as well displayed and, because it is less well-known, in a more peaceful setting. The museum is an education in Western art unto itself.

reviewnospace: You can spend all day here seeing great works of art. The restaurant is really good and not expensive. Buy the ticket for the three art gallery's to save money.
titleopinion: Amazing. You can spend all day here seeing great works of art. The restaurant is really good and not expensive. Buy the ticket for the three art gallery's to save money.

quote: A well curated museum with a relaxed atmosphere
reviewnospace:
Regardless of what type of art enthusiast you are, chances are you will come away from this well-curated museum happy to note some new favourite pieces. This museum houses a vast collection of art from classic to modern artists, and arranged in a way that allows you to easily progress through the levels of the museum and not feel like you might have missed anything special (lots of room between paintings and for walking about).

A brief but genuine appreciation of all the works in this museum will probably have you walking for about 2 hours. There is a coat and bag counter where all things must be placed, for no cost. Photography is allowed, but without flash.
titleopinion: A well curated museum with a relaxed atmosphere. reviewnospace:
Superb collection.
Well laid out.
Excellent audio guide.
Cool.
Must go to museum cafe outside the entrance.

reviewnospace: Great collection, great building, great museum shop, great location! A plus in Madrid for sure if you are an art fan.
titleopinion: The Best Modern Museum. Great collection, great building, great museum shop, great location! A plus in Madrid for sure if you are an art fan.

quote: Nice mix of masters and modern
reviewnospace:
The museum is very well organized and you can easily find the key pieces of art in two hours. Set on three floors, it's easy to navigate around the museum, especially with the museum map/ guide that shows the floor and room associated with the most famous pieces of art.

My favorites included pieces by Rubens and Sargeant (masters) and Hopper, Kandinsky and Lichtenstein (modern). Modern tends to be in the ground floor and master on the top (2nd) floor.

The museum also has an extensive collection of cubism from the early 20th century.

When I visited there was a special exhibit dedicated to Andrew Wyeth and his son; it was included in the admission (€12) and also worth it except his most famous painting about Chirstina is not included.

reviewnospace: Don't miss this gallery. Superb exhibits, well laid out and not too busy. Queues not like the bigger galleries. We thoroughly enjoyed our morning there.

quote: Superb collection of Art for all tastes
reviewnospace: Superb gallery. We have visited many times and it is always fresh and easy to get around. Great selection of art from early 15C to modern contemporary. Bookshop and restaurants accessible without paying enty fee.
