reviewnospace: Very nice collection, located in the Madrid's museum triangle it's a must if you are interested in art. When we visited, a fascinating Munch exhibition was just going on..
titleopinion: World class museum. Very nice collection, located in the Madrid's museum triangle it's a must if you are interested in art. When we visited, a fascinating Munch exhibition was just going on..

reviewnospace:
Started as a private collection so it is challenging to quickly sum up what is here. You will find renaissance and baroque as well as impressionist and modern. Perhaps because of the variety it feels less overwhelming than the Prado. However in terms of sheer volume there are over 1,600 paintings on display.

There are masterpieces from Caravaggio, Hans Holbein, and Degas. There is a temporary exhibit on the American Frontier. I thought this could have been stronger.

I recommend purchasing tickets in advance on-line. It is easy to do and avoids having to decide which sort of ticket best suits your needs whilst queueing.
titleopinion: Broad scope of fantastic art. Started as a private collection so it is challenging to quickly sum up what is here. You will find renaissance and baroque as well as impressionist and modern. Perhaps because of the variety it feels less overwhelming than the Prado. However in terms of sheer volume there are over 1,600 paintings on display.  There are masterpieces from Caravaggio, Hans Holbein, and Degas. There is a temporary exhibit on the American Frontier. I thought this could have been stronger.  I recommend purchasing tickets in advance on-line. It is easy to do and avoids having to decide which sort of ticket best suits your needs whilst queueing.

reviewnospace: Possibly better than the Prado, the museum has an excellent mix of paintings, a great selection from artists across Europe and North America. When we visited there was a separate exhibition of Munsch's work; having been to the Munsch Museum in Oslo in May it was interesting to see more of his work. We had to leave to go to the airport but would definitely like to go back.
titleopinion: Don't miss this museum. Possibly better than the Prado, the museum has an excellent mix of paintings, a great selection from artists across Europe and North America. When we visited there was a separate exhibition of Munsch's work; having been to the Munsch Museum in Oslo in May it was interesting to see more of his work. We had to leave to go to the airport but would definitely like to go back.

reviewnospace: Hadn't been in years, think it's been expanded a bit. Was a very nice way to spend a couple of hours. Make sure you go all the way to the top and take your visit in chronological order,
titleopinion: Great Museum in Madrid. Hadn't been in years, think it's been expanded a bit. Was a very nice way to spend a couple of hours. Make sure you go all the way to the top and take your visit in chronological order,

reviewnospace:
This is a museum of the class of Musee d'Orsay in Paris. The collection of paintings is really impressive and guarantees a quality visit.

I personally liked the fact that the amount of art related to religion and portraits of kings etc. is limited. Instead you have more of impressionism for example and pieces of many many great painters are on display.

The museum is also well organised (in opposition to Del Prado) and elevators make a visit for families with children much easier.

If I were to see one thing in Madrid, this would be the one.
titleopinion: An absolute must . This is a museum of the class of Musee d'Orsay in Paris. The collection of paintings is really impressive and guarantees a quality visit.   I personally liked the fact that the amount of art related to religion and portraits of kings etc. is limited. Instead you have more of impressionism for example and pieces of many many great painters are on display.  The museum is also well organised (in opposition to Del Prado) and elevators make a visit for families with children much easier.   If I were to see one thing in Madrid, this would be the one.

reviewnospace: This is not the largest collection or art you will ever see. But what is amazing about it is the range of pieces on display. It's almost as if the intention was to have just a small number of each major artist and each major period over the last millenium or so. In many ways this is likely to mean that it will be more satisfying for many people than the Prado. Of course you must visit the Prado, but don't underestimate the Thyssen which is a must for any art-lover during a visit to Madrid.
titleopinion: Outstanding range of quality pieces. This is not the largest collection or art you will ever see. But what is amazing about it is the range of pieces on display. It's almost as if the intention was to have just a small number of each major artist and each major period over the last millenium or so. In many ways this is likely to mean that it will be more satisfying for many people than the Prado. Of course you must visit the Prado, but don't underestimate the Thyssen which is a must for any art-lover during a visit to Madrid.

quote: Excellent gallery with astonishing range of art
reviewnospace: We went to this gallery principally for the Munch exhibition but we really enjoyed its permanent exhibits, which range from pre-renaissance to Rothko and Freud. A fantastic range and some really lovely paintings. It's very big so we din't see all its highlights but we would definitely recommend it.
titleopinion: Excellent gallery with astonishing range of art. We went to this gallery principally for the Munch exhibition but we really enjoyed its permanent exhibits, which range from pre-renaissance to Rothko and Freud. A fantastic range and some really lovely paintings. It's very big so we din't see all its highlights but we would definitely recommend it.

quote: A wonderful way to spend the afternoon!
reviewnospace: This museum is almost like a smaller version of the Prado and definitely worth a visit. Beautiful art that spans the ages. We went on Monday afternoon when it is free to the public--I've heard it can be crowded at these times but we had no issues and walked right in! It was the off season so this may have contributed to it being less crowded. Try to see this museum and the Prado!
titleopinion: A wonderful way to spend the afternoon!. This museum is almost like a smaller version of the Prado and definitely worth a visit. Beautiful art that spans the ages. We went on Monday afternoon when it is free to the public--I've heard it can be crowded at these times but we had no issues and walked right in! It was the off season so this may have contributed to it being less crowded. Try to see this museum and the Prado!

reviewnospace:
This museum has an excellent collection of art from the old Christian art to the more contemporary, and everything in between.

The layout is done very well so that it's easy to walk through and see everything. I would suggest starting from the top floor which is the oldest art and then moving down.

There is also a good shop with very nice things to buy, including posters and prints of most of the art housed in the museum.

The reason for the 4/5 is simply that the staff were not very communicative and the signs were not very clear. There is no way to tell where you're supposed to start.
titleopinion: Excellent Collection. This museum has an excellent collection of art from the old Christian art to the more contemporary, and everything in between.  The layout is done very well so that it's easy to walk through and see everything. I would suggest starting from the top floor which is the oldest art and then moving down.  There is also a good shop with very nice things to buy, including posters and prints of most of the art housed in the museum.  The reason for the 4/5 is simply that the staff were not very communicative and the signs were not very clear. There is no way to tell where you're supposed to start.

quote: A nice contrast to the Prado
reviewnospace: We went to the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum after visiting the Prado. The excellent collection of modern art made for a nice contrast to all the very serious classics we had just seen. Nice museum, nice collection.
titleopinion: A nice contrast to the Prado. We went to the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum after visiting the Prado. The excellent collection of modern art made for a nice contrast to all the very serious classics we had just seen. Nice museum, nice collection.

reviewnospace: To have two Museums of the quality of The Prado and the Thyssen in one city is very special. The Thyssen is a beautiful space and full of extraordinary treasures excellently displayed. You need plenty of time to view even a proportion of them. It is not hard to believe that it was the largest private collection in the world before it was given to the Spanish people. Don't miss it, easy to get to and a wonderful way to spend the day.
titleopinion: WHAT A TREAT!. To have two Museums of the quality of The Prado and the Thyssen in one city is very special. The Thyssen is a beautiful space and full of extraordinary treasures excellently displayed. You need plenty of time to view even a proportion of them. It is not hard to believe that it was the largest private collection in the world before it was given to the Spanish people. Don't miss it, easy to get to and a wonderful way to spend the day.

reviewnospace: I only had the time and energy for one art museum in Madrid this trip. I had planned to go to the Prado, but I saw signs all over central Madrid advertising the temporary exhibits at the Thyssen and they looked so interesting that I had to go there. I was not sorry; they were wonderful! There were two exhibits: (1) Munch and (2) The American West. If you are in Madrid this winter, you owe it to yourself to see these shows; ther a few better uses of your time...
titleopinion: Great Museum With Spectacular Exhibits. I only had the time and energy for one art museum in Madrid this trip. I had planned to go to the Prado, but I saw signs all over central Madrid advertising the temporary exhibits at the Thyssen and they looked so interesting that I had to go there. I was not sorry; they were wonderful! There were two exhibits: (1) Munch and (2) The American West. If you are in Madrid this winter, you owe it to yourself to see these shows; ther a few better uses of your time...

reviewnospace:
It has one of the most comprehensive collections in the world, that goes from middle ages to contemporary art (it includes the collection of the baroness as well, that has very interesting and seldom exhibited pieces of American modern art).
The temporary are among the best you can find
titleopinion: Very complete. It has one of the most comprehensive collections in the world, that goes from middle ages to contemporary art (it includes the collection of the baroness as well, that has very interesting and seldom exhibited pieces of American modern art). The temporary are among the best you can find

reviewnospace: Listed as the most impressive private collection in the world Museo Thyssen contains 800 paintings The collection is a survey of Western art and runs from early primitives to 20th century avant-garde. You will feel like you are walking through an art book. I enjoyed on the museum displays one era on each floor. Major works are from Rubens, Titian, Goya, Van Gogh, Kirchner and Kandinsky. Rest up before you visit.
titleopinion: Outstanding private art collection. Listed as the most impressive private collection in the world Museo Thyssen contains 800 paintings The collection is a survey of Western art and runs from early primitives to 20th century avant-garde. You will feel like you are walking through an art book. I enjoyed on the museum displays one era on each floor. Major works are from Rubens, Titian, Goya, Van Gogh, Kirchner and Kandinsky. Rest up before you visit.

reviewnospace: We arrived at the Thyssen at 10:30 without tickets but were able to buy tickets and enter within 10 minutes. We did not find the docents as friendly or English speaking as at the Prado. But the Munch exhibit was fascinating and the audio guide with it informative...the complete audio tour took an hour. The rest of the museum was about 2 more hours. My only switch would be to start on floor 0 with the modern collection and work my way UP to the 1300s, the oldest artwork. Because we started on floor 2, by the time I got to the more current works I was tired.
titleopinion: Diverse collection....well displayed. . We arrived at the Thyssen at 10:30 without tickets but were able to buy tickets and enter within 10 minutes. We did not find the docents as friendly or English speaking as at the Prado. But the Munch exhibit was fascinating and the audio guide with it informative...the complete audio tour took an hour. The rest of the museum was about 2 more hours. My only switch would be to start on floor 0 with the modern collection and work my way UP to the 1300s, the oldest artwork. Because we started on floor 2, by the time I got to the more current works I was tired.

reviewnospace: My Partner lasts about 1 hour at museums, but this one was an exception. We went in the morning to see the Much and American West exhibits and, then, back in the afternoon for the rest of the museum. This museum is really large and can be overwhelming. The suggested method is to start at the top and work down. Be aware that there are very few benches throughout. You might want to research ahead of your visit and decide what exactly you want to see. I love Madrid and museums. Next time I am there I will revisit this museum as well as the Prado.
titleopinion: Excellent Museum. My Partner lasts about 1 hour at museums, but this one was an exception. We went in the morning to see the Much and American West exhibits and, then, back in the afternoon for the rest of the museum. This museum is really large and can be overwhelming. The suggested method is to start at the top and work down. Be aware that there are very few benches throughout. You might want to research ahead of your visit and decide what exactly you want to see. I love Madrid and museums. Next time I am there I will revisit this museum as well as the Prado.

reviewnospace: This is an outstanding collection and even though the museum was busy crowd management was excellent: there were also places to sit and rest a bit in the galleries.
titleopinion: Superb. This is an outstanding collection and even though the museum was busy crowd management was excellent: there were also places to sit and rest a bit in the galleries.

quote: The world of art is not enough!!!
reviewnospace: Phew!!! How did they get in so much of art from 1300 AD till date. It is a must see. Whilst the exhibits are engaging, the real highlight is the souvenir shop, where prints and various other things are available. The place is worth a visit.
titleopinion: The world of art is not enough!!!. Phew!!! How did they get in so much of art from 1300 AD till date. It is a must see. Whilst the exhibits are engaging, the real highlight is the souvenir shop, where prints and various other things are available. The place is worth a visit.

reviewnospace: One of my favorite museums, you can find here beautiful works of art of painters such as Monet, Dali and Vincent van Gogh. Is a place with magic where you can spend all your day moving between different points of view.
titleopinion: Another dimension. One of my favorite museums, you can find here beautiful works of art of painters such as Monet, Dali and Vincent van Gogh. Is a place with magic where you can spend all your day moving between different points of view.

quote: Only for visitors who can relate to Art
reviewnospace: I myself is not an Art Lover nor know many of the famous painters but it was still a good place to visit. Some of the paintings were good and some breath taking.
titleopinion: Only for visitors who can relate to Art. I myself is not an Art Lover nor know many of the famous painters but it was still a good place to visit. Some of the paintings were good and some breath taking.

reviewnospace: My husband and i visited on November 8th Sunday morning and bought the ticket that same day. The queue was very fast moving and the staff approachable. We beat the crowds as we were there as it opened so the place was still calm and you could really appreciate the art in front of you. We're not hardcore art lovers but we definitely loved what we saw. It was a feast for our eyes! Every floor was clearly sign-posted so it was easy to navigate. we took photos using our moblie phones. Wifi was free, too. There is also a restaurant if you are hungry and a shop to buy souvenirs to take home. Without a doubt, a morning well-spent!
titleopinion: Magnificent Museum - a must see!. My husband and i visited on November 8th Sunday morning and bought the ticket that same day. The queue was very fast moving and the staff approachable. We beat the crowds as we were there as it opened so the place was still calm and you could really appreciate the art in front of you. We're not hardcore art lovers but we definitely loved what we saw. It was a feast for our eyes! Every floor was clearly sign-posted so it was easy to navigate. we took photos using our moblie phones. Wifi was free, too. There is also a restaurant if you are hungry and a shop to buy souvenirs to take home. Without a doubt, a morning well-spent!

reviewnospace:
After visiting Prado museum, the Thyssen-Bornemisza is another must-see.
I remember having visited it first when opening in 1992.
Collections are unique: Italian, Dutch masterpieces / Renaissance, Baroque / Impressionism / 20th Century are my preferred paintings.
Half-day or a full day are needed to have a global view on the Thyssen baroness' collections.
titleopinion: An amazing art museum. After visiting Prado museum, the Thyssen-Bornemisza is another must-see. I remember having visited it first when opening in 1992. Collections are unique: Italian, Dutch masterpieces / Renaissance, Baroque / Impressionism / 20th Century are my preferred paintings. Half-day or a full day are needed to have a global view on the Thyssen baroness' collections.

reviewnospace: I especially wanted to see some art from the last two centuries and was not disappointed. Mondrian, Kandisky, Roy Liechtenstein, Van Gogh, Dali and many impressionists. For me the most stunning picture was Telephone Booths by Richard Estes, a painter who is new to me.
titleopinion: Huge variety of artworks. I especially wanted to see some art from the last two centuries and was not disappointed. Mondrian, Kandisky, Roy Liechtenstein, Van Gogh, Dali and many impressionists. For me the most stunning picture was Telephone Booths by Richard Estes, a painter who is new to me.

reviewnospace:
We spent a morning here while in Madrid. This museum covers a lot of the paintings that the Prado and the Riene Sophia do not. It is very well organized and easy to visit. We used the Lonely Planet guide rather than an audio tour or guide.

Tried to go on a Monday when admission is free but there was a long line-up so we went the following day and paid admission. We are glad we did.

Very enjoyable
titleopinion: Great Museum. We spent a morning here while in Madrid. This museum covers a lot of the paintings that the Prado and the Riene Sophia do not. It is very well organized and easy to visit. We used the Lonely Planet guide rather than an audio tour or guide.   Tried to go on a Monday when admission is free but there was a long line-up so we went the following day and paid admission. We are glad we did.  Very enjoyable

quote: One of the best museums I have ever been in.
reviewnospace: Not to be missed. There is so much to see in this museum. Buy your ticket in advance as there are queues and get to the museum by 10am. I visited in November and was surprised by how few crowds there were. I was able to sit and look at paintings in peace and quiet. Wonderful. I can't praise highly enough.
titleopinion: One of the best museums I have ever been in.. Not to be missed. There is so much to see in this museum. Buy your ticket in advance as there are queues and get to the museum by 10am. I visited in November and was surprised by how few crowds there were. I was able to sit and look at paintings in peace and quiet. Wonderful. I can't praise highly enough.

quote: Great museum do not forget to visit
reviewnospace: Easy to reach good facilities inside and well informed not expensive good collections to see and great staff to inform you
titleopinion: Great museum do not forget to visit. Easy to reach good facilities inside and well informed not expensive good collections to see and great staff to inform you

reviewnospace: The museum has a great collection of art from contemporary to mostly older. It is lesser known for younger people because they Prado and Reina Sofia are the most known. I am really glad that I went to this museum because the museum had many great art and they also have great temporary exhibitions.
titleopinion: Great Collection. The museum has a great collection of art from contemporary to mostly older. I am really glad that I went to this museum because the museum had many great art and they also have great temporary exhibitions.

quote: great museum, fantastic exhibition on Munch
reviewnospace: Big museum, so be prepared to spend some time, best (and recommended by museum people) to start from top (older) and go down towards more contemporary stuff
titleopinion: great museum, fantastic exhibition on Munch. Big museum, so be prepared to spend some time, best (and recommended by museum people) to start from top (older) and go down towards more contemporary stuff

reviewnospace:
Always great to go back and discover their new temporary expositions
Nice garden to sit back and relax on a sunny Madrid afternoon
titleopinion: great visit. Always great to go back and discover their new temporary expositions Nice garden to sit back and relax on a sunny Madrid afternoon

reviewnospace:
Very interesting collection of art. quite diverse
Excellent cafe serving very compete els priced food and drink. Table service.
titleopinion: Interesting works of art. Very interesting collection of art. quite diverse  Excellent cafe serving very compete els priced food and drink. Table service.

reviewnospace:
This museum offers opportunities to see the general collection that is truly wonderful. I saw some paintings that were very emotionally moving - as most art is..... Some much more than others.
Then there are the special shows. I saw Munch that was curated so well that I almost went back to view again the following day. I didn't as I only had a couple of days in Madrid. - my new favorite city.

quote: Wonderful collection but book entrance tickets on line to avoid queues
reviewnospace: This is a wonderful collection in a beautiful building - it is arranged in chronological order but it is worth preparing your visit as there is a lot to see and you may want to target certain things that you are most interested in. Also, it is worth booking your entrance tickets in advance as there can be a long wait. There was a Munch exhibition on when we visited which was very well done and well worth paying a bit extra for.
titleopinion: Wonderful collection but book entrance tickets on line to avoid queues. This is a wonderful collection in a beautiful building - it is arranged in chronological order but it is worth preparing your visit as there is a lot to see and you may want to target certain things that you are most interested in. Also, it is worth booking your entrance tickets in advance as there can be a long wait. There was a Munch exhibition on when we visited which was very well done and well worth paying a bit extra for.

reviewnospace:
This is certainly one of the great expositions in 2015. It gives a full view of Munch's work in a great place of easy access and without too much people, depending on the time you make your visit.
The quality and variety of the paintings is fabulous, and the setup of the expo is well done, with agreeable light.
titleopinion: Munch - GREAT exposition. This is certainly one of the great expositions in 2015. It gives a full view of Munch's work in a great place of easy access and without too much people, depending on the time you make your visit. The quality and variety of the paintings is fabulous, and the setup of the expo is well done, with agreeable light.

reviewnospace: The moderns are represented here, and the collection is outstanding. The audio guide is good and the coffee shop has good snacks.
titleopinion: Wonderful art. The moderns are represented here, and the collection is outstanding. The audio guide is good and the coffee shop has good snacks.

quote: Worth a look ( timed it well to see the Edvard Munch exhibition)
reviewnospace:
If your into art, then there is no reason not to explore the Thyssen-Bornemisza along with Madrid's other galleries & museums.
Take the time and enhance your feelings for both classical and modern painting.
titleopinion: Worth a look ( timed it well to see the Edvard Munch exhibition). If your into art, then there is no reason not to explore the Thyssen-Bornemisza along with Madrid's other galleries & museums.  Take the time and enhance your feelings for both classical and modern painting.

quote: Amazing collection and great temporary exhibitions!
reviewnospace: I was told by a friend to visit this museum. It hosts an amazing collection!...from the Primitive to Contemporary Art - including the Nord American landscape painting. I also enjoyed the temporary exhibition on Munch's Archetips! Great value!
titleopinion: Amazing collection and great temporary exhibitions!. I was told by a friend to visit this museum. It hosts an amazing collection!...from the Primitive to Contemporary Art - including the Nord American landscape painting. I also enjoyed the temporary exhibition on Munch's Archetips! Great value!

reviewnospace:
Brilliant art gallery, a perfect compliment to the Prado.
Time passed by quickly, couldn't believe I was in the permanent gallery for so long.5 hours.
Great audio guide, brilliant shop as well.
Start on the 2nd floor and work your way down.
The impressionist section my favourite.
titleopinion: A Must Visit. Brilliant art gallery, a perfect compliment to the Prado. Time passed by quickly, couldn't believe I was in the permanent gallery for so long.5 hours. Great audio guide, brilliant shop as well. Start on the 2nd floor and work your way down. The impressionist section my favourite.

reviewnospace:
Great collection with a much more modern focus then el Prado. But unfortunately, there's very little info provided about the works. I don't really have the patience for the audio tours, so it was pretty much just Artist, Title, Date.
The Edward Munch special exhibition was really well done, but was VERY crowded when we where there.
titleopinion: nice collection, little info. Great collection with a much more modern focus then el Prado. But unfortunately, there's very little info provided about the works. I don't really have the patience for the audio tours, so it was pretty much just Artist, Title, Date. The Edward Munch special exhibition was really well done, but was VERY crowded when we where there.

quote: AFTER the PRADO, give this one a try
reviewnospace: Just catty-corner to the Prado is another fine museum with a varied collection. The delight is that you will see paintings by first-rate artists that are less commonly reproduced and thus fresh to your retinas. The building's layout is a bit confusing, but the handout is helpful. Good gift shop, too. Great rainy day choice.
titleopinion: AFTER the PRADO, give this one a try. Just catty-corner to the Prado is another fine museum with a varied collection. The delight is that you will see paintings by first-rate artists that are less commonly reproduced and thus fresh to your retinas. The building's layout is a bit confusing, but the handout is helpful. Good gift shop, too. Great rainy day choice.

quote: Beautiful selection of art in lovely museum
reviewnospace: This is my second trip to this museum and I was once more amazed at the amount and variety of styles of Paintings and also some sculptures. This is a fabulous building within 5 minutes walk of the Prado and I would say it is equal to the prado for the quality of the Art works on display. I spent four hours here and could have spent more time if my legs would have taken it. There are paintings by all the old great masters and Impressionist paintings. A lovely well fun museum up with the best in the world.

reviewnospace: Visited this because of the alluring exhibit on the Wild West. Also a Munch exhibit. Great gift shops if you are looking for something to take back.
titleopinion: Munch and the wild west. Visited this because of the alluring exhibit on the Wild West. Also a Munch exhibit. Great gift shops if you are looking for something to take back.

reviewnospace: I was very pleased to see the special exhibition by Edward Munch where his works came into a new light. Around the house in different rooms I found many works and artists who have been unknown to me before. I would visit this museum again, if I went back to Madrid.
titleopinion: Great collection. I was very pleased to see the special exhibition by Edward Munch where his works came into a new light. Around the house in different rooms I found many works and artists who have been unknown to me before. I would visit this museum again, if I went back to Madrid.

reviewnospace: This large gallery has a fantastic permanent collection and offers regular world class temporary exhibitions in a modern, light, airy building.
titleopinion: World class collection. This large gallery has a fantastic permanent collection and offers regular world class temporary exhibitions in a modern, light, airy building.

reviewnospace: We visited the Munch exhibition which is temporary and then picked our way through this amazing collection. Take 10 minutes with the floor plan to plan the visit because if you saw everything it would take several days.
titleopinion: Collections are extraordinary. We visited the Munch exhibition which is temporary and then picked our way through this amazing collection. Take 10 minutes with the floor plan to plan the visit because if you saw everything it would take several days.

reviewnospace: Went to see the Edward Munch exposition, which was very good. The museum is well-organised, to prevent queues you get a ticket for a specific time, and because it is near other attractions, a reasonable way to plan your day without having to wait in line for a long time.
titleopinion: Good Munch exposition. Went to see the Edward Munch exposition, which was very good. The museum is well-organised, to prevent queues you get a ticket for a specific time, and because it is near other attractions, a reasonable way to plan your day without having to wait in line for a long time.

quote: If you've got 2 Art Museums in you, this is an impressive Museum and a wonderful complement to the Prado!
reviewnospace: If you've got 2 Art Museums in you, this is an impressive Museum and a wonderful complement to the Prado! Exhibits are split into His and Her's, and are laid out by period. If you start on the top floor and go to the right coming out of the elevator, you start with His Collection and move to Her Collection, going from oldest to youngest as you move around the floor and then to lower floors.
titleopinion: If you've got 2 Art Museums in you, this is an impressive Museum and a wonderful complement to the Prado!. If you start on the top floor and go to the right coming out of the elevator, you start with His Collection and move to Her Collection, going from oldest to youngest as you move around the floor and then to lower floors.

reviewnospace: This was our second visit. The impressionist paintings and modern art in Level 1 and Level 0 are a must see. If you have already been to Museo del Prado, you can opt out of Level 2 or do a brisk round, if time is a constraint. We went at around noon on a Monday, and entry was free.
titleopinion: Must Visit. This was our second visit. The impressionist paintings and modern art in Level 1 and Level 0 are a must see. If you have already been to Museo del Prado, you can opt out of Level 2 or do a brisk round, if time is a constraint. We went at around noon on a Monday, and entry was free.

reviewnospace: This museum has everything from modern art to the old masters . Don't miss this on your trip to Madrid
titleopinion: wide variety. This museum has everything from modern art to the old masters . Don't miss this on your trip to Madrid

reviewnospace: We had a marvelous visit. We saw a Munch exhibit that was beyond special and we spent a couple of hours taking in one of the best permanent collections we have ever seen. For my money this is the best museum visit in Madrid.
titleopinion: Great Collection. We had a marvelous visit. We saw a Munch exhibit that was beyond special and we spent a couple of hours taking in one of the best permanent collections we have ever seen. For my money this is the best museum visit in Madrid.

reviewnospace: If you like modern art then the ground floor is for you, if portraits are your thing then the others floors are for you.
titleopinion: Interesting. If you like modern art then the ground floor is for you, if portraits are your thing then the others floors are for you.

reviewnospace: The collection of art that is displayed in this museum is simply stunning. It is hard to believe that a majority of it is part of a private collection. Make sure you take the time to visit and be wowed.
titleopinion: Amazing personal collection. The collection of art that is displayed in this museum is simply stunning. It is hard to believe that a majority of it is part of a private collection. Make sure you take the time to visit and be wowed.

quote: Favorite museum in Madrid, great surealistic art.
reviewnospace: I enjoy every time I've been here, it is a museum with surrealist art that really is worthwhile, especially for non-museum goer like me. It really puts a modern inpression about thinking. Students, take a student card with you if you are eligable for discount.

quote: In a short time in order to see all types if paintings it is great museum which is cetarally located in Madrid
reviewnospace: You can see varies paintings from different centuries within few hours, it is very close to the tourist attractions. It was not crowded. It has nice cafeteria to make a short break after the visit.

reviewnospace: Very comfortable viewing in a light and airy museum. Less overwhelming than the Prado. Good restaurant for refocusing during or after a visit.
titleopinion: Easily accessed art museum. Very comfortable viewing in a light and airy museum. Less overwhelming than the Prado. Good restaurant for refocusing during or after a visit.

reviewnospace: This museum has "blockbuster shows" along with an interesting permanent collection. They decided to buy two or three of everybody important they could get their hands on.
titleopinion: Excellent. This museum has  blockbuster shows  along with an interesting permanent collection. They decided to buy two or three of everybody important they could get their hands on.

quote: fantastic collection from old masters to modern art
reviewnospace:
We spent 4 hours here. And that did not include the special exhibit. the museum has art from several centuries, but what attracted us was the impressionistic, expressionistic and modern art collections. They have everything from Van Gogh to Picasso. I was surprised that the german expressionists and swiss were also well represented. There's a whole section on pointillism with a couple paintings by our pointillist favorite Maximilien Luce.
Of the three big art museums in Madrid, The Prado, the Reina Sofia and the Thyssen-Bornemisza, this was by far our favorite. If you could only go to one of the three I'd vote this one as it has art represented in the other two museums and so much more.

This is a great museum to introduce oneself to all types of art.
titleopinion: fantastic collection from old masters to modern art. We spent 4 hours here. And that did not include the special exhibit. the museum has art from several centuries, but what attracted us was the impressionistic, expressionistic and modern art collections. They have everything from Van Gogh to Picasso. I was surprised that the german expressionists and swiss were also well represented. There's a whole section on pointillism with a couple paintings by our pointillist favorite Maximilien Luce. Of the three big art museums in Madrid, The Prado, the Reina Sofia and the Thyssen-Bornemisza, this was by far our favorite. If you could only go to one of the three I'd vote this one as it has art represented in the other two museums and so much more.   This is a great museum to introduce oneself to all types of art.

quote: When in Madrid and have time to visit only one place in a short time, choose the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum
reviewnospace: A collection of old and new masters, outstanding 20th century paintings and sculptures with several surprises beyond the well known names. Excellently exhibited, with good audio-video guide. It is a place for connoisseurs as well who appreciate the selection this museum offers.
titleopinion: When in Madrid and have time to visit only one place in a short time, choose the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum. A collection of old and new masters, outstanding 20th century paintings and sculptures with several surprises beyond the well known names. Excellently exhibited, with good audio-video guide. It is a place for connoisseurs as well who appreciate the selection this museum offers.

reviewnospace: easy access, lot of painting, great names, need minimum 2 hours per visit to see all items. Worth visit
titleopinion: great place. easy access, lot of painting, great names, need minimum 2 hours per visit to see all items. Worth visit

quote: If you want a museum for a couple of hours
reviewnospace: All kind of paintings. Interesting how mrs Thyssen build her collection. When we were there we saw several schoolkids. They behave calm and quiet. Nice that Spain gives them such education.
titleopinion: If you want a museum for a couple of hours. All kind of paintings. Interesting how mrs Thyssen build her collection. When we were there we saw several schoolkids. They behave calm and quiet. Nice that Spain gives them such education.

quote: Save energy for this museum! It is not to be missed!!!!!
reviewnospace: A delightful museum with a fabulous Impressionist and Post- impressionist collection and collections from many other periods as well. It should not be missed. The layout of the museum on three floors is conducive to relaxed browsing. The cafe serves a delicious lunch, that includes tasty, healthy selections. On a return visit, this would be the first museum I head to.
titleopinion: Save energy for this museum! It is not to be missed!!!!!. A delightful museum with a fabulous Impressionist and Post- impressionist collection and collections from many other periods as well. It should not be missed. The layout of the museum on three floors is conducive to relaxed browsing. The cafe serves a delicious lunch, that includes tasty, healthy selections. On a return visit, this would be the first museum I head to.

reviewnospace:
This is the largest private collection I have ever seen. Make sure you have enough time to visit. We visited the Munch exhibit and part of the museum...after 3 hours we were still far from having seen it all!

OJ
titleopinion: Impressive private collection.. This is the largest private collection I have ever seen. Make sure you have enough time to visit. We visited the Munch exhibit and part of the museum...after 3 hours we were still far from having seen it all!  OJ

quote: Thyssen is the Best Museum in Madrid!
reviewnospace:
I grew up visiting the Metropolitan Museum of Art (NYC) almost monthly, and frequented the MOMA throughout my middle school and high school years, freely as a p/t art student. And there was the Cleveland Art, Philly Art, Baltimore Art and the National Gallery. These are some of the grand museums of Eastern US. Then there is the Barnes Foundation, currently in Philadelphia at the end of Museum Row. So why mention it apart from the others? Simply because the Thyssen reminded me that regardless of the intimacy of a private collection, there is always an opening for those whose world has been deeply touched by art. One merely has to find the portal and pass through it. That's my experience of the Barnes Foundation; and it was also of the Thyssen.

And yes, there are works there never exhibited in the US. But you can find these catalogue in their webpages or in your art books.

By chance I did arrive on a Monday, so the opportunity was free. But I made up for it in their wonderful Gift Shop. Even got some early holiday shopping done :-)
titleopinion: Thyssen is the Best Museum in Madrid!. I grew up visiting the Metropolitan Museum of Art (NYC) almost monthly, and frequented the MOMA throughout my middle school and high school years, freely as a p/t art student. And there was the Cleveland Art, Philly Art, Baltimore Art and the National Gallery. These are some of the grand museums of Eastern US. Then there is the Barnes Foundation, currently in Philadelphia at the end of Museum Row. So why mention it apart from the others? Simply because the Thyssen reminded me that regardless of the intimacy of a private collection, there is always an opening for those whose world has been deeply touched by art. One merely has to find the portal and pass through it. That's my experience of the Barnes Foundation; and it was also of the Thyssen.  And yes, there are works there never exhibited in the US. But you can find these catalogue in their webpages or in your art books.  By chance I did arrive on a Monday, so the opportunity was free. But I made up for it in their wonderful Gift Shop. Even got some early holiday shopping done :-)

reviewnospace:
To my unartistic mind the Thyssen continues where the Prado ends, with impressionist and expressionist paintings including my favourites Chagall and Nolde, also a Munch exhibition that had nothing to apologize for.
It seemed to be the most accessible of the big three museums in town, including a commendable lack of lineups.
titleopinion: A must/see for art lovers . To my unartistic mind the Thyssen continues where the Prado ends, with impressionist and expressionist paintings including my favourites Chagall and Nolde, also a Munch exhibition that had nothing to apologize for.  It seemed to be the most accessible of the big three museums in town, including a commendable lack of lineups.

reviewnospace: This is a fabulous museum Yet seems to be over shadowed by the Prado. Its collection include every kind of art from Italian primitives to Roy Lischtenstein. Outstanding collection of old masters and German Expressionists.
titleopinion: Best Kept Museum Secret. This is a fabulous museum Yet seems to be over shadowed by the Prado. Its collection include every kind of art from Italian primitives to Roy Lischtenstein. Outstanding collection of old masters and German Expressionists.

reviewnospace: This is a very nice museum with such a large collection of art with a wide range of styles and periods, the art is largely paintings. You can spend hours here. It's a great way to change a rainy day to a useful, fun and educational day.
titleopinion: Beautiful. This is a very nice museum with such a large collection of art with a wide range of styles and periods, the art is largely paintings. You can spend hours here. It's a great way to change a rainy day to a useful, fun and educational day.

quote: Surprised by this museum, but really enjoyed it!
reviewnospace:
My husband and I made our first visit to Madrid in November. While there, I especially wanted to visit the Prado, and see Guernica at the Reina Sofia museum. While investigating ticket options, I stumbled upon the Paseo del Arte Card. SInce the Thyssen was also included in that ticket, we decided to visit it as well.

We were both pleasantly surprised by our visit, especially after spending the previous day at the Prado. The Thyssen was very well organized and the art was nicely displayed. We expected to spend an hour or two here, but stayed more than three.
titleopinion: Surprised by this museum, but really enjoyed it!. My husband and I made our first visit to Madrid in November. While there, I especially wanted to visit the Prado, and see Guernica at the Reina Sofia museum. While investigating ticket options, I stumbled upon the Paseo del Arte Card. SInce the Thyssen was also included in that ticket, we decided to visit it as well.  We were both pleasantly surprised by our visit, especially after spending the previous day at the Prado. The Thyssen was very well organized and the art was nicely displayed. We expected to spend an hour or two here, but stayed more than three.

reviewnospace: Especially on Monday's when it is free. A very well designed museum with good amount of famous artists from 14-20 centuries, including some from the masters.
titleopinion: Excellent. Especially on Monday's when it is free. A very well designed museum with good amount of famous artists from 14-20 centuries, including some from the masters.

reviewnospace:
Take time to explore this museum fully, lots of variation and a master round every corner. It is bright and airy and whilst the route is confusing initially, you start from the top, it shows all the exhibits.
By far the best museum
titleopinion: The best musem in Madrid. Take time to explore this museum fully, lots of variation and a master round every corner. It is bright and airy and whilst the route is confusing initially, you start from the top, it shows all the exhibits. By far the best museum

reviewnospace: This was the highlight. Fantastically laid out, easy to follow and added bonus a special Munch exhibition. Of course there are more paintings from the last hundred years as compared to longer. Very easy to navigate and like all of the museums they do a discount for seniors. We visited on a Sunday, about 12 and no queue, however went by there on the following Monday and they were queuing round the block, could be because the Prado is closed on a Monday.
titleopinion: Best museum for us. This was the highlight. Fantastically laid out, easy to follow and added bonus a special Munch exhibition. Of course there are more paintings from the last hundred years as compared to longer. Very easy to navigate and like all of the museums they do a discount for seniors. We visited on a Sunday, about 12 and no queue, however went by there on the following Monday and they were queuing round the block, could be because the Prado is closed on a Monday.

quote: Good Food - Overworked and unfriendly staff
reviewnospace: We had a nice lunch at the museum restaurant,but the server seemed very overwhelmed. Not friendly and bordered on rude. The food was a nice surprise.
titleopinion: Good Food - Overworked and unfriendly staff. We had a nice lunch at the museum restaurant,but the server seemed very overwhelmed. Not friendly and bordered on rude. The food was a nice surprise.

reviewnospace: Everyone says ' go to the Prado'. But with only one full day in Madrid I didn't want to spend all day indoors. The Thyssen - B Collection is large enough and varied enough to have you feel that it is worth the entry fee, but the collection is compact enough that you don't feel like you must skip whole sections. The collection is beautiful!!
titleopinion: A fabulous surprise. Everyone says ' go to the Prado'. But with only one full day in Madrid I didn't want to spend all day indoors. The Thyssen - B Collection is large enough and varied enough to have you feel that it is worth the entry fee, but the collection is compact enough that you don't feel like you must skip whole sections. The collection is beautiful!!

quote: Just about the best museum/gallery we've ever been to.
reviewnospace:
We've done galleries in Paris, Florence, Berlin and Amsterdam but this outshone them. Maybe this was because it wasn't too busy (we only had to queue for half an hour even though it was free) and maybe because you could get very close to the artwork. We also saw the temporary exhibition (Munch) which was a real bonus.
Good coffee and cake too!
titleopinion: Just about the best museum/gallery we've ever been to.. We've done galleries in Paris, Florence, Berlin and Amsterdam but this outshone them. Maybe this was because it wasn't too busy (we only had to queue for half an hour even though it was free) and maybe because you could get very close to the artwork. We also saw the temporary exhibition (Munch) which was a real bonus. Good coffee and cake too!

reviewnospace: This gallery has an excellent comprehensive collection of art, 99% paintings. Great to work through it following the time line to see the development of art styles since about C12. Note that the cafe is a wait to be seated table service establishment. It was crowded and service was slow when we were there, so we left and walk 200 metres along tge road to a tapas bar where we had coffee and food for less than the cost of 2 cups of coffee in the gallery restaurant. You can come in and out all day with your ticket.
titleopinion: comprehensive and accessible. This gallery has an excellent comprehensive collection of art, 99% paintings. Great to work through it following the time line to see the development of art styles since about C12. Note that the cafe is a wait to be seated table service establishment. It was crowded and service was slow when we were there, so we left and walk 200 metres along tge road to a tapas bar where we had coffee and food for less than the cost of 2 cups of coffee in the gallery restaurant. You can come in and out all day with your ticket.

quote: Second best modern Art Musueum in Southern Europe
reviewnospace: This is the second best modern art museum in Southern Europe. They have nice collection of American Art.
titleopinion: Second best modern Art Musueum in Southern Europe. This is the second best modern art museum in Southern Europe. They have nice collection of American Art.

reviewnospace: Every Monday afternoon 12-4pm this Museum is free. Any other time it costs €10 per person though children under 12 are free when accompanied by an adult at any time. There are 3 levels of this museum showing a varied collection of art from Rodin sculptures in the main hall on the ground floor to over 200 paintings from 17-20th Century. Paintings include works of art by Rubens, Rembrandt, Renoir, Monet, Van Gogh, to Dali, Lichtenstein, Picasso to mention a few. This museum is definately worth visiting especially if you can get in for free.
titleopinion: Free on Mondays. Every Monday afternoon 12-4pm this Museum is free. Any other time it costs €10 per person though children under 12 are free when accompanied by an adult at any time. There are 3 levels of this museum showing a varied collection of art from Rodin sculptures in the main hall on the ground floor to over 200 paintings from 17-20th Century. Paintings include works of art by Rubens, Rembrandt, Renoir, Monet, Van Gogh, to Dali, Lichtenstein, Picasso to mention a few. quote: Great collection in a much more appealling setting than Prado
reviewnospace: By all means include this museum on any art visit to Madrid. Of particular note are the early Italian and Flemish works.
titleopinion: Great collection in a much more appealling setting than Prado. By all means include this museum on any art visit to Madrid. Of particular note are the early Italian and Flemish works.

quote: Loads of variety - audio guide probably worth getting
reviewnospace: We just visited the permanent collection. We worked from the top down which had a nice progression. We didn't get the audio guide and there wasn't much info available so I'd get it if you like details. I really enjoyed the contrast between his/her collections and how the evolved over time.
titleopinion: Loads of variety - audio guide probably worth getting. We just visited the permanent collection. We worked from the top down which had a nice progression. We didn't get the audio guide and there wasn't much info available so I'd get it if you like details. I really enjoyed the contrast between his/her collections and how the evolved over time.

reviewnospace: A beautiful museum and a large collection. I enjoyed the section of expressionist art and the painters of the nineteenth century :. Gaughin, Van Gogh and pop artist Lichtenstein, I will return after my trip to Turkey because I didn´t have the time to see it all. Highly recommended.
titleopinion: Large collections of different artists. A beautiful museum and a large collection. I enjoyed the section of expressionist art and the painters of the nineteenth century :. Gaughin, Van Gogh and pop artist Lichtenstein, I will return after my trip to Turkey because I didn´t have the time to see it all. Highly recommended.

reviewnospace:
First, the collections of the Prado and Reina Sofia are stupendous and not to be missed by any serious art aficionado, but I prefer the MTB because it is more manageable, concise. It is a magnificent personal collection that spans the full range of two-dimensional (mostly) western art. It will take at least four hours to fully appreciate this collection; we have just completed our fifth visit to review the permanent collection and take in the Munch Exhibition.

It is a modern building located a ten to fifteen minute walk from the Puerta del Sol with full accessibility. Check their site for free days!
titleopinion: A wonderful taste. First, the collections of the Prado and Reina Sofia are stupendous and not to be missed by any serious art aficionado, but I prefer the MTB because it is more manageable, concise. It is a magnificent personal collection that spans the full range of two-dimensional (mostly) western art. It will take at least four hours to fully appreciate this collection; we have just completed our fifth visit to review the permanent collection and take in the Munch Exhibition.   It is a modern building located a ten to fifteen minute walk from the Puerta del Sol with full accessibility. Check their site for free days!

reviewnospace: The art museum was lovely, we paid an extra euro each to see the Munch exhibit and was able to use UK student discount.
titleopinion: Munch exhibit was fantastic.. The art museum was lovely, we paid an extra euro each to see the Munch exhibit and was able to use UK student discount.

quote: The huge variety of paintings make it better than Prado
reviewnospace:
The building of the museum is very modern, and the collection of the paintings is so vibrant that they always need and get your full attention.
From El Greco and Caravaggio through Van Gogh and Degas till Matisse , Marc Chagall, Rodin, Picasso etc., this collection is so variable, that you never get bored. We were lucky because the museum is hosting Edvard Munch: Archetype exhibition, a selection of eighty works.
After Prado the Thyssen-Bornemisza is refreshing and I was able to enjoy some contemporary, or nearly contemporary artwork. To mix Caravaggio or Canaletto with Marc Chagall or Picasso is a very enjoyable cocktail. I wish I would able to spend more time there.
titleopinion: The huge variety of paintings make it better than Prado. The building of the museum is very modern, and the collection of the paintings is so vibrant that they always need and get your full attention. From El Greco and Caravaggio through Van Gogh and Degas till Matisse , Marc Chagall, Rodin, Picasso etc., this collection is so variable, that you never get bored. We were lucky because the museum is hosting Edvard Munch: Archetype exhibition, a selection of eighty works. After Prado the Thyssen-Bornemisza is refreshing and I was able to enjoy some contemporary, or nearly contemporary artwork. To mix Caravaggio or Canaletto with Marc Chagall or Picasso is a very enjoyable cocktail. I wish I would able to spend more time there.<U+200B>

reviewnospace:
A stunning collection of artworks from across the ages, very nicely laid out too. As important as the Prado across the road.
There was also a fascinating Munch exhibition when we visited.
titleopinion: Fantastic collection. A stunning collection of artworks from across the ages, very nicely laid out too. As important as the Prado across the road. There was also a fascinating Munch exhibition when we visited.

reviewnospace: Whatever else you do in Madrid, don't miss this - wonderful, wonderful works of art in a lovely, spacious and airy gallery.
titleopinion: A must do. Whatever else you do in Madrid, don't miss this - wonderful, wonderful works of art in a lovely, spacious and airy gallery.

reviewnospace:
We were very impressed by the selection of art on display. Famous works were accompanied by lesser known names, especially from East European countries, which served to illuminate creative trends one does not always become aware of in other collections.
The permanent collection is already well worth the visit in itself, but the temporary shows are interesting to see too, as they seem to be aimed at adding further depth to the museum by focusing on particular artists, periods or art forms, e.g. photography, otherwise not covered.
titleopinion: Potentially better than the Prado. We were very impressed by the selection of art on display. Famous works were accompanied by lesser known names, especially from East European countries, which served to illuminate creative trends one does not always become aware of in other collections. The permanent collection is already well worth the visit in itself, but the temporary shows are interesting to see too, as they seem to be aimed at adding further depth to the museum by focusing on particular artists, periods or art forms, e.g. photography, otherwise not covered.

reviewnospace:
the museum outstanding collection consisting of paintings of masterpieces like Goya, VanGogh and Picaso, this museum is regarded as one ofthe most importandt collection in the world, I
Liked it more than the other Museums in Madrid

reviewnospace: The collection is remarkable - and the buildings and grounds only add to the overall experience. As good as it gets!
titleopinion: Diverse collection in exceptional surroundings. The collection is remarkable - and the buildings and grounds only add to the overall experience. As good as it gets!

reviewnospace: Not as overwelming as prado but every bit as good! Well organised and the huge advantage that you can photograph the artworks so you can research them further when you get home!
titleopinion: The best! . Not as overwelming as prado but every bit as good! Well organised and the huge advantage that you can photograph the artworks so you can research them further when you get home!

reviewnospace: Had wonderful tiring afternoon here seeing whole range of art from 16th century Dutch to Dali and beyond.
titleopinion: Wonderful mix of art. Had wonderful tiring afternoon here seeing whole range of art from 16th century Dutch to Dali and beyond.

reviewnospace: Out of all of the museums in Madrid, this one is not to be missed. They have the best perminent collection and also temporary collections. They have a diverse range of artists which keeps you interested throughout. The cafe is also nice for a snack, although pricey for a full meal.
titleopinion: Nice afternoon out. Out of all of the museums in Madrid, this one is not to be missed. They have the best perminent collection and also temporary collections. They have a diverse range of artists which keeps you interested throughout. The cafe is also nice for a snack, although pricey for a full meal.

quote: Nice Museum easier to navigate than the Prado
reviewnospace: Wonderful artwork. Museum is easy to navigate with many direction you are here maps. Not very crowded easy to locate.
titleopinion: Nice Museum easier to navigate than the Prado. Wonderful artwork. Museum is easy to navigate with many direction you are here maps. Not very crowded easy to locate.

reviewnospace: Brilliant! Private collection with changing exhibitions. Beautiful building - very modern. Also, one of the best gallery shops I have ever visited. Good for unusual gifts.
titleopinion: Thyssen. Brilliant! Private collection with changing exhibitions. Beautiful building - very modern. Also, one of the best gallery shops I have ever visited. Good for unusual gifts.

reviewnospace: The best of Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum (from my point of view), is the that the exhibition is arranged chronologically, also the museum is not hard to visit if you are not an expert. Good art choice!
titleopinion: A great  summary  of art painting. The best of Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum (from my point of view), is the that the exhibition is arranged chronologically, also the museum is not hard to visit if you are not an expert. Good art choice!

reviewnospace:
Super collection of impressionist and more modern paintings compared to the Prado.

Allow at least 2 hours. For me, if you can only visit one gallery, come here. If your other half wants to go to the Prado, say, lets stop here on the way to Prado for 30 minutes, you'll end up happy you spent 2 hours there.

Oh and by the way, unless you like modern art, avoid the Reina Sofia, apart from the Guerinca, it's pants.

Oh and by the way, unless you like modern art, avoid the Reina Sofia, apart from the Guerinca, it's pants.

reviewnospace: Spent most of the afternoon here. Saw a wonderful Munch exhibit and the rest of the collection displayed. Enjoyed a delicious and reasonably proved lunch. A must see in Madrid!
titleopinion: Wonderful museum experience. Spent most of the afternoon here. Saw a wonderful Munch exhibit and the rest of the collection displayed. Enjoyed a delicious and reasonably proved lunch. A must see in Madrid!

quote: A great companion to the Prada
reviewnospace: After visiting the Prada, and you have time to take in another museum, visit the Thyssen. It has some gems that you would not see elsewhere. The rooms are very spacious and you get to see how artists across the world have evolved. We were treated to an exhibition of Edvard Munch, which is usually difficult to see except in Norway.
titleopinion: A great companion to the Prada. After visiting the Prada, and you have time to take in another museum, visit the Thyssen. It has some gems that you would not see elsewhere. The rooms are very spacious and you get to see how artists across the world have evolved. We were treated to an exhibition of Edvard Munch, which is usually difficult to see except in Norway.

quote: Top Collection of art ! Free visit on Monday
reviewnospace: Thank you Mr Thyssen for collecting such a wonderful painting collection and showing it to the public! The list comes unorganized: Monet, Manet, Renoir, Pissaro, Mondriaan, Rubens, Hals, Rembrand, Liechtenstein, Van Gogh, Dali, Picasso and my favorite Egon Schiele....even forgetting some top talents. Impossible to see and capture in one visit ...... Noted free access on Monday from 12 to 4 pm. Would be there every 2 weeks if I was living here:-)

The list comes unorganized: Monet, Manet, Renoir, Pissaro, Mondriaan, Rubens, Hals, Rembrand, Liechtenstein, Van Gogh, Dali, Picasso and my favorite Egon Schiele....even forgetting some top talents. Impossible to see and capture in one visit ...... Noted free access on Monday from 12 to 4 pm. Would be there every 2 weeks if I was living here:-)

reviewnospace: I had to return to this wonderful museum in Central Madrid! I was very lucky this trip to see the Edvard Munch exposition, ARCHETYPES.
titleopinion: Second venture. I had to return to this wonderful museum in Central Madrid! I was very lucky this trip to see the Edvard Munch exposition, ARCHETYPES.

reviewnospace: With constantly changing temporary exhibitions this is a place you can put on your list to visit more than once. try timing your visit when the spanish are eating to avoid the busiest periods
titleopinion: Another Marvel. With constantly changing temporary exhibitions this is a place you can put on your list to visit more than once. try timing your visit when the spanish are eating to avoid the busiest periods

quote: An eclectic mix of amazing art!
reviewnospace: The Baroness Thyssen Bornemisza presents a mix of modern and classic art in a beautiful space where you know you are seeing someone's loved and well chosen collection of art. Don't miss the gift shop where treasures at good prices abound. The handmade woven shawls and the jewelry make a wonderful souvenir that will keep you warm and sparkling long after your visit to Madrid is over!
titleopinion: An eclectic mix of amazing art!. The Baroness Thyssen Bornemisza presents a mix of modern and classic art in a beautiful space where you know you are seeing someone's loved and well chosen collection of art. Don't miss the gift shop where treasures at good prices abound. The handmade woven shawls and the jewelry make a wonderful souvenir that will keep you warm and sparkling long after your visit to Madrid is over!

reviewnospace: This is a wonderful museum. It is not as large as the Prado but has a very diverse and wide range of art. It is set up in an easy to follow way and was a very enjoyable experience. It is only a a couple of minutes from the Prado and maybe 10 minutes from the Sofia.
titleopinion: Great Museum. This is a wonderful museum. It is not as large as the Prado but has a very diverse and wide range of art. It is set up in an easy to follow way and was a very enjoyable experience. It is only a a couple of minutes from the Prado and maybe 10 minutes from the Sofia.

reviewnospace:
This museum has a wealth of 19th and 20th century greats. It's a wonderful contrast to the Prado which has a majority of the old world masters. The museum is manageable
and very easy to navigate. No matter how much time you a lot to this museum you will wish you had more time, so try to have an open time frame. It is not to be missed when in Madrid.
titleopinion: A Favorite. This museum has a wealth of 19th and 20th century greats. It's a wonderful contrast to the Prado which has a majority of the old world masters. The museum is manageable  and very easy to navigate. No matter how much time you a lot to this museum you will wish you had more time, so try to have an open time frame. It is not to be missed when in Madrid.

reviewnospace: Good and best option to see lots of art....the baron and the baroness hold also a privat collection open to public.
titleopinion: Art..... Good and best option to see lots of art....the baron and the baroness hold also a privat collection open to public.

reviewnospace: Great art collection! Well organized. Good restaurant. Nice staff, expect long lines to purchase tickets.
titleopinion: Worth the visit. Great art collection! Well organized. Good restaurant. Nice staff, expect long lines to purchase tickets.

reviewnospace: I had enjoyed the Carmen-Thyssen museum in Malaga very much. So I was especially excited for this Thyssen. And I wasn't disappointed. It may be due to the fact that I had an audioguide to give me more details on what I was viewing, but also, the exhibits span from the early Byzantine to the post-war 20th century abstract avant-garde. It also holds a good collection of Impressionist art pieces that I love. I spent almost four hours strolling through the museums three levels. Get the Paseo del Arte card that gives you access to several museums (including the Reina Sofia and the Prado) for one great price!
titleopinion: Awesome Impressionist collection. I had enjoyed the Carmen-Thyssen museum in Malaga very much. So I was especially excited for this Thyssen. And I wasn't disappointed. It may be due to the fact that I had an audioguide to give me more details on what I was viewing, but also, the exhibits span from the early Byzantine to the post-war 20th century abstract avant-garde. It also holds a good collection of Impressionist art pieces that I love. I spent almost four hours strolling through the museums three levels. Get the Paseo del Arte card that gives you access to several museums (including the Reina Sofia and the Prado) for one great price!

reviewnospace: My second visit here and well worth it after ten years. Visited the Edvard Munch exhibition which we thought was exceptional. We noticed 1pm was the time to go - we queued at 11am. You can book online to avoid the queue. The permanent exhibition is superb and a must see.
titleopinion: Excellent Munch exhibition currently.. My second visit here and well worth it after ten years. Visited the Edvard Munch exhibition which we thought was exceptional. We noticed 1pm was the time to go - we queued at 11am. You can book online to avoid the queue. The permanent exhibition is superb and a must see.

reviewnospace: I choose this museum out of all 3 in Madrid to visit. It has a little bit of all kinds of art, Renaissance, Impressionism, cubism, etc instead of a lot of one type. And it wasn't so massive that you had to pick and choose what to see, you could see it all in 1.5-2 hrs. No line either. Highly recommend
titleopinion: Not overwhelming. I choose this museum out of all 3 in Madrid to visit. It has a little bit of all kinds of art, Renaissance, Impressionism, cubism, etc instead of a lot of one type. And it wasn't so massive that you had to pick and choose what to see, you could see it all in 1.5-2 hrs. No line either. Highly recommend

reviewnospace:
This lovely museum exhibits a wide range of art,from Renaissance right up to pop art. It is well presented and attractively lit,and we'll worth the €10 entrance fee.This is not as busy as the Prada,and you can get close up to the paintings,and photograph them(without using flash). The service in the cafe is really efficient and the food very reasonably priced.
Highly recommended for a morning or afternoon of culture!
titleopinion: First class art museum . This lovely museum exhibits a wide range of art,from Renaissance right up to pop art. It is well presented and attractively lit,and we'll worth the €10 entrance fee.This is not as busy as the Prada,and you can get close up to the paintings,and photograph them(without using flash). The service in the cafe is really efficient and the food very reasonably priced.  Highly recommended for a morning or afternoon of culture!

quote: Madrid's best. An excellent museum and well worth the entrance price
reviewnospace: We visited this museum in late September. I wanted to see the iconic Salvador Dali surrealist painting 'Dream Caused by the Flight of a Bee around a Pomegranate a Second before Waking Up' and Roy Lichtenstein's 'Woman in bath', while my partner was drawn to the special Vogue 'Like a Painting' exhibition of iconic high fashion cover photos. We did both, but there's lot more, including among other Master painters, Degas; Kandinsky; Rembrandt; Renoir; Monet; Van Gogh; Holbein and Rubens. Plenty of space too. You can take photos, but without the flash. They have a cloakroom, restaurant and of course, a gift shop. Allow a few hours. Enjoy.

We did both, but there's lot more, including among other Master painters, Degas; Kandinsky; Rembrandt; Renoir; Monet; Van Gogh; Holbein and Rubens. Plenty of space too. reviewnospace: I went to the Thyssen for their wonderful exhibiton on the paintings of Edvard Munch. Very interesting show providing a well rounded representation of the various stages of the artist's career. The space housing their permanent collection is beautifully designed, and their choice of soft rose colored walls on which to display paintings is very interesting. All in all while there are some exceptional pieces representing an extremely wide array of western artists from numerous countries and periods, these are somewhat outweighed by several lesser artworks of many of well known artists. Sometimes the old adage "Less is More" really does resonate. All in all, however, a wonderful place to spend an afternoon.

quote: A HISTORY OF EUROPEAN ART IN A DAY
reviewnospace: A wonderful collection of paintings considered to be one of largest and most inspired collections ever brought together in the private art world. If you want the best examples of European painting in one place, this is THE place and good not only for connoisseurs but an inspiration for those who know little about the history of art. In the permanent and temporary exhibitions there is absolutely something for everyone and we only left when our aged legs gave up. We had no trouble getting in and, compared to the Prado opposite, it was quiet.

reviewnospace: This museum had old and new art. The old art and paintings were quite impressive. However, many of the museum patrons were laughing at, and making fun of, the modern art. I guess I can understand. After all, how is a canvas painted solid grey supposed to grab at someone's feelings? I have to admit that I did not get much out of that one either. Well, it is still worth going, and if you are an art lover, you may even get something out of the grey canvas that the rest of us simply do not understand.

quote: Newer art than at the nearby Prado
reviewnospace:
This museum can be accessed from the Bank of Spain or Atocha metro stations, Atocha being closer. If you walk down the Paseo de Prada from the Bank of Spain station you will see a building marked Thyssen and a narrow lane leading to what seems to be the entrance. Skip that as it is simply a café and go to a square with two outside elevators and this is the real entrance.
My impression was the Thyssen is like an extension to the Prado which picks up where they leave off, say around 1850 and includes a lot of early impressionists including French and even Austrian but still mostly Spanish artists. This one does overlap the Sophia Reina to some extent but here the emphasis is on the artist and I'll comment on Sofia Reine separately.

quote: Very nice, small museum with visiting collections
reviewnospace: The Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum is a nice, small gem of an art museum. We went to see the Edward Much exhibit - the pieces were grouped perfectly by theme (and chronologically within each theme) I came away with the sense that Much was a very talented artist with a very nihilistic outlook on life. While I ended up realizing I'm not a very big fan of Munch, I absolutely appreciate the museum's commitment to presenting an unflinching retrospective of Munch's work, bleak and morbid as it may be.

While I ended up realizing I'm not a very big fan of Munch, I absolutely appreciate the museum's commitment to presenting an unflinching retrospective of Munch's work, bleak and morbid as it may be.

quote: Superb Private Collection Just A Roundabout From The Prado.
reviewnospace:
In my view this is the next "must see" of major art gallery in Madrid after the Prado. Obviously it's nothing like the size of its near neighbour, but it contains Baron Thyssen & son's astutely assembled diverse collection of the highest quality in a former palace extensively modernised internally and with an C21st
extension housing an upscale cafe and large giftshop. In the entrance hall is a striking pair of full length portraits of the former King Juan Carlos & Queen Sofia. All the top artists of the past 500 years are carefully represented, you won't be disappointed.

quote: Among best art collections around the Globe!
reviewnospace: Must visit place in Madrid. Reserve not less 4-5 hours for the visit. Any way it's not enough to see and feel all hits of the huge collection! But you will obtain impression in overall in a few hours. Really hits of many world famous artists. Selected with a care, exposed in fine conditions. Advice you to purchase combined ticket for visiting permanent exhibition as well as temporary at once. We were lucky see Edvard Munch ex. opened a couple weeks ago and till the beginning of 2016. It's a chance see so many fine works at one place! Hurry to see! Don't forget to buy E. Munch catalogue as well as perfect two-volume catalogue of permanent collection (Old Masters + Modern Masters). Take a half hour to check book shop with exceptional choice of art books. Everything here meets high standards of taste! Enjoy your upcoming visit! We shall come back next time in Madrid with no doubts !

quote: If I compared the Prado to the Louvre, I must compare the Thyssen-B to the Musee d'Orsay
reviewnospace:
If you want to see French Impressionists, don't go to Paris. Come here or go to Chicago.

This is a splendid collection. Actually, it's 2 collections, the Baron's and the Baroness's. Both are organized chronologically, and contain some of the best works from modern and classical times. The French impressionists are exceptionally well represented, as are some of the best 20th century painters; Picasso, Dali and (bonus) quite a few Hopper paintings! There are some fine works by Russian women painters from the early 20th century (a dangerous time for any creativity in Soviet Russia. Also some nice Kandinsky works. Overall, I think there is enough variety to please any reasonable taste in this collection. One of the features I particularly appreciated is that many of the paintings have been restored. The dark varnishes have been removed and the original colours are vibrant. Needless to say, this is especially true for their Van Goghs.

For best value, get the Paseo del Arte pass that gets you into the trinity of Madrid's great galleries: the Prado, the Reina Sofia & the Thyssen-B. I wouldn't recommend seeing the Prado & the Thyssen-B on the same day. It's too overwhelming & you need the time to appreciate them properly.

For best value, get the Paseo del Arte pass that gets you into the trinity of Madrid's great galleries: the Prado, the Reina Sofia & the Thyssen-B. It has an outstanding collection of paintings (and sculptures) of major artists such as Van Gogh, Rubens, Degas etc. Unlike the Prado here you are allowed to take photos (no flash). The gift shop is also nice. Admission 10 euros.

titleopinion: Splendid Museum. The museum is very well organized and the collection is outstanding.We have visited the museum on a Monday afternoon offering free entrance sponsored by Mastercard.

reviewnospace: I loved this museum, more than Prado and Reina Sofía. Combination of modern and old art. Rembrandt is my favourite here. Nice staff.
titleopinion: BeA(R)uTiful. I loved this museum, more than Prado and Reina Sofía. Combination of modern and old art. Rembrandt is my favourite here. Nice staff.

reviewnospace: The special Vogue exhibit was one of the most impressive artistic collections I've seen in a very long time. Consistent high quality artwork. My mother initially expressed no interest (Vogue is image oriented) but Vogue's exploration of the intersection between photography and painting told me of a greater depth of choice and consideration by the museum. I also found their cafe and gift shop to offer better than expected quality. I admit, I wondered if each thing offered were personally approved by the woman behind the museum's collection. I am never know but, in my humble opinion, well done!
