reviewnospace:
Of all the museums and sights that we visited in Spain, this had the best-designed audioguide. Definitely worth it. Enjoyed this more than the Prado.
The collection is quite varied, covering periods from the renaissance to the contemporary. We were very pleased; our only disappointment was that nearly all of the Monets were on loan to temporary exhibits elsewhere.
titleopinion: Great variety, excellent audio guide. Of all the museums and sights that we visited in Spain, this had the best-designed audioguide. Definitely worth it. Enjoyed this more than the Prado.  The collection is quite varied, covering periods from the renaissance to the contemporary. We were very pleased; our only disappointment was that nearly all of the Monets were on loan to temporary exhibits elsewhere.

reviewnospace: Really good museum (free entry on specific days) - so much great art to see. The dancers by Degas are beautiful.There's also a terrace cafe to have a drink.

reviewnospace: This is another fantastic art collection, and well worth a visit to. The collection covers a wide variety of styles and is well curated
titleopinion: a must do. This is another fantastic art collection, and well worth a visit to. The collection covers a wide variety of styles and is well curated

quote: Not to be missed. Suggestion about Paseo del Arte card!
reviewnospace: I would advise purchasing the Paseo del Arte card on their website in advance, having it validated here, which then gives access also to the other two of the three great Madrid museums. This way you would avoid the lineup at the Prado. The Thyssen is an amazing museum; be sure to get the audio guide, and try to plan what you will see. The medieval paintings are wonderful, as is the Dutch landscape. Be sure to see the painting by Edward Hopper (American), "The Hotel Room." Fascinating and bleak. Note the fore-shortening of the bed and the way the arrangement of the furniture creates the feeling of being enclosed and locked in.
titleopinion: Not to be missed. Suggestion about Paseo del Arte card!. I would advise purchasing the Paseo del Arte card on their website in advance, having it validated here, which then gives access also to the other two of the three great Madrid museums. The medieval paintings are wonderful, as is the Dutch landscape. Be sure to see the painting by Edward Hopper (American),  The Hotel Room.  Fascinating and bleak. Note the fore-shortening of the bed and the way the arrangement of the furniture creates the feeling of being enclosed and locked in.

reviewnospace:
We almost didn't go here having been less than blown away by Del Prada, boy am I pleased we did.

Monday has a period where admission is free, sponsored by Mastercard, which made it even better! Start at the top floor and work your way down, they suggest it and it is the best way to do it.

The collections are well laid out, the place is easy to navigate and there are some real masterpieces. Mark you the lower you get the more modern the art becomes until one reaches the area which I call ‘The Kings New Clothes’ better to be hung on the fridge, next to the other efforts of five year olds. They have 10 Picasso’s but all from his latter period when I am sure he was taking the rise from critics, nothing from the early period when he showed he could actually paint.

Don’t miss the Canaletto’s, there are six I found and two are simply outstanding.

The collections are well laid out, the place is easy to navigate and there are some real masterpieces. They have 10 Picasso’s but all from his latter period when I am sure he was taking the rise from critics, nothing from the early period when he showed he could actually paint.  Don’t miss the Canaletto’s, there are six I found and two are simply outstanding.

quote: Good museum with a special exhibition of the works of Zubaran
reviewnospace: We enjoyed a second visit to this wonderful museum. We knew that the special exhibition was Zubaran - a New Perspective. It cost €9 each which was a combination ticket for the Zubaran exhibition and the permanent collection. (You have to show proof of age.) We went to see the Zubaran paintings first. These were wonderful. They are mostly religious. He obviously liked beautiful young woman and painted his female saints from life! He has an amazing ability to paint the materials of the day. You can see the sheen on the silks and that some of the garments are linen. He and his son also painted beautiful still life paintings of exquisite flowers. After this we went to see the permanent collections. These are an art lovers dream with many world famous painters represented. The first time we visited we were so surprised to see a Holbein painting of King Henry 8th of England - probably the most notorious English king. We were happy to see it was still in situ. All in all we really enjoyed our second visit to the Thyssen Bornemisza museum and would definitely go back again. There is a nice museum shop offering a wide range of goods.

reviewnospace: We wanted to take advantage of free entrance on Mondays (on other days it costs 10 euros) and arrived quarter before noon (gallery opens at 12 on Mondays) only to find a loooong queue on the street. It was at the begining of June, so I suspect that it can be even longer in summer months. Fortunately when they let people in, it moved quite quickly. We kind of slipped through the floors as we did not have much time going to the airport straight for the afternoon flight but it was defintely worth it. If possible make some research in advance in order to know which rooms may be most interesting for you as the collection covers many styles and artists and you could easily spend a few hours there. Anyway it's definitely recommended.

reviewnospace:
For art lovers out there, this is a museum for you!

We were able to go to this museum for free on Monday between the hours of 12-4pm, so I would definitely suggest to get there on that day!

If you love Picasso, Miro, Dali, Manet, Degars, Matisse, Ernst....and so many other world renowned artists, there is a painting from each of them in this museum - collection by the Baron and Baroness - it's a complete mix of traditional still life art to the ultra modern all in one place. A fantastic location for those that appreciate all kinds of art!

I would recommend!

reviewnospace:
The Tythesen museum has its collections mostly from one collector and donator, baron Tythesen-Bornemisza, and it is so outright impressive.
Rodin has his works displayed at the entrance of the museum, and then rows of Italian and Spanish artists’ works present themselves, religious, historical, and secular. Here and there, you see the big names of Monet, Picasso, van Gogh, and Gauguin on the wall, quietly, as not to bother themselves with standing and shouting out. There is no large crowds in front of these masters' works, as in some other European museums, so you can enjoy viewing them at your pleasure, even sitting down. Spanish master Goya’s works are of course there.
The first van Gogh I noticed by chance is one of his early works, when he was 30 and still normal, on the way to experiment his master strokes, so the painting "Watermill on Gennep" shows hut, light of sky and water. Monet’s are of colours and landscape, a few of them being on loan to other exhibitions, as indicated by brief notices on the wall. Gauguin has more paintings on show, more than two dozen. Picasso’s paintings could be found numerous times, more than the number shown at Prado.
It is really amazing how this person (Tythesen) alone amassed all of masterpieces by himself and then donated to set up an entire museum, in his name. His collection also includes modern art works, up to the 1970s, taking up one floor of the three floor displaying space. Tythesen museum is thoroughly enjoyable as Prado, but this one is more impressive in the sense that it is one man’s contribution to the cultural heritage of Spain.

reviewnospace: This museum's collection represents over 300 years of a family's personal collecting habits. We particularly enjoyed seeing how the Thyssen-Bornemisza family collected not only the masters, but obviously for their own taste as well. The contemporary 20th century collection is stunning.
titleopinion: Thyssen's collection stunning. This museum's collection represents over 300 years of a family's personal collecting habits. reviewnospace: It's not the size of the Prado, but there is much to see in this museum. Take the advice of the guidebooks and if you like impressionists start there if your time is limited. The collection is arranged chronologically starting on the top floor and there are wonderful 16th, 17th century works there - some gems in the style of the dutch masters. The museum is well laid-out; it's not a palatial space like the Prado, it's ample but feels intimate. A highlight during 4 days in Madrid, i enjoyed it as much as or more than the Prado. Great audio guide in English, too. Photos permitted.

reviewnospace:
I've arrived at the conclusion that Madrid is quite simply showing off. After visiting the Prado,and the Reina Sofia we thought we'd seen the best of it all,but little did we know the cream of the crop was saved until last.
It isn't really fair to judge such stunning collections against one another,however if my hand was forced I would have to say the layout of this place suited me more.
It was a pity Charing Cross bridge by Monet had been loaned to a Berlin gallery as I was looking forward to feasting my eyes upon it,but that was my only slight negative.

quote: A fine museum to complement the Prado and Reina Sofia
reviewnospace: Modern, spotless interior with excellent collections of minor works by major artists and major works by lesser known artists. Worth the admission.
titleopinion: A fine museum to complement the Prado and Reina Sofia. Modern, spotless interior with excellent collections of minor works by major artists and major works by lesser known artists. Worth the admission.

reviewnospace: Spent 3 hrs going through a fantastic art exhibition but could have spent all day. They have works of art from some of the greatest artists of all time. Rembrandt, Van Gogh, Monet and Picasso. I felt privileged to see them. Not as busy as the Prado, but I felt more relaxed. Only €10 each, which was a bargain. I recommend this to everybody who visits Madrid. Remember there is 3 full floors to cover, so wear comfy shoes. And you are allowed to take pictures, unlike the Prado, so get snap happy!
titleopinion: Beautiful. Spent 3 hrs going through a fantastic art exhibition but could have spent all day. They have works of art from some of the greatest artists of all time. Rembrandt, Van Gogh, Monet and Picasso. I felt privileged to see them. Not as busy as the Prado, but I felt more relaxed. Only €10 each, which was a bargain. I recommend this to everybody who visits Madrid. Remember there is 3 full floors to cover, so wear comfy shoes. And you are allowed to take pictures, unlike the Prado, so get snap happy!

reviewnospace: This is just across the street from the Prado and is a phenomenal museum. I liked it better than the Prado. We used a Madrid card which gave access to lots of museums and attractions.
titleopinion: Fabulous Museum. This is just across the street from the Prado and is a phenomenal museum. I liked it better than the Prado. We used a Madrid card which gave access to lots of museums and attractions.

reviewnospace: Nice cafe on the ground level of the museum - fully air conditioned and good choice of snacks and drinks. Wait staff very pleasant and efficient.
titleopinion: Smart cafe. Nice cafe on the ground level of the museum - fully air conditioned and good choice of snacks and drinks. Wait staff very pleasant and efficient.

reviewnospace:
The salmon colored gallery walls beautifully accent this impressive art collection! The galleries are arranged chronologically and are easy to maneuver through. So many wonderful works by so many famous artists! An overall impressive collection and memorable museum experience! We actually enjoyed this museum more than the Prado.

The special Zurbaran exhibit was excellent! So fortunate to have seen these works exhibited together!

We spent 3 1/2 hours enjoying the art works with a break for lunch in their lovely cafe.

The staff was very friendly and spoke English.

Photography is allowed but no flash.

We ordered our tickets online before we left for our trip. Easy and saved time when we arrived.
The Senior Discount tickets were only 5 euro plus we purchased tickets for the special Zurbaran exhibit for only 2 euro.
titleopinion: A Most Enjoyable Art Experience!. The salmon colored gallery walls beautifully accent this impressive art collection! The galleries are arranged chronologically and are easy to maneuver through. So many wonderful works by so many famous artists! An overall impressive collection and memorable museum experience! We actually enjoyed this museum more than the Prado.  The special Zurbaran exhibit was excellent! So fortunate to have seen these works exhibited together!  We spent 3 1/2 hours enjoying the art works with a break for lunch in their lovely cafe.  The staff was very friendly and spoke English.  Photography is allowed but no flash.  We ordered our tickets online before we left for our trip. Easy and saved time when we arrived. The Senior Discount tickets were only 5 euro plus we purchased tickets for the special Zurbaran exhibit for only 2 euro.

reviewnospace: In addition to their permanent collection, we enjoyed the Zurburan exhibit, up through mid-September.
titleopinion: a wonderful and varied collection. In addition to their permanent collection, we enjoyed the Zurburan exhibit, up through mid-September.

reviewnospace: This was my favorite of the museums in Madrid. Much smaller than the Prado. Love Kandinsky, Dali, Lichtenstein, Van Gogh, Monet!
titleopinion: My Favorite Museum in Madrid. This was my favorite of the museums in Madrid. Much smaller than the Prado. Love Kandinsky, Dali, Lichtenstein, Van Gogh, Monet!

quote: Worth a visit besides Prado and Reina Sofia
reviewnospace:
Our family has visited the other 2 museums and read good review about Thyssen Bornemisza.

The size of this museum makes it easier to navigate and cover; We went the the top floor with great length since the 13th century art interested us.

The staffs were helpful and the audio system works great.

It's worth coming here in the afternoon and leisurely stroll through their wonderful collection.
titleopinion: Worth a visit besides Prado and Reina Sofia. Our family has visited the other 2 museums and read good review about Thyssen Bornemisza.  The size of this museum makes it easier to navigate and cover; We went the the top floor with great length since the 13th century art interested us.  The staffs were helpful and the audio system works great.  It's worth coming here in the afternoon and leisurely stroll through their wonderful collection.

reviewnospace: This lesser known gem of Madrid is amazing. It has an incredibly impressive collection! On par with Musee d'Orsay when it comes to impressionist works! Right now they have a vogue exhibition which is awesome. I definitely recommend a trip to this affordable museum! Much less crowded than the Prado and museums in Paris.
titleopinion: Amazing!. This lesser known gem of Madrid is amazing. It has an incredibly impressive collection! On par with Musee d'Orsay when it comes to impressionist works! Right now they have a vogue exhibition which is awesome. I definitely recommend a trip to this affordable museum! Much less crowded than the Prado and museums in Paris.

reviewnospace:
As you can imagine, Spain is full of museums, every town is rich in history, each street has something to say.

This museum is not an exception, the areas are fantastic, the artworks are unique!, every single piece is a master piece!.

The staff is very friendly, polite, attentive and extremely respectful, you can see they really love what they do, you can feel the atmosphere of an unique place on earth.

If you are planning to visit Europe, please, consider a stop by Madrid and take the time to discover this museum, certainly Madrid has a lot of things to do!, visiting Madrid worth everything!.
titleopinion: Great experience!. As you can imagine, Spain is full of museums, every town is rich in history, each street has something to say.  This museum is not an exception, the areas are fantastic, the artworks are unique!, every single piece is a master piece!.  The staff is very friendly, polite, attentive and extremely respectful, you can see they really love what they do, you can feel the atmosphere of an unique place on earth.  If you are planning to visit Europe, please, consider a stop by Madrid and take the time to discover this museum, certainly Madrid has a lot of things to do!, visiting Madrid worth everything!.

reviewnospace: This is my favourite museum. Its very tasteful and an amazing collection of art. Lovely gift shop and garden.
titleopinion: Thyssen Collection. This is my favourite museum. Its very tasteful and an amazing collection of art. Lovely gift shop and garden.

quote: Outstanding beautiful museum. Free on Monday afternoons!
reviewnospace: Loved this gallery. No queues as visited in July. Very pleasant cafe-restaurant adjoining. There is so much to enjoy and easy to select those painters of particular interest. Spent about three hours but could have re-visited.
titleopinion: Outstanding beautiful museum. Free on Monday afternoons!. Loved this gallery. No queues as visited in July. Very pleasant cafe-restaurant adjoining. There is so much to enjoy and easy to select those painters of particular interest. Spent about three hours but could have re-visited.

reviewnospace: A must see in Madrid, and much easier to get through than the Prado or Sofia, which are also both amazing. A bonus for the Thyssen is a very pleasant outside bar that serves great mojitos. Best enjoyed after the museum.
titleopinion: Great Mojitos!. A must see in Madrid, and much easier to get through than the Prado or Sofia, which are also both amazing. A bonus for the Thyssen is a very pleasant outside bar that serves great mojitos. Best enjoyed after the museum.

reviewnospace: This is a terrific art museum. It's hard to believe that it was all a private collection. It's doable in 3 hours but I suppose you could do it in less time.
titleopinion: Excellent Museum. This is a terrific art museum. It's hard to believe that it was all a private collection. It's doable in 3 hours but I suppose you could do it in less time.

reviewnospace: Wonderful presentation of art. Good layout for viewing and was very comfortable inside. Bathrooms are accessible on every floor as are water fountains.
titleopinion: Great Museum. Wonderful presentation of art. Good layout for viewing and was very comfortable inside. Bathrooms are accessible on every floor as are water fountains.

quote: A special group of well chosen 13th c. to modernist artworks,in a walkable, beautifully modern space
reviewnospace:
Like a younger more "hip"sibling of the Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemiza is smaller in scope, doesn't have the same level of fame or emblematic works, but resembles its big sister the Prado with its equally superb selection of art, Mediterranean light terra cotta colored stucco walls, elegant modern interiors and great lighting, as a preserved landmark building, and is actually a bit more comfortable,and walkable. Pictures allowed without a flash, but do slow down and enjoy the trip.

It has a more unusual, satisfying selection of carefully chosen works of master artists of every genre. Well known but, slightly less familiar paintings than the greatest "hits" of the Prado or Louvre,and of exceedingly high quality.

From the 13th through 20th centuries, every period and style, in small groupings, not an overwhelming number, just the best of each period or an unusual example of a well known master. Grouped by genre and style rather than country or artist, paintings on view provide an instant comparison between Dutch, Spanish and early American still life, German, English, and Hudson River landscape, abstract expressionism, pop and Jazz age painting.
It made me see and appreciate distinctions and sensibilities within the same genre..

More a museum about what makes painting great, than a focus on the works of Goya, or Veronese or any one artist.

Of the highly selective choices: Ghirlandaio's young woman is an absolute show stopper, the alternative to the Mona Lisa in Spain. As is the large Carpaccio painting of a knight in the woods,when you walk past the ticket desk.

Glowing landscapes by Martin Heade, two paintings by Roger Van der Weyden that are so small that a magnifying glass us provided to allow you to see the remarkable detail, perspective and illusion of space.
with its surprises, there is a real element of entertainment in this museum, the work is very specific and gets a response that of delight and pleasure.

There is no need for scholarly understanding, because nearly every painting I saw is beautiful, not one clunker. Including great modernist works of Morris Louis, Stuart Davis, Lucien Freud, Andrew Wyeth, pop art, Mondrian, Rothko, as well as Titian and Poussin.

The restaurant provides a welcome respite for coffee, lunch or an afternoon snack, nice service, not expensive and well prepared food. The gift shop is fun, elegant, well designed contemporary jewelry, gourmet goods scarves as well as posters, bags, and of course, a terrific book collection, a lot of it in English. .

You get the feeling of how precious this collection is, as soon as you start looking at the pristine, quintessential examples of the best works not owned by the Louvre or Prado.
Presentation is clever, entices you in the beginning with some absolute knockout, more "flashy" works to keep you excited to see the rest, ,but there are no let downs at any point..

Works by English artist Lucien Freud, Frank Auerbach, Americans Morris Louis and Stuart Davis. paintings we had not seen by artists we know and love.

Countess Thyssen had impeccable visual taste, it shows in the workschedule she chose, the unpretentious but elegant design and presentation of food and menu selections in the all day casual outdoor patio restaurant, also. You can wander in and out for a quick coffee, return for lunch and come back of or a dessert and tea later on.

. One of the most fun gift shops in a museum --a real shopping experience, like visiting a slightly less expensive Barney's in Manhattan, with a selection of unusual and artful scarves, wraps, jewelry, bags, a quite serious book collection, even specially packaged gourmet foods to take back from Spain.

it all seems to fit, and affords a full day of sendory enjoyment..

Also contemporary exhibitions including fashion, Givenchy, Cartier, cinema, etc. .
titleopinion: A special group of well chosen 13th c. to modernist artworks,in a walkable, beautifully modern space. Like a younger more  hip sibling of the Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemiza is smaller in scope, doesn't have the same level of fame or emblematic works, but resembles its big sister the Prado with its equally superb selection of art, Mediterranean light terra cotta colored stucco walls, elegant modern interiors and great lighting, as a preserved landmark building, and is actually a bit more comfortable,and walkable. Pictures allowed without a flash, but do slow down and enjoy the trip.  It has a more unusual, satisfying selection of carefully chosen works of master artists of every genre. Well known but, slightly less familiar paintings than the greatest  hits  of the Prado or Louvre,and of exceedingly high quality.   From the 13th through 20th centuries, every period and style, in small groupings, not an overwhelming number, just the best of each period or an unusual example of a well known master. Grouped by genre and style rather than country or artist, paintings on view provide an instant comparison between Dutch, Spanish and early American still life, German, English, and Hudson River landscape, abstract expressionism, pop and Jazz age painting. It made me see and appreciate distinctions and sensibilities within the same genre..  More a museum about what makes painting great, than a focus on the works of Goya, or Veronese or any one artist.   Of the highly selective choices: Ghirlandaio's young woman is an absolute show stopper, the alternative to the Mona Lisa in Spain. As is the large Carpaccio painting of a knight in the woods,when you walk past the ticket desk.   Glowing landscapes by Martin Heade, two paintings by Roger Van der Weyden that are so small that a magnifying glass us provided to allow you to see the remarkable detail, perspective and illusion of space. with its surprises, there is a real element of entertainment in this museum, the work is very specific and gets a response that of delight and pleasure.  There is no need for scholarly understanding, because nearly every painting I saw is beautiful, not one clunker. Including great modernist works of Morris Louis, Stuart Davis, Lucien Freud, Andrew Wyeth, pop art, Mondrian, Rothko, as well as Titian and Poussin.  The restaurant provides a welcome respite for coffee, lunch or an afternoon snack, nice service, not expensive and well prepared food. The gift shop is fun, elegant, well designed contemporary jewelry, gourmet goods scarves as well as posters, bags, and of course, a terrific book collection, a lot of it in English. .   You get the feeling of how precious this collection is, as soon as you start looking at the pristine, quintessential examples of the best works not owned by the Louvre or Prado. Presentation is clever, entices you in the beginning with some absolute knockout, more  flashy  works to keep you excited to see the rest, ,but there are no let downs at any point..  Works by English artist Lucien Freud, Frank Auerbach, Americans Morris Louis and Stuart Davis. paintings we had not seen by artists we know and love.   Countess Thyssen had impeccable visual taste, it shows in the workschedule she chose, the unpretentious but elegant design and presentation of food and menu selections in the all day casual outdoor patio restaurant, also. You can wander in and out for a quick coffee, return for lunch and come back of or a dessert and tea later on.   . One of the most fun gift shops in a museum --a real shopping experience, like visiting a slightly less expensive Barney's in Manhattan, with a selection of unusual and artful scarves, wraps, jewelry, bags, a quite serious book collection, even specially packaged gourmet foods to take back from Spain.   it all seems to fit, and affords a full day of sendory enjoyment..  Also contemporary exhibitions including fashion, Givenchy, Cartier, cinema, etc. .

reviewnospace: Not too busy considering Monday afternoon is a free entry time to the permanent collection. A wide variety of paintings from primitive Italian to modern works of art, spread over three floors in an attractive display. Nice restaurant attached and a reasonable shop, if you want a souvenir. Don't bother getting there at 12:00, we made it at half past and walked straight in whereas people had queued for an hour to get in at 12:00!
titleopinion: Varied and beautifully displayed collection. Not too busy considering Monday afternoon is a free entry time to the permanent collection. A wide variety of paintings from primitive Italian to modern works of art, spread over three floors in an attractive display. Nice restaurant attached and a reasonable shop, if you want a souvenir. Don't bother getting there at 12:00, we made it at half past and walked straight in whereas people had queued for an hour to get in at 12:00!

quote: Amazing not boring, modern and gorgeous
reviewnospace: I liked that it was modern, spacious and relevant. Not boring, the Vogue exhibition was WOW. I am glad I went, even though I generally do not love museums, this one was modern and light.
titleopinion: Amazing not boring, modern and gorgeous. I liked that it was modern, spacious and relevant. Not boring, the Vogue exhibition was WOW. I am glad I went, even though I generally do not love museums, this one was modern and light.

quote: Quick trip to see the Impressionists
reviewnospace: Lovely museum, good value for the permanent exhibition (free for kids under 12). Free cloakroom and friendly staff. Nicely laid out and easy to move around. No big queues
titleopinion: Quick trip to see the Impressionists. Lovely museum, good value for the permanent exhibition (free for kids under 12). Free cloakroom and friendly staff. Nicely laid out and easy to move around. No big queues

quote: Took us six hours to go through
reviewnospace: We visited Mardird for museum tour. Thyssen was our first day visit and this place was comfortable to see the works because the works are in chronological order and the layout of the rooms are easy to understand with the map. The collection has a large amout of works such as the Renaissance, Mannerism, the Baroque, Rococo, Romanticism and the art of the 19th and 20th centuries. It took us six hours to finish and the colleciton was more than we had expected.

reviewnospace: You can cover this museum in the better part of a day. Lots to see, and it is sorted by period rather than artists. Still a great place to visit.
titleopinion: What a collection!. You can cover this museum in the better part of a day. Lots to see, and it is sorted by period rather than artists. Still a great place to visit.

reviewnospace: This museum houses an expansive collection, focusing primarily on Impressionist Art, but not exclusively. An extensive collection and an interesting background story about the donor. There is also a sleek cafe.
titleopinion: Beautiful Collection. This museum houses an expansive collection, focusing primarily on Impressionist Art, but not exclusively. An extensive collection and an interesting background story about the donor. There is also a sleek cafe.

reviewnospace: A fantastic selection of paintings in good surroundings. No large queues, and helpful staff. A little expensive for anything more than the basic entry fee, but this was already 2 to 3 hours of viewing
titleopinion: Excellent Gallery with no crowds. A fantastic selection of paintings in good surroundings. No large queues, and helpful staff. A little expensive for anything more than the basic entry fee, but this was already 2 to 3 hours of viewing

reviewnospace: Coming from Chicago and frequently visiting the Art Institute of Chicago, I know world class art museums. When in Madrid, I like the Prado and the El Greco collection which surpasses any other grouping of that artist. But right across the street, the Thysen-Bornemisze Art museum is spectacular and well laid out. You can take the tour or wander by yourself. The descriptive signs are in English too! Don't leave Madrid without a visit if you love "star" paintings, the envy of so many museums.
titleopinion: Dutch masters and impressionists galore. Coming from Chicago and frequently visiting the Art Institute of Chicago, I know world class art museums. When in Madrid, I like the Prado and the El Greco collection which surpasses any other grouping of that artist. But right across the street, the Thysen-Bornemisze Art museum is spectacular and well laid out. You can take the tour or wander by yourself. The descriptive signs are in English too! Don't leave Madrid without a visit if you love  star  paintings, the envy of so many museums.

reviewnospace:
This museum is a must because of the size and variety of the art collection.
Besides, the museum itself is so lovely that you can easily spend an entire day.
titleopinion: A must see in Madrid . This museum is a must because of the size and variety of the art collection.  Besides, the museum itself is so lovely that you can easily spend an entire day.

reviewnospace:
We loved this museum. It is gorgeous, modern, and very comfortable. The restaurant and cafe are excellent and reasonably priced. This museum has by far the best museum gift shop in Spain.

The art pieces are select and amazing. There are paintings by Dali, Rothko, Kandinsky, and Botticelli, among many fabulous others.

This is one of my favorite museums in Madrid, one that is worth visiting again and again and again.
titleopinion: Just Fantastic. We loved this museum. It is gorgeous, modern, and very comfortable. The restaurant and cafe are excellent and reasonably priced. This museum has by far the best museum gift shop in Spain.   The art pieces are select and amazing. There are paintings by Dali, Rothko, Kandinsky, and Botticelli, among many fabulous others.   This is one of my favorite museums in Madrid, one that is worth visiting again and again and again.

reviewnospace: I liked all the paintings from centuries ago and all very well organized by galleries. Spectacular!!!!!!
titleopinion: It is a great Museum!!!. I liked all the paintings from centuries ago and all very well organized by galleries. Spectacular!!!!!!

reviewnospace:
Outstanding exhibition!
As an amateur photographer, it was IMPRESSIVE to be in front of the pieces of the big names of the contemporary photography.
The museography was done beautiful.
Also it is a pleasure to browse the permanent collection.
titleopinion: Vogue like a painting . Outstanding exhibition! As an amateur photographer, it was IMPRESSIVE to be in front of the pieces of the big names of the contemporary photography. The museography was done beautiful.  Also it is a pleasure to browse the permanent collection.

reviewnospace: We had enough time in Madrid to visit the Prado, the Reina Sofia, and the Thyssen-Bornemisza museums. This was our favorite of the three. The art collection is fantastic and covers many centuries of art. However, it is a small enough museum that if you spend at least half a day there, you feel like you can see most of it. It is much more manageable than the Prado and I thought the artwork was much more impressive than the Reina Sofia, other than Guernica. I'd recommend this as #1 if you only have time to visit one art museum in Madrid.
titleopinion: Fabulous Collection!. We had enough time in Madrid to visit the Prado, the Reina Sofia, and the Thyssen-Bornemisza museums. This was our favorite of the three. The art collection is fantastic and covers many centuries of art. However, it is a small enough museum that if you spend at least half a day there, you feel like you can see most of it. It is much more manageable than the Prado and I thought the artwork was much more impressive than the Reina Sofia, other than Guernica. I'd recommend this as #1 if you only have time to visit one art museum in Madrid.

reviewnospace: This museum is a must see when in Madrid. I saw the collection they had as well as the Vogue exhibit that was going on and both were great.
titleopinion: The Tyssen. This museum is a must see when in Madrid. I saw the collection they had as well as the Vogue exhibit that was going on and both were great.

reviewnospace: As an American visiting Madrid, I was amazed to find three galleries dedicated to North American painters. I got to see a painting of George Washington´s cook for the first time.
titleopinion: Surprising eclectic collection. As an American visiting Madrid, I was amazed to find three galleries dedicated to North American painters. I got to see a painting of George Washington´s cook for the first time.

reviewnospace: It was a pleasure to take a chronological walk through art history, with pieces from almost all the greats. My favorites in this collection were towards the end, a couple of Lucien Freud portraits and a Rothko. So my only regret is that I was a bit tired by the time we reached modern times to fully appreciate the masterpieces.
titleopinion: A wonderful collection . It was a pleasure to take a chronological walk through art history, with pieces from almost all the greats. My favorites in this collection were towards the end, a couple of Lucien Freud portraits and a Rothko. So my only regret is that I was a bit tired by the time we reached modern times to fully appreciate the masterpieces.

reviewnospace: If you like the past centuries famous Spanish artists like Picasso and Dali visit this museum. Not quite as famous as the Prado at houses an amazing collection of modern Art.
titleopinion: Modern Spanish artists. . If you like the past centuries famous Spanish artists like Picasso and Dali visit this museum. Not quite as famous as the Prado at houses an amazing collection of modern Art.

reviewnospace:
This museum was created to house one families art collection, with some 1000 works of art spanning from the 13th century to Pop Art it is amazing the big names represented here,

The museum isn't huge especially compared to the neighboring Prado but it fills in the gaps Prado and Reina Sofia have by their nature, The three should be taken as an amazing whole.

The collection can feel a bit disjointed but that is because it was built by the family of what they wanted and not untill the end envisioned as a museum collection. Because of that there was I think one Monet but lots of lesser known impressionists. Lots of portraits (one of Baron Thussen-Bornemisza ( I believe the one that sold to collection to Spain) that I saw.

Here most people won't see any paintings they already know about but they will know many of the artists and see important works by artists they don't know.

The museum is on three floors and well layed out, I doubt anyone gets lost here. It took me about 3 hours to see, It is currently free on Monday afternoons.
titleopinion: Great collection. This museum was created to house one families art collection, with some 1000 works of art spanning from the 13th century to Pop Art it is amazing the big names represented here,   The museum isn't huge especially compared to the neighboring Prado but it fills in the gaps Prado and Reina Sofia have by their nature, The three should be taken as an amazing whole.   The collection can feel a bit disjointed but that is because it was built by the family of what they wanted and not untill the end envisioned as a museum collection. Because of that there was I think one Monet but lots of lesser known impressionists. Lots of portraits (one of Baron Thussen-Bornemisza ( I believe the one that sold to collection to Spain) that I saw.  Here most people won't see any paintings they already know about but they will know many of the artists and see important works by artists they don't know.   The museum is on three floors and well layed out, I doubt anyone gets lost here. It took me about 3 hours to see, It is currently free on Monday afternoons.

quote: Great museum with an excellent collection
reviewnospace: My favorite museum in Madrid. I know that the Prado is well-renknowned, but having visited both, I prefer the Thyssen. This museum has an excellent variety of art from many different centuries and is the perfect size as you can see everything in an afternoon and not feel like you are missing out. Unlike the Prado, they do charge for children, however there are days when children (and teenagers/students) are free. When we visited they had a "selfie" station, where you could put on the costume of a very famous painting and sit in front of the background and take a selfie. Our 20 something son and girlfriend did this and the pictures we took were super fun and amazing. Overall, it was a great afternoon.
titleopinion: Great museum with an excellent collection. My favorite museum in Madrid. I know that the Prado is well-renknowned, but having visited both, I prefer the Thyssen. This museum has an excellent variety of art from many different centuries and is the perfect size as you can see everything in an afternoon and not feel like you are missing out. Unlike the Prado, they do charge for children, however there are days when children (and teenagers/students) are free. When we visited they had a  selfie  station, where you could put on the costume of a very famous painting and sit in front of the background and take a selfie. Our 20 something son and girlfriend did this and the pictures we took were super fun and amazing. Overall, it was a great afternoon.

reviewnospace: Very interest museum, interest regular collection. A lot of russian artists very famous and less famous. On Monday noon you can visit this museum for free. Thanks to MacterCard. Not very interest museum shop, don't find something interest.
titleopinion: One of the best museum. Very interest museum, interest regular collection. A lot of russian artists very famous and less famous. On Monday noon you can visit this museum for free. Thanks to MacterCard. Not very interest museum shop, don't find something interest.

reviewnospace: Once you've seen the Prada, you may assume you've seen it all. This is a more intimate, magnificent collection, going way back, with far fewer visitors to shall we say intrude upon your contemplation.
titleopinion: Beautiful artwork, beautifully displayed. Once you've seen the Prada, you may assume you've seen it all. This is a more intimate, magnificent collection, going way back, with far fewer visitors to shall we say intrude upon your contemplation.

reviewnospace: We combined our ticket with the Prado, Thyssen and a third museum that we never made it to. If you are a lover of art, go to these museums. If you go in July, you will enjoy a day out of the heat of Madrid.
titleopinion: Near the Prado. We combined our ticket with the Prado, Thyssen and a third museum that we never made it to. If you are a lover of art, go to these museums. If you go in July, you will enjoy a day out of the heat of Madrid.

reviewnospace: Eclectic mix of artists. Something for everyone! I now can tell the difference between Monet and Pissarro for instance!
titleopinion: Well worth a visit. Eclectic mix of artists. Something for everyone! I now can tell the difference between Monet and Pissarro for instance!

reviewnospace: A much smaller and compact visitor experience to this lovely museum/gallery. A few hours were well rewarded with some excellent art works and interesting exhibits
titleopinion: Wonderful eclectic collection. A much smaller and compact visitor experience to this lovely museum/gallery. A few hours were well rewarded with some excellent art works and interesting exhibits

quote: The envy of London, Paris and New York.
reviewnospace: What a coup for Madrid. This wonderful building houses an eclectic collection that includes some really stunning works that span the whole development of 'Western Art' - wonderful to put it all into context.
titleopinion: The envy of London, Paris and New York.. What a coup for Madrid. This wonderful building houses an eclectic collection that includes some really stunning works that span the whole development of 'Western Art' - wonderful to put it all into context.

reviewnospace: This museum is beautifully done, and the collection is excellent. it has a very good collection of impressionist paintings, including some Gaugins and Van Goghs that are atypical and less familiar to art history students. We also enjoyed the North American landscapes and many Pissarro and Sisleys, two of my favorite impressionists. Nice representation of post impressionist and expressionist, Kirschner, Nolde. Also Hopper. Too many to name. A treat for those who enjoy painting from mid 19th century forward.
titleopinion: Great place to experience art. This museum is beautifully done, and the collection is excellent. it has a very good collection of impressionist paintings, including some Gaugins and Van Goghs that are atypical and less familiar to art history students. We also enjoyed the North American landscapes and many Pissarro and Sisleys, two of my favorite impressionists. Nice representation of post impressionist and expressionist, Kirschner, Nolde. Also Hopper. Too many to name. A treat for those who enjoy painting from mid 19th century forward.

reviewnospace: This was the first of the three museum pass that we purchased at the hotel and saved a bunch. It has some paintings and it is in a nice area.
titleopinion: Nice & quick Strole. This was the first of the three museum pass that we purchased at the hotel and saved a bunch. It has some paintings and it is in a nice area.

reviewnospace: Monets, Manets and a beautiful Caravaggio, ( Saint Catherine of Siena ). Plus a very good collection of medieval art. About two hundred paintings but each and every one of them a masterpiece. Very manageable bright and easy.
titleopinion: An absolute must see. Monets, Manets and a beautiful Caravaggio, ( Saint Catherine of Siena ). Plus a very good collection of medieval art. About two hundred paintings but each and every one of them a masterpiece. Very manageable bright and easy.

quote: Fabulous private collection of most known artists
reviewnospace: You can;t believe the vastness is this collection , in my opinion it rivals the Prado. You must realize that this collection was made with private funds and is one of more than one Thyssen museum. We have visited the Thyssen museum in Italy's Lakes Region which though a bit smaller is also spectacular. It is an attraction not to be missed and I feel that for content it is on a par with the Prado. DO NOT MISS IT!!!
titleopinion: Fabulous private collection of most known artists. You can;t believe the vastness is this collection , in my opinion it rivals the Prado. You must realize that this collection was made with private funds and is one of more than one Thyssen museum. We have visited the Thyssen museum in Italy's Lakes Region which though a bit smaller is also spectacular. It is an attraction not to be missed and I feel that for content it is on a par with the Prado. DO NOT MISS IT!!!

reviewnospace: Just an easy walk down Calle Jeronimo from our hotel to the museum. 10 euros per person, a free guide and friendly advice on the best way to view the artworks. On the 2nd floor works by one of my favourite artists - Canaletto and other Italian artists, plus some wonderful 19th century North-American paintings. On the 1st floor Renoir, Monet, van Gogh and more modern artists - Gris, Hopper. Well set out galleries with benches to linger on. On the ground floor in the foyer there was a wonderful sculpture by Rodin and galleries dedicated to 20th century art. We were there fairly early and this paid off because by the time we were ready to go, the queue in the foyer was long. The shop had plenty of colourful things to buy but I resisted this time. There was also a cafe but again we resisted. Will certainly return.
titleopinion: Well worth a visit. Just an easy walk down Calle Jeronimo from our hotel to the museum. 10 euros per person, a free guide and friendly advice on the best way to view the artworks. On the 2nd floor works by one of my favourite artists - Canaletto and other Italian artists, plus some wonderful 19th century North-American paintings. On the 1st floor Renoir, Monet, van Gogh and more modern artists - Gris, Hopper. Well set out galleries with benches to linger on. On the ground floor in the foyer there was a wonderful sculpture by Rodin and galleries dedicated to 20th century art. We were there fairly early and this paid off because by the time we were ready to go, the queue in the foyer was long. The shop had plenty of colourful things to buy but I resisted this time. There was also a cafe but again we resisted. Will certainly return.

reviewnospace: Absolutely amazing collection of art, and all within short walking distance of the Prado. I very much enjoyed a few hours in the museum. You can't miss the Degas and Van Gogh.
titleopinion: Amazing Collection of Famous Artists. Absolutely amazing collection of art, and all within short walking distance of the Prado. I very much enjoyed a few hours in the museum. You can't miss the Degas and Van Gogh.

reviewnospace: Not as well known and therefore mercifully less crowded than the Prado and the Reina Sofia, this museum is nevertheless a truly eclectic little collection of art through the ages. I particularly appreciated the peace and quiet, the very well presented audio guide and the fast & free wi-fi.
titleopinion: Eclectic little gem. Not as well known and therefore mercifully less crowded than the Prado and the Reina Sofia, this museum is nevertheless a truly eclectic little collection of art through the ages. I particularly appreciated the peace and quiet, the very well presented audio guide and the fast & free wi-fi.

reviewnospace: I spent two days in this gem of an art gallery. The two collections are outstanding and the audio accompanying the artworks is very informative without being verbose. This museum would be my first choice of museums in Madrid!
titleopinion: A Must See in Madrid. I spent two days in this gem of an art gallery. The two collections are outstanding and the audio accompanying the artworks is very informative without being verbose. This museum would be my first choice of museums in Madrid!

quote: Another great exhibition at the Thyssen...
reviewnospace: 2nd visit to Madrid and 2nd time to this fantastic museum. This time around we mad a visit to the newly opened exhibit: Vogue: like a painting which has brought together an incredible collection of stunning photographs taken by some of the greatest photographers of our time. If you are in Madrid before 12th October you should stop in. €7 entry per person.
titleopinion: Another great exhibition at the Thyssen.... 2nd visit to Madrid and 2nd time to this fantastic museum. This time around we mad a visit to the newly opened exhibit: Vogue: like a painting which has brought together an incredible collection of stunning photographs taken by some of the greatest photographers of our time. If you are in Madrid before 12th October you should stop in. €7 entry per person.

reviewnospace: I loved the impressionist collection of art to bits, the Vougue like painting exhibition was also impressive. The museum was quiet and it is spacious enough to enjoy it freely
titleopinion: Wonderful. I loved the impressionist collection of art to bits, the Vougue like painting exhibition was also impressive. The museum was quiet and it is spacious enough to enjoy it freely

reviewnospace:
This museum is a delight. Familiar artists , and delightful discoveries. Excellent presentation.
Arrive a little before opening times and the queue is very accessible.
Didn't eat there as in Madrid there are so many choices.
titleopinion: one of Madrids  must sees . This museum is a delight. Familiar artists , and delightful discoveries. Excellent presentation. Arrive a little before opening times and the queue is very accessible. Didn't eat there as in Madrid there are so many choices.

reviewnospace: Not the biggest museum here in Madrid, but it holds its own none the less. Wonderful collection of art. Beautiful building.
titleopinion: Small but mighty. Not the biggest museum here in Madrid, but it holds its own none the less. Wonderful collection of art. Beautiful building.

reviewnospace: Book in advance to avoid the long long queues, nice on site cafe type eatery but you are going to see the numerous masterpieces that really are a must for a visit to Madrid. There is a lovely restaurant down the road towards the botanical gardens for lunch or evening meal. A great place to visit.
titleopinion: A great place to visit. Book in advance to avoid the long long queues, nice on site cafe type eatery but you are going to see the numerous masterpieces that really are a must for a visit to Madrid. There is a lovely restaurant down the road towards the botanical gardens for lunch or evening meal. A great place to visit.

reviewnospace: Amazing collection. Easy gallery to get through in 3 hours. Start on top floor and work your way downstairs. Don't miss it.
titleopinion: 1/2 Day at Thyssen. Amazing collection. Easy gallery to get through in 3 hours. Start on top floor and work your way downstairs. Don't miss it.

reviewnospace: Visit the Prado with all the old masters, then the Reina Sofia with the modern and contemporary masters, then round out your visit at the Thyssen which houses works from the last 700 years (or so?). It really does fill in some gaps from the other two museums. Really shouldn't miss it! I was able to visit on a free day as well, can't believe I got to see what they have in their collection for FREE.
titleopinion: Don't skip this museum!. Visit the Prado with all the old masters, then the Reina Sofia with the modern and contemporary masters, then round out your visit at the Thyssen which houses works from the last 700 years (or so?). It really does fill in some gaps from the other two museums. Really shouldn't miss it! I was able to visit on a free day as well, can't believe I got to see what they have in their collection for FREE.

reviewnospace:
Go on a Monday between 12-4pm, Free to get in.

Some fantastic pictures and the layout works really well.
titleopinion: Quality art. Go on a Monday between 12-4pm, Free to get in.  Some fantastic pictures and the layout works really well.

reviewnospace: I left this museum for last and I almost wish I had gone there first. Quite a great eclectic collection well-organized and laid out.
titleopinion: An art surprise. I left this museum for last and I almost wish I had gone there first. Quite a great eclectic collection well-organized and laid out.

reviewnospace: In addition to visiting the Prado, if you are interested in art, you should go and see the Thyssen-Bornemisza. We didn't have time to see everything-nor the energy (having 'done' the Prado the previous day) but this collection is truly magnificent particularly the Impressionists.
titleopinion: Must do in Madrid. In addition to visiting the Prado, if you are interested in art, you should go and see the Thyssen-Bornemisza. We didn't have time to see everything-nor the energy (having 'done' the Prado the previous day) but this collection is truly magnificent particularly the Impressionists.

reviewnospace: need to pace yourselves as several floors of art works of the highest quality. Far superior to the Prado. Clean facilities and smart cafe with garden space. Not expensive in comparison to London or USA. If had more time would have gone around again another day.
titleopinion: Quality artworks spacious galleries. need to pace yourselves as several floors of art works of the highest quality. Far superior to the Prado. Clean facilities and smart cafe with garden space. Not expensive in comparison to London or USA. If had more time would have gone around again another day.

quote: Directly across the street from the Prado
reviewnospace:
do not try to do the Thyssen Museum on the same day as the Prado. It is just too much to take in in one day. Go to the Prado first to set the stage. It is filled with old masters and old alter pieces. Go to the Thyssen the next day. It is not nearly as crowded. Go all the way to the top floor and follow the arrows (turn right off the elevator). The museum is well curated. The signage is not as in depth as at the Prado, but the collection is extensive and impressive. How did one family amass such an enormous collection? The oldest is an alter piece from 1290 and the newest is a Milton Avery.
There is a lovely cafe in the garden where we sat afterward for some bubbly mineral water and a tortilla Espanola.
titleopinion: Directly across the street from the Prado. do not try to do the Thyssen Museum on the same day as the Prado. It is just too much to take in in one day. Go to the Prado first to set the stage. It is filled with old masters and old alter pieces. Go to the Thyssen the next day. It is not nearly as crowded. Go all the way to the top floor and follow the arrows (turn right off the elevator). The museum is well curated. The signage is not as in depth as at the Prado, but the collection is extensive and impressive. How did one family amass such an enormous collection? The oldest is an alter piece from 1290 and the newest is a Milton Avery. There is a lovely cafe in the garden where we sat afterward for some bubbly mineral water and a tortilla Espanola.

reviewnospace: the Thyssen Museum offers beauty for everyone's eyes to enjoy - It is definitely a place to spend half of your day and get absorbed in the story of each work of art
titleopinion: Worth the stop. the Thyssen Museum offers beauty for everyone's eyes to enjoy - It is definitely a place to spend half of your day and get absorbed in the story of each work of art

reviewnospace: If you're in Madrid on a Monday, there is free entry to the Permanent Collections between 12 and 4. This muesum has a beautiful art collection with a surprising number of paintings of the American West as well as a very nice impressionist collection.
titleopinion: Free on Mondays!. If you're in Madrid on a Monday, there is free entry to the Permanent Collections between 12 and 4. This muesum has a beautiful art collection with a surprising number of paintings of the American West as well as a very nice impressionist collection.

quote: Not that crowded, not that big, get the audioguide!
reviewnospace: Really well curated museum. It takes you thorough many highlights of the history of art. I enjoyed the audioguide, as they explain the period, influences and techniques of the most relevant paintings. If you go now they also have a very interesting VOGUE exhibition.
titleopinion: Not that crowded, not that big, get the audioguide!. Really well curated museum. It takes you thorough many highlights of the history of art. I enjoyed the audioguide, as they explain the period, influences and techniques of the most relevant paintings. If you go now they also have a very interesting VOGUE exhibition.

reviewnospace: A wonderful and amazing private collection, well presented and representing a broad range of Spanish artists.
titleopinion: Extraordinary collection. A wonderful and amazing private collection, well presented and representing a broad range of Spanish artists.

reviewnospace: A great tour through western art. Not too much but a lot of works that you will recognise. Not too crowded on a Friday.
titleopinion: Excellent collection. A great tour through western art. Not too much but a lot of works that you will recognise. Not too crowded on a Friday.

reviewnospace: Madrid has several great museums and this is one of them. We spent about four hours there and could have used more time. Not to be missed if you are in the area.
titleopinion: Great museum.. Madrid has several great museums and this is one of them. We spent about four hours there and could have used more time. Not to be missed if you are in the area.

reviewnospace: Wonderful museum. I found it a little harder to get around than the Prado (although smaller), but still a great collection and worth a visit if you can make it.
titleopinion: Very good museum. Wonderful museum. I found it a little harder to get around than the Prado (although smaller), but still a great collection and worth a visit if you can make it.

reviewnospace: One of the three art galleries you must visit in Madrid. It was undergoing refurbishment when we were there so some parts were closed. We also found the cafe inside the museum excellent..
titleopinion: Wonderful museum. One of the three art galleries you must visit in Madrid. It was undergoing refurbishment when we were there so some parts were closed. We also found the cafe inside the museum excellent..

reviewnospace: Great museum. very glad we went. very different from the Prado (must see!), but you should see this museum as well!
titleopinion: Excellent museum!. Great museum. very glad we went. very different from the Prado (must see!), but you should see this museum as well!

reviewnospace:
Thyssen-Bornemisza museum is a very unique museum. They like to involve every kind of audience in their cultural projects. They showcase art from the 13th century to the late 20th century. They represent anything from Renaissance to the experimental avant-garde movements of the early 20th century. We tried to go there on our first day, but since they closed at 7:00 PM we didn’t have enough time. The second time, it was our last day and we only had two hours to run around and see the magnificent works of art. Had we known how special this museum was, we would have allocated more time. We will never forget this very special museum.

You can see the pictures at :
https://travel4foodnart.wordpress.com/2015/06/28/thyssen-bornemisza-museum/
titleopinion: Amazing range of art. Thyssen-Bornemisza museum is a very unique museum. They like to involve every kind of audience in their cultural projects. They showcase art from the 13th century to the late 20th century. They represent anything from Renaissance to the experimental avant-garde movements of the early 20th century. We tried to go there on our first day, but since they closed at 7:00 PM we didn’t have enough time. The second time, it was our last day and we only had two hours to run around and see the magnificent works of art. Had we known how special this museum was, we would have allocated more time. We will never forget this very special museum.  You can see the pictures at : https://travel4foodnart.wordpress.com/2015/06/28/thyssen-bornemisza-museum/

reviewnospace: Great collection, so plan some spare time to enjoy it whole ;) Was nice to see different impressionsts together with other artworks from earlier and later times..
titleopinion: great collection. Great collection, so plan some spare time to enjoy it whole ;) Was nice to see different impressionsts together with other artworks from earlier and later times..

quote: A highlight of trip to Madrid
reviewnospace: If you like art both Prado and Thyssen are a must. They offer very differently focused collections and complement each other. Thyssen is very strong in Renaissance and up to 19 century art. It is a collection of masterpieces gathered by a connoisseur. The ground floor is 20-century and modern art. It is mainly price-tag art except for a few masterpieces. The ticket is good for the whole day so you can go out for lunch to have a break and then come back. Photography without flash is allowed. Going on a free day is not advisable, huge queue encircling the building and crowds inside.
titleopinion: A highlight of trip to Madrid. If you like art both Prado and Thyssen are a must. They offer very differently focused collections and complement each other. Thyssen is very strong in Renaissance and up to 19 century art. It is a collection of masterpieces gathered by a connoisseur. The ground floor is 20-century and modern art. It is mainly price-tag art except for a few masterpieces. The ticket is good for the whole day so you can go out for lunch to have a break and then come back. Photography without flash is allowed. Going on a free day is not advisable, huge queue encircling the building and crowds inside.

reviewnospace: This museum contains the private collection of the Thyssen-Bornemisza family and may easily be overlooked for those on a short stay in Madrid. That would be unfortunate because the beautifully displayed art represents works from the 13th century through the 1980s. It is in the museum area near the Prado so it is easy to get to.
titleopinion: A gem of a collection. This museum contains the private collection of the Thyssen-Bornemisza family and may easily be overlooked for those on a short stay in Madrid. That would be unfortunate because the beautifully displayed art represents works from the 13th century through the 1980s. It is in the museum area near the Prado so it is easy to get to.

quote: Vast collection of masterpieces and a delicious dining experience
reviewnospace: Three floors of incredible pristine paintings. You can view art from the 1400s to modern American paintings. In every art history book there is the famous portrait by Ghirlandaio of the beautiful women in profile, and then you are looking at her in person. Only 40 or so Caravaggio paintings in the world, they have one, then there are the other great artists--Holbein, Rembrandt, Picasso, Rubens, Titian and on and on. You need a minimum of 3 hours to see this vast collection and then reward yourself with a great lunch in the garden. They also have an upstairs cafe with tapas.
titleopinion: Vast collection of masterpieces and a delicious dining experience. Three floors of incredible pristine paintings. You can view art from the 1400s to modern American paintings. In every art history book there is the famous portrait by Ghirlandaio of the beautiful women in profile, and then you are looking at her in person. Only 40 or so Caravaggio paintings in the world, they have one, then there are the other great artists--Holbein, Rembrandt, Picasso, Rubens, Titian and on and on. You need a minimum of 3 hours to see this vast collection and then reward yourself with a great lunch in the garden. They also have an upstairs cafe with tapas.

reviewnospace:
This incredible museum has old masterband new alike.
Big but not as overwhelming as the unique Prado museum across the avenue.
To think that this was once a private collection is truly remarkable.
titleopinion: Amazing museum. This incredible museum has old masterband new alike. Big but not as overwhelming as the unique Prado museum across the avenue. To think that this was once a private collection is truly remarkable.

reviewnospace: It's a bit "must have one Van Gogh and a Picasso too" but it makes for a delightful whizz through mainly European art. You can take no-flash photos which adds to the interest and it wasn't busy. We particularly liked the more recent paintings, Bonnard, Braque, Nolde, Hopper etc. But there were some superb older ones too, eg by El Greco.
titleopinion: A lovely eclectic collection. It's a bit  must have one Van Gogh and a Picasso too  but it makes for a delightful whizz through mainly European art. You can take no-flash photos which adds to the interest and it wasn't busy. We particularly liked the more recent paintings, Bonnard, Braque, Nolde, Hopper etc. But there were some superb older ones too, eg by El Greco.

reviewnospace: Definitely a good collection. However, personally i think most of the arts are commonly seen in other European museums, and are of mediocre level comparing with some of the best works. I've visited a lots of museums, so I found very few pieces here that wowed me or intrigued me.
titleopinion: Good, but no wow. Definitely a good collection. However, personally i think most of the arts are commonly seen in other European museums, and are of mediocre level comparing with some of the best works. I've visited a lots of museums, so I found very few pieces here that wowed me or intrigued me.

quote: One of the best museum to visit
reviewnospace:
Excellent collections covers at least 500 years painting history up the 20 centry with so many master piece. We spent more than 4 hours there, we would stay there longer if we have more time.

Strongly recommend it
titleopinion: One of the best museum to visit. Excellent collections covers at least 500 years painting history up the 20 centry with so many master piece. We spent more than 4 hours there, we would stay there longer if we have more time.  Strongly recommend it

reviewnospace: This is a truly fantastic museum, and one that most visitors don't make it to. An incredible collection of art over the centuries. Don't miss it, and leave enough time to see everything!
titleopinion: Just staggering. This is a truly fantastic museum, and one that most visitors don't make it to. An incredible collection of art over the centuries. Don't miss it, and leave enough time to see everything!

reviewnospace: Great space. Wide variety from Roy Lichtenstein to Old Masters and religious art. We had been to the Prado earlier and were worried about repetition. But that certainly wasn't the case. Well worth your time.
titleopinion: Wonderful Mix. Great space. Wide variety from Roy Lichtenstein to Old Masters and religious art. We had been to the Prado earlier and were worried about repetition. But that certainly wasn't the case. Well worth your time.

reviewnospace: The Thyssen has a collection of art which is varied and more interesting than that of the Prado. Favour impressionist/post impressionist over the more somber Prado collection of Madonnas, etc. Visited in May during the free hours and we only in line for 5 minutes before entry. It was not overly crowded during this time and 3 hour visit was sufficient for modest art lovers.
titleopinion: ART -. The Thyssen has a collection of art which is varied and more interesting than that of the Prado. Favour impressionist/post impressionist over the more somber Prado collection of Madonnas, etc. Visited in May during the free hours and we only in line for 5 minutes before entry. It was not overly crowded during this time and 3 hour visit was sufficient for modest art lovers.

reviewnospace:
Huge variety of work on display, although there isn’t the volume of the Prado. Many artists are represented by only a couple of pieces, but this has the advantage of allowing the non-expert to view paintings by possibly unfamiliar artists. This could be good preparation for a visit to the Prado for a more detailed study. Clearly it depends on what you see, but I thought this was better value for money than the Prado.
Restaurant quiet, good quality but quite expensive.
titleopinion: Superb. Huge variety of work on display, although there isn’t the volume of the Prado. Many artists are represented by only a couple of pieces, but this has the advantage of allowing the non-expert to view paintings by possibly unfamiliar artists. This could be good preparation for a visit to the Prado for a more detailed study. Clearly it depends on what you see, but I thought this was better value for money than the Prado. Restaurant quiet, good quality but quite expensive.

quote: Lovely museum - visit the bar and cafe!
reviewnospace: The art in the museum is fantastic; the best part was the 10 Picassos which are there this summer. After the galleries we had a coffee at the outdoor cafe, which was a perfect place to people watch while relaxing.
titleopinion: Lovely museum - visit the bar and cafe!. The art in the museum is fantastic; the best part was the 10 Picassos which are there this summer. After the galleries we had a coffee at the outdoor cafe, which was a perfect place to people watch while relaxing.

reviewnospace: This exhibition is amazing and owned by private individuals at one time. The layout of the museum makes it easy to decide which exhibitions or periods to view. There is an amusing installation to allow visitors to dress in historic clothing and pose by an empty picture frame.
titleopinion: Hoard of Old Masters. This exhibition is amazing and owned by private individuals at one time. The layout of the museum makes it easy to decide which exhibitions or periods to view. There is an amusing installation to allow visitors to dress in historic clothing and pose by an empty picture frame.

quote: A great Journey through art history
reviewnospace:
This is a great gallery and we'll worth taking time over.

The presentation takes you on a journey from middle ages to some very modern art. You can see the development of art from religious iconography through realism impressionism post impressionism surrealism and very modern "cartoon" art.

We bought the app.and followed the highlighted works as a great narrative. There is a more complete audio guide in the museum but you can't take it home.

We went quickly and spent only 2 hours 30 mins.

In the bookshop at the end there is a great book about modern art... why your 5 year old could not have produced this... A book in defense of modernism.
titleopinion: A great Journey through art history. This is a great gallery and we'll worth taking time over.   The presentation takes you on a journey from middle ages to some very modern art. You can see the development of art from religious iconography through realism impressionism post impressionism surrealism and very modern  cartoon  art.  We bought the app.and followed the highlighted works as a great narrative. There is a more complete audio guide in the museum but you can't take it home.   We went quickly and spent only 2 hours 30 mins.   In the bookshop at the end there is a great book about modern art... why your 5 year old could not have produced this... A book in defense of modernism.

reviewnospace: Collection was bigger than we thought. Recommend you concentrate on the masterpieces if time is limited. Really nice restaurant with outdoor tables for lunch
titleopinion: masterpieces. Collection was bigger than we thought. Recommend you concentrate on the masterpieces if time is limited. Really nice restaurant with outdoor tables for lunch

reviewnospace:
Go. Amazing personal collection donated to the city of Madrid by Thyssen Family. The collection is so extensive and large that I'd allow an hour or so and I would not miss Tyssen wife's collection of more modern work on the first floor. Blow you mind cool.

Well curated, amazing gift shop, ...

"Minor works by major artists and major works by minor artists" best describes this collection. That's not my phrase though. That is the phrase I lifted from the guide book I was using.

reviewnospace: If the Prado seems overwhelming, try this smaller,charming alternative. It is a stop on the hop on hop off bus and is free for seniors with ID.
titleopinion: A quieter place. If the Prado seems overwhelming, try this smaller,charming alternative. It is a stop on the hop on hop off bus and is free for seniors with ID.

reviewnospace: Nice overwiew of styles of mainly paintings over the past centuries. It is a peraonal collection, so reflects the taste of the Thysaen family.
titleopinion: Nice collection . Nice overwiew of styles of mainly paintings over the past centuries. It is a peraonal collection, so reflects the taste of the Thysaen family.

quote: Best modern art gallery in Madrid, Picassos, Dali, and plenty of new artists I had not ever seen ,
reviewnospace: It was a better gallery full of modernists particularly Dali, about 3 floors of art well spaced and a lovely garden in the middle,It was more interesting than the Prado as there are so many Titians and Ruebens one can look at. One Dutch couple,women come back to the Thysson every year and ride there bikes to it.
titleopinion: Best modern art gallery in Madrid, Picassos, Dali, and plenty of new artists I had not ever seen ,. It was a better gallery full of modernists particularly Dali, about 3 floors of art well spaced and a lovely garden in the middle,It was more interesting than the Prado as there are so many Titians and Ruebens one can look at. reviewnospace: We spent 3-4 hours in this museum and were surprised and delighted to find a fair number of paintings by Americans. Their collection spans a wide variety of eras and nationalities and there were nice touches of whimsy, such as the option to take photos while wearing clothing depicted in a painting.
titleopinion: unexpectedly large and impressive collection. We spent 3-4 hours in this museum and were surprised and delighted to find a fair number of paintings by Americans. Their collection spans a wide variety of eras and nationalities and there were nice touches of whimsy, such as the option to take photos while wearing clothing depicted in a painting.

quote: If you only do one museum in Madrid, do this one
reviewnospace: A museum that never feels overpowering, or boring, or confusing: amazing permanent collection that is perfectly organised and makes you want to come back as soon as you've left.
titleopinion: If you only do one museum in Madrid, do this one. A museum that never feels overpowering, or boring, or confusing: amazing permanent collection that is perfectly organised and makes you want to come back as soon as you've left.

reviewnospace: Visit on a Monday and enter FREE! Shortened hours, though. Whatever day you visit, though, it is WORTH it. A lovely way to visit a Museum. Begin @ the top and work your way down. Their "gothic" works are amazing and a fantastic selection of Impressionists, Post-Impressionists and on. Another "Madrid Must"!
titleopinion: Monday Freebie!. Visit on a Monday and enter FREE! Shortened hours, though. Whatever day you visit, though, it is WORTH it. A lovely way to visit a Museum. Begin @ the top and work your way down. Their  gothic  works are amazing and a fantastic selection of Impressionists, Post-Impressionists and on. Another  Madrid Must !

reviewnospace: it's awesome museum to visit, there are incredible artworks to view and enjoy. You will need time to walk in the museum, I spent a whole afternoon to walk in their galleries.
titleopinion: Great Museum. it's awesome museum to visit, there are incredible artworks to view and enjoy. You will need time to walk in the museum, I spent a whole afternoon to walk in their galleries.

reviewnospace: The better museum because: it has a great impressionist and post-impressionist collection, its laid out in a simple linear walk through design compared to endless dead end rooms at the Prado, its less busy with none of the school parties at the Prado, and you seem to be able to take pictures at the Thyssen but definitely not at the Prado – to my embarrasment.
titleopinion: Thyssen - not Prado. The better museum because: it has a great impressionist and post-impressionist collection, its laid out in a simple linear walk through design compared to endless dead end rooms at the Prado, its less busy with none of the school parties at the Prado, and you seem to be able to take pictures at the Thyssen but definitely not at the Prado – to my embarrasment.

reviewnospace: The 3 big museums are all close to one another so don't miss this one. It is a marvelous collection.
titleopinion: convenient. The 3 big museums are all close to one another so don't miss this one. It is a marvelous collection.

quote: This place gave me goosebumps literally delightful I would do it again. It was beautiful.

reviewnospace: Filled with beloved examples of impressionism, fauvism and modernism this museum is much less overwhelming than the Prada. A perfect way to spend an afternoon, strolling the cool galleries filled with recognizable masters like Caravaggio, Manet, Picasso. A lovely shaded cafe too.
titleopinion: A beautifully curated gem. Filled with beloved examples of impressionism, fauvism and modernism this museum is much less overwhelming than the Prada. A perfect way to spend an afternoon, strolling the cool galleries filled with recognizable masters like Caravaggio, Manet, Picasso. A lovely shaded cafe too.

reviewnospace:
Here is the best art gallery in Madrid (in my humble opinion). It is so well laid out and off a size that you can see it all in one visit.
I in no way want to detract from the Prado but it is too big where as here is more manageable.

quote: The Dufy exhibition was the atraction
reviewnospace:
We visited Madrid as Dufy's paintings are rarely exhibited and so this was a wonderful excuse to spend three days in Madrid.
The gallery was excellent and Dufy was so so great, it was very good to see so many of his paintings.
We would recommend this as a must see!

reviewnospace: This must be one of the most organized art museums in the world. If you follow the audio guide you get a full course in art appreciation. Especially worthwhile for those a little lacking in the art history or art appreciation areas.
