quote: Very nice collections of impressionists and moderns
reviewnospace:
Really liked this museum. very interesting impressionism collection, including 4 Van Gogh paintings spanning different periods and sales, plus a lithograph of The Potato Eaters. Lovely Renoir of a wheat field.

The organization of this museum was excellent and the rooms numbered for easy navigation.

There was a temporary Givenchy exhibit my wife loved.

quote: Very nice museum, less nice personnel
reviewnospace: We really enjoyed this museum, spending about three hours. Many incredible paintings here, including Rubins, Rembrandt, Goya, Greco, The Old Masters, Monet, Renoir, Degas, van Gogh and Munch to name a few. The only negative was that a couple of the museum personnel were disruptive to everyone by yelling at patrons (to embarrass them) for taking pictures or stepping on the guide line of the room perimeter (even in areas of no art). In addition, they were intolerant even when the crowds were so large that stepping around the crowd (tour groups) and barely stepping on the line resulted in a reprimand!
titleopinion: Very nice museum, less nice personnel. We really enjoyed this museum, spending about three hours. Many incredible paintings here, including Rubins, Rembrandt, Goya, Greco, The Old Masters, Monet, Renoir, Degas, van Gogh and Munch to name a few. The only negative was that a couple of the museum personnel were disruptive to everyone by yelling at patrons (to embarrass them) for taking pictures or stepping on the guide line of the room perimeter (even in areas of no art). reviewnospace: This museum is definitely a must see if you visit Madrid. The permanent collection is beautiful and today we enjoyed the temporary collection of the Impressionists. Allow a minimum of 2-1/2 to 3 hours to have an opportunity to see the wonderful paintings, sculptures and even spend some time in the museum store. Although we did not go to the cafeteria this time, we have been there before and it is worth it. A nice place to recharge and rest a bit during your visit. Entrance to the permanent collection is free Mondays from 1200 to 1600; admission to the temporary collections is comparable to others in the city.

reviewnospace: Such an interesting collection. A lovely morning spent enjoying the artwork of the great pop artists of all time. Take the audio tour in your language and move at your pace.

quote: Do not go if you are a dark person
reviewnospace: What I can I say? I did nothing different than any other visitor yet the security at this museum ruined my experience of the art there. First the security guards gathered together and followed me around. Then, when I got fed up and tried to leave through an exit with no special label they acted like they caught me doing something and essentially escorted me out. The exit I went through was apparently an emergency exit although there was nothing to indicate that. Finally, I was able to leave with who knows how many guards trailing me. Very embarrassing and the experience of art I had was greatly destroyed due to these security weirdos.

quote: Maybe the most interesting museum in Madrid
reviewnospace: Thyssen-Bornemisza is not as big as Prado or Reina Sofia but big enough and of great quality,,, you just watch the beautiful and precious paintings and think how a private person could afford to have this kind of paintings … all of a great value, Spanish and international master pieces … This is a must!

Thyssen-Bornemisza is not as big as Prado or Reina Sofia but big enough and of great quality,,, you just watch the beautiful and precious paintings and think how a private person could afford to have this kind of paintings … all of a great value, Spanish and international master pieces … This is a must!

reviewnospace: I had only few hours in Madrid and already I decided to visit Thyssen Bornemiza Museum. It was fast i go to my ticket and since I have two hours i went directly to the second floor. The paintings were wonderful....

reviewnospace: My wife loved this collection, maybe because of the good representation of modern art, something we were able to relate more to, including a special exhibition of Givenchy's. Completed the Golden Triangle of Art after visiting the Prado and the Reina Sofia. Not as overwhelming as the Prado, and more diverse than the Reina Sofia. 2-3 hrs was enough and satisfying.

quote: The museum to visit in Madrid if little time
reviewnospace:
I always recommend friends visiting Madrid to visit this museum. It got the perfect mix of famous painters and only the best paintings. If you only have time to see one museum in Madrid, this is the one.
You get an ALL IN ONE experience.
"The Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum offers visitors an overview of art from the 13th century to the late 20th century. In the nearly one thousand works on display, visitors can contemplate the major periods and pictorial schools of western art such as the Renaissance, Mannerism, the Baroque, Rococo, Romanticism and the art of the 19th and 20th centuries up to Pop Art.

The museum also features works from some movements not represented in state-owned collections, such as Impressionism, Fauvism, German Expressionism and the experimental avant-garde movements of the early 20th century. In addition, it boasts an important collection of 19th-century American painting not found in any other European museum institutions."
titleopinion: The museum to visit in Madrid if little time. I always recommend friends visiting Madrid to visit this museum. It got the perfect mix of famous painters and only the best paintings. If you only have time to see one museum in Madrid, this is the one.  You get an ALL IN ONE experience.  The Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum offers visitors an overview of art from the 13th century to the late 20th century. In the nearly one thousand works on display, visitors can contemplate the major periods and pictorial schools of western art such as the Renaissance, Mannerism, the Baroque, Rococo, Romanticism and the art of the 19th and 20th centuries up to Pop Art.  The museum also features works from some movements not represented in state-owned collections, such as Impressionism, Fauvism, German Expressionism and the experimental avant-garde movements of the early 20th century. In addition, it boasts an important collection of 19th-century American painting not found in any other European museum institutions.

reviewnospace: This museum has a medium-sized and well-rounded art collection worth a 3-4 hour visit and is not as crowded as the Prado.
titleopinion: One of the  Mandatory  Madrid Visits. This museum has a medium-sized and well-rounded art collection worth a 3-4 hour visit and is not as crowded as the Prado.

reviewnospace:
should be visited more than once. Too much to grasp in one round.
Paintings from all over the world and from different time periods.
titleopinion: very interesting and braod collection.. should be visited more than once. Too much to grasp in one round. Paintings from all over the world and from different time periods.

quote: Extraordinary personal collection - a wondrous digest of art history
reviewnospace:
The most pleasant surprise was the collection of American art from the West and the Hudson River School in the context of European masters --- with the Thyssen facing the Prado Madrid is a
treasure palace for enthusiasts of great sculpture and painting --- the temporary exhibitions may
be good or not so good but the Thyssen store is exemplary

quote: They've got a little of everything, but beautiful pieces
reviewnospace: This museum is a treat to see-they have some works from premier artists throughout history-they cover everything in a very pretty space. Don't miss the shop-they are very creative with their products.
titleopinion: They've got a little of everything, but beautiful pieces. This museum is a treat to see-they have some works from premier artists throughout history-they cover everything in a very pretty space. Don't miss the shop-they are very creative with their products.

reviewnospace: Can't say enough about this place. As you travel though churches and museums and palaces in Spain and Italy, you are swamped with pics of the Annunciation, Resurrection, Last Supper, and martyrdom of Saints. This museum is a refreshing change. Sure it includes the aforementioned subject matter, but adds balance by with painting from the 12th through 20th centuries. Just a pleasure to walk through

reviewnospace: An excellent Cubism survey....some real gems. Engaging idiosyncratic collection. Near hysterics to see an Andrew Wyeth portrait in a gilt Baroque frame.
titleopinion: Delightful surprises.. An excellent Cubism survey....some real gems. Engaging idiosyncratic collection. Near hysterics to see an Andrew Wyeth portrait in a gilt Baroque frame.

reviewnospace: We took the advantage of the generous offer of free entry on Monday afternoons to visit this truly excellent art museum. The only reason for my withholding the fifth star was the lack of written information beside the paintings. We had been spoilt by the excellent documentaion offerred by the Prado for each exhibit! Truly a bonus. (Of course audio information was available at the Thyssen if desired.) Nevertheless, I must stress that this visit was full of superlatives. The collection is exquisite, the staff extremely helpful.... and we thoroughly enjoyed four hours of browsing among some of the world's greatest paintings. By the way, the Hop-on, Hop-off bus wil get you there easily - and if you are over 65, the price is a mere 10 Euros for one day or 13 Euros for two days for unlimited hopping!
titleopinion: Excellent day at the Thyssen-Bornemisza. We took the advantage of the generous offer of free entry on Monday afternoons to visit this truly excellent art museum. The only reason for my withholding the fifth star was the lack of written information beside the paintings. We had been spoilt by the excellent documentaion offerred by the Prado for each exhibit! Truly a bonus. (Of course audio information was available at the Thyssen if desired.) Nevertheless, I must stress that this visit was full of superlatives. The collection is exquisite, the staff extremely helpful.... and we thoroughly enjoyed four hours of browsing among some of the world's greatest paintings. By the way, the Hop-on, Hop-off bus wil get you there easily - and if you are over 65, the price is a mere 10 Euros for one day or 13 Euros for two days for unlimited hopping!

reviewnospace: Have been before so we knew what a great museum. But we did not know until our arrival today that Monday is free! We definitely enjoyed our visit as usual.
titleopinion: Go on a Monday!!. Have been before so we knew what a great museum. But we did not know until our arrival today that Monday is free! We definitely enjoyed our visit as usual.

reviewnospace: Ignore all the stuff about this being an eclectic collection and therefore superficial. This is art snobbery. Go in without preconceptions and enjoy the closeness of genius.Manet,Van Gogh,Rembrant Self Portrait.These alone are worth the admission fee.Look at Hopper's hotel Room-mesmerising,Lucien Freud self portrait. I could go on. Maybe I'm alone in disliking cubism. I'm rambling. Great gallery though.Loved it.Went early and avoided crowds.

reviewnospace: Amazing art collected by one family. Slightly disappointed several paintings were on loan out. But well worth a visit.
titleopinion: Great Art Gallery. Amazing art collected by one family. Slightly disappointed several paintings were on loan out. But well worth a visit.

reviewnospace: We had just gotten off the plane but it was close to our hotel (which was not the Ritz) and it was just right for two hours plus a wonderful outdoor cafe lunch! Great easy to find location.
titleopinion: Nice collection and good cafe. We had just gotten off the plane but it was close to our hotel (which was not the Ritz) and it was just right for two hours plus a wonderful outdoor cafe lunch! Great easy to find location.

quote: Eclectic collection, preferred this to the Prado

Religious art is not really my thing but some wonderful French paintings. Preferred this to the Prado.

reviewnospace: A great collection from old masters to contemporary classics. Lots of room so groups don't bother too much. Not open on Monday.
titleopinion: Great collection!. A great collection from old masters to contemporary classics. Lots of room so groups don't bother too much. Not open on Monday.

quote: If you like 19th -20th century art, don't miss this one.
reviewnospace:
Arrived in Madrid on monday and the receptionist told us to visit the museum as it was for free and near the hotel. What a great start to our visit of this amazing city.
Although it is not as big as the Prado, it still has a very large collection of wonderful paintings. We only had two hours so we decided to make a selection. We choose Italian an Spanish painters and the painters of the 19th and 20th century. Loved it. The audioguide is very good, so make sure to get one.

The audioguide is very good, so make sure to get one.

reviewnospace:
Where did the family hang all this art???

The collection is housed in a magnificent edifice which just seems to go on and on…from the Middle Ages to Miro and Kadinsky ! Not to mention the 19th c American art right through to POP…something here for EVERYONE

Was fantastic to view many artists not well known which just enhances this unbelievable collection.

Left feeling very satisfied and envious.
titleopinion: Stunning and VAST collection. Where did the family hang all this art???  The collection is housed in a magnificent edifice which just seems to go on and on…from the Middle Ages to Miro and Kadinsky ! Not to mention the 19th c American art right through to POP…something here for EVERYONE  Was fantastic to view many artists not well known which just enhances this unbelievable collection.  Left feeling very satisfied and envious.

quote: Very good, extensive range on display

titleopinion: Very good, extensive range on display. Liked this more than the Prado as, for me, it covered a wider range of art, into my preferred mid 19th to early 20th century periods. Large, airy museum - and they let you take photos...

reviewnospace: Big gallery but easy to get around and it happened to have some paintings that I really wanted to see, so even better. Really great place to while away 2 or 3 hours. And lots of seating on the way round to sit and have a rest and take in the art work.

reviewnospace: This was a truly joyful experience as this museum was so wonderful. It is full of classic pieces to the modern and has something for everyone. I wish I has had time to go back... Worth its weight in gold...
titleopinion: Joyful. This was a truly joyful experience as this museum was so wonderful. It is full of classic pieces to the modern and has something for everyone. I wish I has had time to go back... Worth its weight in gold...

quote: One of my Favourite Art Collections
reviewnospace:
This is a great museum - You can start on the top floor and work your way down through the entire history of art. The middle floor is clearly the big draw with the Impressionists etc.

In early October this year there were a huge number of paintings on loan elsewhere which was disappointing.

quote: A walk through the whole history of art

titleopinion: A walk through the whole history of art. What a fantastic museum. Well planned, well laid out and a the best paintings of every artist from the 14 th to the 20th Century. Very excellent audio tour and easy to follow

reviewnospace: And great collection. Make this part of your trip. The openess and flow of the museum is very welcoming and the art work is wonderful.
titleopinion: Wonderful space. And great collection. Make this part of your trip. The openess and flow of the museum is very welcoming and the art work is wonderful.

reviewnospace: We really appreciated the scale and diversity of this museum. It's a beautiful complement to the Prado just down the street. We spent several hours here and didn't come close to doing it justice. I believe everyone will find art to like here.

quote: Space is brilliant; art is hit and miss
reviewnospace: While I'm certainly glad I visited, the space in which the industrialist and his wife made the museum is very compelling, the collection itself is fine but not universally so. Read up before you go, and see for yourself.
titleopinion: Space is brilliant; art is hit and miss. While I'm certainly glad I visited, the space in which the industrialist and his wife made the museum is very compelling, the collection itself is fine but not universally so. Read up before you go, and see for yourself.

reviewnospace:
worth a visit
depends on what you like but they have a detailed map and the collection is rather compact especially comparing to that of Prado.

quote: A must see if you are in Madrid
reviewnospace: This museum houses world class art and is free to the public. It is a must see if you are in the Madrid area and are an art lover!
titleopinion: A must see if you are in Madrid. This museum houses world class art and is free to the public. It is a must see if you are in the Madrid area and are an art lover!

quote: A must see museum in Madrid as well

quote: One of the top galleries in Europe
reviewnospace: This gallery puts many to shame and you can even have free entrance on a Monday afternoon. The paintings are well displayed and to gain the most from a visit head straight for the top floor and work down. Besides having many classic gems on displays there are a wonderful selecting of paintings by less well know artists. I was more relaxed and happier with the display here than in the Prado - not to be missed.

quote: Wish it was my Private Collection
reviewnospace: Very enjoyable and easy to navigate. Nice selection of art throughout history with pieces from all the major artists, but not overly redundant or overwhelming. Was my favorite museum in Madrid.
titleopinion: Wish it was my Private Collection. Very enjoyable and easy to navigate. Nice selection of art throughout history with pieces from all the major artists, but not overly redundant or overwhelming. Was my favorite museum in Madrid.

reviewnospace: Start at the second floor and work your way down. A really great collection of masters. The top floor has an amazing collection of old religious icons in superb condition,
titleopinion: Well worth a visit. Start at the second floor and work your way down. A really great collection of masters. The top floor has an amazing collection of old religious icons in superb condition,

reviewnospace: Unlike the Prado down the street which is mostly religious art, this museum has a wide selection of art. I saw impressionists, landscapes, portraits, middle ages, renaissance, modern etc. There are some free admission times, so don't miss it.
titleopinion: Nice selection of varied art. Unlike the Prado down the street which is mostly religious art, this museum has a wide selection of art. I saw impressionists, landscapes, portraits, middle ages, renaissance, modern etc. There are some free admission times, so don't miss it.

reviewnospace: If you only had time to visit one gallery in Madrid ,I would say this is the one. One man's collection from four centuries of the finest western art is beautifully displayed with plenty of space between the pictures. Someone said this collection has minor works by major artists and major works by minor ones , which is probably true but the quality is very high .
titleopinion: Fabulous !. If you only had time to visit one gallery in Madrid ,I would say this is the one. One man's collection from four centuries of the finest western art is beautifully displayed with plenty of space between the pictures. Someone said this collection has minor works by major artists and major works by minor ones , which is probably true but the quality is very high .

reviewnospace: From the Prado, the Thyssen offers Miro, and of course Picasso. Guernica! In all its glory and horror and history. Picassos works speak volumes but this exhibit is Spain in torment. Visit, visit, visit!!!!
titleopinion: Completes the visit. From the Prado, the Thyssen offers Miro, and of course Picasso. Guernica! In all its glory and horror and history. Picassos works speak volumes but this exhibit is Spain in torment. Visit, visit, visit!!!!

reviewnospace: The collections are nicely and systematically organized. If you are short on time I advise you to use the free pamphlet as a check-off list. BUT the paintings shown on the pamphlet are not the only famous paintings. For instance, The Green Dancer by Edgar Degas was part of the exhibition but not on the pamphlet. Also some Picasso paintings are part of the exhibition but not on the pamphlet. Give yourself 2 hours. Due to the popularity of the Prado museum the line may not be too long.
titleopinion: Overshadowed by Prado. The collections are nicely and systematically organized. If you are short on time I advise you to use the free pamphlet as a check-off list. BUT the paintings shown on the pamphlet are not the only famous paintings. For instance, The Green Dancer by Edgar Degas was part of the exhibition but not on the pamphlet. Also some Picasso paintings are part of the exhibition but not on the pamphlet. Give yourself 2 hours. Due to the popularity of the Prado museum the line may not be too long.

quote: Not as great as the Prado but still special
reviewnospace: In many cities this would be the best art gallery and possibly the city’s highlight, but just down the road from the Prado means, for me, it’s neither. I thoroughly enjoyed it though and its free if you go on the Monday. Even going on the free day it was less busy than going to the Prado when you need to pay 14 euros (and not going when that is free in the last two hours of the day). It’s consistency isn’t as high as the Prado, but that means it’s not as hard to visit and you have more time to see the bits you like. It was a disappointment that so many of the impressionist work was out on loan though. I found the 4 hours its open on the Monday, just about enough time there, and I didn’t even bother with the modern stuff on the ground floor.
titleopinion: Not as great as the Prado but still special. In many cities this would be the best art gallery and possibly the city’s highlight, but just down the road from the Prado means, for me, it’s neither. I thoroughly enjoyed it though and its free if you go on the Monday. Even going on the free day it was less busy than going to the Prado when you need to pay 14 euros (and not going when that is free in the last two hours of the day). It’s consistency isn’t as high as the Prado, but that means it’s not as hard to visit and you have more time to see the bits you like. It was a disappointment that so many of the impressionist work was out on loan though. I found the 4 hours its open on the Monday, just about enough time there, and I didn’t even bother with the modern stuff on the ground floor.

reviewnospace: It has a great collection that gives timeline continuity to the superb Prado museum collection, specially in 19th-20th century French painting.
titleopinion: Beautiful museum. It has a great collection that gives timeline continuity to the superb Prado museum collection, specially in 19th-20th century French painting.

quote: Not to be missed in Madrid
reviewnospace:
When in Madrid the Prado must visited ....BUT...this museum is the one which should not be missed.

An outstanding collection which is beautifully displayed in a most interesting building.
titleopinion: Not to be missed in Madrid. When in Madrid the Prado must visited ....BUT...this museum is the one which should not be missed.  An outstanding collection which is beautifully displayed in a most interesting building.

quote: A Collection and (Compared to the Prado) a Manageable Size
reviewnospace:
The Thyssen Museum is relatively recent, established in 1992 from the private collection for which the museum is named. At the time the collection went up for sale, there was a bidding war between the Getty Museum in Los Angeles, CA, USA and the Spanish government which the Spaniards won. It is a wonderfully chosen collection of painting from the 13th century to the present. It's scope does not dilute its quality.

It has a particularly good collection of Dutch and Flemish painting, including Breughel, Van Eyck, Van Ruysdael, Steen and even one Vermeer. I was also surprised how many American paintings it had, including Gilbert Stuart's portrait of George Washington's cook! There were some Peales and Copleys, quite a few Bierstadt landscapes, Russel (who in this collection I saw as an impressionist rather than just a Western painter). There was even a painting by George Catlin of the Falls of St. Anthony as they existed before the founding of my home city, Minneapolis, Minnesota!

The collection also does a good job of including the 19th and 20th century. It includes works by many of the famous artists that are rather different than what we are used to. One gem is Picasso's painting of the Harlequin. Or there is also a relatively realistic engraving by Van Gogh.

The museum fills three floors of galleries and it is a lot but we had a good look in about 2 1/2 hours. Admission is €10.
titleopinion: A Collection and (Compared to the Prado) a Manageable Size. The Thyssen Museum is relatively recent, established in 1992 from the private collection for which the museum is named. At the time the collection went up for sale, there was a bidding war between the Getty Museum in Los Angeles, CA, USA and the Spanish government which the Spaniards won. It is a wonderfully chosen collection of painting from the 13th century to the present. It's scope does not dilute its quality.   It has a particularly good collection of Dutch and Flemish painting, including Breughel, Van Eyck, Van Ruysdael, Steen and even one Vermeer. I was also surprised how many American paintings it had, including Gilbert Stuart's portrait of George Washington's cook! There were some Peales and Copleys, quite a few Bierstadt landscapes, Russel (who in this collection I saw as an impressionist rather than just a Western painter). There was even a painting by George Catlin of the Falls of St. Anthony as they existed before the founding of my home city, Minneapolis, Minnesota!  The collection also does a good job of including the 19th and 20th century. It includes works by many of the famous artists that are rather different than what we are used to. One gem is Picasso's painting of the Harlequin. Or there is also a relatively realistic engraving by Van Gogh.   The museum fills three floors of galleries and it is a lot but we had a good look in about 2 1/2 hours. Admission is €10.

reviewnospace: this is a mixed collection, no artist specialised, but a view of art through the ages. Start on the top floor in the middle ages and end up on the ground floor in 21st century. Fascinating.
titleopinion: A comprehensive view of art. this is a mixed collection, no artist specialised, but a view of art through the ages. Start on the top floor in the middle ages and end up on the ground floor in 21st century. Fascinating.

reviewnospace: Handy to the Prado, this has what the Prado doesnt. All the best in more modern works as well as old.
titleopinion: Wonderful. Handy to the Prado, this has what the Prado doesnt. All the best in more modern works as well as old.

quote: Going in the evening is very civilised
reviewnospace: Loved it. Was a relaxed and friendly place where photos no flash were allowed. Their collections are of such high quality and interest we could have gone a few times!
titleopinion: Going in the evening is very civilised. Loved it. Was a relaxed and friendly place where photos no flash were allowed. Their collections are of such high quality and interest we could have gone a few times!

reviewnospace: I loved all the sculpture and paintings. I wish we had more time to see it all. The art of Madrid is so wonderful and there is never enough time.
titleopinion: Grand. I loved all the sculpture and paintings. I wish we had more time to see it all. The art of Madrid is so wonderful and there is never enough time.

reviewnospace: If you like classical art and don't understand modern art like me (lol) you prefer this museum than Reina Sofia. There are various works of art, from different periods, include Salvador Dali famous tigers. Also, on Mondays the entry is free!

reviewnospace: We enjoy seeing Impressionist paintings and this museum does not disappoint. It is well laid out and easy to access. Its quite different from the Prado which gives it a good contrast in museum styles.
titleopinion: Excellent museum. We enjoy seeing Impressionist paintings and this museum does not disappoint. It is well laid out and easy to access. Its quite different from the Prado which gives it a good contrast in museum styles.

quote: Very elegant well displayed and good staff
reviewnospace: Great collection of paintings very well laid out and spacious. Staff friendly and efficient. Thought the cafe was on the expensive side although in a nice setting
titleopinion: Very elegant well displayed and good staff. Great collection of paintings very well laid out and spacious. Staff friendly and efficient. Thought the cafe was on the expensive side although in a nice setting

quote: The way art should be displayed
reviewnospace: I love Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza. First, they allow photography (just don't use flash). Then, maybe because it is not as "popular" as the Prado, it isn't crowded. Third, the paintings are well-spaced, and arranged. i feel very relaxed when I walk from one room to the other; it is how one should feel when appreciating art. Lastly, there is a variety in the collection (modernism, impressionist, and even religious art in one museum vs. 90% religious-themed art in The Prado).
titleopinion: The way art should be displayed. I love Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza. First, they allow photography (just don't use flash). Then, maybe because it is not as  popular  as the Prado, it isn't crowded. Third, the paintings are well-spaced, and arranged. i feel very relaxed when I walk from one room to the other; it is how one should feel when appreciating art. Lastly, there is a variety in the collection (modernism, impressionist, and even religious art in one museum vs. 90% religious-themed art in The Prado).

quote: not the Prado, but still outstanding
reviewnospace: This art museum has a superb collection and offers a pleasant visit. The Prado, in my view, is a chore: hard work, wobbly legs and a brain that turns to mush unless you limit what you see. Thyssen offers great art without all the work.

reviewnospace: This is the Madrid version of New York's Frick. Small, intimate, beautifully hung and manageable. And don't miss the gift shop. It's full of great little stuff that's pricey but unique. The Thyssen is just across the plaza from the Prado, so you can do both in a day. Well worth the visit. Oh, and the cafe is darling. Food is excellent.
titleopinion: Perfect little museum. This is the Madrid version of New York's Frick. Small, intimate, beautifully hung and manageable. And don't miss the gift shop. It's full of great little stuff that's pricey but unique. The Thyssen is just across the plaza from the Prado, so you can do both in a day. Well worth the visit. Oh, and the cafe is darling. Food is excellent.

reviewnospace: great collection of paintings and art works from gothic times to modern. The oldies pieces are on the tpo,moderm in the ground floor.I prefer the modern art and this collection is...unforgetable. You ll find there all well known names presented with excellent works.
titleopinion: great. great collection of paintings and art works from gothic times to modern. The oldies pieces are on the tpo,moderm in the ground floor.I prefer the modern art and this collection is...unforgetable. You ll find there all well known names presented with excellent works.

quote: Must SEE...one of the greatest collections in the world..

reviewnospace: Near the Prado Museum, this art museum has a nice collection of impressionists and medieval and pre medieval art .There you can also see a collection of modern art and enjoy a nice coffee in the coffee shop of the museum. On Mondays, from 12 noon to 4 pm the entrance is free.

Near the Prado Museum, this art museum has a nice collection of impressionists and medieval and pre medieval art .There you can also see a collection of modern art and enjoy a nice coffee in the coffee shop of the museum. On Mondays, from 12 noon to 4 pm the entrance is free.

quote: Enjoyable museum with outstanding art collection
reviewnospace:
I really enjoyed the Thyssen. It's so well organized and easy to walk around and find what you want to see. I headed up to the 2nd floor and went straight to the Impressionists and finished with the modern art on the 1st floor.
The entire museum is a history of about 700 years of European art!
titleopinion: Enjoyable museum with outstanding art collection. I really enjoyed the Thyssen. It's so well organized and easy to walk around and find what you want to see. I headed up to the 2nd floor and went straight to the Impressionists and finished with the modern art on the 1st floor.  The entire museum is a history of about 700 years of European art!

quote: As much as MUST as the Prado museum
reviewnospace:
A personal travel through the ages of art from early middle ages to today.
One problem: descriptions of paintings are written in red, on transparent displays, which are on orange painted wall. Difficult to read - a MUST to change writing to bacl, from red.
So, take good glasses, if you want to read.
Use an audio guide, good descriptions of the key paintings.
titleopinion: As much as MUST as the Prado museum. A personal travel through the ages of art from early middle ages to today. reviewnospace: This is brilliantly set out in chronological order so that you follow the development of art from about the 15th century. The only problem for me was that I particularly wanted to see the modern art, and by the time I got to that section, my brain was suffering from art overload. A bit of selectivity was called for!
titleopinion: Wonderful trip through art history. This is brilliantly set out in chronological order so that you follow the development of art from about the 15th century. The only problem for me was that I particularly wanted to see the modern art, and by the time I got to that section, my brain was suffering from art overload. A bit of selectivity was called for!

quote: Newer museum (1992) but do make sure you visit the Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza!
reviewnospace: In contrast to Del Prado, the paintings in this museum were mostly owned privately until they were donated to Spain in 1993. The works include everything from American artists like Gilbert Stuart, Edward Hopper and Andrew Wyeth to the Impressionists, as well as some modern artists. In the process of tracing the history of western art, the collection actually started with Italians from the 13th century. Although I appreciate the importance of Renaissance art, I am partial to the Impressionists and was delighted to find so many here in Madrid!
titleopinion: Newer museum (1992) but do make sure you visit the Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza!. In contrast to Del Prado, the paintings in this museum were mostly owned privately until they were donated to Spain in 1993. The works include everything from American artists like Gilbert Stuart, Edward Hopper and Andrew Wyeth to the Impressionists, as well as some modern artists. In the process of tracing the history of western art, the collection actually started with Italians from the 13th century. Although I appreciate the importance of Renaissance art, I am partial to the Impressionists and was delighted to find so many here in Madrid!

reviewnospace: We did this Museum on a Monday afternoon, luckily from 1400 to 1600 it's free entry. There are lots of exhibits that are well lit and not too overpowering. Nice cafe outside too
titleopinion: Not too heavy. We did this Museum on a Monday afternoon, luckily from 1400 to 1600 it's free entry. There are lots of exhibits that are well lit and not too overpowering. Nice cafe outside too

reviewnospace: The Thyssen is an interesting mix of old and new, many artists you've heard of and many you haven't. I'd also recomment the adjoining restaurant where we had a decent lunch in nice surroundings.
titleopinion: Worth a Visit. The Thyssen is an interesting mix of old and new, many artists you've heard of and many you haven't. I'd also recomment the adjoining restaurant where we had a decent lunch in nice surroundings.

quote: Large collection fills in the gaps
reviewnospace: The collection of paintings in the Thyssen Bornemisza museum is spread over two floors with the top floor mostly presenting paintings from the same era that is covered in the Prado (though usually of slightly lesser quality, not counting notable exceptions like stunning works by Van Eyck, El Greco or Carravagio, etc). The lower floor fills in the blanks between what is covered in the Prado and in the Centro de Arte Reina Sofía with a vast collection of paintings from the 18th and 19th century. If you like to visit musea you can easily spend a day here. Point of attention: you probably need the audio guide as there are no explanations other than the name of the work and its executioner next to the paintings.
titleopinion: Large collection fills in the gaps. The collection of paintings in the Thyssen Bornemisza museum is spread over two floors with the top floor mostly presenting paintings from the same era that is covered in the Prado (though usually of slightly lesser quality, not counting notable exceptions like stunning works by Van Eyck, El Greco or Carravagio, etc). The lower floor fills in the blanks between what is covered in the Prado and in the Centro de Arte Reina Sofía with a vast collection of paintings from the 18th and 19th century. titleopinion: 4.5 hours here today. Amazing museum and a brief history of art from antiquity to modern art. Many masterpieces and the presentation is impeccable. A must-see for the museum crowd.

reviewnospace: This museum has a good selection of modern and classical art. While not the Prado, it is worth visiting.
titleopinion: a nice selection of art. This museum has a good selection of modern and classical art. While not the Prado, it is worth visiting.

reviewnospace: This is an incredible museum that lives in the shadow of the Prada. Very nicely done with a wide variety of painting, including many modern classics. Give it a full day. And be sure to visit the cafe--a bit over-priced by a delight.
titleopinion: Go. This is an incredible museum that lives in the shadow of the Prada. Very nicely done with a wide variety of painting, including many modern classics. Give it a full day. And be sure to visit the cafe--a bit over-priced by a delight.

reviewnospace: Hard to believe that two indiduals could have brought together so many wonderful paintings - and what a range! Two visits on two separate days were not enough to do justice to this museum's collections.
titleopinion: Amazing!. Hard to believe that two indiduals could have brought together so many wonderful paintings - and what a range! Two visits on two separate days were not enough to do justice to this museum's collections.

quote: So much better than the Prado
reviewnospace:
OK so I'll be upfront and say I'm not a fan of the style of painting that's exhibited in the Prado. To me you see one room you've seen them all.

So my opinion is skip the Prado and go here. The most amazing eclectic collection that is really well laid out and where every room has something that just stops you in your tracks. There are some old masters but in the next room there might be a Van Gogh or a Cezanne or a Turner.
titleopinion: So much better than the Prado. OK so I'll be upfront and say I'm not a fan of the style of painting that's exhibited in the Prado. To me you see one room you've seen them all. There are some old masters but in the next room there might be a Van Gogh or a Cezanne or a Turner.

quote: If the Prado is too busy...
reviewnospace:
We visited the Thyssen Museum on a Saturday morning, after seeing the queues for the Prado even at 10am...the Thyssen was still quiet at that time and we viewed the Alma-Tadema temporary exhibit and the permanent modern art on the ground floor before the visitor numbers built up too much. Eventually, it became crowded and we beat a retreat to the cafe. The ordering system here is a queer one, with calling buttons on each table. However, this was so slow most people went up to the counter anyway...

All-in-all, a great experience for some quiet art viewing.
titleopinion: If the Prado is too busy.... Eventually, it became crowded and we beat a retreat to the cafe. The ordering system here is a queer one, with calling buttons on each table. However, this was so slow most people went up to the counter anyway...  All-in-all, a great experience for some quiet art viewing.

reviewnospace: This musemum was a pleasant surprise, with a large and very diverse collection of art - paintings and other media. The rooms were large enough that the collection was not crowded. There was also a decent cafe.
titleopinion: Competition of the Prado?. This musemum was a pleasant surprise, with a large and very diverse collection of art - paintings and other media. The rooms were large enough that the collection was not crowded. There was also a decent cafe.

reviewnospace: Good collection of old masters right up to the Impressionist and post-Impressionist including Cezanne, van Gogh, Rubens, Rembrandt to mention a few. Second to the Prada. WOrth the visit if you have the time.

reviewnospace:
Dond miss it,
An explendid colection of art, its like the update after the visit to the Del Prado museum
titleopinion: For art lovers. Dond miss it, An explendid colection of art, its like the update after the visit to the Del Prado museum

reviewnospace: There is no description, so renting the audio is almost a must, unless you buy a guide book from the bookstore. The museum is well organized and includes works from many different periods. It is free from on Monday from noon to 4 pm.
titleopinion: Rent the audio guide. There is no description, so renting the audio is almost a must, unless you buy a guide book from the bookstore. The museum is well organized and includes works from many different periods. It is free from on Monday from noon to 4 pm.

reviewnospace:
Well organized art, beautifully presented.
Great collection in a magnificent building. Go there and enjoy a wonderful coffee on their terrace.
titleopinion: better than the Prado. Well organized art, beautifully presented. Great collection in a magnificent building. Go there and enjoy a wonderful coffee on their terrace.

reviewnospace: This has to be one of the best art galleries in the world. The quality of the collection is unsurpassed. Try and go on Monday's after noon when it's free to enter!
titleopinion: We never tire of visiting. This has to be one of the best art galleries in the world. The quality of the collection is unsurpassed. Try and go on Monday's after noon when it's free to enter!

reviewnospace: We visited this museum using the "Paseo del Arte pass" which also provides entrance to the Prado and Museo Reina Sofía. This was our favourite of the three great art museums, with a splendid, eclectic collection of art. Its amazing to think that this was once a privately owned collection. A must see museum on a visit to Madrid.
titleopinion: Fabulous collection. We visited this museum using the  Paseo del Arte pass  which also provides entrance to the Prado and Museo Reina Sofía. This was our favourite of the three great art museums, with a splendid, eclectic collection of art. Its amazing to think that this was once a privately owned collection. A must see museum on a visit to Madrid.

reviewnospace: Everyone who goes to Madrid knows about the Prado, and it is certainly something that should not be missed. But the Thyssen isn't quite as well know, and that's a shame. It's a wonderful museum, smaller than the Prado so it's easier to see everything. The art work is beautifully presented, and there is a abundance of modern art which is not as common in other museums like the Prado or the Louvre. After strolling through the museum, we stopped in the cafe for lunch - one of the best meals we had in Madrid! The salads are huge - we could have split one. I would strongly recommend that you add this to your list of things to do in Madrid.
titleopinion: Don't Miss This. Everyone who goes to Madrid knows about the Prado, and it is certainly something that should not be missed. But the Thyssen isn't quite as well know, and that's a shame. It's a wonderful museum, smaller than the Prado so it's easier to see everything. The art work is beautifully presented, and there is a abundance of modern art which is not as common in other museums like the Prado or the Louvre. After strolling through the museum, we stopped in the cafe for lunch - one of the best meals we had in Madrid! The salads are huge - we could have split one. I would strongly recommend that you add this to your list of things to do in Madrid.

reviewnospace:
It's a really outstanding private art collection, with much impressionist and modern art.

It is located just across the Prado museum.
titleopinion: Outstanding art museum. It's a really outstanding private art collection, with much impressionist and modern art.  It is located just across the Prado museum.

reviewnospace: So much to see, so give yourself time to take it all in. The shop is a great place to buy really lovely things.
titleopinion: Wonderful gallery. So much to see, so give yourself time to take it all in. The shop is a great place to buy really lovely things.

reviewnospace: If classic art is your thing, then have a coffee and a sandwich after the Prado, cross the street and indulge! Its temporary exhibits are also superb but usually require booking in advance.

reviewnospace: A really consistent and understandable representation of art from the 15th century to 20th century with a dimension achievable in one visit. On a visit to Madrid this Museum should be the #1 priority.
titleopinion: Just Fabulous. A really consistent and understandable representation of art from the 15th century to 20th century with a dimension achievable in one visit. On a visit to Madrid this Museum should be the #1 priority.

reviewnospace: Who would have guessed that one of the most extensive collection of contemporary American art is in a Spanish museum?
titleopinion: Excellent American Art. Who would have guessed that one of the most extensive collection of contemporary American art is in a Spanish museum?

quote: Lucky we caught the Alma Tadema temporary exhibition
reviewnospace: We left the Thyssen museum until our last full day in Madrid but fortunately we checked what was on before we went so we made an earlier trip so we could see the temporary exhibition of Sir Lawrence Alma Tadema's work (along with some other pre-Raphaelites including Waterhouse, Hughes and Burne-Jones. These alone would have been worth the very reasonable 13.5o Euro entry fee in my view, but there is a real feast of other work in the Thyssen and there really is a huge diversity on offer; Hopper, Dali, Lichtenstein, Picasso, Rubens, Lautrec, Monet, Matisse, Munch, the list goes on and on. Don't take my word for it, go yourself and spend many happy hours!
titleopinion: Lucky we caught the Alma Tadema temporary exhibition. These alone would have been worth the very reasonable 13.5o Euro entry fee in my view, but there is a real feast of other work in the Thyssen and there really is a huge diversity on offer; Hopper, Dali, Lichtenstein, Picasso, Rubens, Lautrec, Monet, Matisse, Munch, the list goes on and on. Don't take my word for it, go yourself and spend many happy hours!

reviewnospace: I know of no museum in the world consisting of a private collection that is so overwelming. Like the Prado, it takes several days to visit in order to digest its entire wealth.
titleopinion: Fabulous. I know of no museum in the world consisting of a private collection that is so overwelming. Like the Prado, it takes several days to visit in order to digest its entire wealth.

reviewnospace: I spent one whole rainy day at this museum and enjoyed every minute of it. The collection is rather huge and unique and the way in which the exhibits are organized is very user-friendly. Elaborate explanations and plenty of benches to sit on and take a break. A definite must! I would definitely prefer it to the Prado.

reviewnospace: very large collection of paintings throughout the whole world from 16th century till nowadays. take electronic guide, you will learn and understand more. It is a must-to-go museum in Madrid

reviewnospace: Many famous paintings and artists works to see. You can spend hours in there. I havbe never seen a Van Gough painbing, now I have. It is free on Mondays.

reviewnospace:
In the heart of Madrid. Beautiful, interesting, easily accesible,
You'll enjoy and learn from its offerings. Truly a most if you admire art. Take time to enjoy the experience.

reviewnospace: This museum was a complete surprise. It has the expected Spanish masters: El Greco, Goya, Picasso and Dali. It had the Italians: Raphael, Titian, Piazzetta; the French: Degas, Monet, Renoir, Gauguin, Lautrec; Dutch: Rembrandt, Van Gogh, Vermeer, van Eyck. But the surprise was massive collection of American artists: O'Keeffe, Homer, Hooper, Pollack, Lichtenstein and many others. There was also and extensive collection of German expressionists. With 1,600 works it would be hard to find a more extensive private collection.
titleopinion: Suprisingly Diverse. This museum was a complete surprise. It has the expected Spanish masters: El Greco, Goya, Picasso and Dali. It had the Italians: Raphael, Titian, Piazzetta; the French: Degas, Monet, Renoir, Gauguin, Lautrec; Dutch: Rembrandt, Van Gogh, Vermeer, van Eyck. But the surprise was massive collection of American artists: O'Keeffe, Homer, Hooper, Pollack, Lichtenstein and many others. There was also and extensive collection of German expressionists. With 1,600 works it would be hard to find a more extensive private collection.

reviewnospace:
The gallery is free from 1-4 on a Monday so it makes sense to go then.
The gallery is well laid out and has a very good content, would recommend.

reviewnospace: Whereas the Prado is crowded and usually has a long line, this museum is less visited and does not have long waits. Hailed as the finest private collection belonging to an individual after that of the Queen of England and purchased by the Spanish government for a huge sum, the quality of this collection is virtually the equal of most of the top 10 art museums in the world. A very worthwhile visit. To see it all takes a whole day.

reviewnospace:
Ok yes that's a massive call but I'll stand by it as I went to both in the same day...
The museum is smaller, yet with the audio guide I spent much more time there than Prado, and could've spent longer if I wasn't hankering for some Tapas!
The mix was interesting, probably lots of pre and post Impressionism, which actually appeals to me.
So for those with similar aesthetics, get the audio guide and wander through, just be sure to have a meal before hand!

quote: A nice collection worth a visit
reviewnospace: I had a quick visit during free hours on a Monday. It's a nice collection, spanning many periods. Also a well organized space over three floors. Worth a visit if you like art
titleopinion: A nice collection worth a visit. I had a quick visit during free hours on a Monday. It's a nice collection, spanning many periods. Also a well organized space over three floors. Worth a visit if you like art

quote: A Walk Through the History of Art
reviewnospace: What a pleasant place this museum is. For the art connoisseur maybe the Prado is the pinnacle but for us this was a more pleasant three hours. From the 14th to the 20th century there were works of all ages and styles. Maybe some of the best work from past masters are not there but Titian, Rubens, Murillo, Raphael, Picasso, Gaugin, Monet, Kadinsky, are all represented just to name a few. And a Carravaggio which was for me the highlight. Reasonable price, courteous staff, easy and logical layout, good visitor facilities, this gallery was our favourite in Madrid.
titleopinion: A Walk Through the History of Art. What a pleasant place this museum is. For the art connoisseur maybe the Prado is the pinnacle but for us this was a more pleasant three hours. From the 14th to the 20th century there were works of all ages and styles. Maybe some of the best work from past masters are not there but Titian, Rubens, Murillo, Raphael, Picasso, Gaugin, Monet, Kadinsky, are all represented just to name a few. And a Carravaggio which was for me the highlight. Reasonable price, courteous staff, easy and logical layout, good visitor facilities, this gallery was our favourite in Madrid.

reviewnospace:
I have to say that my first impression was what a fabulous collection, but as we went round there was a problem in that the labels with the exhibits didn't give you any information or context. We had the audio devices, but these only gave info on a minority of the items. Further you got into the museum the ore items, especially 20th C were out on loan to other museums.

We had also bought a Madrid Card which was supposed to get us in to all the museums and art galleries, but were ttold that it didn't get us in to the temporary exhibitions at the Thyssen, so be warned.

All this said I don't think there is a better collection in Europe, if they had all been here!!!!

We had also bought a Madrid Card which was supposed to get us in to all the museums and art galleries, but were ttold that it didn't get us in to the temporary exhibitions at the Thyssen, so be warned.  All this said I don't think there is a better collection in Europe, if they had all been here!!!!

reviewnospace: So many beautiful pieces, plan to spend an entire day enjoying them. When you're too tired to appreciate the beauty, stop in the outdoor cafe for a coffee and a nibble. Its a beautiful spot to refuel and relax before heading back inside for more masterpieces.

quote: Fine arts of a private collection
reviewnospace: Different of the Prado Museum, this small Museum has its own qualities: many impressionists and modernists (cubisms). The collection is selective and has not a must-to-see master pieces as Guernica (Reina Sofia) or Goya & Velazquez (Prado). Deserve a visit if you are near to Paseo Prado and have already visited Retiro Park and Prado Museum.

quote: If you had to choose between the 2....
reviewnospace:
Between Prado and this one, I'd go here.

Smaller, easier to navigate, and a more interesting mix of some more modern and non-old world pieces also.

Personal favourites were the Gaugins and Edward Hoppers.

And I am new convert to always paying a a bit more and getting the audio guide. You get so much more value and understanding.

And I am new convert to always paying a a bit more and getting the audio guide. You get so much more value and understanding.

reviewnospace: We were surprised at the size of the collection and range of paintings. The viewing starts at the top floor and paintings are grouped in chronological order. Allow yourself a long time to enjoy as much as possible.
titleopinion: What range. We were surprised at the size of the collection and range of paintings. The viewing starts at the top floor and paintings are grouped in chronological order. Allow yourself a long time to enjoy as much as possible.

quote: PopArt Myths and good collection of 20th century art
reviewnospace:
We saw quite good quality exhibition for PopArt myths at Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, but most of the pieces have been travelling around so that the same art has already been available for every average PopArt fan.
After the exhibition we made the mistake to order two small cups of coffee (Cafe Solo) at the Museum cafeteria. The coffee was not as good as you get in any normal cafeteria in Madrid, but the price was 3-4 times more expensive... Waste of money.
The permanent collection was more attractive than the PopArt myths, and we get carried away when we realised that we really can take photoes for every piece of art.

reviewnospace: An excellent collection of modern masters - monet, degas, van gogh, Dali and old ones - el greco, Riberia etc
titleopinion: Excellent collection. An excellent collection of modern masters - monet, degas, van gogh, Dali and old ones - el greco, Riberia etc

reviewnospace:
"basically minor works by major artists" but "complements the Prado where it is weak-such as Impressionism" - Rick Steve

Museum actually has two collections: the Permanent Collection and the Coleccion Carmen Thyssen-Bornemisza.

We went on the Paseo del Arte combo-ticket and spent about 4 hours including a stop for lunch in the museum café. Museum was not crowded since we did not go on "free" Monday.

In the Permanent Collection, my favorites were Room 29 to 48 on Levels 0,1 and 2- 19th & 20th century paintings- Impressionism/ Post-Impressionism, Cubism,Surrealism. Very interesting works and pictures are allowed.

Levels 1and 2 also house the Coleccion Carmen Rooms H through P which also covers the 19th & 20th century paintings- Impressionism/ Post-Impressionism, Cubism, Surrealism.

An enjoyable visit followed by a stroll through the Parque del Buen Retiro.

Worth your time if you appreciate art ....even better if you love art or are a student of art.

We went on the Paseo del Arte combo-ticket and spent about 4 hours including a stop for lunch in the museum café. Museum was not crowded since we did not go on  free  Monday.  In the Permanent Collection, my favorites were Room 29 to 48 on Levels 0,1 and 2- 19th & 20th century paintings- Impressionism/ Post-Impressionism, Cubism,Surrealism. Very interesting works and pictures are allowed.  Levels 1and 2 also house the Coleccion Carmen Rooms H through P which also covers the 19th & 20th century paintings- Impressionism/ Post-Impressionism, Cubism, Surrealism.   An enjoyable visit followed by a stroll through the Parque del Buen Retiro.  Worth your time if you appreciate art ....even better if you love art or are a student of art.
