quote: In the shadow of the Prado, but well worth it
reviewnospace: This facility houses a great collection of masterpiece artwork. A must visit on your trip to Madrid. Plan to spend most of the day. The second floor exhibit of old world masters is truly spectacular. Make time for the temporary exhibit.
titleopinion: In the shadow of the Prado, but well worth it. This facility houses a great collection of masterpiece artwork. A must visit on your trip to Madrid. Plan to spend most of the day. The second floor exhibit of old world masters is truly spectacular. Make time for the temporary exhibit.

reviewnospace: We went to the Prado to see the Old Masters but we liked the paintings in here more. The restaurant was excellent with waitress service. Lovely and airy and air conditioned. Would recommend.
titleopinion: Best for Impressionists.. We went to the Prado to see the Old Masters but we liked the paintings in here more. The restaurant was excellent with waitress service. Lovely and airy and air conditioned. Would recommend.

reviewnospace: This is art history in a collection, spoiled only by the attached coffee shop, very poor presentation of a very ordinary sandwich, this is only surpassed by the head waiter who treats customers like dirt on his shoe.
titleopinion: What a collection. This is art history in a collection, spoiled only by the attached coffee shop, very poor presentation of a very ordinary sandwich, this is only surpassed by the head waiter who treats customers like dirt on his shoe.

quote: A top notch art museum with what the Prado lacks
reviewnospace:
Lots of 19th-20th century works. Also, early 1900's with some American artists. Good representation of impressionists.

We went on a Monday and it's only open from noon - 4:00, but it was free.

You can spend 1-2 hrs here.
titleopinion: A top notch art museum with what the Prado lacks. Lots of 19th-20th century works. Also, early 1900's with some American artists. Good representation of impressionists.  We went on a Monday and it's only open from noon - 4:00, but it was free.  You can spend 1-2 hrs here.

reviewnospace: The collection from the last 200 years is remarkable in its breadth and depth including American artists at times as well as European. You can certainly trace the progress of art. Anyone who is going who owns a tablet should download the museum's notes on their paintings. They are incredible and enrich the experience. It is impossible to do justice to this collection in one day. Their thematic tours help you pick and choose. And BTW, they have a great cafe outside.
titleopinion: Should Be Much Better Known. The collection from the last 200 years is remarkable in its breadth and depth including American artists at times as well as European. You can certainly trace the progress of art. Anyone who is going who owns a tablet should download the museum's notes on their paintings. They are incredible and enrich the experience. It is impossible to do justice to this collection in one day. Their thematic tours help you pick and choose. And BTW, they have a great cafe outside.

quote: This is what money could buy...
reviewnospace: The permanent collection was impressive in scope and diversity. The flow of the galleries and progression of the paintings arranged chronologically were quite nicely done. I was slightly perturbed by the unvarying terracotta orange coloured walls, but that could be just a personal preference quirk. Some of the artworks were not the most stellar representation of the artist's oeuvres. I guess they were acquired because of the name, not necessarily because they were 'good'. However, it did show progression of the artist's style and maturity. Definitely worth a visit.
titleopinion: This is what money could buy.... The permanent collection was impressive in scope and diversity. The flow of the galleries and progression of the paintings arranged chronologically were quite nicely done. I was slightly perturbed by the unvarying terracotta orange coloured walls, but that could be just a personal preference quirk. Some of the artworks were not the most stellar representation of the artist's oeuvres. I guess they were acquired because of the name, not necessarily because they were 'good'. However, it did show progression of the artist's style and maturity. Definitely worth a visit.

reviewnospace: Many works Impressionists and Expressionist, as well as representatives of the classical school of painting. Very interesting. I recommend to necessarily visit in Madrid.
titleopinion: good collection. Many works Impressionists and Expressionist, as well as representatives of the classical school of painting. Very interesting. I recommend to necessarily visit in Madrid.

quote: A huge collection of modern and impressionist works
reviewnospace: The museum visit to Madrid should be composed of a visit to the Prado, and a visit to the Thyssen-Bornemisza. Each museum complements the other, the Prado with its historic and masterpiece works, and the T-B with the works that follow through the modern schools of art, from impressionist to modern and contemporary. Our visit included a viewing of the temporal "pop" art of 20th century artists like Warhol and Pollock.
titleopinion: A huge collection of modern and impressionist works. The museum visit to Madrid should be composed of a visit to the Prado, and a visit to the Thyssen-Bornemisza. Each museum complements the other, the Prado with its historic and masterpiece works, and the T-B with the works that follow through the modern schools of art, from impressionist to modern and contemporary. Our visit included a viewing of the temporal  pop  art of 20th century artists like Warhol and Pollock.

quote: One of the best collections in one place I have seen
reviewnospace:
Very impressive - take your time. A fantastic mix of artists, styles, and eras. I cannot believe it was a private collection, incredible.

The visiting show of pop art was enjoyable but was crowded and the space was a little stuffy. The audio guide for the show was good but seemed to drag on a bit with each work and would discuss other works in the same room making it difficult to follow.
titleopinion: One of the best collections in one place I have seen. Very impressive - take your time. A fantastic mix of artists, styles, and eras. I cannot believe it was a private collection, incredible.   The visiting show of pop art was enjoyable but was crowded and the space was a little stuffy. The audio guide for the show was good but seemed to drag on a bit with each work and would discuss other works in the same room making it difficult to follow.

reviewnospace: Everyone flocks to the Prado but it would be such a shame to miss this museum. Particularly enjoyed the collection of Carmen Thyssen - wife of Baron. Great collection of post-impressionists, expressionists and much more besides.
titleopinion: Don't miss this one. Everyone flocks to the Prado but it would be such a shame to miss this museum. Particularly enjoyed the collection of Carmen Thyssen - wife of Baron. Great collection of post-impressionists, expressionists and much more besides.

quote: Very interesting collection, definitely worth a visit
reviewnospace: One of the museums to visit while in Madrid if you like your art. Most definitely recommended for it's more modern collection. We've managed to complete in 3-4 hours. Also, the terrace bar/restaurant is excellent to finish off the day and contemplate all the artwork your've just seen accompanied by good food and some drinks.
titleopinion: Very interesting collection, definitely worth a visit. One of the museums to visit while in Madrid if you like your art. Most definitely recommended for it's more modern collection. We've managed to complete in 3-4 hours. Also, the terrace bar/restaurant is excellent to finish off the day and contemplate all the artwork your've just seen accompanied by good food and some drinks.

reviewnospace: There is a lovely exhibition of Victorian soft porn based around the work of Alma Tadema. It's very exotic and quite charming and completely inoffensive
titleopinion: Alma Tadema temporary exhibition. There is a lovely exhibition of Victorian soft porn based around the work of Alma Tadema. It's very exotic and quite charming and completely inoffensive

reviewnospace: We enjoyed visiting this museum as part of a combination ticket but it is not as impressive as the Prado or Reina Sofia. I think we were spoilt as we visited these first! But well worth a visit.
titleopinion: Well worth a visit. We enjoyed visiting this museum as part of a combination ticket but it is not as impressive as the Prado or Reina Sofia. I think we were spoilt as we visited these first! But well worth a visit.

reviewnospace: Take time to view the 2 collections separately. Start the permanent collection on the 2nd floor and work down to the bottom. Take a break and get a drink or a reasonably priced lunch at the Cafe-Restuarant before ascending to the top again to view the Coleccion Carmen Thyssen-Bornemisza. Both collections ar perfectly arranged in chronological order. Worthy of several visits if you are in Madrid long enough.
titleopinion: A lesson in arrangement. Take time to view the 2 collections separately. Start the permanent collection on the 2nd floor and work down to the bottom. Take a break and get a drink or a reasonably priced lunch at the Cafe-Restuarant before ascending to the top again to view the Coleccion Carmen Thyssen-Bornemisza. Both collections ar perfectly arranged in chronological order. Worthy of several visits if you are in Madrid long enough.

reviewnospace: We were very disappointed by the temporary exhibition of pre-Raphaelite painting - very few paintings merited any attention. (We did not visit the pop-art show.) However, as always the permanent collection was outstanding. I have visited it at least four times now and every time see something I'd missed before. There do seem to be n awful lot of paintings on loan/in use elsewhere though just now.
titleopinion: Stick to the permanent collection. We were very disappointed by the temporary exhibition of pre-Raphaelite painting - very few paintings merited any attention. (We did not visit the pop-art show.) However, as always the permanent collection was outstanding. I have visited it at least four times now and every time see something I'd missed before. There do seem to be n awful lot of paintings on loan/in use elsewhere though just now.

reviewnospace: A great museum-and the amazing part is that this collection was once a private(!) collection of the donors.
titleopinion: Great!. A great museum-and the amazing part is that this collection was once a private(!) collection of the donors.

reviewnospace: A spectacular collection of impressionist paintings. We returned a second time to take in all of the exhibits. The Madrid Card covers entry.
titleopinion: Impressionist gem!. A spectacular collection of impressionist paintings. We returned a second time to take in all of the exhibits. The Madrid Card covers entry.

reviewnospace: A well stocked art museum that you must visit if you have some time in Madrid where you will find one of the finest collections of art donated by the Varonessa for the spanish people.
titleopinion: Excellent art collection !!!. A well stocked art museum that you must visit if you have some time in Madrid where you will find one of the finest collections of art donated by the Varonessa for the spanish people.

quote: One of my favourite museums in Madrid
reviewnospace:
Beautiful collection of pieces and not boring at all.
You don't need hours to see it but you can take your time to view the whole collection
titleopinion: One of my favourite museums in Madrid. Beautiful collection of pieces and not boring at all. You don't need hours to see it but you can take your time to view the whole collection

reviewnospace: I like Victorian paintings as well as Renoir, Monet, Van Gough etc. this place is very nice and less boring..
titleopinion: My favorite museum. I like Victorian paintings as well as Renoir, Monet, Van Gough etc. this place is very nice and less boring..

reviewnospace: Loved this place. Nothing more to say about that - it's so fantastic. Give yourself plenty of time here. Probably not for young kids.
titleopinion: Wow. Loved this place. Nothing more to say about that - it's so fantastic. Give yourself plenty of time here. Probably not for young kids.

reviewnospace: Nice museum, but very big, so go after eating any snack, because you might stay there for some hours :)
titleopinion: Nice Museum. Nice museum, but very big, so go after eating any snack, because you might stay there for some hours :)

reviewnospace: The second best museum. A great variaty of paints, and a very good colection ok impressionism. The temporary also used to be good when i was there
titleopinion: best museum. The second best museum. A great variaty of paints, and a very good colection ok impressionism. The temporary also used to be good when i was there

quote: One of the best foreign art collections I have seen...
reviewnospace: A great collection of pieces of art put together in a logical way... the exhibition was complete, profound and satisfying. Picasso, Dali, Warhol, Lichtenstein... The museum is very well organized and it even offers free entrance every Monday afternoon. Great experience!
titleopinion: One of the best foreign art collections I have seen.... A great collection of pieces of art put together in a logical way... the exhibition was complete, profound and satisfying. Picasso, Dali, Warhol, Lichtenstein... The museum is very well organized and it even offers free entrance every Monday afternoon. Great experience!

reviewnospace: I was lucky and on the day I went I got in free due to a national offer. This no doubt a great collection but I wasn't overly impressed with the layout. Quite a few pictures were away on loan and although I saw some great works of art, there was no real 'wow!' I can cross it off my bucket list but won't be very likely to make a return visit.
titleopinion: Some Great Art. I was lucky and on the day I went I got in free due to a national offer. This no doubt a great collection but I wasn't overly impressed with the layout. Quite a few pictures were away on loan and although I saw some great works of art, there was no real 'wow!' I can cross it off my bucket list but won't be very likely to make a return visit.

reviewnospace:
I know that's saying a lot, with the Prado just across the street and the Reina Sofia a short walk away, but it's got around 7 exhibitions a year and a not-to-shabby permanent collection.
Definitely worth visiting.
titleopinion: My favorite Madrid museum. I know that's saying a lot, with the Prado just across the street and the Reina Sofia a short walk away, but it's got around 7 exhibitions a year and a not-to-shabby permanent collection.  Definitely worth visiting.

reviewnospace: We picked this over the Prado due to time restrictions as it listed more of the artists I particularly wanted to see. Fanastic museum, paintings are well spaced out so easy to get round and see - we went on a Wednesday morning - although there were quite a lot of people, the space and size meant it never felt crowded. As it's a smaller gallery, we thought we'd be in a much shorter time but ended up staying for over 3 hours. Would highly recommend.
titleopinion: Very impressive collection. We picked this over the Prado due to time restrictions as it listed more of the artists I particularly wanted to see. Fanastic museum, paintings are well spaced out so easy to get round and see - we went on a Wednesday morning - although there were quite a lot of people, the space and size meant it never felt crowded. As it's a smaller gallery, we thought we'd be in a much shorter time but ended up staying for over 3 hours. Would highly recommend.

reviewnospace:
Amazing collection of interwar art (20th century) as well as superb Reneissance portrait gallery. Besides, it is accessible for free on Mondays (from 12 to 4 pm; which is more or less enough time to explore this museum).
Really nice museum shop with many good books as well. I would recommend it to everyone (except maybe families with young kids).
titleopinion: amazing well presented collection. Amazing collection of interwar art (20th century) as well as superb Reneissance portrait gallery. Besides, it is accessible for free on Mondays (from 12 to 4 pm; which is more or less enough time to explore this museum).  Really nice museum shop with many good books as well. I would recommend it to everyone (except maybe families with young kids).

reviewnospace:
Pro tip: from 12:00 to 16:00 every Monday the main collection is free!

Check out the Pop art exhibition which ends on Sept 14th 2014. Great collection of Wahrols and Lichtensteins!
titleopinion: Free on Mondays!. Pro tip: from 12:00 to 16:00 every Monday the main collection is free!  Check out the Pop art exhibition which ends on Sept 14th 2014. Great collection of Wahrols and Lichtensteins!

reviewnospace: Very modern place with a lot of well presented art. Take an opportunity and rent the "Audio quide" makes the visit so much more undertandable and memorable.
titleopinion: Must to see. Very modern place with a lot of well presented art. Take an opportunity and rent the  Audio quide  makes the visit so much more undertandable and memorable.

quote: Every time we enjoy this museum
reviewnospace: Check what are the temporary collection, it varies and you could be surprised of the quality of it. The permanet collection is amazing. We had gone to the Thyssen everytime we are at Madrid and never regret it
titleopinion: Every time we enjoy this museum. Check what are the temporary collection, it varies and you could be surprised of the quality of it. The permanet collection is amazing. We had gone to the Thyssen everytime we are at Madrid and never regret it

reviewnospace: This lovely gallery has painting from the 15th Century onwards so something for everyone. Free on a Monday afternoon
titleopinion: Fantastic Free Attraction. This lovely gallery has painting from the 15th Century onwards so something for everyone. Free on a Monday afternoon

reviewnospace: I've been impressed by the richness of the Museum's collections. I enjoyed it more than Prado, you can find a small compendium of Art's History. Shouldn't be missed.
titleopinion: Really impressive. I've been impressed by the richness of the Museum's collections. I enjoyed it more than Prado, you can find a small compendium of Art's History. Shouldn't be missed.

reviewnospace:
Magnificent collection of works of art.
I also recommend a visit to some other day, take the map and see the first major works.
As a curiosity you can see a painting of Henry VIII and near there is a painting of Catherine organization, his first wife
titleopinion: Amazing Museum. Magnificent collection of works of art. I also recommend a visit to some other day, take the map and see the first major works. As a curiosity you can see a painting of Henry VIII and near there is a painting of Catherine organization, his first wife

reviewnospace:
Very nice temporary exhibition pop art myths with Andy Warholl, Roy Lichtenstein, Richard Hamilton ...
You need one hour for the exhibition. The audioguide is excellent too.
Nice terrace al well!
titleopinion: Pop art exhibition. Very nice temporary exhibition pop art myths with Andy Warholl, Roy Lichtenstein, Richard Hamilton ...  You need one hour for the exhibition. The audioguide is excellent too.  Nice terrace al well!

reviewnospace: Although art experts may not like this museum very much, ordinary people who enjoy looking at art works will enjoy it. I always get an audio guide whenever I visit museums, and what is great about the one at the Thyssen-Bornemisza is that the hall is explained. There is an overview of the works that are collected in that particular room. I found the explanation about Flemish and Italian/Spanish Renaissance painting very informative.
titleopinion: Another good thing. Although art experts may not like this museum very much, ordinary people who enjoy looking at art works will enjoy it. I always get an audio guide whenever I visit museums, and what is great about the one at the Thyssen-Bornemisza is that the hall is explained. There is an overview of the works that are collected in that particular room. I found the explanation about Flemish and Italian/Spanish Renaissance painting very informative.

reviewnospace:
The earlier religious paintings.

Make certain you do not miss this fine art museum comfortably located near the Prado Museum. If you are planning on visiting both museums in a day, forget about it. Take two days and have a nice meal in both Museums.
titleopinion: Thyssen Bornemiza. The earlier religious paintings.  Make certain you do not miss this fine art museum comfortably located near the Prado Museum. If you are planning on visiting both museums in a day, forget about it. Take two days and have a nice meal in both Museums.

reviewnospace: The arts are very nicely arranged. I'm into cubism and surrealism, and I enjoyed the museum's collection very much. There are several very good Kandinsky pieces. Museum is free on Monday afternoons (1-4). Plan to spend 2-3 hours to enjoy the museum at a good and comfortable pace. The hotel cafeteria is good and reasonably priced. The Tapas bar's got good sandwich choices. The head waiter is very friendly.
titleopinion: Great modern art collection. The arts are very nicely arranged. I'm into cubism and surrealism, and I enjoyed the museum's collection very much. There are several very good Kandinsky pieces. Museum is free on Monday afternoons (1-4). Plan to spend 2-3 hours to enjoy the museum at a good and comfortable pace. The hotel cafeteria is good and reasonably priced. The Tapas bar's got good sandwich choices. The head waiter is very friendly.

reviewnospace:
It's not without its faults but Thyssen is a great museum with a broad range of art within their permanent collection. The flow does a good job of showing the progress of art over the centuries, something that helps connect the dots for a non expert like myself. On your visit to Madrid, I'd recommend visiting Thyssen first and then going to Prado, the art you've seen at Thyssen will provide a good context for the pieces at Prado and help you appreciate them more.

There are quite a few major works out on loan from the Thyssen.

There were quite a few pieces out on loan, including some masterpieces. We did not get an audio guide but there aren't many explanations in English so I might recommend it. Some reviewers complain about staff being on their phones. They are, we aren't nearly as bothered as some people are.
titleopinion: Visit before Prado. It's not without its faults but Thyssen is a great museum with a broad range of art within their permanent collection. The flow does a good job of showing the progress of art over the centuries, something that helps connect the dots for a non expert like myself. On your visit to Madrid, I'd recommend visiting Thyssen first and then going to Prado, the art you've seen at Thyssen will provide a good context for the pieces at Prado and help you appreciate them more.   There are quite a few major works out on loan from the Thyssen.   There were quite a few pieces out on loan, including some masterpieces. We did not get an audio guide but there aren't many explanations in English so I might recommend it. Some reviewers complain about staff being on their phones. They are, we aren't nearly as bothered as some people are.

quote: Very good collection with a broad historical scope
reviewnospace: Great collection spanning sveral centuries. A good selection of 20th century pieces. Very educational.
titleopinion: Very good collection with a broad historical scope. Great collection spanning sveral centuries. A good selection of 20th century pieces. Very educational.

reviewnospace: There was a special exhibition of paintings by Cezanne that was particularly good although the descriptions were somewhat pretentious. In the main gallery there was a lot of post mid nineteenth century paintings to enjoy. I particularly enjoyed a couple of Hoppers.
titleopinion: Great Gallery. There was a special exhibition of paintings by Cezanne that was particularly good although the descriptions were somewhat pretentious. In the main gallery there was a lot of post mid nineteenth century paintings to enjoy. I particularly enjoyed a couple of Hoppers.

reviewnospace: This an alternative art museum to Prada. One part is 19th/20th century paintings. Then you can visit the Pop Art section. Worth a visit
titleopinion: Quaint Museum. This an alternative art museum to Prada. One part is 19th/20th century paintings. Then you can visit the Pop Art section. Worth a visit

reviewnospace: We visited here as part of our three gallery tour. Our guide Teresa was an exceptional font of knowledge about the pieces of art, the art techniques, the Thyseen family and related matters.
titleopinion: Great exhibits. We visited here as part of our three gallery tour. Our guide Teresa was an exceptional font of knowledge about the pieces of art, the art techniques, the Thyseen family and related matters.

quote: Great mix of new plus old..
reviewnospace: There was a Pop exhibit going on now so I got to see some cool American stuff plus the old classic stuff I really came for. Great Victorian pieces on the lower level as well.
titleopinion: Great mix of new plus old... There was a Pop exhibit going on now so I got to see some cool American stuff plus the old classic stuff I really came for. Great Victorian pieces on the lower level as well.

reviewnospace:
Collections are outstanding, and it is never crowded. Don't miss it.
Accross the street from the Prado, need around 3 hours to visit it.
titleopinion: Don't miss this museum. Collections are outstanding, and it is never crowded. Don't miss it. Accross the street from the Prado, need around 3 hours to visit it.

quote: Best Explanation of the History of Art Ever!
reviewnospace:
Organised in such a way that you can see how art developed over the centuries, with plenty of examples by artists you've heard about. Full of famous artwork, both from Spain and around the world. Do get an audio guide.
Their exhibition on El Greco's influence up to Bacon was a little over egged I felt, but interesting all the same.
This, for me, was the best art gallery ever.
titleopinion: Best Explanation of the History of Art Ever!. Organised in such a way that you can see how art developed over the centuries, with plenty of examples by artists you've heard about. Full of famous artwork, both from Spain and around the world. Do get an audio guide. Their exhibition on El Greco's influence up to Bacon was a little over egged I felt, but interesting all the same. This, for me, was the best art gallery ever.

reviewnospace: Fantastic collection including artists that you won't find in El Prado (much better than some National Museums' collection, like the Rijksmuseum). Withing walking distance of the most important museum in the country (El Prado), you will find a surprisingly good collection, especially considering it is privately owned. A must in your cultural visit to Madrid,
titleopinion: Second best, but also superb. Fantastic collection including artists that you won't find in El Prado (much better than some National Museums' collection, like the Rijksmuseum). Withing walking distance of the most important museum in the country (El Prado), you will find a surprisingly good collection, especially considering it is privately owned. A must in your cultural visit to Madrid,

reviewnospace: We were told to take the lift to the top floor and view the art working our way down to the ground floor. Actually the top floors have alot of art similar to the Prado, which we'd ust spent a few hours walking around. In the Thyssen the more modern stuff is on the ground floor and by the time we got to it we were a little tired. Anyway it was a worthwhile visit.
titleopinion: Start on the ground floor. We were told to take the lift to the top floor and view the art working our way down to the ground floor. Actually the top floors have alot of art similar to the Prado, which we'd ust spent a few hours walking around. In the Thyssen the more modern stuff is on the ground floor and by the time we got to it we were a little tired. Anyway it was a worthwhile visit.

reviewnospace: This is a must see. They have wunderfull paintings off great artists. Very big museum so take your time or choose a part of the museum. Look at the site of the museum if they have a period where you don't pay entrance fee
titleopinion: Beautiful art. This is a must see. They have wunderfull paintings off great artists. Very big museum so take your time or choose a part of the museum. Look at the site of the museum if they have a period where you don't pay entrance fee

reviewnospace: I was under the impression that this museum was small - WRONG! Over 1000 works of art displayed inside span the 13th - 20th Centuries. Monet, Renoir, Caravaggio, Rubens, Dali, Kandinsky, Hopper, Degas, Van Gogh, Rembrandt, Picasso, and many more! The museum opened in 1992 and is primarily from a collection of the Thyssen-Bornemisza collection. Near the Prado, but if you are an art lover, don't try to see both in one day, it's too much. Their restaurant is nice for a relaxing break from viewing and the gift shop is excellent. They do allow photos, so bring your camera.
titleopinion: Not small at all!. I was under the impression that this museum was small - WRONG! Over 1000 works of art displayed inside span the 13th - 20th Centuries. Monet, Renoir, Caravaggio, Rubens, Dali, Kandinsky, Hopper, Degas, Van Gogh, Rembrandt, Picasso, and many more! The museum opened in 1992 and is primarily from a collection of the Thyssen-Bornemisza collection. Near the Prado, but if you are an art lover, don't try to see both in one day, it's too much. Their restaurant is nice for a relaxing break from viewing and the gift shop is excellent. They do allow photos, so bring your camera.

reviewnospace: 3 museums in 3 days in a group of 4 with 2 teenagers including one very reluctant. There is only so much that Coca-cola and great food can do but this museum which happened to be our 3rd of 3 delivered the best Pop Art as a visiting exhibition did help. Strangely this museum had the MOST INCOMPETANT staff of any in our 3 weeks in Spain. They made us pay again for the audio guide even though we had Pre-payed. Then they gave us only the Collections guide even though we had also booked the Pop exhibition. Then 2 out of the 4 audio guides failed in the first 10 mins - and we were the first group in at 10am. Sorting all this out. Took around 40 mins. Not great. Do these museums really want people to pre-book? I compare our experiences in Spain with previous years in Paris and London and Spain is some way behind in terms of visitor management and tourist engagement at the big museums. This is a real shame as the tourist office staff are excellent and the actual underlying quality of the collections is spectacular.
titleopinion: Pick this one first. 3 museums in 3 days in a group of 4 with 2 teenagers including one very reluctant. There is only so much that Coca-cola and great food can do but this museum which happened to be our 3rd of 3 delivered the best Pop Art as a visiting exhibition did help. Strangely this museum had the MOST INCOMPETANT staff of any in our 3 weeks in Spain. They made us pay again for the audio guide even though we had Pre-payed. Then they gave us only the Collections guide even though we had also booked the Pop exhibition. Then 2 out of the 4 audio guides failed in the first 10 mins - and we were the first group in at 10am. Sorting all this out. Took around 40 mins. Not great. Do these museums really want people to pre-book? I compare our experiences in Spain with previous years in Paris and London and Spain is some way behind in terms of visitor management and tourist engagement at the big museums. This is a real shame as the tourist office staff are excellent and the actual underlying quality of the collections is spectacular.

reviewnospace: Beautiful building, big and spacious and comfortable display. It has a fantastic collection of impressionists. Easy to get to and free on Mondays 1200 to 2:00.
titleopinion: Great collection. Beautiful building, big and spacious and comfortable display. It has a fantastic collection of impressionists. Easy to get to and free on Mondays 1200 to 2:00.

reviewnospace: Great little gallery. As a private collection made public it's very much a trip through the ages so there should be something for everyone here. We did a fairly quick visit, a little over an hour, as my partner isn't a huge fan of galleries. This was enough time to see all of the permanent collection, spending a little longer on the pictures we preferred. I note that you can by a combined ticket for the Thyssen-Bornemisza, the Prado and the Reina Sofia, which for 25E seems like a pretty good deal to me. If you've only time, or inclination, to visit one gallery in Madrid then this is a good bet as the Prado is HUGE in comparison.
titleopinion: Lovely little gallery. Great little gallery. As a private collection made public it's very much a trip through the ages so there should be something for everyone here. We did a fairly quick visit, a little over an hour, as my partner isn't a huge fan of galleries. This was enough time to see all of the permanent collection, spending a little longer on the pictures we preferred. I note that you can by a combined ticket for the Thyssen-Bornemisza, the Prado and the Reina Sofia, which for 25E seems like a pretty good deal to me. If you've only time, or inclination, to visit one gallery in Madrid then this is a good bet as the Prado is HUGE in comparison.

quote: I enjoyed this more than the Prado
reviewnospace: I gave the Prado 5 stars because it is absolutely beautiful and is filled with amazing art, but in my opinion, this museum is better. This is really just based on personal taste because the Thyssen museum has a lot of different pieces, whereas the Prado had a lot of art influenced by Catholicism and works by Goya (though I am by no means an art connoisseur!) We took our time walking through the museum and managed to get through it in 2 hours. The museum has a great flow to it with each room leading to each other so you're not backtracking too often to see any pieces you may have missed. A lot of great masterpieces and some fascinating contemporary pieces. We went around 11 in the morning on a Thursday and it wasn't busy at all. By the time we left, crowds were coming in. Cannot compare it to the Reina Sofia as we did not go there, but I can tell you that it's a must see!
titleopinion: I enjoyed this more than the Prado. I gave the Prado 5 stars because it is absolutely beautiful and is filled with amazing art, but in my opinion, this museum is better. This is really just based on personal taste because the Thyssen museum has a lot of different pieces, whereas the Prado had a lot of art influenced by Catholicism and works by Goya (though I am by no means an art connoisseur!) We took our time walking through the museum and managed to get through it in 2 hours. The museum has a great flow to it with each room leading to each other so you're not backtracking too often to see any pieces you may have missed. A lot of great masterpieces and some fascinating contemporary pieces. We went around 11 in the morning on a Thursday and it wasn't busy at all. By the time we left, crowds were coming in. Cannot compare it to the Reina Sofia as we did not go there, but I can tell you that it's a must see!

reviewnospace: We visited this museum twice as once did not do it justice, The collection is incredibly rich and diverse, ranging from Rembrandt to Van Gough, Renoir, Miro, Kandinsky, Dali, and Picasso. I loved this museum, it was far better than the Reina Sofia and the Prado. To top it off we visited the POP art exhibition which included a lot of Andy Warhol - not what I expected to see in Madrid, it was great! Also, visit the roof terrace at the museum for a cool drink after the exhibit, the drinks are a bit pricy and the service a bit slow but the atmosphere is wonderful.
titleopinion: Simply the best!. We visited this museum twice as once did not do it justice, The collection is incredibly rich and diverse, ranging from Rembrandt to Van Gough, Renoir, Miro, Kandinsky, Dali, and Picasso. I loved this museum, it was far better than the Reina Sofia and the Prado. To top it off we visited the POP art exhibition which included a lot of Andy Warhol - not what I expected to see in Madrid, it was great! Also, visit the roof terrace at the museum for a cool drink after the exhibit, the drinks are a bit pricy and the service a bit slow but the atmosphere is wonderful.

reviewnospace:
A wonderful art journey!
The collection is very rich, you will see masterpieces and discover less mainstream painters and works.
The exposition is structured very well, it is not as tiring as in the Prado and it is more enjoyable than Reina Sofia.
The audio-guides provide good explanation and there is wifi throughout the museum so you can search for more details on the spot if you want to.
Give it time for a thorough visit, it will be worth!
titleopinion: Most enjoyable museum in Madrid!. A wonderful art journey!  The collection is very rich, you will see masterpieces and discover less mainstream painters and works.  The exposition is structured very well, it is not as tiring as in the Prado and it is more enjoyable than Reina Sofia.  The audio-guides provide good explanation and there is wifi throughout the museum so you can search for more details on the spot if you want to. Give it time for a thorough visit, it will be worth!

quote: A wonderful journey through the historical development of western art!
reviewnospace: I have learnt so much from this Museum! Make sure you begin your visit on the second floor so that you can trace the development of western art chronologically from the pre-Renaissance period to the present!
titleopinion: A wonderful journey through the historical development of western art!. I have learnt so much from this Museum! Make sure you begin your visit on the second floor so that you can trace the development of western art chronologically from the pre-Renaissance period to the present!

reviewnospace: Excelent museum. The collection is very impressive and correctly showed. II do not recomend to go in a rush. It is good to save, at least, 3 hours to explore it carefully .The collection is full of masterpieces from the renaissance to XX Century. If you have time to visit only two museums in Madrid, pick Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza.
titleopinion: Wonderful Collection. Excelent museum. The collection is very impressive and correctly showed. II do not recomend to go in a rush. It is good to save, at least, 3 hours to explore it carefully .The collection is full of masterpieces from the renaissance to XX Century. If you have time to visit only two museums in Madrid, pick Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza.

quote: Worth visiting if you like art
reviewnospace:
If you like Art you will like this place (and get the pass for all the art museums). We only saw the permanent exhibition on the top floor as it was quite expensive to see all the temporary ones too. It was suitable for my wife, who is a wheelchair user, all floors had a lift and steps can be avoided. Disabled people get a slight discount (other museums are free), The paintings did get a bit samy after a while.
Worth visiting
titleopinion: Worth visiting if you like art. If you like Art you will like this place (and get the pass for all the art museums). We only saw the permanent exhibition on the top floor as it was quite expensive to see all the temporary ones too. It was suitable for my wife, who is a wheelchair user, all floors had a lift and steps can be avoided. Disabled people get a slight discount (other museums are free), The paintings did get a bit samy after a while. Worth visiting

reviewnospace: I know the Prado gets all the attention, but we enjoyed this museum much more. The artwork was more interesting and varied and it was laid out better. It would be easy to miss this museum, but a shame. Truly spectacular art in a wonderful setting.
titleopinion: Best Art Museum in Madrid. I know the Prado gets all the attention, but we enjoyed this museum much more. The artwork was more interesting and varied and it was laid out better. It would be easy to miss this museum, but a shame. Truly spectacular art in a wonderful setting.

reviewnospace: I visited this museum some 15 years ago, the experience burned in my memory and there was no chance I would miss this opportunity on my second trip to Madrid. I took notes of artists that really grabbed my attention and will research these particular artists. The quality of artwork on display ensures this museum remains one of the leading European art museums.
titleopinion: Not to be missed. I visited this museum some 15 years ago, the experience burned in my memory and there was no chance I would miss this opportunity on my second trip to Madrid. I took notes of artists that really grabbed my attention and will research these particular artists. The quality of artwork on display ensures this museum remains one of the leading European art museums.

reviewnospace: Good collection, better than expected. Don't miss. Nice area of Madrid for walking and hanging around.
titleopinion: Good collection. Good collection, better than expected. Don't miss. Nice area of Madrid for walking and hanging around.

quote: A Quick Alternative to the Prado
reviewnospace: With only two hours to spend one morning at a museum, we opted for the Thyssen over the Prado. We saw all of the exhibits in this amount of time, so we were not disappointed. I would have liked to see a little more Spanish art, but I'm assuming it's across the street.
titleopinion: A Quick Alternative to the Prado. With only two hours to spend one morning at a museum, we opted for the Thyssen over the Prado. We saw all of the exhibits in this amount of time, so we were not disappointed. I would have liked to see a little more Spanish art, but I'm assuming it's across the street.

reviewnospace: awesome to enjoy the museum for free. the collection is interesting I like this place more than prado.
titleopinion: free Monday pm. awesome to enjoy the museum for free. the collection is interesting I like this place more than prado.

quote: Light, modern and a wide variety of art
reviewnospace: We loved this place. Not much of a queue at 10am when it opened. 3 floors of a delicious variety of art - some rooms we just glanced at the work other rooms we sat and absorbed. We saw works from artist we knew (Rodin, Degas, Cezanne, Hopper, Dali) and others which were new to us (Derain, O'Keefe, Heade). There was a bit too much to see in one sitting so maybe select 2 out of the 3 floors or have a coffee break after two floors. The staff suggest starting at the top and working down but I would suggest you choose your favorite genre and start with that. The ground floor has fewer exhibits so allow less time to view it. Don't miss the wonderful Rodin sculptures in the entrance hall.
titleopinion: Light, modern and a wide variety of art. We loved this place. Not much of a queue at 10am when it opened. 3 floors of a delicious variety of art - some rooms we just glanced at the work other rooms we sat and absorbed. We saw works from artist we knew (Rodin, Degas, Cezanne, Hopper, Dali) and others which were new to us (Derain, O'Keefe, Heade). There was a bit too much to see in one sitting so maybe select 2 out of the 3 floors or have a coffee break after two floors. The staff suggest starting at the top and working down but I would suggest you choose your favorite genre and start with that. The ground floor has fewer exhibits so allow less time to view it. Don't miss the wonderful Rodin sculptures in the entrance hall.

reviewnospace: I was recommended to visit this art gallery by lonely planet and trip adviser. The art work which was on show is definitely extraordinary and does warrant a visit, however it was so disappointing the amount that was missing because it was being shown at other galleries/exhibitions. Especially major pieces which we were looking forward to viewing. The gallery itself is wonderful in the way the artwork is spaced out allowing you time to view the artwork in depth which I enjoyed. Another disappointment was the staff in practically every room; they were either playing games on their mobile phones, sending text messages or emails or stood around chatting to one another. When I did ask 2or 3 questions about the artwork it felt as though I was an interruption to what they were doing and the majority were unable to answer basic questions, not what I expected from a gallery which is a member of Madrid's "Golden Triangle" of art and which is charging 10 euros per person to visit. The staff definitely need more training and more motivation, they are working in an amazing place.
titleopinion: Not the best experience. I was recommended to visit this art gallery by lonely planet and trip adviser. The art work which was on show is definitely extraordinary and does warrant a visit, however it was so disappointing the amount that was missing because it was being shown at other galleries/exhibitions. Especially major pieces which we were looking forward to viewing. The gallery itself is wonderful in the way the artwork is spaced out allowing you time to view the artwork in depth which I enjoyed. Another disappointment was the staff in practically every room; they were either playing games on their mobile phones, sending text messages or emails or stood around chatting to one another. When I did ask 2or 3 questions about the artwork it felt as though I was an interruption to what they were doing and the majority were unable to answer basic questions, not what I expected from a gallery which is a member of Madrid's  Golden Triangle  of art and which is charging 10 euros per person to visit. The staff definitely need more training and more motivation, they are working in an amazing place.

quote: Great art but a poor service from museum staff
reviewnospace: This was my first visit to this museum and whilst the museum is very modern with the art work very well displayed - there were many exhibits missing with no prior warning provided when entry tickets were purchased. A member of staff, from the museum, is seated in almost all of the exhibit halls but the majority were on their mobiles texting friends or listening to music on their mobiles or chatting to other members of staff or reading books which were hidden behind museum plans so it looked as though they were deeply engrossed in their day job but in reality were completely dis-interested. I approached staff on two occasions to ask about the exhibits in their rooms and they could not answer my questions and when I asked where certain pieces were - the guidebook showed that they should have been in a particular room and were missing - the staff had no idea. None of the staff in the museum participated in the visitor's experience and, if anything, they were oblivious to it - preferring to text friends or listen to music - instead of making sure that visitors received the benefit of their supposed knowledge. For the price that is charged - I would expect a lot more from this visit.
titleopinion: Great art but a poor service from museum staff. This was my first visit to this museum and whilst the museum is very modern with the art work very well displayed - there were many exhibits missing with no prior warning provided when entry tickets were purchased. A member of staff, from the museum, is seated in almost all of the exhibit halls but the majority were on their mobiles texting friends or listening to music on their mobiles or chatting to other members of staff or reading books which were hidden behind museum plans so it looked as though they were deeply engrossed in their day job but in reality were completely dis-interested. I approached staff on two occasions to ask about the exhibits in their rooms and they could not answer my questions and when I asked where certain pieces were - the guidebook showed that they should have been in a particular room and were missing - the staff had no idea. None of the staff in the museum participated in the visitor's experience and, if anything, they were oblivious to it - preferring to text friends or listen to music - instead of making sure that visitors received the benefit of their supposed knowledge. For the price that is charged - I would expect a lot more from this visit.

reviewnospace: Impressive collection as well as seasonal exhibits. I like the way the visits are organized so that you can see everything without going ariund in circles.
titleopinion: I always return!. Impressive collection as well as seasonal exhibits. I like the way the visits are organized so that you can see everything without going ariund in circles.

quote: Pricy, but not necessarily the best
reviewnospace:
Thanks to the temporary Pop Art exhibit (Warhols, Leichtensteins and alikes), our stop over was definitley worth it. Otherwise, the permanent collection is rich, but not very well arranged, neither chronologically nor categorically. You keep moving back and forth between medieval, classical, and even modern.
Also, a large number of French impressionist paintings were on loan to other exhibits or museums, and small prints were offered as substitute. A museum should not allow such high percentage of its paintings in a particular category to move out all at once, as this could be considered as a disgrace to its own visitors.
A note: museum gift shop is the best and most resonablu priced of the 3 major art museums in Madrid.
titleopinion: Pricy, but not necessarily the best. Thanks to the temporary Pop Art exhibit (Warhols, Leichtensteins and alikes), our stop over was definitley worth it. Otherwise, the permanent collection is rich, but not very well arranged, neither chronologically nor categorically. You keep moving back and forth between medieval, classical, and even modern.  Also, a large number of French impressionist paintings were on loan to other exhibits or museums, and small prints were offered as substitute. A museum should not allow such high percentage of its paintings in a particular category to move out all at once, as this could be considered as a disgrace to its own visitors.  A note: museum gift shop is the best and most resonablu priced of the 3 major art museums in Madrid.

quote: One of our favorite art museums in the world
reviewnospace: This is a really amazing collection in an easy to navigate central museum with great lighting and galleries of the perfect size to showcase the amazing art. Don't miss this fantastic museum. Free visiting hours are a great plus too. Check their website for details.
titleopinion: One of our favorite art museums in the world. This is a really amazing collection in an easy to navigate central museum with great lighting and galleries of the perfect size to showcase the amazing art. Don't miss this fantastic museum. Free visiting hours are a great plus too. Check their website for details.

reviewnospace: The museum pass includes this museum and it has works from many different artists and periods of art history.
titleopinion: Lovely Collection. The museum pass includes this museum and it has works from many different artists and periods of art history.

reviewnospace:
There is some amazing art here from a few different eras and styles. It is small and easy to walk around in a few hours. We went WITH A SIX YEAR OLD BOY, and he had fun as it is a fairly open gallery.
My only real complaint is that almost every painting is under glass. Taking photos of art under glass is tough. Plus, the glass wreaks havoc on the view of the texture of each painting. I understand completely why they do it--and yes, I felt better every time my 6 year old boy got too close. Still, seeing the art without the glass is clearly better.
titleopinion: spectacular art, all under glass. There is some amazing art here from a few different eras and styles. It is small and easy to walk around in a few hours. We went WITH A SIX YEAR OLD BOY, and he had fun as it is a fairly open gallery.  My only real complaint is that almost every painting is under glass. Taking photos of art under glass is tough. Plus, the glass wreaks havoc on the view of the texture of each painting. I understand completely why they do it--and yes, I felt better every time my 6 year old boy got too close. Still, seeing the art without the glass is clearly better.

reviewnospace: What a fabulous collection of artwork that spans centuries .... literally. The outdoor cafe is lovely as well. Highly recommend this museum.
titleopinion: Wow!. What a fabulous collection of artwork that spans centuries .... literally. The outdoor cafe is lovely as well. Highly recommend this museum.

reviewnospace: The museum has a lot to offer, a great variety of art through the ages. However, many of the paintings on my list to view were out on loan to other museums. However, two fabulous pieces were there for my total enjoyment: Adlbrecht Durer's "Jesus among the Doctors" and Rembrandt's "Self-Portrait Wearing a Hat and Two Chains."
titleopinion: Many favorites out on loan. The museum has a lot to offer, a great variety of art through the ages. However, many of the paintings on my list to view were out on loan to other museums. However, two fabulous pieces were there for my total enjoyment: Adlbrecht Durer's  Jesus among the Doctors  and Rembrandt's  Self-Portrait Wearing a Hat and Two Chains.

reviewnospace: We went here because of a review that we saw in our SPAIN travel book. Although not as large as the Prado it is still a large collection of a wide variety of artists, not just Spanish artists either. We really enjoyed our visit and one of the good things is that you can take photos, which is not often found in Spain.
titleopinion: Variety and Quality. We went here because of a review that we saw in our SPAIN travel book. Although not as large as the Prado it is still a large collection of a wide variety of artists, not just Spanish artists either. We really enjoyed our visit and one of the good things is that you can take photos, which is not often found in Spain.

quote: A wonderful and manageable history of art experience
reviewnospace: I loved the Thyssen Museum. The tour from the 2nd floor down to the ground is a beautiful history of art from the 1300s to the present day. There are many, many important works of art by artists of time honored places in art history. I was surprised by the amount of dedication to Impressionism which was a delight. The cafe on the patio is a lovely setting and tasty. We split a Caprese Salad and it was very good.
titleopinion: A wonderful and manageable history of art experience. I loved the Thyssen Museum. The tour from the 2nd floor down to the ground is a beautiful history of art from the 1300s to the present day. There are many, many important works of art by artists of time honored places in art history. I was surprised by the amount of dedication to Impressionism which was a delight. The cafe on the patio is a lovely setting and tasty. We split a Caprese Salad and it was very good.

reviewnospace:
Loved it. Allow lots of time - there's lots to see.
Be careful you are in the right queue - we joined the first (very long) queue we saw - then found that was for the cafe and in fact we could go straight into the gallery with no queuing at all.
We paid extra for the Pop Art exhibtion - we thought twice about that as we simply aren't used to paying fairly high fees for art exhibitions but were glad we saw it. Made a change to more traditional art.
Nice food in the cafe - either for quick snacks or more substantial lunch.
titleopinion: Well worth a visit. Loved it. Allow lots of time - there's lots to see.   Be careful you are in the right queue - we joined the first (very long) queue we saw - then found that was for the cafe and in fact we could go straight into the gallery with no queuing at all. We paid extra for the Pop Art exhibtion - we thought twice about that as we simply aren't used to paying fairly high fees for art exhibitions but were glad we saw it. Made a change to more traditional art.  Nice food in the cafe - either for quick snacks or more substantial lunch.

quote: Don't miss it, just cross the road from El Prado
reviewnospace:
Absolutely fantastic collection of painting, specially from XV and XVI centuries (Italian, Flamish) and also from impressionism to modern times. Particularly for these last ones, they have at least one or two paintings from each of the bests in their style.
This museum together with El Prado and Reina Sofia will make you enjoy the whole history of painting.
Reserve three to four hours to visit, on Monday from noon until 16:30 the entry is free of charge.
titleopinion: Don't miss it, just cross the road from El Prado. Absolutely fantastic collection of painting, specially from XV and XVI centuries (Italian, Flamish) and also from impressionism to modern times. Particularly for these last ones, they have at least one or two paintings from each of the bests in their style. This museum together with El Prado and Reina Sofia will make you enjoy the whole history of painting. Reserve three to four hours to visit, on Monday from noon until 16:30 the entry is free of charge.

reviewnospace:
We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Thyssen. The museum was easy to tour with an easy to read map for finding the artists for which we were interested, but also who were similar and are new favorites.

This museum is overlooked by tourists - this allows you to have the ability to be close to the paintings without a large crowd to have push through. We found Van Gogh, Picasso, Degas, Hopper, Monet and many more.

The only disappointment was the special exhibit on Pop art. There were a lot of posters advertising the exhibit. But upon arrival, we find out the fee is $11 euros and not covered in the expensive Madrid pass. We were sold on the exhibit and were sad it was so expensive (as it looked small)

Worth the time
titleopinion: Amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Thyssen. The museum was easy to tour with an easy to read map for finding the artists for which we were interested, but also who were similar and are new favorites.   This museum is overlooked by tourists - this allows you to have the ability to be close to the paintings without a large crowd to have push through. We found Van Gogh, Picasso, Degas, Hopper, Monet and many more.   The only disappointment was the special exhibit on Pop art. There were a lot of posters advertising the exhibit. But upon arrival, we find out the fee is $11 euros and not covered in the expensive Madrid pass. We were sold on the exhibit and were sad it was so expensive (as it looked small)  Worth the time

reviewnospace: A fantastic museum and complement to the Prado. Concentrating on more modern art, this museum is a very manageable size. Some true amazing works of art that are not to be missed. Be sure to check with the museum, because there are times where there is no admission fee (I just can't recall off the top of my head).
titleopinion: A Must See!. A fantastic museum and complement to the Prado. Concentrating on more modern art, this museum is a very manageable size. Some true amazing works of art that are not to be missed. Be sure to check with the museum, because there are times where there is no admission fee (I just can't recall off the top of my head).

reviewnospace: This jewel of a museum is sometimes overshadowed by the larger Prado but it should not be missed. The art works are more contemporary in nature and so you will be among old friends such as Van Gogh, Monet, Homer, Hopper and many others. The thyssen is a true gem and should not be missed.
titleopinion: A must see. This jewel of a museum is sometimes overshadowed by the larger Prado but it should not be missed. The art works are more contemporary in nature and so you will be among old friends such as Van Gogh, Monet, Homer, Hopper and many others. The thyssen is a true gem and should not be missed.

reviewnospace: second time I been there and remains a very good museum. It is not a big (3 floors) and you can enjoy sinv=ce the classic dutch to several impressionism
titleopinion: excellent small museum. second time I been there and remains a very good museum. It is not a big (3 floors) and you can enjoy sinv=ce the classic dutch to several impressionism

reviewnospace: Hard to believe this was one family's collection, even if you count his wife's collection as another separate collection, as it is thus on display. Great art, most extensive 19th/20th century I've seen. It's a lot to look at in one day. Carmen Thyssen-Bonremisza collection is more to my liking, though the whole place is great. Free Monday's, yay!! Don't drag your young kids here, they will grow up to hate museums!
titleopinion: Excellent collection. Hard to believe this was one family's collection, even if you count his wife's collection as another separate collection, as it is thus on display. Great art, most extensive 19th/20th century I've seen. It's a lot to look at in one day. Carmen Thyssen-Bonremisza collection is more to my liking, though the whole place is great. Free Monday's, yay!! Don't drag your young kids here, they will grow up to hate museums!

reviewnospace: Some outstanding pieces in this collection - we were there for the Pop Art special exhibition which was great. The cafe was very nice too.
titleopinion: A really choice collection. Some outstanding pieces in this collection - we were there for the Pop Art special exhibition which was great. The cafe was very nice too.

reviewnospace: It was a little bit of everything - great works from across the years. Make sure you start on the right floor and get the sequence right. The audio is great for each of the rooms, but is a little long if you listen all of it. Shop at the end was excellent. I enjoyed the Pop exhibition currently on display, but felt it was expensive for the size - and the audio is more again!
titleopinion: Excellent Collection. It was a little bit of everything - great works from across the years. Make sure you start on the right floor and get the sequence right. The audio is great for each of the rooms, but is a little long if you listen all of it. Shop at the end was excellent. I enjoyed the Pop exhibition currently on display, but felt it was expensive for the size - and the audio is more again!

quote: One of the best small museums any time anywhere
reviewnospace: If you visit Madrid and do not go here you have to go back because your trip is incomplete. Wonderful staging of exhibits and very interesting and well done pieces.
titleopinion: One of the best small museums any time anywhere. If you visit Madrid and do not go here you have to go back because your trip is incomplete. Wonderful staging of exhibits and very interesting and well done pieces.

reviewnospace: It's smaller than the Prado but had numerous great pieces from all the major artists. We rented the audio guides and wished we would have allowed more time here. We also viewed the Cezanne exhibit which was there.
titleopinion: Favorite Madrid art museum. It's smaller than the Prado but had numerous great pieces from all the major artists. We rented the audio guides and wished we would have allowed more time here. We also viewed the Cezanne exhibit which was there.

quote: Free of charge on Mondays 12-4 pm
reviewnospace: It was nice to be able to enjoy these collections for free on a Monday afternoon. There are lots of impressionists and post impressionists artists and the lines are more reasonable than the Prado Museum.
titleopinion: Free of charge on Mondays 12-4 pm. It was nice to be able to enjoy these collections for free on a Monday afternoon. There are lots of impressionists and post impressionists artists and the lines are more reasonable than the Prado Museum.

reviewnospace: I recommend overall this museum but specially the itinerant collections are normally really interesting. I recommend the one about pop art which is on from June 2014. Really interesting pop collection
titleopinion: Interesting itinerant collections. I recommend overall this museum but specially the itinerant collections are normally really interesting. I recommend the one about pop art which is on from June 2014. Really interesting pop collection

reviewnospace: We bought tickets in the morning and returned in the afternoon. What a fabulous collection of artwork from the 13th to the 20th century. It is probably the most important private collection in the world. Now I wish I had bought the companion guide for the museum.
titleopinion: Amazing collection of art!. We bought tickets in the morning and returned in the afternoon. What a fabulous collection of artwork from the 13th to the 20th century. It is probably the most important private collection in the world. Now I wish I had bought the companion guide for the museum.

reviewnospace: great paintings covering all centuries..a must...good in house restaurant, too, do visit all collections and between 12-4 entrance is free
titleopinion: wonderful, wonderful art. great paintings covering all centuries..a must...good in house restaurant, too, do visit all collections and between 12-4 entrance is free

reviewnospace:
First, I do not ordinarily enjoy art museums (incredibly dull). That being said I would highly recommend the Thyssen. It's inexpensive (10 euro I think) with no line (versus the Prado which is across the street), the museum is easy to navigate.

There isn't so much artwork you're completely overwhelmed, but you'll see classics (Dali, Picasso, Monet, ect.) and you'll see works by artists you've never heard of. You can navigate the museum in as little as 1.5 hrs, but could easily spend 3-4 here.

I highly recommend this museum and would return.
titleopinion: One Stop Shop. First, I do not ordinarily enjoy art museums (incredibly dull). That being said I would highly recommend the Thyssen. It's inexpensive (10 euro I think) with no line (versus the Prado which is across the street), the museum is easy to navigate.   There isn't so much artwork you're completely overwhelmed, but you'll see classics (Dali, Picasso, Monet, ect.) and you'll see works by artists you've never heard of. You can navigate the museum in as little as 1.5 hrs, but could easily spend 3-4 here.   I highly recommend this museum and would return.

reviewnospace: Loved seeing all the Warhol, Lichtenstein and other works. The museum shop is excellent. The cafe has very good service and the courtyard is lovely.
titleopinion: Pop art exhibition. Loved seeing all the Warhol, Lichtenstein and other works. The museum shop is excellent. The cafe has very good service and the courtyard is lovely.

reviewnospace: Sensational experience!!! I spent there like two hours and let my husband spleeping the "siesta". This museum I add to my favourits.
titleopinion: Amazing gallery. Sensational experience!!! I spent there like two hours and let my husband spleeping the  siesta . This museum I add to my favourits.

quote: Great Museum Too bad Artists' works aren't Together
reviewnospace: We decided to try this smaller museum out after walking through Retio Park. We loved all of the art work, but couldn't figure out why the different (Master) artists works weren't grouped together, i.e. you would find one Van Gogh on the second floor, and others on the first floor. Same with Pissaro and others. There was also a nice cafe outside but SUPER expensive! Better to grab something down the street or food to go and eat in the adjacent lush gardens.
