It truly was the best hamburger and fries I've had in a long time. So, the so called Caravaggio room was soon forgotten, and we left knowing that we had seen one of the best art museums anywhere.

quote: Small, varied, extremely well organized museum
reviewnospace: I absolutely loved this museum! You can do an excellent visit in 4 hours. The Thyssen-Bornemisza is incredibly well organized, maps are super useful and easy to follow, and the collection is amazing. You find works from the Reinassance to Modern Art. Highly recommend it!
titleopinion: Small, varied, extremely well organized museum. I absolutely loved this museum! You can do an excellent visit in 4 hours. The Thyssen-Bornemisza is incredibly well organized, maps are super useful and easy to follow, and the collection is amazing. You find works from the Reinassance to Modern Art. Highly recommend it!

reviewnospace: The view and location are absolutely amazing. There was a high breeze blowing and it was very welcome after a very hot day. The food was good but slightly overwrought. Too many garnishes and swirls and sauces to be authentically Spanish but overall quite good. I didn't pay so I have no idea what the meal cost but expect the view doesn't come cheaply. Very nice dinner, beautiful location, but don't expect classic Spanish fare.
titleopinion: Spectacular view, overwrought food. The view and location are absolutely amazing. There was a high breeze blowing and it was very welcome after a very hot day. The food was good but slightly overwrought. Too many garnishes and swirls and sauces to be authentically Spanish but overall quite good. I didn't pay so I have no idea what the meal cost but expect the view doesn't come cheaply. Very nice dinner, beautiful location, but don't expect classic Spanish fare.

reviewnospace: rivals the great art museums in paris. excellent facility that can easily accommodate visitors. special exhibit was good, but after spending time there it was too much for one visit.
titleopinion: excellent collection. rivals the great art museums in paris. excellent facility that can easily accommodate visitors. special exhibit was good, but after spending time there it was too much for one visit.

reviewnospace: The Thysson collection is a wonderfully eclectic group of art works. Well worth a visit while in Madrid. I found it easy to walk through and more compact than either the Reina Sofia or the Prado but with a more extensive collection of impressionist and modern art works. Highly recommended if you like art galleries with known artists.
titleopinion: My Favourite of the big 3. The Thysson collection is a wonderfully eclectic group of art works. Well worth a visit while in Madrid. I found it easy to walk through and more compact than either the Reina Sofia or the Prado but with a more extensive collection of impressionist and modern art works. Highly recommended if you like art galleries with known artists.

reviewnospace: Large collection that provides a great value for the cost of admission. Probably just as good or not better than the Prado in my opinion
titleopinion: Nice collection. Large collection that provides a great value for the cost of admission. Probably just as good or not better than the Prado in my opinion

reviewnospace:
I was lucky enough to get there when they had a special a pissarro exibit that made it even better!
I didn't do the tour of buy the headset for English but I still had fun.
titleopinion: Great experience. I was lucky enough to get there when they had a special a pissarro exibit that made it even better! I didn't do the tour of buy the headset for English but I still had fun.

reviewnospace: across the street from our hotel, this small museum is just perfect for a morning or afternoon. worth seein and you can get combination passes to it and the Prado.
titleopinion: small museum. across the street from our hotel, this small museum is just perfect for a morning or afternoon. worth seein and you can get combination passes to it and the Prado.

reviewnospace: I had a great experience at the Thyssen. I think it must get fewer visitors than its big brother Prado across the street, and so it had the perfect amount of limited traffic mid-morning for me to stroll through and reflect on the works. The collection itself is fantastic for modern art lovers - they've created an eclectic but well-manicured lineup of big names and lesser known artists.
titleopinion: Great collection, peaceful space!. I had a great experience at the Thyssen. I think it must get fewer visitors than its big brother Prado across the street, and so it had the perfect amount of limited traffic mid-morning for me to stroll through and reflect on the works. The collection itself is fantastic for modern art lovers - they've created an eclectic but well-manicured lineup of big names and lesser known artists.

reviewnospace: We made our second visit to the Thyssen-Bornemisza in a few years. Once again, we were glad that we did. The museum is a bit off the typical tour itinerary. The museum's own collection is eclectic. And they often have interesting and well planned special exhibits, two of which were up on this visit. So be sure and check out what the T-B has to fifer during your visit to Madrid. And purchase online tickets to make your visit as efficient as possible.
titleopinion: Seriously Consider a Visit. We made our second visit to the Thyssen-Bornemisza in a few years. Once again, we were glad that we did. The museum is a bit off the typical tour itinerary. The museum's own collection is eclectic. And they often have interesting and well planned special exhibits, two of which were up on this visit. So be sure and check out what the T-B has to fifer during your visit to Madrid. And purchase online tickets to make your visit as efficient as possible.

reviewnospace: Y was blown away with the art colletion in this museum. Like Prado museum, a must visit when in Madrid. Beautiful.
titleopinion: Amazing!!!!. Y was blown away with the art colletion in this museum. Like Prado museum, a must visit when in Madrid. Beautiful.

reviewnospace: The Thyssen's holdings take the visitor from the medieval to the modern. One pleasant surprise was the photo policy. You can take a picture of anything as long as you don't use a flash.
titleopinion: Great experience. The Thyssen's holdings take the visitor from the medieval to the modern. One pleasant surprise was the photo policy. You can take a picture of anything as long as you don't use a flash.

reviewnospace: I actually liked Thyssen better than the Prado since it was smaller and not so overwhelming. Many major artists have their work on display. Very much work the visit.
titleopinion: Thyssen -quick overview. I actually liked Thyssen better than the Prado since it was smaller and not so overwhelming. Many major artists have their work on display. Very much work the visit.

reviewnospace: This is an amazing collection spanning the centuries and I think there is something for everyone here. They had some of the most beautiful artworks I have seen and I preferred it to the Prado and and the Reina Sofia. If you only have time for one of the 3, this would be the one I'd choose.
titleopinion: My favourite in Madrid. This is an amazing collection spanning the centuries and I think there is something for everyone here. They had some of the most beautiful artworks I have seen and I preferred it to the Prado and and the Reina Sofia. If you only have time for one of the 3, this would be the one I'd choose.

reviewnospace: For a private collection, this museum is incredible. There was a temporary Pissarro exhibit there when I went, which was really comprehensive.
titleopinion: Amazing collection. For a private collection, this museum is incredible. There was a temporary Pissarro exhibit there when I went, which was really comprehensive.

quote: One of the best Madrid museums.
reviewnospace: Excellent collection near the Prado with strengths exactly where Prado's weaknesses might be, more modern art and impressionism.You will enjoy Flemish and Dutch paintings. A lot of true masterpieces, easy to follow plan but start from the top to the level zero.
titleopinion: One of the best Madrid museums.. Excellent collection near the Prado with strengths exactly where Prado's weaknesses might be, more modern art and impressionism.You will enjoy Flemish and Dutch paintings. A lot of true masterpieces, easy to follow plan but start from the top to the level zero.

quote: Wow! Here you can feast on so much beauty
reviewnospace:
There is so much to see here so make sure you reserve enough time to meander through the three floors of elegant art. There was an exhibition of Camille Pissarro when we were there which we loved. The museum is a treat to visit, the rooms are restful and one can concentrate on the items without getting tired.

There is a restaurant and terrace for those who need a break or two while there with a view of the beautiful gardens. This makes for extra pleasure and throughly recommended.

Don't miss this opportunity when in Madrid.
titleopinion: Wow! Here you can feast on so much beauty. There is so much to see here so make sure you reserve enough time to meander through the three floors of elegant art. There was an exhibition of Camille Pissarro when we were there which we loved. The museum is a treat to visit, the rooms are restful and one can concentrate on the items without getting tired.  There is a restaurant and terrace for those who need a break or two while there with a view of the beautiful gardens. This makes for extra pleasure and throughly recommended.  Don't miss this opportunity when in Madrid.

reviewnospace: This museum is a more manageable size than the Prado and the artwork is well organized chronologically. I particularly enjoyed the special Pissaro exhibit.
titleopinion: Pissaro Exhibit. This museum is a more manageable size than the Prado and the artwork is well organized chronologically. I particularly enjoyed the special Pissaro exhibit.

reviewnospace: Our guide book suggested that this museum contained mostly unimportant works or works by unknown artists. This was not the case. The collection dates from the 13th to 20th centuries and is actually 2 collections of husband and wife. It is worth including in your group of 3-museum ticket. When we went there was also a Pissaro exhibit which was very good (an extra 6 euros) Be advised that the Euro21.50 ticket for all 3 musuems was sold out by 11:30 AM so buy in advance. However, if you are over 65 you are better off paying for each museum as there are discounts for each.
titleopinion: An extensive collection. Our guide book suggested that this museum contained mostly unimportant works or works by unknown artists. This was not the case. The collection dates from the 13th to 20th centuries and is actually 2 collections of husband and wife. It is worth including in your group of 3-museum ticket. When we went there was also a Pissaro exhibit which was very good (an extra 6 euros) Be advised that the Euro21.50 ticket for all 3 musuems was sold out by 11:30 AM so buy in advance. However, if you are over 65 you are better off paying for each museum as there are discounts for each.

quote: the best choice in Madrid for an artist
reviewnospace: One of the best museums in the world. It is light and the art work is awe inspiring. The marc Chagall exhibition was going on when I was there and I loved it. The modern art work is beautiful, unique and its spacious. I disliked nothing about this gallery.
titleopinion: the best choice in Madrid for an artist. One of the best museums in the world. It is light and the art work is awe inspiring. The marc Chagall exhibition was going on when I was there and I loved it. The modern art work is beautiful, unique and its spacious. I disliked nothing about this gallery.

reviewnospace: I didn't expect so a rich museum. Lots of true masterpieces of all ages and styles, all accurately presented and well enlightened. We also visited a temporary exhibit of Hyperrealism 1967-2012, that was really astonishing.
titleopinion: Above my expectations. I didn't expect so a rich museum. Lots of true masterpieces of all ages and styles, all accurately presented and well enlightened. We also visited a temporary exhibit of Hyperrealism 1967-2012, that was really astonishing.

reviewnospace: Well worth visiting. While it fewer "masterpieces" than the nearby Prado, it still has some wonderful works, by many of those same world famous artist.
titleopinion: Very good. Well worth visiting. While it fewer  masterpieces  than the nearby Prado, it still has some wonderful works, by many of those same world famous artist.

quote: Not as big as the Prado but everything is quality
reviewnospace: A smaller museum / art gallery that the Prado. If you are interested enough in art to visit the Prado you must visit the Thyssen. The layout is a bit different than the Prado, I found this better. There are a number of artworks in this museum that are considered to be master pieces. Some of these do actually stand out in a museum full of excellent artworks.
titleopinion: Not as big as the Prado but everything is quality. A smaller museum / art gallery that the Prado. If you are interested enough in art to visit the Prado you must visit the Thyssen. reviewnospace: If you don't know what you like in the the art world but would like to go to an art museum I would recommend this one as this collection gives you a little bit of everything so there is bound to be something you like, without a doubt!
titleopinion: A little bit of everything!. If you don't know what you like in the the art world but would like to go to an art museum I would recommend this one as this collection gives you a little bit of everything so there is bound to be something you like, without a doubt!

quote: Good - well worth going to see the Pissarro exhibit
reviewnospace: You'll see works from most of the great masters - Renoir, Cezanne, Picasso, Miro, Rembrandt, Monet, etc. You won't see many of their greatest works though, but you will see a good representation of the works of most of the great masters - if you go, take in the Pissarro exhibit (available through September, 2013) - you will see some of the greatest works of Pissarro at that temporary exhibit.
titleopinion: Good - well worth going to see the Pissarro exhibit. You'll see works from most of the great masters - Renoir, Cezanne, Picasso, Miro, Rembrandt, Monet, etc. You won't see many of their greatest works though, but you will see a good representation of the works of most of the great masters - if you go, take in the Pissarro exhibit (available through September, 2013) - you will see some of the greatest works of Pissarro at that temporary exhibit.

reviewnospace: I love this museum due to its varied collection and small footprint. Very classy and hip museum. The Prado is fantastic, don't get me wrong, and the Sophia Reina is worth visiting for a few works. This one really captures a great spirit and feeling. Good lighting allows you to enjoy the paintings. Also, the ability to take photos (what is up with that in other museums and buildings here in Spain?) is a plus. After walking around the city and museum, the terrace bar is also a very nice and luxe frill. Nice "chill" music while you enjoy your cava and spider crab salad.
titleopinion: Best of the big three. I love this museum due to its varied collection and small footprint. Very classy and hip museum. The Prado is fantastic, don't get me wrong, and the Sophia Reina is worth visiting for a few works. This one really captures a great spirit and feeling. Good lighting allows you to enjoy the paintings. Also, the ability to take photos (what is up with that in other museums and buildings here in Spain?) is a plus. After walking around the city and museum, the terrace bar is also a very nice and luxe frill. Nice  chill  music while you enjoy your cava and spider crab salad.

quote: Great impressionist art museum with a nice shop
reviewnospace: This museum is not to be missed, if you like contemporary art. It is particularly strong on impressionist paintings and they are shown in well lit galleries. The museum has an excellent gift shop with some unusual gifts to take home.
titleopinion: Great impressionist art museum with a nice shop. This museum is not to be missed, if you like contemporary art. It is particularly strong on impressionist paintings and they are shown in well lit galleries. The museum has an excellent gift shop with some unusual gifts to take home.

quote: Great introduction to art, covering history very well
reviewnospace: Very easy to navigate museum that is well laid out and chronologically show the history of art from a european/spanish perspective. Great for the casual art lover .. not too long nor too many paintings. My 9yr old daughter loved it.

reviewnospace: Friendly Nd interesting. Entrance fee shoud have included the audio guide. Extra 3 euros are petty...

reviewnospace: i ve been there because i wanted to see Camille pisarro but the other part of the museum didnt want so much interesting

reviewnospace: This is my favorites of all the art museums in Madrid. Great collection in an easy-to-follow layout. We were able to see every single work in the museum in a leisurely day. The cafe there is good, as is the gift shop. You are able to re-enter the museum the same day if you want to eat at a local restaurant or cafe.

reviewnospace: If you love 19th century art, you will love this treasure of a museum close to the Prado. It is smaller and more manageable.
titleopinion: Love art. If you love 19th century art, you will love this treasure of a museum close to the Prado. It is smaller and more manageable.

reviewnospace: Excellent private museum with a mixed collection of old and modern masters (from El Greco and Van Gogh to DalÌ and Lichtenstein), and since it’s not as huge as the Prado or Reina Sofia, I found it less tiring, but its collection is really impressive. All in all, a wonderful museum and I highly recommend it.
titleopinion: Must-see. Excellent private museum with a mixed collection of old and modern masters (from El Greco and Van Gogh to DalÌ and Lichtenstein), and since it’s not as huge as the Prado or Reina Sofia, I found it less tiring, but its collection is really impressive. All in all, a wonderful museum and I highly recommend it.

quote: If you are short for time, pick this one
reviewnospace: This is the pick of galleries in Madrid for me. Lovely collection, lovely building and just the right size to be able to appreciate it all without suffering from art overload. The best thing is that the layout just makes sense, unlike the Prado & Reina Sofia, so you don't get lost & are able to navigate easily around the entire collection. Being able to see Mondrians, Picasso''s, Goya, Lautrec & Rembrandts & Dalis all in one collections is an amazing treat.

Being able to see Mondrians, Picasso''s, Goya, Lautrec & Rembrandts & Dalis all in one collections is an amazing treat.

reviewnospace: We saw the Pissaro exhibit and it was fabulous. Then we returned and saw the remainder of the museum. Also fabulous. Check online to see when the museum is free to the public.
titleopinion: Pissaro Exhibit. We saw the Pissaro exhibit and it was fabulous. Then we returned and saw the remainder of the museum. Also fabulous. Check online to see when the museum is free to the public.

reviewnospace: I read the reviews on tripadvisor about this museum and it was a great find. A huge range of art from the masters to the very modern and set out in such a way that in maintained your interest all the way through.
titleopinion: Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum. I read the reviews on tripadvisor about this museum and it was a great find. A huge range of art from the masters to the very modern and set out in such a way that in maintained your interest all the way through.

reviewnospace: Haven't been to ANY museum in a long time. What better place to resume the arts but in a place that houses a few Picasso's and Dali's. Along with some works (that I enjoyed the most) from the 1300's-1600's that was simply amazing with the amount of detail and passion for paintings about Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary and simple portraits and scenes of everyday life in a time when things were simple. The cafeteria style restaurant got no complaints from me and the al fresco atmosphere just adds to the artistic feel of the place. Go. See. Enjoy. Your eyes will thank you.
titleopinion: Literally An Eye Opener. Haven't been to ANY museum in a long time. What better place to resume the arts but in a place that houses a few Picasso's and Dali's. Along with some works (that I enjoyed the most) from the 1300's-1600's that was simply amazing with the amount of detail and passion for paintings about Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary and simple portraits and scenes of everyday life in a time when things were simple. The cafeteria style restaurant got no complaints from me and the al fresco atmosphere just adds to the artistic feel of the place. Go. See. Enjoy. Your eyes will thank you.

reviewnospace:
Excellent collection, and, when I was there, they had a wonderful exhibit of PISSARO.

The staff is a bit off hand, and the restaurant, which is beautifully designed and set up so that one can take advantage of the indoor/outdoors is a bit chaotic. Staff not too well organized, but the food was not up to scratch.

As an off-shoot of the Prado, it and its sister institution need to be a bit better at customer relations,

but, don't miss it if you are in Madrid.
titleopinion: Another  must  when you visit Madrid. Excellent collection, and, when I was there, they had a wonderful exhibit of PISSARO.  The staff is a bit off hand, and the restaurant, which is beautifully designed and set up so that one can take advantage of the indoor/outdoors is a bit chaotic. Staff not too well organized, but the food was not up to scratch.  As an off-shoot of the Prado, it and its sister institution need to be a bit better at customer relations,  but, don't miss it if you are in Madrid.

reviewnospace:
Last time I visited T-B after Prado´s and was a wrong decision. Much better to visit before. Thyssen is nice, but nothing to do if compares to Prado´s...
I wil visit again!! It´s worth...
titleopinion: Need to visit before Prado´s.... Last time I visited T-B after Prado´s and was a wrong decision. Much better to visit before. Thyssen is nice, but nothing to do if compares to Prado´s... I wil visit again!! It´s worth...

quote: Do not miss this delightful museum!
reviewnospace:
Madrid has the top 3 museums, Thyssen, Reina Sofia, and Prado. My husband and I enjoyed this the best. We saw the Pissarro exhibition and hyper realism exhibits. We enjoyed this museum over the Prado. honestly, if you have been to the Louvre or the museums in Florence, the Prado has more of the same works.
We really enjoyed the hyper realism exhibition. After visiting the museum, enjoy some cava and tapas from the cool cafe /bar of the Thyssen- it is where the local, hip Madrilenos hang out.

After visiting the museum, enjoy some cava and tapas from the cool cafe /bar of the Thyssen- it is where the local, hip Madrilenos hang out.

quote: One of the most beautiful museums in the world
reviewnospace: Two hours were insufficient to see all this excellent museum has to offer. One needs at least three visits to absorb all the outstanding works of art that have been collected in this museum.
titleopinion: One of the most beautiful museums in the world. Two hours were insufficient to see all this excellent museum has to offer. One needs at least three visits to absorb all the outstanding works of art that have been collected in this museum.

reviewnospace: We were there during an outstanding exhibit of Impressionists. The main collection is exceptional as well. It was easy to make a reservation on-line, and even though we couldn't print our tickets the checking in was efficient and friendly.
titleopinion: Wonderful private museum. We were there during an outstanding exhibit of Impressionists. The main collection is exceptional as well. It was easy to make a reservation on-line, and even though we couldn't print our tickets the checking in was efficient and friendly.

reviewnospace: This is the best art collection in Madrid and one of the best in the world, spanning all periods of western art. They are also the venue for Madrid's "blockbuster" art events. Be prepared to pay for tickets-they are stingy with discounts.
titleopinion: An incredible art collection!. This is the best art collection in Madrid and one of the best in the world, spanning all periods of western art. They are also the venue for Madrid's  blockbuster  art events. Be prepared to pay for tickets-they are stingy with discounts.

quote: Fantastic art museum - better than the Prado
reviewnospace: We visited the Thyssen-Bornemisza as well the Prado on this short trip and this is the better of the two by far. It houses some of the more wonderful modern artists and, unlike the Prado, is not overwhelming in its size and collection. The current Pissarro exhibition alone is worth the visit to Madrid - simply wonderful.
titleopinion: Fantastic art museum - better than the Prado. We visited the Thyssen-Bornemisza as well the Prado on this short trip and this is the better of the two by far. It houses some of the more wonderful modern artists and, unlike the Prado, is not overwhelming in its size and collection. The current Pissarro exhibition alone is worth the visit to Madrid - simply wonderful.

reviewnospace: This is a very good museum with paintings from all over, including early American painters like Winslow Homer. We only managed to cover the two upper floors or more historical art. The contemporary art is on the main floor. Well worth the visit.
titleopinion: Many beautiful paintings. This is a very good museum with paintings from all over, including early American painters like Winslow Homer. We only managed to cover the two upper floors or more historical art. The contemporary art is on the main floor. Well worth the visit.

quote: A stunning collection in a stunning place
reviewnospace: This is a large but beautifully intimate gallery, showing a fantastic range of European and US art from the 14th to 20th centuries. A bit of everything, something for everybody, and one of the classiest gallery cafes in the world.
titleopinion: A stunning collection in a stunning place. This is a large but beautifully intimate gallery, showing a fantastic range of European and US art from the 14th to 20th centuries. A bit of everything, something for everybody, and one of the classiest gallery cafes in the world.

reviewnospace: Great works of art in an intimate setting. Some of the works by the great artists are just OK , but some of the lesser painters works are awesome.
titleopinion: A national treasure. Great works of art in an intimate setting. Some of the works by the great artists are just OK , but some of the lesser painters works are awesome.

reviewnospace: A substantial exhibition of the artist's work until September 2013, Seniors get a 50% reduction on the admission cost but you hire the audio handset for maximum benefit
titleopinion: Pissaro exhibition. A substantial exhibition of the artist's work until September 2013, Seniors get a 50% reduction on the admission cost but you hire the audio handset for maximum benefit

reviewnospace: A really nice museum with some very well collections of art! Also interesting temporary exhibitions which actually work on timed entrances so it doesn't get too crowed there!
titleopinion: Great museum. A really nice museum with some very well collections of art! Also interesting temporary exhibitions which actually work on timed entrances so it doesn't get too crowed there!

quote: Smaller than the Prada, but outstanding exhibits
reviewnospace:
Within easy walking distance of the Prada, and smaller in scale, this museum makes up for some of the gaps in the Prada's collection, in particular the artworks of the later 19th and 20th century. Not as busy as the Prada, but the exhibits were outstanding and well spaced.
Well lit, airy, but with few accompanying texts, a good guide book will be beneficial. The restaurant has an exterior terrace serving full or light meals and drinks, is reasonably priced and provides a much welcomed space to relax.
titleopinion: Smaller than the Prada, but outstanding exhibits. Within easy walking distance of the Prada, and smaller in scale, this museum makes up for some of the gaps in the Prada's collection, in particular the artworks of the later 19th and 20th century. Not as busy as the Prada, but the exhibits were outstanding and well spaced.  Well lit, airy, but with few accompanying texts, a good guide book will be beneficial. The restaurant has an exterior terrace serving full or light meals and drinks, is reasonably priced and provides a much welcomed space to relax.

quote: If you take advantage of Free Monday admission
reviewnospace: be aware that they will escort you out at 4pm. They now have free admissions every Monday sponsored by Master Card from 12-4pm and I had assumed that meant that as long as you entered in that time period you would be allowed to see everything so I took my time. Apparently Mondays they close early and not at their usual 7pm. So get there by 1:30pm if you want to see everything in time for closing. That said the museum is wonderful. It feels very warm and inviting and the pink paint and layout makes the experience much better than some other staid, rigid museum layouts (looking at your Queen Reina Sofia Arts Museum). The collection is great and there's free maps with 24 selected works that you need to see. These include Heade, Renoir, Van Gogh, Rembrandt, and other works. When you begin the tour start on Floor 2 where the first room is and progress downwards. You will begin with Italian Early Renaissance works in the first floor and progress to 19th and 20th century on the second floor. The last floor has some neat pop art including "Woman in Bath" by Roy Lichtenstein which is very pop artsy. Alas, I didn't get to see everything since they closed at 4pm so be sure to pace yourself. But I would say 2 hours is enough time for most people, 3 hours if you like to glance at selected works for more than 30 seconds and 4 hours if you want to listen to every audioguide story about all the works. But no longer than 4 hours tops. It's very manageable and definitely worthwhile. It's a medium-sized museum but it packs a punch artistically

reviewnospace: Not as complete a collection as the Prado or Reina Sophia but outstanding nonetheless. A personal guide is most recommended.
titleopinion: Great Hyperrealism exhibit.. Not as complete a collection as the Prado or Reina Sophia but outstanding nonetheless. A personal guide is most recommended.

reviewnospace: What an amazing experience. The accompanying commentaries were really helpful and it was so wonderful to get a better understanding of art through the centuries. A wonderful collection and so great to see so many different things in one place.
titleopinion: Wonderful Art. What an amazing experience. The accompanying commentaries were really helpful and it was so wonderful to get a better understanding of art through the centuries. A wonderful collection and so great to see so many different things in one place.

quote: A must see amongst great museum of the world
reviewnospace:
The place itself is very beautiful and modern.
The collection is amazing.Well worth a few hours of your time for eternal memories.
titleopinion: A must see amongst great museum of the world. The place itself is very beautiful and modern. The collection is amazing.Well worth a few hours of your time for eternal memories.

quote: Most relaxing and well displayed gallery
reviewnospace: Amazing museum full of art treasures including many pieces most people would be familiar with but never seen in the 'flesh'. My 14yr old son even enjoyed this museum with a huge selection of Impressionist and Post Impressionist work, as well as Renaissance pieces and modern art. It's huge and well laid out and less busy than others if you arrive before lunch. We were impressed to see that over 60's get a discount (proof of age may be required as my Mum looks younger, good job she had her passport on her) as do students (including over 12's - 16yr olds), There were 2 small groups of students having tours however they did not distract from our enjoyment and there is also a very well stocked shop not disimilar to the V & A and Tate Modern in London.

It's huge and well laid out and less busy than others if you arrive before lunch. quote: A Gem- do not miss it
reviewnospace: Together with the Prado, this is a "cannot miss" attraction of Madrid. The Museum is very well curated, both collections are fantastic and well organized.
titleopinion: A Gem- do not miss it. Together with the Prado, this is a  cannot miss  attraction of Madrid. The Museum is very well curated, both collections are fantastic and well organized.

reviewnospace: A huge museum. I went twice with the audioguide which was very informative. Interesting to see some not-so-famous works by Gauguin, Picasso. Did the special exhibition of hyperrealism, beautifully presented, excellent guide. Will go again to see the Pisarro exhibition. Very expensive very nice café where you can sit on white sofas and watch the birds in the garden. It was free on one of my visits thanks to MasterCard. People had queued in the sun for this, not necessary as within 10 minutes they had all gone in [after their 30min wait], and you can then walk straight in. None of the silly business at the Prado where you must queue to get your ticket for free entry then queue to get in
titleopinion: Vast panorama of art. A huge museum. I went twice with the audioguide which was very informative. Interesting to see some not-so-famous works by Gauguin, Picasso. Did the special exhibition of hyperrealism, beautifully presented, excellent guide. Will go again to see the Pisarro exhibition. Very expensive very nice café where you can sit on white sofas and watch the birds in the garden. It was free on one of my visits thanks to MasterCard. People had queued in the sun for this, not necessary as within 10 minutes they had all gone in [after their 30min wait], and you can then walk straight in. None of the silly business at the Prado where you must queue to get your ticket for free entry then queue to get in

reviewnospace: I am not an art lover, but I really enjoyed visiting the Thyssen-Bornemisza! This was my favorite museum by far! I loved the diverse collections of modern and classic art, especially the hyperrealism exhibit. There was something for everyone here!
titleopinion: My favorite, by far!. I am not an art lover, but I really enjoyed visiting the Thyssen-Bornemisza! This was my favorite museum by far! I loved the diverse collections of modern and classic art, especially the hyperrealism exhibit. There was something for everyone here!

reviewnospace: Better than the Prado. Collection is more modern with more interesting pieces. There are some free entries on the first Friday of the month but the lines are long. Well worth a visit.
titleopinion: Excellent Museum. Better than the Prado. Collection is more modern with more interesting pieces. There are some free entries on the first Friday of the month but the lines are long. Well worth a visit.

reviewnospace: Madrid offers some of the best art galleries and Museo's in the world. the Thyssen-Bornemisza is one of them. EAch year when I travel to Madrid there is always something new to discover and the beautiful building makes you feel rich like a Countess.
titleopinion: Never boring, always alive. Madrid offers some of the best art galleries and Museo's in the world. the Thyssen-Bornemisza is one of them. EAch year when I travel to Madrid there is always something new to discover and the beautiful building makes you feel rich like a Countess.

quote: Come see the stuff your art history prof never learned
reviewnospace: The collection is fantastically diverse! For me, it was seeing works by artists outside of their "normal" style - actually, I imagine, it's just outside of the box in which conventional art history has placed them. Landscapes by Toulouse-Lautrec, non abstract pictures by Picasso, and this cute, upbeat impressionist picture of ducks waddling out of a pond by Edvard Munch. Great place, photos are ALLOWED!! :) They have one of nearly everything I believe. A great contrast with the formality and heavy classicism of the Museo del Prado (also excellent and literally across the street).
titleopinion: Come see the stuff your art history prof never learned. The collection is fantastically diverse! For me, it was seeing works by artists outside of their  normal  style - actually, I imagine, it's just outside of the box in which conventional art history has placed them. Landscapes by Toulouse-Lautrec, non abstract pictures by Picasso, and this cute, upbeat impressionist picture of ducks waddling out of a pond by Edvard Munch. Great place, photos are ALLOWED!! :) They have one of nearly everything I believe. A great contrast with the formality and heavy classicism of the Museo del Prado (also excellent and literally across the street).

reviewnospace: One of the best museums in Madrid. I was impressed by the collection and I wish I had more time to explore all expositions. Tickets are a little pricey but nevertheless worth every cent.
titleopinion: Amazing collection. One of the best museums in Madrid. I was impressed by the collection and I wish I had more time to explore all expositions. Tickets are a little pricey but nevertheless worth every cent.

reviewnospace: I actually enjoyed this museum better than the Prado. It is smaller and more manageable and the Impressionist painters are my favorites. In every room I was surprised to find paintings that I recognized from books. It was one delight after another.
titleopinion: A Gem. I actually enjoyed this museum better than the Prado. It is smaller and more manageable and the Impressionist painters are my favorites. In every room I was surprised to find paintings that I recognized from books. It was one delight after another.

quote: Fab Collection and Worth Your Time
reviewnospace: OK, this is one of the Big 3 art museums in town, so just go. In some ways, art lovers may (like me) find this collection more interesting than the Prado because of its variety and good taste. The 'ol Baron really had a great eye -- or a good art advisor!
titleopinion: Fab Collection and Worth Your Time. OK, this is one of the Big 3 art museums in town, so just go. In some ways, art lovers may (like me) find this collection more interesting than the Prado because of its variety and good taste. The 'ol Baron really had a great eye -- or a good art advisor!

reviewnospace:
Insane.

Everything you need in life to make you happy is inside those 4 walls.

Loved--Loved--Loved.

And ir was free courtesy of those corporate thieves Mastercard.
titleopinion: Mad Museum ... !. Insane.  Everything you need in life to make you happy is inside those 4 walls.  Loved--Loved--Loved.  And ir was free courtesy of those corporate thieves Mastercard.

reviewnospace: If this place offered Free hours, it probably would be. Smaller and more manageable without feeling overwhelmed like I did at Prado. Another review said it best: pick what you like to see and enjoy.
titleopinion: better than Prado?. If this place offered Free hours, it probably would be. Smaller and more manageable without feeling overwhelmed like I did at Prado. Another review said it best: pick what you like to see and enjoy.

reviewnospace: This museum houses the most fantastic collection of art. Perhaps even more amazing than the Prado. We spent many hours there and also had a good lunch in the attached restaurant.
titleopinion: One of the best. This museum houses the most fantastic collection of art. Perhaps even more amazing than the Prado. We spent many hours there and also had a good lunch in the attached restaurant.

reviewnospace: This is a smaller museum than the Prado, but has just as distinguished selection of renaissance art. You can pick the style you'd like to see and not be rushed to see it all.
titleopinion: More manageable than the Prado. This is a smaller museum than the Prado, but has just as distinguished selection of renaissance art. You can pick the style you'd like to see and not be rushed to see it all.

quote: Excellent collection of Impresionist and Post- Impressionists
reviewnospace: Much less crowded than the Prado, and their collection is more to our liking. We enjoyed a special exhibition of "open air" Impressionist paintings.
titleopinion: Excellent collection of Impresionist and Post- Impressionists. Much less crowded than the Prado, and their collection is more to our liking. We enjoyed a special exhibition of  open air  Impressionist paintings.

reviewnospace: The collection of modern, impressionist and post-impressionist art was really terrific. Getting the museum pass is well worth the money and this museum was well worth the time.
titleopinion: Another amazing museum. The collection of modern, impressionist and post-impressionist art was really terrific. Getting the museum pass is well worth the money and this museum was well worth the time.

reviewnospace:
This was my first time here on my third visit to Madrid and i was very impressed. The gallery has an outstanding collection of paintings and s well set out and run you do not get tired which often happens in some of the other galleries.
There are some briliant paintings from modern David Hockney
to old masters like Canalletto.
The French impresionist and the Russian section is outstanding.
For an real ride through 16 to 20 century art this cannot be missed.
titleopinion: A really great art gallery. This was my first time here on my third visit to Madrid and i was very impressed. The gallery has an outstanding collection of paintings and s well set out and run you do not get tired which often happens in some of the other galleries. There are some briliant paintings from modern David Hockney  to old masters like Canalletto. The French impresionist and the Russian section is outstanding. For an real ride through 16 to 20 century art this cannot be missed.

reviewnospace:
Look up in advance and go when it is free (for us this was Monday afternoon).

Begin at the top of the museum and walk downwards so that the art is chronological.
titleopinion: Great, varied gallery. Look up in advance and go when it is free (for us this was Monday afternoon).  Begin at the top of the museum and walk downwards so that the art is chronological.

reviewnospace:
We were pleasantly surprised to find that Mondays are free. The museum offers a good collection of art from 15th century onward. I personally liked modern art a bit less than the exhibits on the upper floors but this is a personal opinion.
Anyway, the museum is very good and takes between 3 and 4 hours to see all paintings with audio-guide.
titleopinion: Free entrance on Mondays. We were pleasantly surprised to find that Mondays are free. The museum offers a good collection of art from 15th century onward. I personally liked modern art a bit less than the exhibits on the upper floors but this is a personal opinion.  Anyway, the museum is very good and takes between 3 and 4 hours to see all paintings with audio-guide.

quote: Modern Art Collection at its best
reviewnospace: If you are a Modern Art lover this is the place. Then again it's collection of medieval art is also very impressive, yet I'm not a fan. The temporary exhibitions are magnificent, very well put together. Worth every penny of your ticket.
titleopinion: Modern Art Collection at its best. If you are a Modern Art lover this is the place. Then again it's collection of medieval art is also very impressive, yet I'm not a fan. The temporary exhibitions are magnificent, very well put together. Worth every penny of your ticket.

quote: A good collection of paintings near the Prado
reviewnospace: The permanent collection features "more accessible" works by major artists, nicely presented in both old and new wings. It is open every day of the week (short hours Monday) and most holidays. Ask for senior and student discounts (permanent collection is 9 or 6 euros, and temporary collections are priced separately). Near the Prado, some find it even more enjoyable -- worth several hours.
titleopinion: A good collection of paintings near the Prado. The permanent collection features  more accessible  works by major artists, nicely presented in both old and new wings. It is open every day of the week (short hours Monday) and most holidays. Ask for senior and student discounts (permanent collection is 9 or 6 euros, and temporary collections are priced separately). Near the Prado, some find it even more enjoyable -- worth several hours.

quote: A welcoming museum with a very good collection
reviewnospace:
The galleries are really well laid out with the works nicely grouped into themes and periods. The restaurant is excellent and there's a very pleasant outdoor terrace area for when the weather is good.

It's easy to spend a whole day just browsing the art with periodic visits to the restaurant for drinks and lunch. A must do when in Madrid.
titleopinion: A welcoming museum with a very good collection. The galleries are really well laid out with the works nicely grouped into themes and periods. The restaurant is excellent and there's a very pleasant outdoor terrace area for when the weather is good.  It's easy to spend a whole day just browsing the art with periodic visits to the restaurant for drinks and lunch. A must do when in Madrid.

reviewnospace: Another very nice museum in Madrid. Smaller than this others but still very charming. I really liked it to be honest and the art is great.
titleopinion: Very good !. Another very nice museum in Madrid. Smaller than this others but still very charming. I really liked it to be honest and the art is great.

reviewnospace: Quite simply one of the world's best private collections, with something to please most people. When in town, I tend to go to the well curated temporary exhibitions - just right for a focused culture shot, without spending hours and hours trailing round a museum. The main collection is housed in a palace where every wall is painted in the most shocking salmon pink (the former Miss Spain, Tita's favourite colour apparently - she now owns the collection). The temporary exhibitions are in a more contemporary setting, and are much better explained. I'm not hugely arty and I always enjoy the Thyssen - in contrast to the Prado which I find much more challenging.
titleopinion: Great temporary exhibitions. Quite simply one of the world's best private collections, with something to please most people. When in town, I tend to go to the well curated temporary exhibitions - just right for a focused culture shot, without spending hours and hours trailing round a museum. The main collection is housed in a palace where every wall is painted in the most shocking salmon pink (the former Miss Spain, Tita's favourite colour apparently - she now owns the collection). The temporary exhibitions are in a more contemporary setting, and are much better explained. I'm not hugely arty and I always enjoy the Thyssen - in contrast to the Prado which I find much more challenging.

reviewnospace:
When you think of Madrid you think of the Prado but we only had time to 'do' one gallery properly and the eclectic mix of the Thyssen was more appealing to our taste than the more gothic selection in the Prado.

The paintings were beautifully hung all at a consistent level without resorting to placing one painting above another. It was a very easy place to move about and view the paintings in logical order (Rijksmuseum please note).
The gallery also introduced us to lesser known works from some of the better known artists and helped us appreciate some works from artists in Germany and North America we'd not been aware of previously.
Altogether a really splendid gallery.
titleopinion: Deserves more credit. When you think of Madrid you think of the Prado but we only had time to 'do' one gallery properly and the eclectic mix of the Thyssen was more appealing to our taste than the more gothic selection in the Prado.  The paintings were beautifully hung all at a consistent level without resorting to placing one painting above another. It was a very easy place to move about and view the paintings in logical order (Rijksmuseum please note). The gallery also introduced us to lesser known works from some of the better known artists and helped us appreciate some works from artists in Germany and North America we'd not been aware of previously. Altogether a really splendid gallery.

quote: Thought We Had Seen It All.....but
reviewnospace: We do LOTS of art (my wife paints extensively). Saw lots of lesser known works of mega artists and lots of mega works by artists who are lesser known. The facility is a knockout. The art is a collection that spans centuries and countries. Saw a Hopper I did not know existed and some great North American art blended into the collection. God knows how this much art can be collected on a personal level but it was and thankfully the Spanish Government kept it together. More art here that appeals to us.....not to take away from the Prado. Well worth the time. You can spend 2 hours or ten hours.
titleopinion: Thought We Had Seen It All.....but. We do LOTS of art (my wife paints extensively). Saw lots of lesser known works of mega artists and lots of mega works by artists who are lesser known. The facility is a knockout. The art is a collection that spans centuries and countries. Saw a Hopper I did not know existed and some great North American art blended into the collection. God knows how this much art can be collected on a personal level but it was and thankfully the Spanish Government kept it together. More art here that appeals to us.....not to take away from the Prado. Well worth the time. You can spend 2 hours or ten hours.

reviewnospace: I had read a number of reviews here from people who preferred this museum to the Prado or the Reina Sofia, so my hopes were high coming in. While i was impressed, i can't say i preferred it to the other two. More specifically, i think the museum itself (e.g. the quality of the building and curation) is very fine here, but in terms of the pieces on display, i was more wowed by the collections at the Prado and Reina Sofia. This is of course a matter of personal taste, but i wouldn't want any lover to miss the Prado or the Reina Sofia.
titleopinion: A fine museum, but.... I had read a number of reviews here from people who preferred this museum to the Prado or the Reina Sofia, so my hopes were high coming in. While i was impressed, i can't say i preferred it to the other two. More specifically, i think the museum itself (e.g. the quality of the building and curation) is very fine here, but in terms of the pieces on display, i was more wowed by the collections at the Prado and Reina Sofia. This is of course a matter of personal taste, but i wouldn't want any lover to miss the Prado or the Reina Sofia.

quote: May be the best museum in Madrid...
reviewnospace: ...and that is saying something for Madrid has such world class museums! Plan on a full day here and be sure to wear good foot ware as the floors are hard. You will see art from very old to some of the most noteworthy modern works.
titleopinion: May be the best museum in Madrid.... ...and that is saying something for Madrid has such world class museums! Plan on a full day here and be sure to wear good foot ware as the floors are hard. You will see art from very old to some of the most noteworthy modern works.

reviewnospace: My favourite - has the best mix of paintings to suite all tastes. Allow serveral hours to cover. Look for any special exhibits.
titleopinion: Best of the three. My favourite - has the best mix of paintings to suite all tastes. Allow serveral hours to cover. Look for any special exhibits.

quote: If you have a large purse and good taste you can create magic!
reviewnospace: I am not a big fan of religious art, but those who are will find a wide selection of paintings here. The five wonderful Pissarros and those of Sisley were a special treat to an Impressionist fan. Dutch painters have a special place here and I was surprised the breadth of their collection, including many by Cranach.
titleopinion: If you have a large purse and good taste you can create magic!. I am not a big fan of religious art, but those who are will find a wide selection of paintings here. The five wonderful Pissarros and those of Sisley were a special treat to an Impressionist fan. Dutch painters have a special place here and I was surprised the breadth of their collection, including many by Cranach.

reviewnospace: ... because this Museum has one or two examples of each artist's work, rather than 100s. Also the works cover more contemporary art periods and the exhibitions are usually first rate. Nice coffee shop/wine bar out the front across the courtyard.
titleopinion: More enjoyable than the Prado. ... because this Museum has one or two examples of each artist's work, rather than 100s. Also the works cover more contemporary art periods and the exhibitions are usually first rate. Nice coffee shop/wine bar out the front across the courtyard.

reviewnospace: The well designed and endowed contemporary art museum close to the Prado and the iconic Westin Palace hotel features an extensive permanent exhibition with varied special exhibits according to the program. I visited the Cartier jewellery show - so many beautiful pieces, excellently lit and displayed, and visitors were organised so as not to crowd. There is also a very decent cafe area, and of course a shop!
titleopinion: accessibly fascinating. The well designed and endowed contemporary art museum close to the Prado and the iconic Westin Palace hotel features an extensive permanent exhibition with varied special exhibits according to the program. I visited the Cartier jewellery show - so many beautiful pieces, excellently lit and displayed, and visitors were organised so as not to crowd. There is also a very decent cafe area, and of course a shop!

quote: Fantastic collections, well worth a visit
reviewnospace: Amazingly extensive private collection of modern art -- be sure to include this in your tour of Madrid's art museums.
titleopinion: Fantastic collections, well worth a visit. Amazingly extensive private collection of modern art -- be sure to include this in your tour of Madrid's art museums.

reviewnospace: This is maybe the best museum i have seen in my life. We went on thursday so it was not really crowded. Ill come back for sure next time im in Madrid !
titleopinion: UNBELIEVABLE. This is maybe the best museum i have seen in my life. We went on thursday so it was not really crowded. Ill come back for sure next time im in Madrid !

quote: Great museum, encompassing wide range of styles
reviewnospace: This is a good museum to visit if you have culture phobic members of the party or just want to do a half day visit. It's not as large as the Prado, but it has about the same range - from a few prerenaissance primitives to the romantic era to modernism. Didn't see any post-modern, which is fine with me (and you can see at the Prado). More about the transition in styles from humanists to impressionists.
titleopinion: Great museum, encompassing wide range of styles. This is a good museum to visit if you have culture phobic members of the party or just want to do a half day visit. It's not as large as the Prado, but it has about the same range - from a few prerenaissance primitives to the romantic era to modernism. Didn't see any post-modern, which is fine with me (and you can see at the Prado). More about the transition in styles from humanists to impressionists.

reviewnospace: Not what we expected and the modern art just did not doing for us. We basically looked at the Picasso pieces and left. But nice to say we saw them
titleopinion: disappointing. Not what we expected and the modern art just did not doing for us. We basically looked at the Picasso pieces and left. But nice to say we saw them

quote: Fabulous art and first rate restaurant
reviewnospace: This is a private collection of high quality European and North American paintings. The portraits are outstanding but there are also excellent landscape pictures by, e.g., Van Gogh and Frederick Church. The experience is enhanced by a visit to the Museum restaurant. The seafood risotto is not to be missed.
titleopinion: Fabulous art and first rate restaurant. This is a private collection of high quality European and North American paintings. The portraits are outstanding but there are also excellent landscape pictures by, e.g., Van Gogh and Frederick Church. The experience is enhanced by a visit to the Museum restaurant. The seafood risotto is not to be missed.

quote: The History of Art in One Building
reviewnospace: A great eclectic collection of art from the old masters to pop art in a small enough location that is 'do-able' in half a day.
titleopinion: The History of Art in One Building. A great eclectic collection of art from the old masters to pop art in a small enough location that is 'do-able' in half a day.

reviewnospace: This museum really is a gem. Close to the Prado and I enjoyed the museum and the collection better than the Prado. It won't match the Louvre but there is plenty of quality and variety here. It was also a lot larger than I expected so allow time so you don't have to hurry. I rate this as a must see, and definitely the first museum you should see in Madrid.
titleopinion: Best art museum in Madrid. This museum really is a gem. Close to the Prado and I enjoyed the museum and the collection better than the Prado. It won't match the Louvre but there is plenty of quality and variety here. It was also a lot larger than I expected so allow time so you don't have to hurry. I rate this as a must see, and definitely the first museum you should see in Madrid.

reviewnospace: I only had one hour at the end of the day to see this marvelous collection. I followed the Rick Steves recommendation and went to the top floor and moved downwards. The printed guide was excellent as it showed highlights and in which room they could be found. We will definitely go for a longer visit when we are in Madrid again. Even though it was only an hour it left a great impression.
titleopinion: A quick but enticing visit. I only had one hour at the end of the day to see this marvelous collection. I followed the Rick Steves recommendation and went to the top floor and moved downwards. The printed guide was excellent as it showed highlights and in which room they could be found. We will definitely go for a longer visit when we are in Madrid again. Even though it was only an hour it left a great impression.

quote: Amazing museum needs time to explore it fully.
reviewnospace: I spent a rainy afternoon here. The suggested tour starts on the 2nd floor and with an audio guide its an absolute pleasure to spend 2-3 hours admiring the art on display. I came out feeling inspired, uplifted and somewhat honoured to have been able to see such masterpieces.
titleopinion: Amazing museum needs time to explore it fully.. I spent a rainy afternoon here. The suggested tour starts on the 2nd floor and with an audio guide its an absolute pleasure to spend 2-3 hours admiring the art on display. I came out feeling inspired, uplifted and somewhat honoured to have been able to see such masterpieces.

reviewnospace: Visit to Madrid not complete without a morning spent at this Museum. Diverse collection from modern to 13th century art. From the greats to the obscure. Something to inspire everyone. Lovely cafe to rest your feet and satiate your thirst.
titleopinion: Worth a visit. Visit to Madrid not complete without a morning spent at this Museum. Diverse collection from modern to 13th century art. From the greats to the obscure. Something to inspire everyone. Lovely cafe to rest your feet and satiate your thirst.

reviewnospace: This is an amazing art collection, ranging across many different countries and periods of European art, with masterpieces at every turn. But it would benefit from better curating, i.e. some commentary on the wall telling those of us without a deep background in art history a bit more about the painting in question and what's special about it. Still, we enjoyed our visit a lot.
titleopinion: More information, please. This is an amazing art collection, ranging across many different countries and periods of European art, with masterpieces at every turn. But it would benefit from better curating, i.e. some commentary on the wall telling those of us without a deep background in art history a bit more about the painting in question and what's special about it. Still, we enjoyed our visit a lot.

reviewnospace: I was going to stay for a couple of hours; I ended up staying for at least four. I had to pull myself away so that I could see other things in Madrid. The permanent collection, particularly of modern painting on the 1st floor, is highly engaging. When I was there, they had two exhibitions for which you had to pay an entrance fee: Early Impressionishm (organized by theme -- Rocks, Skies, etc.) and Hyper-Realism. Both were worth the price.
titleopinion: Very impressive. I was going to stay for a couple of hours; I ended up staying for at least four. I had to pull myself away so that I could see other things in Madrid. The permanent collection, particularly of modern painting on the 1st floor, is highly engaging. When I was there, they had two exhibitions for which you had to pay an entrance fee: Early Impressionishm (organized by theme -- Rocks, Skies, etc.) and Hyper-Realism. Both were worth the price.

quote: good range of relatively modern paintings
reviewnospace: well set out gallery with superb exhibit of impressionist art. Audio guide well worth the price. You should find a good selection of any particular genre.
titleopinion: good range of relatively modern paintings. well set out gallery with superb exhibit of impressionist art. Audio guide well worth the price. You should find a good selection of any particular genre.

reviewnospace: There is a great collection of art here--apparently in two different collections because artists are not grouped all together but are found in different parts of the museum. While I understand the logic behind keeping the collections separate, I would have found it more useful to see all of one artist in one place. We bought the three museum ticket which will save you lots of money and time standing in line. We also rented the acoustiguides which were useful and gave a great deal of information about the paintings.
titleopinion: Great Collection. There is a great collection of art here--apparently in two different collections because artists are not grouped all together but are found in different parts of the museum. While I understand the logic behind keeping the collections separate, I would have found it more useful to see all of one artist in one place. We bought the three museum ticket which will save you lots of money and time standing in line. We also rented the acoustiguides which were useful and gave a great deal of information about the paintings.

reviewnospace: This is a great museum for visitors. It covers a lot of centuries, and you can enjoy all the art it has in a half day or so.
titleopinion: Excellent museum. This is a great museum for visitors. It covers a lot of centuries, and you can enjoy all the art it has in a half day or so.

reviewnospace: We went to see an Impressionist exhibit, which was well curated and a good sample of work from the period. The museum itself is very cozy, showcasing pieces that were at one point a private collection. One thing that stood out was the "small" size of the paintings, but the diversity in styles and wide representation of many important movements and periods in art made for a delightful afternoon. A manageable, see in half day museum, and absolutely a must do.
titleopinion: Tiny Gem. We went to see an Impressionist exhibit, which was well curated and a good sample of work from the period. The museum itself is very cozy, showcasing pieces that were at one point a private collection. One thing that stood out was the  small  size of the paintings, but the diversity in styles and wide representation of many important movements and periods in art made for a delightful afternoon. A manageable, see in half day museum, and absolutely a must do.

quote: one of the best art history lessons you can get
reviewnospace: superb museum with all of it, you get to start with the renaissance and go all the way through to modern 20th century art. Get the audio guide so you can stay on track.
titleopinion: one of the best art history lessons you can get. superb museum with all of it, you get to start with the renaissance and go all the way through to modern 20th century art. Get the audio guide so you can stay on track.

quote: A must visit when in Madrid
reviewnospace:
Apparently the biggest/ best collection out side of the British Queens personal stuff.
Just amazing.
You must see the Picasso
titleopinion: A must visit when in Madrid. Apparently the biggest/ best collection out side of the British Queens personal stuff. Just amazing. You must see the Picasso

quote: Very nice museum with wide range of paintings
reviewnospace:
I came here originally to see the exhibition of impressionism and landscapes which was really excellent, but then decided to look around the main part of this lovely building. I thought it had an excellent variety of styles and artists, something for everyone. I had a very nice coffee break on the terrace and noticed that the restaurant was very busy when I was leaving in the afternoon,
having spent way longer than I anticipated here. Have to say I preferred it to the Prado.
titleopinion: Very nice museum with wide range of paintings. I came here originally to see the exhibition of impressionism and landscapes which was really excellent, but then decided to look around the main part of this lovely building. I thought it had an excellent variety of styles and artists, something for everyone. I had a very nice coffee break on the terrace and noticed that the restaurant was very busy when I was leaving in the afternoon, having spent way longer than I anticipated here. Have to say I preferred it to the Prado.

reviewnospace:
Ok, so I'm not a great art lover but even I enjoyed my walk around Thyssen-Bornemisza..
Lots of artists I'd heard of and paintings I recognised so great to see them in real life...
We were there on a gloriously sunny day so after 90 minutes in the gallery I retired to the outdoor bar to wait for my friends...the prices were reasonably and the view was great...a piece of art in itself!
titleopinion: Good art, great bar. Ok, so I'm not a great art lover but even I enjoyed my walk around Thyssen-Bornemisza.. Lots of artists I'd heard of and paintings I recognised so great to see them in real life...  We were there on a gloriously sunny day so after 90 minutes in the gallery I retired to the outdoor bar to wait for my friends...the prices were reasonably and the view was great...a piece of art in itself!

reviewnospace: Spent the entire day at this magnificent museum and enjoyed breakfast, lunch, and afternoon tea. Thus we tasted a variety of food which was all fresh, served nicely, and in light airy surroundings. Lunch on the terrace was a treat in that the sun was pleasantly warm. The smoked salmon wrap was almost too big, so you may to share a salad and a wrap. Prices were same as everywhere else we had eaten, so not extortionate. A great day out!
titleopinion: Modern but with atmosphere. Spent the entire day at this magnificent museum and enjoyed breakfast, lunch, and afternoon tea. Thus we tasted a variety of food which was all fresh, served nicely, and in light airy surroundings. Lunch on the terrace was a treat in that the sun was pleasantly warm. The smoked salmon wrap was almost too big, so you may to share a salad and a wrap. Prices were same as everywhere else we had eaten, so not extortionate. A great day out!

reviewnospace: As much as we liked the Prado, the Thyssen far excelled due its enormous sweep of paintings from pre-Renaissance through the Italian, Flemish, Dutch, German Renaissance to the modern. If you like the Louvre or the London or Washington National Galleries, this is the museum for you. It is relatively new, open since 1992. It is near the Prado. It was our best museum experience in Madrid and it is NOT TO BE MISSED!!!!

reviewnospace: Found it difficult to orientate ourselves, but liked the way paintings are displayed in small rooms. We had gone specifically to see Picasso's ' Guernica', and it did not disappoint. quote: Impressionism and Open-air Painting. From Corot to Van Gogh 5 February to 12 May 2013
reviewnospace:
Dear All,

if you like the Impressionism go for that exposition, and do it quickly because it will have end the 12th of May!!!

The exhibition is rich, well managed and the tails are the real object of this exhibition: each room have a title that represent the topic, the rooms are simple, apparently not cured, but that's because the organizer decided for giving space just to the tails.

You can appreciate tails from Corot, Turner, Van Gogh and Cézanne among many other key names.

I picked up that exhibition instead Picasso or Dali, always in Madrid in the same period, due to the richness of the exhibition, of course also because I love impressionism but having to choice I prefer to see the high number of tails, mainly if many of these are coming from foreign countries.

Enjoy!

p.s.: if front of The Art doesn't matter how much are you going to spend, but remember that the ticket of this exhibition is really really cheap and if you want there are also some days free: have a look!

quote: From ancient to modern - it's all covered
reviewnospace: There were no queues, which was refreshing. The collection is massive. You start at the top and work your way to the bottom. Halfway through, my husband and I started to only listen to the explanation on the audio guides of the paintings we really, really liked because it just becomes too much. Unless you are a massive lover of modern art, I would skip the ground floor entirely.

Once you have completed your tour, we would recommend a drink and a snack in the elegant terrace restaurant.

I spent most of the morning visiting this museum.

reviewnospace: Attempted entry but there are no signs up or explanation of where to pay for entry. We were sent from one office to another. The queues were so long as there were only two ticket windows. Each appeared to be for a different exhibition at the gallery. No indication that general admission could be bought there. This caused long delays as there were many foreign tourist who were confused and asking questions. We walked away after 20 minutes. What a shambles!

quote: The most interesting museum in Madrid
reviewnospace: Sometimes miss regarded, the Thyssen-Bornemisza Musem is the most interesting museum in Madrid ! A fantastic collection of paintings from about 1300 till 2000 and almost to day, perfect planning and flow of the periods. Go and take your time there - it is worthwhile !!

reviewnospace:
This museum is a must see must do in Madrid. Of course Pucasso's Guernica is a major crowd puller, but the two temporary exhibitions on Open Air Impressionism and Hyperealism really stand out. Though even with Madirid Card, you will end up paying 18 Euros for the two wonderful exhibitions, as they are not included but are truly worth it. The impressionist exhibition has van gogh, monet's seascapes, carpenter and many others. Take the Audio guide, it enhances the flavour.
The exhibition on Hypertealism was a eye opener. Having never been exposed to this genre before, I thoroughly enjoyed it. It is so modern, so refreshingly different. I enjoyed the cityscapes of New York, London, and Florence immensely. The ones on automobiles were also so stunning in their perspective. All in all, ypu need to spend the whole day at this museum. The cafetaria serves wonderful espressos.

quote: The nicest museum in Madrid, don't miss it!
reviewnospace:
Open Tuesday to Sunday 10 am - 9 pm, also on Mondays 12 am - 4 pm.
Admission € 9 / € 6.
Admission also possible with “Paseo del Arte Card” (Tarjeta Paseo del Arte): entrance to 3 museums, Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza and Reina Sofia. Card can be bought in any of these 3 museums. With this card you can skip the queues.

This is a much more modern museum than the Prado, much lighter and better organised. A very nice collection, with a splendid overview of the art of painting from the 13th to the 20th century. Temporary exhibitions (separate price).

Large entrance hall, at the left the ticket sale, at the (middle) right the audioguides. Cloakroom past the audioguides. Entrance to the collection at the back to the right. You take the elevator to the 2nd floor, where the museum visit starts with the oldest works. You follow the rooms chronologically, after room 18 there is a connection with the Carmen Thyssen-wing (room A-H). When you finish here you can pick up the tour at room 19. Then you descend to the 1st floor en afterwards to the ground floor. Everything is explained in a map that you get at the ticket control. There is 2nd floor plan for the Carmen-Thyssen wing, which is in small boxes on the wall at the entrance of these rooms.

The audioguide discusses 70 masterpieces and explains the different "schools". At the entrance of each room there is a number which refers to the general explanation of that room. I listened to it all, which takes 4 hours.

Ver few benches in the museum. One can get a folding chair at the cloakroom. Climate control is OK in this museum (contrary to the Prado), which makes the visit much more comfortable.

There weren't many visitors when I went (Saturday 10 am). Also here (as for Prado) better not to come at 10 am sharp because of the first (long) queue. Within 1 or 2 hours it became much more crowded, but still OK. Quieter museum than the Prado, but also because supervisors silence the visitors when they become too loud (which is not the case at the Prado).

On the ground floor near the entrance (at the right) there is a passage to a cafe-restaurant. NOT recommended. Arrogant staff and food very poor for the (high) price.
titleopinion: The nicest museum in Madrid, don't miss it!. Open Tuesday to Sunday 10 am - 9 pm, also on Mondays 12 am - 4 pm. Admission € 9 / € 6. Admission also possible with “Paseo del Arte Card” (Tarjeta Paseo del Arte): entrance to 3 museums, Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza and Reina Sofia. Card can be bought in any of these 3 museums. With this card you can skip the queues.  This is a much more modern museum than the Prado, much lighter and better organised. A very nice collection, with a splendid overview of the art of painting from the 13th to the 20th century. Temporary exhibitions (separate price). You take the elevator to the 2nd floor, where the museum visit starts with the oldest works. You follow the rooms chronologically, after room 18 there is a connection with the Carmen Thyssen-wing (room A-H). When you finish here you can pick up the tour at room 19. Then you descend to the 1st floor en afterwards to the ground floor. Everything is explained in a map that you get at the ticket control. There is 2nd floor plan for the Carmen-Thyssen wing, which is in small boxes on the wall at the entrance of these rooms.  The audioguide discusses 70 masterpieces and explains the different  schools . At the entrance of each room there is a number which refers to the general explanation of that room. I listened to it all, which takes 4 hours.  Ver few benches in the museum. One can get a folding chair at the cloakroom. Climate control is OK in this museum (contrary to the Prado), which makes the visit much more comfortable.  There weren't many visitors when I went (Saturday 10 am). Also here (as for Prado) better not to come at 10 am sharp because of the first (long) queue. Within 1 or 2 hours it became much more crowded, but still OK. Quieter museum than the Prado, but also because supervisors silence the visitors when they become too loud (which is not the case at the Prado).  On the ground floor near the entrance (at the right) there is a passage to a cafe-restaurant. NOT recommended. Arrogant staff and food very poor for the (high) price.

quote: Take Plenty of Time for the Thyssen
reviewnospace: The Thyssen Museum in Madrid, Spain, takes the visitor on a travel through time, starting with early medieval art and ending with modern art. A new wing has been opened which adds more impressionists and is a great addition! One afternoon is not enough time to appreciate the entire collection. Just one floor could take an afternoon. If you can only visit once, choose which time period you are most interested in, skim the other rooms if you need to, and spend most of your time in your favorite section (mine would be impressionists). If you can only visit one of three major museums in Madrid, I would choose the Thyssen.

If you can only visit one of three major museums in Madrid, I would choose the Thyssen.

reviewnospace: Fantasically organised and presented collection of art with in a delightful builidng. Very helpful and pleasant staff and not crowdeed because people go to the Prado and athe Reine sofia as well/instead.
