reviewnospace: Nice eclectic collection; Very well designed layout, easy to walk around in systematic order.
titleopinion: Very good layout. Nice eclectic collection; Very well designed layout, easy to walk around in systematic order.

reviewnospace: I loved the little court yard as you enter. The collection is amazing. Even the shop is something special
titleopinion: It was brilliant!. I loved the little court yard as you enter. The collection is amazing. Even the shop is something special

quote: Fantastic collection of a variety of painting styles
reviewnospace:
I concur with the reviewer below who described the museum as a whistlestop tour of art history. Not being an art buff going in, the collection available at the Thyssen was of great breadth in the styles of painting. Very well organized as well.

What I liked a lot about the museum was the interactive (and intuitive) touch screen database of artists available. Each artist had a short biography, analysis, and paintings available with their location. So if you're short on time it would allow you to make plan a route through the museum if you know which artists you want to see.
titleopinion: Fantastic collection of a variety of painting styles. I concur with the reviewer below who described the museum as a whistlestop tour of art history. Not being an art buff going in, the collection available at the Thyssen was of great breadth in the styles of painting. Very well organized as well.  What I liked a lot about the museum was the interactive (and intuitive) touch screen database of artists available. Each artist had a short biography, analysis, and paintings available with their location. So if you're short on time it would allow you to make plan a route through the museum if you know which artists you want to see.

reviewnospace: Amazing that so many items can be acquired by a single family. Very interesting collection - and quite varied.
titleopinion: Interesting collection. Amazing that so many items can be acquired by a single family. Very interesting collection - and quite varied.

reviewnospace: Current architecture in paintings exhibit is good, as all temporary exhibitions they have usually are. Very nice restaurant for casual snacking or lunch with outdoor tables weather permitting.
titleopinion: Great exhibitions and restaurant. Current architecture in paintings exhibit is good, as all temporary exhibitions they have usually are. Very nice restaurant for casual snacking or lunch with outdoor tables weather permitting.

reviewnospace: We could not face the Prado - just too much religious art and old masters that leave me cold. this was an outstanding collection in a really great space for viewing - particularly the Carmen collection. Nice to have enough money to put a collection like that together - but she has great taste.
titleopinion: Must see. We could not face the Prado - just too much religious art and old masters that leave me cold. this was an outstanding collection in a really great space for viewing - particularly the Carmen collection. Nice to have enough money to put a collection like that together - but she has great taste.

reviewnospace: What is really amusing is that this was a private colection. A great museum with a variety of artists
titleopinion: Excellent. What is really amusing is that this was a private colection. A great museum with a variety of artists

reviewnospace: along el prado & reina sofia this are must sees if you are interested in art.
titleopinion: good. along el prado & reina sofia this are must sees if you are interested in art.

reviewnospace: I went to visit Antonio Lopez exhibition and it was amazing. The light, the textures and the minute details portray the real self of Madrid, warts and all. The technique that he uses can be fully appreciated, as some of his paintings seem to be on the making.
titleopinion: A treat to your eyes. I went to visit Antonio Lopez exhibition and it was amazing. The light, the textures and the minute details portray the real self of Madrid, warts and all. The technique that he uses can be fully appreciated, as some of his paintings seem to be on the making.

reviewnospace: The best museum ever! Overwhelming volume of paintings beautifully and more importantly clearly laid out. You could spend a whole day there and want to go back for more.
titleopinion: The must-see in Madrid. The best museum ever! Overwhelming volume of paintings beautifully and more importantly clearly laid out. You could spend a whole day there and want to go back for more.

reviewnospace: There is a good number of impressionist paintings and more modern American painters such asEdward Hopper. They have a printing facility so you just key in/look up the painting and they will print one off for you. Great shop as well to buy gifts for your friends. Not too expensive to get in ....I think it was about 6 euros.
titleopinion: great art. There is a good number of impressionist paintings and more modern American painters such asEdward Hopper. They have a printing facility so you just key in/look up the painting and they will print one off for you. Great shop as well to buy gifts for your friends. Not too expensive to get in ....I think it was about 6 euros.

reviewnospace: I enjoyed this more than the Prado because it has such a variety of paintings. And it's amazing to think one person could collect all of these pieces.
titleopinion: Amazing collection. I enjoyed this more than the Prado because it has such a variety of paintings. And it's amazing to think one person could collect all of these pieces.

reviewnospace: While doing sightseeing in Madrid I walked by the Thyssen Museum and I decided to take a look in. They had these special displays portraying Mario Testino's work on famous woman, and since I'm a student I got a discount at the front desk which was awesome, there's people inside the museum who give you small hindsights on what to see or suggestions about the photograph you're looking at, really helpful.
titleopinion: Classic adventure at Thyssen!. While doing sightseeing in Madrid I walked by the Thyssen Museum and I decided to take a look in. They had these special displays portraying Mario Testino's work on famous woman, and since I'm a student I got a discount at the front desk which was awesome, there's people inside the museum who give you small hindsights on what to see or suggestions about the photograph you're looking at, really helpful.

reviewnospace: Like this museum more than the Prado for its modern art.
titleopinion: modern art. Like this museum more than the Prado for its modern art.

reviewnospace: This great museum has recently added an entire new wing to house Carmen's collection. Definitely worth a visit.
titleopinion: Even more to see. This great museum has recently added an entire new wing to house Carmen's collection. Definitely worth a visit.

reviewnospace:
Basically across from the Prado Museum. Super collection of the Thyssen family with one wing being donated by the husband and a second wing containing the wife's personal collection. Includes a wide variety of work from Picasso to Caravagio. Well organized, the works include all types of paintings, including some American artists. The museum is less crowed than the Prado so you get a good chance to view the works on display. The audio guide is very good.

As an aside, the small restaurant served the absolute best wrap sandwich that I have ever had. I'm not normally a wrap eater but boy was that good!
titleopinion: Great Museum, Relatively Uncrowded. Basically across from the Prado Museum. Super collection of the Thyssen family with one wing being donated by the husband and a second wing containing the wife's personal collection. Includes a wide variety of work from Picasso to Caravagio. Well organized, the works include all types of paintings, including some American artists. The museum is less crowed than the Prado so you get a good chance to view the works on display. The audio guide is very good.  As an aside, the small restaurant served the absolute best wrap sandwich that I have ever had. I'm not normally a wrap eater but boy was that good!

reviewnospace: We can't remember a more substantial, easily accessible musuem - even better than Musee d'Orsay.
titleopinion: Incredible collection. We can't remember a more substantial, easily accessible musuem - even better than Musee d'Orsay.

quote: In this museum you can travel in time
reviewnospace:
You start in the Middle Ages and you arrive in the 20th century just by walking through the museum. An amazing collection!
The Museum cafe is quite expensive and the service is bad so go to a nice place near the Museum....
titleopinion: In this museum you can travel in time. You start in the Middle Ages and you arrive in the 20th century just by walking through the museum. An amazing collection! The Museum cafe is quite expensive and the service is bad so go to a nice place near the Museum....

reviewnospace: Excellent private collection of European art especially the 62 wonderful masterpieces that form part of the overall collection.
titleopinion: The Hidden GEM. Excellent private collection of European art especially the 62 wonderful masterpieces that form part of the overall collection.

quote: Eat before you go, or after
reviewnospace: Excellent paintings, well displayed, but not as well laid out as the Prado and a truly awful restaurant. Still worth the visit.
titleopinion: Eat before you go, or after. Excellent paintings, well displayed, but not as well laid out as the Prado and a truly awful restaurant. Still worth the visit.

reviewnospace:
First the downside. We wished to see the collection and not the special exhibition that was on display at the time. We queued endlessly to get an entry ticket. We were led to believe that it was necessary to purchase a ticket that covered both the permanent and special exhibition. Because the special exhibition was fully booked on the day we had to accept a booking some days later and so could not visit the premanent exhibition. In the event we later discoverd that it is perfectly possible to purchase a ticket for the permanent exhibition alone and we could have visited on the day we had planned.

The special exhibition was very poor. However, the permanent exhibition was splendid and we enjoyed our visit enomously.
titleopinion: An enjoyable morning. First the downside. We wished to see the collection and not the special exhibition that was on display at the time. We queued endlessly to get an entry ticket. We were led to believe that it was necessary to purchase a ticket that covered both the permanent and special exhibition. Because the special exhibition was fully booked on the day we had to accept a booking some days later and so could not visit the premanent exhibition. In the event we later discoverd that it is perfectly possible to purchase a ticket for the permanent exhibition alone and we could have visited on the day we had planned.  The special exhibition was very poor. However, the permanent exhibition was splendid and we enjoyed our visit enomously.

quote: The best organized museum I have ever visited!
reviewnospace: This museum has a map with numbers of each gallery in a logical and numerical order to ensure visitors have the option of not missing anything! I left not wondering if I would cry after getting home because I missed a piece that sings to my heart! There were very unique pieces by Picasso and Van Gogh and Georgia O'Keefe I had never seen before!
titleopinion: The best organized museum I have ever visited!. This museum has a map with numbers of each gallery in a logical and numerical order to ensure visitors have the option of not missing anything! I left not wondering if I would cry after getting home because I missed a piece that sings to my heart! There were very unique pieces by Picasso and Van Gogh and Georgia O'Keefe I had never seen before!

reviewnospace: Loved the more modern feel here than the classical feel of the Prado.
titleopinion: Amazing collection. Loved the more modern feel here than the classical feel of the Prado.

reviewnospace: Like collectors who want 'one of everything' the Thyssens bought great works from the middle ages to the most avant garde modern art. The result is a sort of chronological tour of art history. It's doable in an hour or two but if you add the annexe, you may want to allow three hours. Not as overwhelming as the Prado and more eclectic.
titleopinion: Whistlestop tour of art history. Like collectors who want 'one of everything' the Thyssens bought great works from the middle ages to the most avant garde modern art. The result is a sort of chronological tour of art history. It's doable in an hour or two but if you add the annexe, you may want to allow three hours. Not as overwhelming as the Prado and more eclectic.

quote: One of the world's finest museums
reviewnospace:
A relaxed, perfectly organized nest of treasures. I kept going back day after day just for the sheer fun of seeing a Winslow, a Kandinsky, even a Cornell. Beautiful place filled with wonder.
DO NOT HAVE LUNCH HERE. FOOD BEYOND AWFUL.
titleopinion: One of the world's finest museums. A relaxed, perfectly organized nest of treasures. I kept going back day after day just for the sheer fun of seeing a Winslow, a Kandinsky, even a Cornell. Beautiful place filled with wonder. DO NOT HAVE LUNCH HERE. FOOD BEYOND AWFUL.

reviewnospace: Absolutely loved this museum which featured brilliant pieces by Van Gogh, Gaugain, Monet and other lesser known artists. The museum does a great job displaying this work. Its not too immense like the other two famous art museums in Madrid, not leaving you overwhelmed. I hesitated to spend the money to see this museum based on the free admission polices of the others, but it would have been a huge mistake to miss it. Highly recommended if you like Impressionism.
titleopinion: My favorite in Madrid. Absolutely loved this museum which featured brilliant pieces by Van Gogh, Gaugain, Monet and other lesser known artists. The museum does a great job displaying this work. Its not too immense like the other two famous art museums in Madrid, not leaving you overwhelmed. I hesitated to spend the money to see this museum based on the free admission polices of the others, but it would have been a huge mistake to miss it. Highly recommended if you like Impressionism.

reviewnospace: This museum is very impressive and in many respects we found it better than the Louvre! For one, it was not as crowded! Second, the art was displayed and grouped with a more logical approach. Third, some of the pieces were lesser known and much more powerful (like the portrait of Millicent, Duchess of Sutherland). Having seen the Louvre a week before this visit, it was easy for us to compare and contrast: Thyssen is our winner! Amazing staff, very helpful, very polite, approachable and respectful.
titleopinion: Insightful. This museum is very impressive and in many respects we found it better than the Louvre! For one, it was not as crowded! Second, the art was displayed and grouped with a more logical approach. Third, some of the pieces were lesser known and much more powerful (like the portrait of Millicent, Duchess of Sutherland). Having seen the Louvre a week before this visit, it was easy for us to compare and contrast: Thyssen is our winner! Amazing staff, very helpful, very polite, approachable and respectful.

reviewnospace: Many little known paintings by well known artists.
titleopinion: Interesting. Many little known paintings by well known artists.

reviewnospace: You want to see impressionist, post impressionist and avant garde art from around the world. They the "Thyssen" is for you.
titleopinion: Lovely!. You want to see impressionist, post impressionist and avant garde art from around the world. They the  Thyssen  is for you.

quote: An enormous collection from Bottecelli to Munch with everything in between and a bunch on both sides.
reviewnospace: There are no free times for this museum, unlike the others in Madrid which have some free hours. It is closed Tuesday. For 8 Euros, it is one of the best deals in Madrid. There is a lot of 14th and 15th century art work. There is one Bottecelli so watch for it. And some impressionist works. Also a lot of 20th C works. Check the electronic board for a list of the collection if there are certain things you want to see. Along with Prado, must this is a "must do" in Madrid. Also, the gift store is pretty good. Toilets are clean and nice. Highly recommended!!
titleopinion: An enormous collection from Bottecelli to Munch with everything in between and a bunch on both sides.. There are no free times for this museum, unlike the others in Madrid which have some free hours. It is closed Tuesday. For 8 Euros, it is one of the best deals in Madrid. There is a lot of 14th and 15th century art work. There is one Bottecelli so watch for it. And some impressionist works. Also a lot of 20th C works. Check the electronic board for a list of the collection if there are certain things you want to see. Along with Prado, must this is a  must do  in Madrid. Also, the gift store is pretty good. Toilets are clean and nice. Highly recommended!!

quote: Rich family's personal art collection turned major museum
reviewnospace: An interesting collection. The Russian art was new to us. The latest work added by the Baroness shows more wealth than taste
titleopinion: Rich family's personal art collection turned major museum. An interesting collection. The Russian art was new to us. The latest work added by the Baroness shows more wealth than taste

reviewnospace: Okay...if you really like art....otherwise, somewhat boring.
titleopinion: Okay. Okay...if you really like art....otherwise, somewhat boring.

reviewnospace:
So, if you have a lot of money, aside from marrying a trophy wife/former beauty queen, collecting art and allowing it to be used for a museum is not a bad thing.
This museum, kitty corner from the nice fountain, a few blocks from the Prado, has a very nice collection and is particularly strong in the Impressionists. It was not overwhelming like the Prado, and more enjoyable than the Reina. Located on two floors, the collection is split between the main collection and the subsequent collection acquired by the Senora; she seems to have good advisors. If you like art at all you will enjoy this museum.
titleopinion: Nicely endowed, like Sra. Thyssen. So, if you have a lot of money, aside from marrying a trophy wife/former beauty queen, collecting art and allowing it to be used for a museum is not a bad thing.  This museum, kitty corner from the nice fountain, a few blocks from the Prado, has a very nice collection and is particularly strong in the Impressionists. It was not overwhelming like the Prado, and more enjoyable than the Reina. Located on two floors, the collection is split between the main collection and the subsequent collection acquired by the Senora; she seems to have good advisors. If you like art at all you will enjoy this museum.

reviewnospace:
This museum is so full of masterpieces that I could not see them to the end. If you like Western art it is a MUST. The works range from wonderful Italian primitives (14th century) through Rembrandt, El Greco, and up to impressionists and 20th century painters. There's a really large number of wonderful works.
A very slight down side - the cafeteria is pretty skimpy, don't arrive at the museum hungry!

A very slight down side - the cafeteria is pretty skimpy, don't arrive at the museum hungry!

reviewnospace:

The staff are extremely helpful and information is available in various languages.
The Prado may be better known but this is a Madrid attraction NOT to be missed,

reviewnospace:
The Thyseen always has interesting in exhibitions on, so if you have time to see the one that is on during your visit please do! Their audio guides are very well done, they have a good control of the number of people who can go in during each round which means that you can enjoy the paintings without having someone breathing down your next to move on to the next painting.

The private collection is spread over 2 floors and they are in chronological order so you can see how art has evolved throughout history. As mentioned already you do not have the swarms of people you get in other galleries such as el Prado or the Louvre. You can take your time and admire the paintings.

If you have time, pop by the shop. I think that it is probably the best art book shop in Madrid.

I will be visiting this museum again next week.

As mentioned already you do not have the swarms of people you get in other galleries such as el Prado or the Louvre. You can take your time and admire the paintings. quote: Wonderful collection that shouldn't be missed
reviewnospace:
Whereas the Prado Museum is Madrid's answer to the Louvre, and really shouldn't be missed for its collections of pre-20th Century artworks, the Thyssen is more along the lines of the Musee D'Orsay or the Phillips Collection in Washington, and also, shouldn't be missed for its collection of rarely seen Impressionist, Post-Impressionist, Expressionist and other 20th Century art. The Thyssen has pleasant, human-scale interior space and it's two floors are not so intimidating or difficult to navigate as the Prado.
What's notable about the collection is the impeccable taste used in selecting the paintings on display, and for this American, the surprise at finding some first-rate modernist American artworks on exhibition. It's really a great presentation of art from the past 100 years. If you could only go to one museum in Madrid, I would make it the Thyssen.
Am

reviewnospace: I love this museum! The paintings are beautiful and the atmosphere was so peaceful. It is ten times better than the Prado, which was hectic and noisy. While I haven't been to all of the museums in Madrid I can easily say this is my favorite, and it would be hard to beat. I just wish photography was allowed inside. They have many prints available in the gift shop ranging from postcard to poster size, but they didn't have some of my favorites available. It's not like I'm going to sell prints, I would just like a picture as a reminder. Even the Louvre allows photography, but I found many sites all around Spain banned cameras.

reviewnospace: It's easy to understand why this visitor attraction receives so many five star reviews. It's quality through and through. Yes, there is an admission fee (and the Naval Museum, almost opposite, does not but you cannot compare!). For me, one of the single-best aspects is the display of the exhibits in chronological order, starting from the top floor. Having only limited understanding of art, it does permit a walk through the development of the form. Fantastic.
